Sweetens TV Ad Approach Ahead Of Halloween,candy-sweetens-tv-ad-approach-ahead-of-halloween-2,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[],""cards"":[[""image"",{""src"":""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2022/11/copy-madhive-political-ctv-tvrev-1.png"",""width"":1000,""height"":508,""caption"":""<em>(via <a href=\""https://www.ispot.tv/hub/which-candy-brands-scared-up-tv-ad-impressions-before-halloween/\"">iSpot</a>)</em>"",""href"":""https://www.ispot.tv/hub/which-candy-brands-scared-up-tv-ad-impressions-before-halloween/""}]],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.ispot.tv/hub/which-candy-brands-scared-up-tv-ad-impressions-before-halloween/""]],[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.ispot.tv/products/creative-testing""]]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""As candy brands vie for Halloween supremacy, TV ads help them stay top-of-mind for consumers. iSpot reveals ""],[0,[0],1,""data on candy TV advertising""],[0,[],0,"" this year, and how industry giants like Hershey and Mars both changed their respective approaches to Halloween – including Hershey’s move to consolidate brands into the same ad creatives.""]]],[3,""ul"",[[[0,[],0,""This year, Hershey launched a new ad for Reese’s and KitKat, with encouragement for consumers to “choose both.” ""],[0,[1],1,""iSpot’s Creative Assessment Survey""],[0,[],0,"" showed that respondents found the ad 13% more likeable than the norm for candy & snack ads in the last 90 days, and it garnered 10% more attention.""]],[[0,[],0,""For Mars, the increase was in large part due to a greater emphasis on Twix TV ad impressions year-over-year. Twix impressions increased nearly 7.5x year-over-year, without really borrowing against Mars’ other brands.""]],[[0,[],0,""M&Ms had nearly double the ad airings year-over-year, though the spots it used were primarily from previous years.""]]]],[10,0]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>As candy brands vie for Halloween supremacy, TV ads help them stay top-of-mind for consumers. iSpot reveals <a href=""https://www.ispot.tv/hub/which-candy-brands-scared-up-tv-ad-impressions-before-halloween/"">data on candy TV advertising</a> this year, and how industry giants like Hershey and Mars both changed their respective approaches to Halloween – including Hershey’s move to consolidate brands into the same ad creatives.</p><ul><li>This year, Hershey launched a new ad for Reese’s and KitKat, with encouragement for consumers to “choose both.” <a href=""https://www.ispot.tv/products/creative-testing"">iSpot’s Creative Assessment Survey</a> showed that respondents found the ad 13% more likeable than the norm for candy &amp; snack ads in the last 90 days, and it garnered 10% more attention.</li><li>For Mars, the increase was in large part due to a greater emphasis on Twix TV ad impressions year-over-year. Twix impressions increased nearly 7.5x year-over-year, without really borrowing against Mars’ other brands.</li><li>M&amp;Ms had nearly double the ad airings year-over-year, though the spots it used were primarily from previous years.</li></ul><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card kg-card-hascaption""><a href=""https://www.ispot.tv/hub/which-candy-brands-scared-up-tv-ad-impressions-before-halloween/""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2022/11/copy-madhive-political-ctv-tvrev-1.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1000"" height=""508"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2022/11/copy-madhive-political-ctv-tvrev-1.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2022/11/copy-madhive-political-ctv-tvrev-1.png 1000w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></a><figcaption><em>(via <a href=""https://www.ispot.tv/hub/which-candy-brands-scared-up-tv-ad-impressions-before-halloween/"">iSpot</a>)</em></figcaption></figure>",6362b95805d727003d788cc1,"As candy brands vie for Halloween supremacy, TV ads help them stay top-of-mind for consumers. iSpot reveals data on candy TV advertising this year, and how industry giants like Hershey and Mars both changed their respective approaches to Halloween – including Hershey’s move to consolidate brands into the same ad creatives.

 * This year, Hershey launched a new ad for Reese’s and KitKat, with encouragement for consumers to “choose both.” iSpot’s Creative Assessment Survey showed that respondents found the ad 13% more likeable than the norm for candy & snack ads in the last 90 days, and it garnered 10% more attention.
 * For Mars, the increase was in large part due to a greater emphasis on Twix TV ad impressions year-over-year. Twix impressions increased nearly 7.5x year-over-year, without really borrowing against Mars’ other brands.
 * M&Ms had nearly double the ad airings year-over-year, though the spots it used were primarily from previous years.",https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1621939514649-280e2ee25f60?crop=entropy&cs=tinysrgb&fit=max&fm=jpg&ixid=MnwxMTc3M3wwfDF8c2VhcmNofDE0fHxjYW5keXxlbnwwfHx8fDE2Njc0OTU2NjE&ixlib=rb-4.0.3&q=80&w=2000,0,post,published,,public,all,2022-11-02T18:39:20.000Z,2022-11-03T17:14:34.000Z,2022-11-02T19:08:13.000Z,,,,,,6359c410975d780031398a07,1,6362bb2505d727003d788cd7,8ae224a1-749a-4417-bdb7-97c5f7760ce5,Hermès Shoppers Want To Visit Vegas,hermes-shoppers-want-to-visit-vegas,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[],""cards"":[[""image"",{""src"":""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2022/11/copy-madhive-political.png"",""width"":1000,""height"":571,""caption"":""<em>(via <a href=\""http://tubularlabs.com/\"">Tubular Labs</a>)</em>"",""href"":""http://tubularlabs.com/""}]],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""http://tubularlabs.com/""]]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""New data from ""],[0,[0],1,""Tubular Labs""],[0,[],0,"" showcases the social video categories that luxury brand shoppers are most likely to watch. Of particular interest below, Hermès.com visitors appear to like watching content about traveling to Vegas over 25 times more than the average viewer.""]]],[3,""ul"",[[[0,[],0,""On Amazon, Hermes.com shoppers are predictably interested in product categories like wallet & bag accessories (108x more likely than the norm) and handbag organizers (74x) – but also sourdough bread (66x).""]],[[0,[],0,""Hermes.com shoppers frequently watch content from creators like JE SUIS LOU (99x), Maria Draganova (99x) and JUNJUN SQUARE (96x).""]]]],[10,0]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>New data from <a href=""http://tubularlabs.com/"">Tubular Labs</a> showcases the social video categories that luxury brand shoppers are most likely to watch. Of particular interest below, Hermès.com visitors appear to like watching content about traveling to Vegas over 25 times more than the average viewer.</p><ul><li>On Amazon, Hermes.com shoppers are predictably interested in product categories like wallet &amp; bag accessories (108x more likely than the norm) and handbag organizers (74x) – but also sourdough bread (66x).</li><li>Hermes.com shoppers frequently watch content from creators like JE SUIS LOU (99x), Maria Draganova (99x) and JUNJUN SQUARE (96x).</li></ul><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card kg-card-hascaption""><a href=""http://tubularlabs.com/""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2022/11/copy-madhive-political.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1000"" height=""571"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2022/11/copy-madhive-political.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2022/11/copy-madhive-political.png 1000w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></a><figcaption><em>(via <a href=""http://tubularlabs.com/"">Tubular Labs</a>)</em></figcaption></figure>",6362bb2505d727003d788cd7,"New data from Tubular Labs showcases the social video categories that luxury brand shoppers are most likely to watch. Of particular interest below, Hermès.com visitors appear to like watching content about traveling to Vegas over 25 times more than the average viewer.

 * On Amazon, Hermes.com shoppers are predictably interested in product categories like wallet & bag accessories (108x more likely than the norm) and handbag organizers (74x) – but also sourdough bread (66x).

During season four – Nov. 7, 2021-Jan. 2, 2022 – Yellowstone was No. 11 among all programs by watch-time. The show also accounted for nearly 64% of minutes watched on Paramount Network during that timeframe.""]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[[1,[],0,0],[0,[],0,""Inscape also looked at viewership for the show during the summer, when Paramount Network milked its popularity through a few weekend rerun marathons. (Data is for May 28 through Sept. 5, 2022 and includes all dayparts).""]]],[3,""ul"",[[[0,[0],1,""Yellowstone""],[0,[],0,"" was the No.1 most-watched program on Paramount Network, with 274 episodes aired in total that captured 24.5% of all minutes watched.""]],[[0,[],0,""Each time Paramount aired a Yellowstone marathon, the show jumped into the top 50 ranking of programs on TV by watch-time across all networks for that TV week.""]]]],[1,""p"",[[1,[],0,1]]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>With <em>Yellowstone</em>’s season five premiere right on the horizon, we used data from VIZIO’s <a href=""http://inscape.tv/"">Inscape</a> to quantify the success of the hit Paramount Network show. During season four – Nov. 7, 2021-Jan. 2, 2022 – Yellowstone was No. 11 among all programs by watch-time. The show also accounted for nearly 64% of minutes watched on Paramount Network during that timeframe.</p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card kg-card-hascaption""><a href=""http://inscape.tv/""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2022/11/copy-vizio-voting--1-.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1000"" height=""509"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2022/11/copy-vizio-voting--1-.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2022/11/copy-vizio-voting--1-.png 1000w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></a><figcaption><em>(via <a href=""http://inscape.tv/"">Inscape</a>)</em></figcaption></figure><p><br>Inscape also looked at viewership for the show during the summer, when Paramount Network milked its popularity through a few weekend rerun marathons. (Data is for May 28 through Sept. 5, 2022 and includes all dayparts).</p><ul><li><em>Yellowstone</em> was the No.1 most-watched program on Paramount Network, with 274 episodes aired in total that captured 24.5% of all minutes watched.</li><li>Each time Paramount aired a Yellowstone marathon, the show jumped into the top 50 ranking of programs on TV by watch-time across all networks for that TV week.</li></ul>",6362bb7605d727003d788ce3,"With Yellowstone’s season five premiere right on the horizon, we used data from VIZIO’s Inscape to quantify the success of the hit Paramount Network show. During season four – Nov. 7, 2021-Jan. 2, 2022 – Yellowstone was No. 11 among all programs by watch-time. The show also accounted for nearly 64% of minutes watched on Paramount Network during that timeframe.


Inscape also looked at viewership for the show during the summer, when Paramount Network milked its popularity through a few weekend rerun marathons. (Data is for May 28 through Sept. 5, 2022 and includes all dayparts).

 * Yellowstone was the No.1 most-watched program on Paramount Network, with 274 episodes aired in total that captured 24.5% of all minutes watched.
 * Each time Paramount aired a Yellowstone marathon, the show jumped into the top 50 ranking of programs on TV by watch-time across all networks for that TV week.",https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1570470276043-874a41ad9b40?crop=entropy&cs=tinysrgb&fit=max&fm=jpg&ixid=MnwxMTc3M3wwfDF8c2VhcmNofDV8fHllbGxvd3N0b25lfGVufDB8fHx8MTY2NzQ5OTEzNA&ixlib=rb-4.0.3&q=80&w=2000,0,post,published,,public,all,2022-11-02T18:48:22.000Z,2022-11-03T18:12:24.000Z,2022-11-02T19:10:56.000Z,,,,,,6359c410975d780031398a07,1,6362c31b05d727003d788d7e,038734bb-4235-4ea7-909c-41f41cc047de,LeBron James Takes On 'Father Time' in New Nike Ad,lebron-james-takes-on-father-time-in-new-nike-ad,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[],""cards"":[[""html"",{""html"":""<div style=\""position:relative; width:100%; padding-top:56.25%; padding-bottom:40px;\""><iframe src=\""https://www.ispot.tv/share/2gZH\"" style=\""position:absolute; top:0; right:0; left:0; bottom:0; width:100%; height:100%;\"" frameborder=\""0\"" scrolling=\""no\"" allowfullscreen=\""\""></iframe></div>""}]],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""https://adage.com/article/hot-spots/new-commercials-taco-bell-nike-crown-royal-nissan-jeep/2447346#""]]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""As Los Angeles Lakers star LeBron James started his 20th NBA season last month, Nike's rolled out a new spot to comically portray his battle with \""Father Time.\"" The character, played by actor Jason Momoa, ultimately falls to James in the spot as a testment to the future Hall-of-Famer's durability over the course of his career.""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""As ""],[0,[0],1,""AdAge notes with data from iSpot""],[0,[],0,"", the ad accounts for 5% of industry TV ad impressions and 9% of est. national TV ad spend over the last 30 days. The character, played by actor Jason Momoa, ultimately falls to James in the spot as a testment to the future Hall-of-Famer's durability over the course of his career.</p><p>As <a href=""https://adage.com/article/hot-spots/new-commercials-taco-bell-nike-crown-royal-nissan-jeep/2447346#"">AdAge notes with data from iSpot</a>, the ad accounts for 5% of industry TV ad impressions and 9% of est. national TV ad spend over the last 30 days. To learn more about this Nike ad and more of the newest TV ads, c<a href=""https://adage.com/article/hot-spots/new-commercials-taco-bell-nike-crown-royal-nissan-jeep/2447346#"">heck out AdAge's Hot Spots</a>.</p><!--kg-card-begin: html--><div style=""position:relative; width:100%; padding-top:56.25%; padding-bottom:40px;""><iframe src=""https://www.ispot.tv/share/2gZH"" style=""position:absolute; top:0; right:0; left:0; bottom:0; width:100%; height:100%;"" frameborder=""0"" scrolling=""no"" allowfullscreen=""""></iframe></div><!--kg-card-end: html-->",6362c31b05d727003d788d7e,"As Los Angeles Lakers star LeBron James started his 20th NBA season last month, Nike's rolled out a new spot to comically portray his battle with ""Father Time."" The character, played by actor Jason Momoa, ultimately falls to James in the spot as a testment to the future Hall-of-Famer's durability over the course of his career.

As AdAge notes with data from iSpot, the ad accounts for 5% of industry TV ad impressions and 9% of est. national TV ad spend over the last 30 days. To learn more about this Nike ad and more of the newest TV ads, check out AdAge's Hot Spots.",https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1546519638-68e109498ffc?crop=entropy&cs=tinysrgb&fit=max&fm=jpg&ixid=MnwxMTc3M3wwfDF8c2VhcmNofDZ8fG5iYXxlbnwwfHx8fDE2Njc0OTU2Mjg&ixlib=rb-4.0.3&q=80&w=2000,0,post,published,,public,all,2022-11-02T19:20:59.000Z,2022-11-03T17:13:55.000Z,2022-11-02T19:26:23.000Z,,,,,,6359c410975d780031398a07,1,6362c3a705d727003d788d91,c283c9cb-bd71-4e87-82fb-84c54a7bf6c5,Ocean Spray Gets The Party Started In Just 15 Seconds,ace-metrix-spotlight-ocean-spray-gets-the-party-started-in-just-15-seconds,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[],""cards"":[[""image"",{""src"":""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2022/11/ace-metrix-ad-spotlightOceanSpray.png"",""width"":667,""height"":682}]],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.adweek.com/creativity/this-party-doesnt-start-until-the-ocean-spray-cranberry-sauce-jiggles""]],[""a"",[""href"",""http://acemetrix.com/""]]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Ocean Spray’s new “Power Your Holidays” campaign aims to show that its canned cranberry sauce isn’t just a side dish, but a true party starter. A silent Thanksgiving dinner turns into a wiggly dance party as soon as the cranberry sauce arrives at the table. Soon, the somber-faced family members are shaking erratically in an ad that you can’t help but giggle at given the quirky absurdity. As noted by Adweek, this is part of Ocean Spray’s effort “""],[0,[0],1,""to connect with the TikTok generation and extend its multigenerational appeal.""],[0,[],0,""” ""]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""A few more insights via iSpot's ""],[0,[1],1,""Ace Metrix""],[0,[],0,"": ""]]],[3,""ul"",[[[0,[],0,""The :15 second ad was rated by survey respondents as more memorable than the minute-long version""]],[[0,[],0,""The shorter creative is driving much better brand awareness than the longer form, at 73% unaided recall vs. 45% for the :60.""]],[[0,[],0,""The :15 successfully resonated with younger viewers aged 21-49, suggesting the campaign is achieving its objective at reaching a youthful demographic.""]],[[0,[],0,""Viewer comments reflect a surprisingly funny creative that also reflected the true nature of the product in a positive way. Many appreciated how the ad embraced the glory of the product in its natural, wiggly state straight from the can.""]],[[0,[],0,""Due to the higher resonance and much stronger engagement across age (as seen in Ace’s second by second trace results), the :15 \""Power Your Holidays\"" also drove better intent, with 53% reporting positive consideration.""]]]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>Ocean Spray’s new “Power Your Holidays” campaign aims to show that its canned cranberry sauce isn’t just a side dish, but a true party starter. A silent Thanksgiving dinner turns into a wiggly dance party as soon as the cranberry sauce arrives at the table. Soon, the somber-faced family members are shaking erratically in an ad that you can’t help but giggle at given the quirky absurdity. As noted by Adweek, this is part of Ocean Spray’s effort “<a href=""https://www.adweek.com/creativity/this-party-doesnt-start-until-the-ocean-spray-cranberry-sauce-jiggles"">to connect with the TikTok generation and extend its multigenerational appeal.</a>” </p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2022/11/ace-metrix-ad-spotlightOceanSpray.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""667"" height=""682"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2022/11/ace-metrix-ad-spotlightOceanSpray.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2022/11/ace-metrix-ad-spotlightOceanSpray.png 667w""></figure><p>A few more insights via iSpot's <a href=""http://acemetrix.com/"">Ace Metrix</a>: </p><ul><li>The :15 second ad was rated by survey respondents as more memorable than the minute-long version</li><li>The shorter creative is driving much better brand awareness than the longer form, at 73% unaided recall vs. 45% for the :60.</li><li>The :15 successfully resonated with younger viewers aged 21-49, suggesting the campaign is achieving its objective at reaching a youthful demographic.</li><li>Viewer comments reflect a surprisingly funny creative that also reflected the true nature of the product in a positive way. Many appreciated how the ad embraced the glory of the product in its natural, wiggly state straight from the can.</li><li>Due to the higher resonance and much stronger engagement across age (as seen in Ace’s second by second trace results), the :15 ""Power Your Holidays"" also drove better intent, with 53% reporting positive consideration.</li></ul>",6362c3a705d727003d788d91,"Ocean Spray’s new “Power Your Holidays” campaign aims to show that its canned cranberry sauce isn’t just a side dish, but a true party starter. A silent Thanksgiving dinner turns into a wiggly dance party as soon as the cranberry sauce arrives at the table. Soon, the somber-faced family members are shaking erratically in an ad that you can’t help but giggle at given the quirky absurdity. As noted by Adweek, this is part of Ocean Spray’s effort “to connect with the TikTok generation and extend its multigenerational appeal.”

A few more insights via iSpot's Ace Metrix:

 * The :15 second ad was rated by survey respondents as more memorable than the minute-long version
 * The shorter creative is driving much better brand awareness than the longer form, at 73% unaided recall vs. 45% for the :60.
 * The :15 successfully resonated with younger viewers aged 21-49, suggesting the campaign is achieving its objective at reaching a youthful demographic.
 * Viewer comments reflect a surprisingly funny creative that also reflected the true nature of the product in a positive way. Many appreciated how the ad embraced the glory of the product in its natural, wiggly state straight from the can.

However, the brand also hasn't advertised on TV much since the pandemic started back in 2020, according to data from <a href=""http://ispot.tv"">iSpot</a>.</p><p>During the first three months of 2020, Chili's was the No. 7 most-seen casual dining brand by TV ad impressions, and during all of 2019, Chili's was also No. 7 while spending over $38 million on national TV ad spots.</p><p>Since then, Chili's has only spent about $300K on national TV ads, with no spend at all since October 2021. The chart below shows more around the steep drop-off, as other casual dining competitors have been spending close to pre-pandemic rates on TV ads.</p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><a href=""http://ispot.tv""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2022/11/chilis_brand-overview_media-measurement-by-date_01-01-2020_to_10-14-2022.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1600"" height=""600"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2022/11/chilis_brand-overview_media-measurement-by-date_01-01-2020_to_10-14-2022.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2022/11/chilis_brand-overview_media-measurement-by-date_01-01-2020_to_10-14-2022.png 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2022/11/chilis_brand-overview_media-measurement-by-date_01-01-2020_to_10-14-2022.png 1600w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></a></figure>",6362c4ac05d727003d788de8,"As Bloomberg recently detailed, Chili's is trying new methods to get diners back in the doors of its restaurants. However, the brand also hasn't advertised on TV much since the pandemic started back in 2020, according to data from iSpot.

During the first three months of 2020, Chili's was the No. 7 most-seen casual dining brand by TV ad impressions, and during all of 2019, Chili's was also No. 7 while spending over $38 million on national TV ad spots.

Since then, Chili's has only spent about $300K on national TV ads, with no spend at all since October 2021.  * Two installments of the Halloween franchise made the top five: Halloween H20: 20 Years Later, which captured 5.18% of all minutes watched of horror content, and Halloween 5: The Revenge of Michael Myers (3.59% of horror minutes watched)
 * A Nightmare on Elm Street, Jaws and House of Wax also made the top five.

The data reveals how Food Network’s content brings audiences to insurance companies’ websites at higher rates, across the board. This is especially interesting when we compare Food Network’s social audience with that of Tastemade (a digital-first media company), and Food Ranger (an influencer and travel blogger).""]]],[10,0],[3,""ul"",[[[0,[],0,""Those watching Food Network social content are 8.8x more likely to visit insurance brands’ websites, on average.""]],[[0,[],0,""Liberty Mutual and AllState see the highest amount of web traffic from Food Network’s audience, at 10.8x and 10.2x respectively""]]]],[1,""p"",[[1,[],0,0]]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>A consumer insights report from <a href=""http://tubularlabs.com"">Tubular Labs</a> looks at the online habits of Food Network’s social audience. The data reveals how Food Network’s content brings audiences to insurance companies’ websites at higher rates, across the board. This is especially interesting when we compare Food Network’s social audience with that of Tastemade (a digital-first media company), and Food Ranger (an influencer and travel blogger).</p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card kg-card-hascaption""><a href=""https://tubularlabs.com/""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2022/11/Screen-Shot-2022-10-26-at-11.08.50-AM.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""750"" height=""420"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2022/11/Screen-Shot-2022-10-26-at-11.08.50-AM.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2022/11/Screen-Shot-2022-10-26-at-11.08.50-AM.png 750w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></a><figcaption><em>(via <a href=""https://tubularlabs.com/"">Tubular Labs</a>)</em></figcaption></figure><ul><li>Those watching Food Network social content are 8.8x more likely to visit insurance brands’ websites, on average.</li><li>Liberty Mutual and AllState see the highest amount of web traffic from Food Network’s audience, at 10.8x and 10.2x respectively</li></ul>",6362c7f805d727003d788eac,"A consumer insights report from Tubular Labs looks at the online habits of Food Network’s social audience. The data reveals how Food Network’s content brings audiences to insurance companies’ websites at higher rates, across the board. This is especially interesting when we compare Food Network’s social audience with that of Tastemade (a digital-first media company), and Food Ranger (an influencer and travel blogger).

 * Those watching Food Network social content are 8.8x more likely to visit insurance brands’ websites, on average.
 * Liberty Mutual and AllState see the highest amount of web traffic from Food Network’s audience, at 10.8x and 10.2x respectively",__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2022/11/Hungry-for-Insurance.jpg,0,post,published,,public,all,2022-11-02T19:41:44.000Z,2022-11-03T20:41:46.000Z,2022-11-02T19:55:25.000Z,,,,,,6359c410975d780031398a07,1,6362c8a005d727003d788ef9,3bdeef57-43f2-43e9-b7cc-54c5349f1b0a,CPG Brands Turn The Tide In Q3,cpg-brands-turn-the-tide-in-q3,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[[""soft-return"","""",{}]],""cards"":[[""image"",{""src"":""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2022/11/Screen-Shot-2022-10-25-at-4.02.47-PM.png"",""width"":1000,""height"":403,""caption"":""Q3’s Most-Seen CPG Brands by TV Ad SOV (new-airing programming only) <em>via <a href=\""https://www.ispot.tv/hub/resources/free-reports/q3-cpg-tv-advertising-rundown/\"">iSpot</a></em>"",""href"":""https://www.ispot.tv/hub/resources/free-reports/q3-cpg-tv-advertising-rundown/""}]],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""https://ispot-blog.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2022/10/25145646/CPG-LP-Graphic-600x400-2.png""]]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Along with ""],[0,[0],1,""its new Q3 report""],[0,[],0,"", iSpot shared a list of the most seen CPG brands on TV last quarter, by share-of-voice (SOV). Most notable on that list: pet food manufacturer Blue Buffalo jumped into the top 10 from No. 26 in Q2 with a 32.9% increase in impressions, aided by more airings on morning talk shows like Today and Good Morning America. Nutrition drink Boost also grew, with a 50% increase in impressions quarter-over-quarter.

 * Downy and Tide held the top two spots by impressions SOV in the category, at 3.32% and 2.87% respectively.
 * CNN and MSNBC were two of the networks with the highest increase in ad airings (+166.5% and 153.3%, respectively), leading to 2x impressions SOV increases for those channels versus Q2.

Spend is also ramping up in Arizona, which has seen a 200% increase during the same time period.</li><li>Some news publishers that are seeing big increases as we enter the homestretch include FOX News, CNN, MSN News, CBS News, USA Today, CNBC, and Bloomberg. Other non-news networks and platforms are seeing impression spikes as well, including Tubi, PlutoTV, ESPN, Bravo, and FX.</li><li>Looking at the top six congressional districts by impressions, three of them are in Wisconsin (Districts 08, 05 and 01). The others include New Hampshire District 01, Pennsylvania District 07 and California District 49.</li></ul>",6362c92d05d727003d788f11,"As the midterm elections approach, political advertising is heating up and candidates are on track to shell out nearly $9 billion in ad spend, with $1.5 billion of that going to connected TV. Madhive, a leading tech company in the TV advertising space, recently examined current political advertising trends and discovered that average daily political impressions on connected TV are up 96% in October vs. September this year.

 * In addition to the aforementioned month-over-month increase in average daily political ad impressions, there was a 46% week-over-week increase from October 10th vs October 3rd.
 * While it got off to a slow start, political ad impressions are ramping up in California, which has taken the top spot with a 32.03% increase in impressions week-over-week from October 10th vs October 3rd, and overall has captured 14% of political ad impressions. Spend is also ramping up in Arizona, which has seen a 200% increase during the same time period.
 * Some news publishers that are seeing big increases as we enter the homestretch include FOX News, CNN, MSN News, CBS News, USA Today, CNBC, and Bloomberg. Other non-news networks and platforms are seeing impression spikes as well, including Tubi, PlutoTV, ESPN, Bravo, and FX.
 * Looking at the top six congressional districts by impressions, three of them are in Wisconsin (Districts 08, 05 and 01). The others include New Hampshire District 01, Pennsylvania District 07 and California District not children reside in a household, is often incorrect within big data sets.</p><ul><li>Only 40% of data sets accurately indicated the presence of children.</li><li>While overall marital status is correct 63% of the time, “single” responses present accurately just 22% of the time.</li><li>For a CPG brand running a $2 million TV ad campaign targeted at families on cable, that could mean as much The spot <em>does</em> feature Curry at the end, with the playful comment “I just never dance in public.” </p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2022/11/ace-metrix-ad-spotlightrakuten.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""667"" height=""618"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2022/11/ace-metrix-ad-spotlightrakuten.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2022/11/ace-metrix-ad-spotlightrakuten.png 667w""></figure><p>A few additional insights via iSpot’s <a href=""http://acemetrix.com"">Ace Metrix</a> : </p><ul><li>The interesting music and dancing characters were excellent attention-getters: 22% of survey respondents said the characters were the single best thing about the ad, while 16% thought the music was the best aspect.</li><li>The funny scenes were engaging to many viewers, with most also feeling that the ad educated well on the cash back opportunities. Across the full gen pop audience, 47% reported positive intent to visit/use Rakuten (+10 points over its recent :30 ""Cha-Ching While You Sing'') after seeing the newest ad.</li><li>Although enjoying great appeal among NBA fans (of any level), the new spot also resonated well across age/gender and ethnicity, suggesting opportunity to air it broadly beyond NBA programming</li><li>Emotional profiling reveals the new ad connected through the humor while sparking some “curiosity”</li><li>Gen pop viewers engaged with both Curry (and other characters) and the music, both of which were disproportionately forward vs. other discount website ads from the past year.</li></ul>",6363bdb805d727003d788fc4,"Rakuten is taking a play out of Stephen Curry’s book with its recent ad featuring the NBA star himself — although you won’t see him breaking out the moves this time. Instead, the ad shows people in everyday life getting their groove on after receiving cash back from Rakuten. The spot does feature Curry at the end, with the playful comment “I just never dance in public.”

A few additional insights via iSpot’s Ace Metrix :

 * The interesting music and dancing characters were excellent attention-getters: 22% of survey respondents said the characters were the single best thing about the ad, while 16% thought the music was the best aspect.
 * The funny scenes were engaging to many viewers, with most also feeling that the ad educated well on the cash back opportunities. Across the full gen pop audience, 47% reported positive intent to visit/use Rakuten (+10 points over its recent :30 ""Cha-Ching While You Sing'') after seeing the newest ad.
 * Although enjoying great appeal among NBA fans (of any level), the new spot also resonated well across age/gender and ethnicity, suggesting opportunity to air it broadly beyond NBA programming
 * Emotional profiling reveals the new ad connected through the humor while sparking some “curiosity”

A little more about the pet care brand’s recent push: </p><ul><li>Fi Collars, established in 2017, had never advertised on national TV before Oct. 24, 2022, when it debuted “<a href=""https://www.ispot.tv/ad/2TBY/fi-series-3-not-just-a-dog"">Not Just a Dog</a>” on the Travel channel during <em>Beyond the Unknown: Dueling Mammoths, Stanford Prison Experiment </em>and<em> MIT Blackjack</em></li><li>As of Nov. 2, this spot has aired over 600 times and been seen primarily on <em>First Take </em>(9.19% TV ad impressions share), <em>The First 48</em> (5.87% impressions share) and <em>The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon</em> (4.21%)</li><li>Fi has spent a little over $250K on TV ad placements, generating 36.6 million TV ad impressions in the week and a half since the campaign kicked off.  </li></ul><!--kg-card-begin: html--><div style=""position:relative; width:100%; padding-top:56.25%; padding-bottom:40px;""><iframe src=""https://www.ispot.tv/share/2TBY"" style=""position:absolute; top:0; right:0; left:0; bottom:0; width:100%; height:100%;"" frameborder=""0"" scrolling=""no"" allowfullscreen=""""></iframe></div><!--kg-card-end: html-->",6363bf7105d727003d788ff5,"iSpot.tv data reveals a recent newcomer to the national TV advertising scene: Fi Collars, which began airing its spot “Not Just a Dog” on Oct. 24. A little more about the pet care brand’s recent push:

 * Fi Collars, established in 2017, had never advertised on national TV before Oct. 24, 2022, when it debuted “Not Just a Dog” on the Travel channel during Beyond the Unknown: Dueling Mammoths, Stanford Prison Experiment and MIT Blackjack
 * As of Nov. 2, this spot has aired over 600 times and been seen primarily on First Take (9.19% TV ad impressions share), The First 48 (5.87% impressions share) and The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon (4.21%)

When looking at September's numbers, one of the big takeaways is that Cocomelon is dominant in the U.S. once again.</p><p>Tubular data shows Cocomelon - Nursery Rhymes was the No. 1 U.S. creator in September 2022, with 62.7 million unique viewers across YouTube and Facebook – or 57% more than the next-best creator, The McCarty's, who are all-in on YouTube Shorts. </p><p>Interestingly, it's actually the lowest U.S. unique viewer figure for Cocomelon - Nursery Rhymes since April 2022; perhaps speaking to kids being back in school. Tubular data shows Cocomelon - Nursery Rhymes was the No. 1 U.S. creator in September 2022, with 62.7 million unique viewers across YouTube and Facebook – or 57% more than the next-best creator, The McCarty's, who are all-in on YouTube Shorts.

Still, such a high figure – despite Cocomelon also appearing on streaming platforms – speaks to the power Cocomelon wields as a creator.

 * The :30s version drove stronger purchase intent (54%, +5 above the online stores norm) than the shorter creative, particularly among the key demographic target of 36+.

TV ad impressions were also down 5.5% as car brands seemed to move even more buys to NFL programming.</p><p>Toyota was the most-seen brand, with 10.44% of automaker TV ad impressions, followed by Lexus (8.65%) and Hyundai (7.60%). ""]]],[3,""ul"",[[[0,[],0,""According to Tribe, a data platform that helps power ""],[0,[1],1,""CreatorIQ""],[0,[],0,""’s insights, only 19 percent of beauty brands spend less than $200,000 on influencer marketing annually.""]],[[0,[],0,""Despite this statistic, measuring the success of influencer campaigns via sales and spend numbers isn’t a holistic approach to assessing ROI.""]],[[0,[],0,""Starr explains, “the more creator content that is being generated about your brand, and the more creators are talking about your brand actively, the more consumers are searching for your brand online. That desirability aspect is super interesting.”""]]]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>Building a beauty brand in 2022 is a costly endeavor. Brit Starr, senior vice president of strategy at CreatorIQ, told <a href=""https://web.archive.org/web/20221104151122/https://wwd.com/beauty-industry-news/beauty-features/beauty-brand-cost-to-scale-rise-1235406318/"">Women’s Wear Daily</a> that the big brands with more money to spend see the most success when it comes to social media engagement. </p><ul><li>According to Tribe, a data platform that helps power <a href=""https://www.creatoriq.com/"">CreatorIQ</a>’s insights, only 19 percent of beauty brands spend less than $200,000 on influencer marketing annually.</li><li>Despite this statistic, measuring the success of influencer campaigns via sales and spend numbers isn’t a holistic approach to assessing ROI.</li><li>Starr explains, “the more creator content that is being generated about your brand, and the more creators are talking about your brand actively, the more consumers are searching for your brand online. That desirability aspect is super interesting.”</li></ul>",63657e87b49ce9003d81853a,"Building a beauty brand in 2022 is a costly endeavor. Brit Starr, senior vice president of strategy at CreatorIQ, told Women’s Wear Daily that the big brands with more money to spend see the most success when it comes to social media engagement.

 * According to Tribe, a data platform that helps power CreatorIQ’s insights, only 19 percent of beauty brands spend less than $200,000 on influencer marketing annually.
 * Despite this statistic, measuring the success of influencer campaigns via sales and spend numbers isn’t a holistic approach to assessing ROI.
 * Starr explains, “the more creator content that is being generated about your brand, and the more creators are talking about your brand actively, the more consumers are searching for your brand online. That desirability aspect is super interesting.”",https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1635011340527-f7aeac346b01?crop=entropy&cs=tinysrgb&fit=max&fm=jpg&ixid=MnwxMTc3M3wwfDF8c2VhcmNofDR8fGJlYXV0eSUyMGJyYW5kfGVufDB8fHx8MTY2NzU5ODQ2Mg&ixlib=rb-4.0.3&q=80&w=2000,0,post,published,,public,all,2022-11-04T21:05:11.000Z,2022-11-04T21:48:30.000Z,2022-11-04T21:48:30.000Z,,,,,,6359c410975d780031398a07,1,636a8f88101b88003d9b78bf,34c2809a-c5cb-462a-8e0a-615fe7aad058,FanDuel Keeps Betting on TV Advertising,fanduel,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[],""cards"":[[""image"",{""src"":""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2022/11/custom-industry-online-sports-betting-custom-brands_industry-overview_top-brands_11-06-2021_to_11-06-2022.png"",""width"":1800,""height"":900,""href"":""http://ispot.tv""}]],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""http://ispot.tv""]],[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.mediapost.com/publications/article/379530/fox-corp-wins-the-right-to-buy-fanduel-option-.html""]]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Sports betting keeps growing as the biggest brands in the space continue to spend on TV advertising to entice both new and existing bettors. FanDuel, in particular, has spent $114.3 million on national TV advertising alone over the last 365 days, according to ""],[0,[0],1,""iSpot""],[0,[],0,"" – which is nearly 35% of the total for the sports betting industry in that timeframe. The total also doesn't include local TV ads, which account for over 28% of sports betting TV ad impressions (given the localized nature of betting and betting legality in the U.S. right now).""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""MediaPost recently ""],[0,[1],1,""noted that Fox Corp. has won the right to buy an 18.6% stake in FanDuel""],[0,[],0,"", though the price tag is too steep to exercise at this time. Given the amount of money sportsbooks seemingly need to spend to during football season each year, that may always be the case.""]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>Sports betting keeps growing as the biggest brands in the space continue to spend on TV advertising to entice both new and existing bettors. FanDuel, in particular, has spent $114.3 million on national TV advertising alone over the last 365 days, according to <a href=""http://ispot.tv"">iSpot</a> – which is nearly 35% of the total for the sports betting industry in that timeframe. The total also doesn't include local TV ads, which account for over 28% of sports betting TV ad impressions (given the localized nature of betting and betting legality in the U.S. right now).</p><p>MediaPost recently <a href=""https://www.mediapost.com/publications/article/379530/fox-corp-wins-the-right-to-buy-fanduel-option-.html"">noted that Fox Corp. has won the right to buy an 18.6% stake in FanDuel</a>, though the price tag is too steep to exercise at this time. Given the amount of money sportsbooks seemingly need to spend to during football season each year, that may always be the case.</p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><a href=""http://ispot.tv""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2022/11/custom-industry-online-sports-betting-custom-brands_industry-overview_top-brands_11-06-2021_to_11-06-2022.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1800"" height=""900"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2022/11/custom-industry-online-sports-betting-custom-brands_industry-overview_top-brands_11-06-2021_to_11-06-2022.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2022/11/custom-industry-online-sports-betting-custom-brands_industry-overview_top-brands_11-06-2021_to_11-06-2022.png 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1600/2022/11/custom-industry-online-sports-betting-custom-brands_industry-overview_top-brands_11-06-2021_to_11-06-2022.png 1600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2022/11/custom-industry-online-sports-betting-custom-brands_industry-overview_top-brands_11-06-2021_to_11-06-2022.png 1800w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></a></figure>",636a8f88101b88003d9b78bf,"Sports betting keeps growing as the biggest brands in the space continue to spend on TV advertising to entice both new and existing bettors. FanDuel, in particular, has spent $114.3 million on national TV advertising alone over the last 365 days, according to iSpot – which is nearly 35% of the total for the sports betting industry in that timeframe. The total also doesn't include local TV ads, which account for over 28% of sports betting TV ad impressions (given the localized nature of betting and betting legality in the U.S. right now).

MediaPost recently noted that Fox Corp. has won the right to buy an 18.6% stake in FanDuel, though the price tag is too steep to exercise at this time. Given the amount of money sportsbooks seemingly need to spend to during football season each year, that may always be the case.",https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1601588462898-cb949cee5702?crop=entropy&cs=tinysrgb&fit=max&fm=jpg&ixid=MnwxMTc3M3wwfDF8c2VhcmNofDN8fHNwb3J0cyUyMGJldHRpbmd8ZW58MHx8fHwxNjY3OTI4MjYw&ixlib=rb-4.0.3&q=80&w=2000,0,post,published,,public,all,2022-11-08T17:19:04.000Z,2022-12-06T19:18:07.000Z,2022-11-08T17:25:24.000Z,,,,,,6359c410975d780031398a07,1,636a912a101b88003d9b790c,4a659f93-c64c-479c-a6ae-fc054b2a8968,"World Series TV Ad Impressions, Spend Decrease Year-Over-Year",world-series-tv-ad-impressions-spend-decrease-year-over-year,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[],""cards"":[[""html"",{""html"":""<div style=\""position:relative; width:100%; padding-top:56.25%; padding-bottom:40px;\""><iframe src=\""https://www.ispot.tv/share/2531\"" style=\""position:absolute; top:0; right:0; left:0; bottom:0; width:100%; height:100%;\"" frameborder=\""0\"" scrolling=\""no\"" allowfullscreen=\""\""></iframe></div>""}]],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.nexttv.com/news/world-series-ad-spending-on-fox-down-91-to-dollar194-million-ispot""]],[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.ispot.tv/hub/samsung-ads-score-during-world-series/""]]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Even with the excitement around the Philadelphia Phillies' surprising run to the World Series, it wasn't enough to fuel an increase in TV ad impressions or est. national TV ad spend for this year's Fall Classic. ""],[0,[0],1,""Data from iSpot""],[0,[],0,"" shows that national TV ad spend during 2022 World Series on Fox was down 9.1% year-over-year, to $194.4 million. TV ad impressions declined 7.7% as well, to 5.87 billion.""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Taking some guesses around the decreases in both spend and impressions vs. last year's World Series: The final three games of the 2022 series were not overly competitive, fans could be experiencing Houston Astros fatigue after the team made its fourth World Series in six years, and the Phillies lack the more national following the Braves (last year's champion) possess.""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Samsung Mobile was the ""],[0,[1],1,""most-seen advertiser of this year's World Series""],[0,[],0,"", with 3.20% of all TV ad impressions on Fox.""]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>Even with the excitement around the Philadelphia Phillies' surprising run to the World Series, it wasn't enough to fuel an increase in TV ad impressions or est. national TV ad spend for this year's Fall Classic. <a href=""https://www.nexttv.com/news/world-series-ad-spending-on-fox-down-91-to-dollar194-million-ispot"">Data from iSpot</a> shows that national TV ad spend during 2022 World Series on Fox was down 9.1% year-over-year, to $194.4 million. TV ad impressions declined 7.7% as well, to 5.87 billion.</p><p>Taking some guesses around the decreases in both spend and impressions vs. last year's World Series: The final three games of the 2022 series were not overly competitive, fans could be experiencing Houston Astros fatigue after the team made its fourth World Series in six years, and the Phillies lack the more national following the Braves (last year's champion) possess.</p><p>Samsung Mobile was the <a href=""https://www.ispot.tv/hub/samsung-ads-score-during-world-series/"">most-seen advertiser of this year's World Series</a>, with 3.20% of all TV ad impressions on Fox.</p><!--kg-card-begin: html--><div style=""position:relative; width:100%; padding-top:56.25%; padding-bottom:40px;""><iframe src=""https://www.ispot.tv/share/2531"" style=""position:absolute; top:0; right:0; left:0; bottom:0; width:100%; height:100%;"" frameborder=""0"" scrolling=""no"" allowfullscreen=""""></iframe></div><!--kg-card-end: html-->",636a912a101b88003d9b790c,"Even with the excitement around the Philadelphia Phillies' surprising run to the World Series, it wasn't enough to fuel an increase in TV ad impressions or est. national TV ad spend for this year's Fall Classic. Data from iSpot shows that national TV ad spend during 2022 World Series on Fox was down 9.1% year-over-year, to $194.4 million. TV ad impressions declined 7.7% as well, to 5.87 billion.

Taking some guesses around the decreases in both spend and impressions vs. last year's World Series: The final three games of the 2022 series were not overly competitive, fans could be experiencing Houston Astros fatigue after the team made its fourth World Series in six years, and the Phillies lack the more national following the Braves (last year's champion) possess.

Over the last six months, CNN viewers are doing a lot of shopping for chicken and turkey products (15.9x more likely than the norm). Are they getting ahead of Thanksgiving? Or just enthusiastic about poultry? Brands in the space may want to know, and adjust CNN ads accordingly.</p><ul><li>Meanwhile, MSNBC social video viewers were 37.4x more likely than the norm to shop for Amazon for gun scopes, and 36.3x more likely to shop for jewelry casting machines.</li><li>Fox News viewers are shopping Amazon for books about conservatism &amp; liberalism (45.9x more likely than the norm) and 43.1x more likely to shop for gun swivels.</li></ul><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><a href=""https://tubularlabs.com/""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2022/11/copy-copy-madhive-political.jpeg"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1378"" height=""787"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2022/11/copy-copy-madhive-political.jpeg 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2022/11/copy-copy-madhive-political.jpeg 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2022/11/copy-copy-madhive-political.jpeg 1378w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></a></figure>",636bf3cb101b88003d9b79fd,"Data from Tubular Labs reveals how likely CNN social video viewers are to shop for specific product categories on Amazon, relative to the norm for all audiences. Data from VIZIO’s ""],[0,[0],1,""Inscape""],[0,[],0,"" shows that from Oct. 28-Nov. 5 the World Series accounted for 10.78% of minutes watched across ABC, CBS, Fox and NBC. That barely trailed the NFL (11.1%) and college football (10.94%) despite more games for those sports in the timeframe.""]]],[3,""ul"",[[[0,[],0,""The World Series was a big hit for Fox, in particular, with 31.48% of all minutes watched on the network from Oct. 28-Nov. 5 (more than double what the NFL accounted for).""]],[[0,[],0,""Fox’s ""],[0,[1],1,""World Series Pre-Game""],[0,[],0,"" show also made up 3.28% of minutes watched on the network during that stretch — No. 4 among all programs.""]]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>While football owns the fall, this year’s World Series still managed to compete for eyeballs across broadcast networks. Data from VIZIO’s <a href=""http://inscape.tv/"">Inscape</a> shows that from Oct. 28-Nov. 5 the World Series accounted for 10.78% of minutes watched across ABC, CBS, Fox and NBC. That barely trailed the NFL (11.1%) and college football (10.94%) despite more games for those sports in the timeframe.</p><ul><li>The World Series was a big hit for Fox, in particular, with 31.48% of all minutes watched on the network from Oct. 28-Nov. 5 (more than double what the NFL accounted for).</li><li>Fox’s <em>World Series Pre-Game</em> show also made up 3.28% of minutes watched on the network during that stretch — No. 4 among all programs.</li></ul><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><a href=""http://inscape.tv/""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2022/11/copy-madhive-political-ctv-tvrev.jpeg"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1500"" height=""762"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2022/11/copy-madhive-political-ctv-tvrev.jpeg 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2022/11/copy-madhive-political-ctv-tvrev.jpeg 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2022/11/copy-madhive-political-ctv-tvrev.jpeg 1500w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></a></figure>",636bf518101b88003d9b7a1f,"While football owns the fall, this year’s World Series still managed to compete for eyeballs across broadcast networks.  * The World Series was a big hit for Fox, in particular, with 31.48% of all minutes watched on the network from Oct. 28-Nov. 5 (more than double what the NFL accounted for).

""],[0,[0],1,""Using data from iSpot, AdAge shares""],[0,[],0,"" that the ad landed nearly 2.6 million impressions in the last 30 days (28% of industry), with an est. national TV ad spend of almost $21 million (34% of the industry’s total). The quirkiness of the ad seemed to pay off well for Amazon, as the spot held an attention index of 102, with 2% fewer interruptions than average. ""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""For more on this Amazon ad and other top new TV ads, check out ""],[0,[1],1,""Hot Spots""],[0,[],0,"".""]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>As the holiday shopping season looms, Amazon wants consumers to know about their early Black Friday deals.</p><p>The brand’s new spot, “Holidays: Lonely Yeti”, depicts the mythical creature as being socially rejuvenated, after discovering Amazon’s early Black Friday deals. <a href=""https://adage.com/article/hot-spots/new-commercials-peloton-macys-walmart-iams-dunkin/2449991#"">Using data from iSpot, AdAge shares</a> that the ad landed nearly 2.6 million impressions in the last 30 days (28% of industry), with an est. national TV ad spend of almost $21 million (34% of the industry’s total). The quirkiness of the ad seemed to pay off well for Amazon, as the spot held an attention index of 102, with 2% fewer interruptions than average. </p><p>For more on this Amazon ad and other top new TV ads, check out <a href=""https://adage.com/article/hot-spots/new-commercials-peloton-macys-walmart-iams-dunkin/2449991"">Hot Spots</a>.</p><!--kg-card-begin: html--><div style=""position:relative; width:100%; padding-top:56.25%; padding-bottom:40px;""><iframe src=""https://www.ispot.tv/share/2GUp"" style=""position:absolute; top:0; right:0; left:0; bottom:0; width:100%; height:100%;"" frameborder=""0"" scrolling=""no"" allowfullscreen=""""></iframe></div><!--kg-card-end: html-->",636bfc9a101b88003d9b7a7b,"As the holiday shopping season looms, Amazon wants consumers to know about their early Black Friday deals.

The brand’s new spot, “Holidays: Lonely Yeti”, depicts the mythical creature as being socially rejuvenated, after discovering Amazon’s early Black Friday deals. Using data from iSpot, AdAge shares that the ad landed nearly 2.6 million impressions in the last 30 days (28% of industry), with an est. national TV ad spend of almost $21 million (34% of the industry’s total). The quirkiness of the ad seemed to pay off well for Amazon, as the spot held an attention index of 102, with 2% fewer interruptions than average.

 * After six games, the Houston Astros defeated the Philadelphia Phillies in the World Series, which accounted for 3.12% of watch-time during the week.
 * CBS takes first place on the network ranking, thanks in part to NFL and college football, with 9.04% of minutes watched (up from 7.32% the previous week).
 * Fox, benefiting primarily from the World Series, edges out NBC to take second place on the network chart, with 8.01% of watch-time.

The climb resulted in an estimated 2.59 million additional visitors to Nike in June – and this without any official relationship in place.</p><p>When brands understand where traffic is coming from, it can help better inform social video partnerships and ad buying practices, to maximize investments on those platforms.</p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><a href=""http://tubularlabs.com""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2022/11/Screen-Shot-2022-11-10-at-10.00.04-AM.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1616"" height=""716"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2022/11/Screen-Shot-2022-11-10-at-10.00.04-AM.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2022/11/Screen-Shot-2022-11-10-at-10.00.04-AM.png 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1600/2022/11/Screen-Shot-2022-11-10-at-10.00.04-AM.png 1600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2022/11/Screen-Shot-2022-11-10-at-10.00.04-AM.png 1616w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></a></figure>",636d3c49101b88003d9b7b93,"Individual creators wield a ton of power on social video, and whether they have official relationships or not, many can drive increased traffic (and business) for brands.

One large-scale instance of that push is with MrBeast and Nike. Tubular Labs data shared with TheInformation shows how the share of MrBeast viewers visiting Nike.com increased from February through June of 2022, from 3.4% to 5.0%. The climb resulted in an estimated 2.59 million additional visitors to Nike in June – and this without any official relationship in place.

In its 2023 lookahead identifying key trends around content creation, Tubular Labs highlights some key figures for brands, agencies and publishers to consider. For instance...

 * In a single, three-month period, more than 1.3 million sports-related videos are uploaded across social video platforms.
 * Over the past year, influencer-created content was watched 13.2 times more than media and brand content combined (so it makes much more sense to spend on partnering).
 * It takes just 14 days for trending TikTok sound video views to go from origin to peak, so anyone looking to take advantage needs to move rapidly.

While the Turner Sports-owned site has found big success in the past with events its parent company owns broadcast rights to (like the NBA and March Madness), it's not necessarily as simple for the Fox-owned World Cup.</p><p>Using data from <a href=""http://tubularlabs.com"">Tubular Labs</a>, Digiday shows that B/R Football had over 122 million cross-platform social video views in September, with those predominantly coming from U.S. males aged 18 to 34.</p><p>So while B/R Football won't be able to use highlights, it'll spend the World Cup speaking directly to that audience with analysis and commentary segments, plus shorter cutdowns on platforms like Instagram and TikTok. Since Fox doesn't have the same digital-first outlet like Bleacher Report at its disposal, it'll be interesting to see how it performs during the World Cup (with access to match highlights) vs. B/R Football.</p><!--kg-card-begin: html--><iframe width=""560"" height=""315"" src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/OilIL97Vg0s"" title=""YouTube video player"" frameborder=""0"" allow=""accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture"" allowfullscreen></iframe><!--kg-card-end: html-->",6373d40632100b004d44582a,"Digiday recently looked into how Bleacher Report is aiming to differentiate its coverage going into this year's FIFA Men's World Cup. Popeyes is pushing new chicken sandwich menu items right now, and they're far from the only ones, ""],[0,[0],1,""as AdAge details""],[0,[],0,"".""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Using data from iSpot, ""],[0,[0],1,""AdAge spotlights how competitors are spending on chicken sandwiches""],[0,[],0,"" this year. Arby's has increased its est. national TV ad spend on chicken sandwiches from $1 million last year to $11.3 million this year, while Panera Bread has jumped from $4.3 million to $25.5 million so far. Meanwhile, brands like McDonald's and Burger King have decreased est. national TV ad spend on chicken sandwiches year-over-year by comparison.""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Popeyes' new Thanksgiving-centric spot can be viewed below.""]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>If you feel like you've seen more chicken sandwich ads lately, you're not alone. Popeyes is pushing new chicken sandwich menu items right now, and they're far from the only ones, <a href=""https://adage.com/article/marketing-news-strategy/how-popeyes-trying-restart-chicken-sandwich-wars/2451836"">as AdAge details</a>.</p><p>Using data from iSpot, <a href=""https://adage.com/article/marketing-news-strategy/how-popeyes-trying-restart-chicken-sandwich-wars/2451836"">AdAge spotlights how competitors are spending on chicken sandwiches</a> this year. Arby's has increased its est. national TV ad spend on chicken sandwiches from $1 million last year to $11.3 million this year, while Panera Bread has jumped from $4.3 million to $25.5 million so far. Meanwhile, brands like McDonald's and Burger King have decreased est. national TV ad spend on chicken sandwiches year-over-year by comparison.</p><p>Popeyes' new Thanksgiving-centric spot can be viewed below.</p><!--kg-card-begin: html--><div style=""position:relative; width:100%; padding-top:56.25%; padding-bottom:40px;""><iframe src=""https://www.ispot.tv/share/2Soj"" style=""position:absolute; top:0; right:0; left:0; bottom:0; width:100%; height:100%;"" frameborder=""0"" scrolling=""no"" allowfullscreen=""""></iframe></div><!--kg-card-end: html-->",6373d66032100b004d445884,"If you feel like you've seen more chicken sandwich ads lately, you're not alone. Popeyes is pushing new chicken sandwich menu items right now, and they're far from the only ones, as AdAge details.

Using data from iSpot, AdAge spotlights how competitors are spending on chicken sandwiches this year. Arby's has increased its est. national TV ad spend on chicken sandwiches from $1 million last year to $11.3 million this year, while Panera Bread has jumped from $4.3 million to $25.5 million so far. Meanwhile, brands like McDonald's and Burger King have decreased est. national TV ad spend on chicken sandwiches year-over-year by comparison.

Popeyes' new Thanksgiving-centric spot can be viewed below.",https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1610150157941-f7bcc26f8914?crop=entropy&cs=tinysrgb&fit=max&fm=jpg&ixid=MnwxMTc3M3wwfDF8c2VhcmNofDJ8fGNoaWNrZW4lMjBzYW5kd2ljaHxlbnwwfHx8fDE2Njg1MzYyNjc&ixlib=rb-4.0.3&q=80&w=2000,0,post,published,,public,all,2022-11-15T18:11:44.000Z,2022-11-15T18:17:58.000Z,2022-11-15T18:17:58.000Z,,,,,,6359c410975d780031398a07,1,6373f38432100b004d4458da,a2f15f8d-c280-41ee-be83-bfde1336e8df,Downy Deploys Backstreet Boys In New Spot,tell-me-why-downy-thought-this-would-be-a-good-ad,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[],""cards"":[[""html"",{""html"":""                    <div style=\""position:relative; width:100%; padding-top:56.25%; padding-bottom:40px;\""><iframe src=\""https://www.ispot.tv/share/2DMJ\"" style=\""position:absolute; top:0; right:0; left:0; bottom:0; width:100%; height:100%;\"" frameborder=\""0\"" scrolling=\""no\"" allowfullscreen=\""\""></iframe></div>\n""}]],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""https://adage.com/article/hot-spots/new-commercials-etsy-downy-glade-verizon-wendys/2451961""]]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Downy’s new spot, “Tell Me Why,\"" features a woman receiving laundry tips from her Backstreet Boys poster, with the boy band advising -- or rather, singing -- that she should use Downy’s new rinse and refresh odor remover. Viewership fragmentation (40%) is the largest source of headaches, followed by creative personalization (37%). Though one could also argue that these are also opportunities to deliver ads to more clearly defined audiences. Per data from Inscape, the leading currency-grade smartTV ACR data provider and the data technology division of VIZIO, the beloved Western drama accounted for 1.35% of all live, linear minutes watched during the week, thanks to rerun marathons and the two-hour season five premiere on November 13.

A few additional viewership insights from the week:

 * Multiple election specials made the top 25 programs, including Fox News Democracy 2022: Election Coverage (1.14% of minutes watched), Election Night in America (0.92%) and Decision 2022 (0.39%).
 * Election coverage helped boost watch-time across cable news networks: Fox News captured 6.44% of minutes watched (up from 5.48% the previous week), CNN had 2.24% (up from 1.39%) and MSNBC had 2.07% (up from 1.47%).
 * Paramount Network jumps from No. 23 to No. 12 in the network ranking, largely thanks to Yellowstone reruns and the season five premiere, which accounted for 58.54% of the network’s watch-time for the week.

According to iSpot's survey-based Creative Assessment, the theme of ""To the Travelers"" is resonating with viewers, particularly with its Heartfelt* and Wholesome* messaging.

 * The campaign has driven 60% Positive Purchase Intent* among gen pop viewers.
 * So far the ads have generated 889.1 million TV ad impressions with an estimated national TV ad spend of $5.7 million.
 * Among the Retail Stores: Online & Auction Websites category, “To the Travelers” is in first place for impressions share of voice (17.01%)

For more on how this campaign is performing, check out iSpot's blog post.

According to the report, respondents say Reels are the most effective (most likely to drive engagement/outcomes) content type on Instagram 71% of the time. But just 10% said Stories were, despite also being video-based. Other key takeaways from the video portion of the report:""]]],[3,""ul"",[[[0,[],0,""74% of creators posted more videos on Instagram this year than the year before, while just 11% posted fewer videos.""]],[[0,[],0,""64% of creators surveyed used an influencer marketplace to connect with brands.""]],[[0,[],0,""Just 15% of creators surveyed worked with agencies to connect with brands.""]]]],[10,0]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>A <a href=""https://www.adweek.com/adweek-wire/creatoriqs-annual-influencer-marketing-trends-report-finds-measurement-top-priority/"">new annual survey from CreatorIQ</a> reveals numerous findings around the creator economy, including just how important Instagram Reels have become. According to the report, respondents say Reels are the most effective (most likely to drive engagement/outcomes) content type on Instagram 71% of the time. But just 10% said Stories were, despite also being video-based. Other key takeaways from the video portion of the report:</p><ul><li>74% of creators posted more videos on Instagram this year than the year before, while just 11% posted fewer videos.</li><li>64% of creators surveyed used an influencer marketplace to connect with brands.</li><li>Just 15% of creators surveyed worked with agencies to connect with brands.</li></ul><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card kg-card-hascaption""><a href=""https://www.adweek.com/adweek-wire/creatoriqs-annual-influencer-marketing-trends-report-finds-measurement-top-priority/""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2022/11/Screen-Shot-2022-11-15-at-11.37.52-AM.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1480"" height=""594"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2022/11/Screen-Shot-2022-11-15-at-11.37.52-AM.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2022/11/Screen-Shot-2022-11-15-at-11.37.52-AM.png 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2022/11/Screen-Shot-2022-11-15-at-11.37.52-AM.png 1480w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></a><figcaption><em>via CreatorIQ</em></figcaption></figure>",63768c92570d49003d0b322d,"A new annual survey from CreatorIQ reveals numerous findings around the creator economy, including just how important Instagram Reels have become. According to the report, respondents say Reels are the most effective (most likely to drive engagement/outcomes) content type on Instagram 71% of the time. But just 10% said Stories were, despite also being video-based. Other key takeaways from the video portion of the report:

 * 74% of creators posted more videos on Instagram this year than the year before, while just 11% posted fewer videos.
 * 64% of creators surveyed used an influencer marketplace to connect with brands.

And interestingly, the answer is not a U.S.-based creator.</p><p>In October 2022, LADbible reached 86.3 million unique viewers in the U.S. – making it far and away the top creator for the month. Fellow United Kingdom creator (and sister brand) UNILAD was No. 2 at 59.2 million uniques, followed by Chefclub Network (57 million), MrBeast (52.7 million) and Cocomelon - Nursery Rhymes (51.2 million).</p><p>LADbible's been growing its U.S. audience consistently over the last year as well. <!--kg-card-end: html-->",637d1b1a9fd86c003d56a7a0,"In light of the holiday season, Google is pushing ads to show off the browser's shopping search capabilities.

""]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>Here's a quick snapshot of TV by the numbers for the week of November 14-20, highlighting the most-watched shows and networks using glass-level data from <a href=""http://inscape.tv/"" rel=""noopener""><u>Inscape</u></a><a href=""http://ispot.tv/"" rel=""noopener""><u>.</u></a></p><p>While the NFL and college football retain their first and second place positions week-over-week, both had small decreases in minutes watched: NFL games accounted for 5.68% of watch-time (down from 5.87% previously), and college football slipped to 4.26% from 4.50% the week prior. Meanwhile, the NBA and college basketball jump into the top 10 on the ranking, moving from No. 17 to No. 6, and No. 34 to No. 4, respectively.</p><p>A few additional viewership insights for the week: </p><ul><li><em><em>Below Deck</em></em> moves into the ranking at No. 20, thanks to Bravo’s rerun marathons in the week leading up to the season 10 premiere on November 21.</li><li>CBS leads the list of most-watched networks, accounting for 8.77% of watch-time, up from 7.08% previously. While the NFL and college football retain their first and second place positions week-over-week, both had small decreases in minutes watched: NFL games accounted for 5.68% of watch-time (down from 5.87% previously), and college football slipped to 4.26% from 4.50% the week prior. Meanwhile, the NBA and college basketball jump into the top 10 on the ranking, moving from No. 17 to No. 6, and No. 34 to No. 4, respectively.

A few additional viewership insights for the week:

 * Below Deck moves into the ranking at No. 20, thanks to Bravo’s rerun marathons in the week leading up to the season 10 premiere on November 21.
 * CBS leads the list of most-watched networks, accounting for 8.77% of watch-time, up from 7.08% previously. NBC also saw a week-over-week gain in viewership, moving into second place with 7.19% of minutes watched (up from 6.81% the week before).
 * TNT is the sole week-over-week newcomer to the network ranking, landing at No. 20 with 1.03% of watch-time. NBA games accounted for 16.78% of viewing time on the network.

Amid the soccer frenzy, insights from Tubular Labs show interesting shopping trends coming from fans of the red white and blue. Audiences searching for U.S. Soccer have the highest Amazon shopping affinity for sunglass accessories (91.8x more likely than the norm), sunglasses (91.7x) and casual button-down shirts (73.2x).""]]],[10,0],[3,""ul"",[[[0,[],0,""Additionally, audiences searching for Christian Pulisic (America's star player in this year's tournament) had the highest Amazon shopping affinity for products from brands like Wilson (29.3x more likely than the norm), Electronic Arts (27.5x) and Dove (25.7x).""]],[[0,[],0,""U.S. viewers of Men In Blazers, a popular comedy show reviewing Premier League action, were most likely to shop Amazon for cheese products (47.3x more likely than the norm), soccer-related items (45.3x) and deli and prepared foods (42.4x).""]],[[0,[],0,""MLS viewers are most likely to shop Amazon for brands like Atomos (24.5x more likely than the norm), Hawkers (24.4x) and Panini (23.2x).""]]]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>With the 2022 World Cup in Qatar underway, U.S. Soccer has got the nation's attention, especially since the team missed the previous tournament in 2018. Amid the soccer frenzy, insights from Tubular Labs show interesting shopping trends coming from fans of the red white and blue. Audiences searching for U.S. Soccer have the highest Amazon shopping affinity for sunglass accessories (91.8x more likely than the norm), sunglasses (91.7x) and casual button-down shirts (73.2x).</p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2022/11/us-fans-shopping-affinity.jpg"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1378"" height=""787"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2022/11/us-fans-shopping-affinity.jpg 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2022/11/us-fans-shopping-affinity.jpg 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2022/11/us-fans-shopping-affinity.jpg 1378w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></figure><ul><li>Additionally, audiences searching for Christian Pulisic (America's star player in this year's tournament) had the highest Amazon shopping affinity for products from brands like Wilson (29.3x more likely than the norm), Electronic Arts (27.5x) and Dove (25.7x).</li><li>U.S. viewers of Men In Blazers, a popular comedy show reviewing Premier League action, were most likely to shop Amazon for cheese products (47.3x more likely than the norm), soccer-related items (45.3x) and deli and prepared foods (42.4x).</li><li>MLS viewers are most likely to shop Amazon for brands like Atomos (24.5x more likely than the norm), Hawkers (24.4x) and Panini (23.2x).</li></ul>",638650624d20a6004d9b8d34,"With the 2022 World Cup in Qatar underway, U.S. Soccer has got the nation's attention, especially since the team missed the previous tournament in 2018. Amid the soccer frenzy, insights from Tubular Labs show interesting shopping trends coming from fans of the red white and blue. Audiences searching for U.S. Soccer have the highest Amazon shopping affinity for sunglass accessories (91.8x more likely than the norm), sunglasses (91.7x) and casual button-down shirts (73.2x).

 * Additionally, audiences searching for Christian Pulisic (America's star player in this year's tournament) had the highest Amazon shopping affinity for products from brands like Wilson (29.3x more likely than the norm), Electronic Arts (27.5x) and Dove (25.7x).
 * U.S. viewers of Men In Blazers, a popular comedy show reviewing Premier League action, were most likely to shop Amazon for cheese products (47.3x more likely than the norm), soccer-related items (45.3x) and deli and prepared foods (42.4x).
 * MLS viewers are most likely to shop Amazon for brands like Atomos (24.5x more likely than the norm), Hawkers (24.4x) and Panini (23.2x).",https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1522778119026-d647f0596c20?crop=entropy&cs=tinysrgb&fit=max&fm=jpg&ixid=MnwxMTc3M3wwfDF8c2VhcmNofDV8fHNvY2NlcnxlbnwwfHx8fDE2Njk3NDgwMjc&ixlib=rb-4.0.3&q=80&w=2000,0,post,published,,public,all,2022-11-29T18:33:06.000Z,2022-12-05T21:45:29.000Z,2022-11-30T15:55:08.000Z,,,,,,6359c410975d780031398a07,1,6386a27a4802ed003d57634d,affc7d50-4c8a-4821-ba44-d3ebdc61675c,Songtradr Sonic Spotlight: Sir-Mix-A-Lot’s Baby Got Back Is The TikTok Pick Of The Week For Brands,songtradr-sonic-spotlight-sir-mix-a-lots-baby-got-back-is-the-tiktok-pick-of-the-week-for-brands,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[[""soft-return"","""",{}]],""cards"":[[""image"",{""src"":""https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/pSf2ii3SQGZjIX6UlVVUW92MpF8SnhSLXCCTtBmd9sc9PTiIddL1IenUaY6KGIDdutJndW0N6GP9Dvvta68q1zFYJu1Krquy87KKk6nLgZcRKnNJ8pvwkHujA6Va7_jra0517B6j1NZhC9n8NM89ED4BSOusqQW6B36NbVn_BPNH1O4410R_jUReEdnDhA"",""width"":624,""height"":223,""caption"":""Daily videos made using Baby got Back on Tiktok""}],[""image"",{""src"":""https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/RCpI7vdVnM3s71wmY9_QNZPAnmH4VKRceKS5E6Afmij-IDgiZzX1NlQsbdWhs_66ECeW0TIOF0h-NlaMN9SYPtIvR7R-x-SMvBg8NaQCIvR8j9Qiuae6u-oLE40npVW_3cCZT5tsJcxZCVzSWPS3rfoPwacGMDPaIWc89sBZlkfSk7akZdYElZMribv21w"",""width"":331,""height"":199,""caption"":""The TikTok Bounce also shows up in Spotify""}]],""markups"":[[""strong""],[""a"",[""href"",""team@fabricmedia.net""]]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Sir-Mix-A-Lot first found fame in 1991 with Baby Got Back… Unfortunately, it was short-lived for the mostly one-hit-wonder. That was until it caught steam with GenZ on TikTok, generating more than 32.8K unique videos and 7.8 million streams on the platform over the past few months thanks to a viral challenge.""]]],[1,""p"",[[1,[],0,0]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""This has also driven a massive increase for him on Spotify, with his monthly listeners up 73% in the past 6 months and 173M streams of Baby Got Back in the past month, proving interest and engagement is extending beyond just TikTok.""]]],[10,1],[1,""p"",[[0,[0,0],2,""What does this mean for brands: ""],[0,[],0,""piggybacking on virality is the perfect way for brands to keep a steady drumbeat on TikTok, as the challenges drive increased engagement for all parties involved. That was until it caught steam with GenZ on TikTok, generating more than 32.8K unique videos and 7.8 million streams on the platform over the past few months thanks to a viral challenge.




This has also driven a massive increase for him on Spotify, with his monthly listeners up 73% in the past 6 months and 173M streams of Baby Got Back in the past month, proving interest and engagement is extending beyond just TikTok.

What does this mean for brands: piggybacking on virality is the perfect way for brands to keep a steady drumbeat on TikTok, as the challenges drive increased engagement for all parties involved. So, in short, if you’re a brand on TikTok, and you’re not afraid to take a risk, now could be a good time to leverage Sir-Mix-A-Lot’s Baby Got Back.
