Part 2</a>, which generated over 565 million views.</p><p>Creator content and shorts have grown at a staggering pace in recent years, and are increasingly successful ways for brands to get in front of audiences on social video as well. There’s an avenue for brands and publishers here as well — both Coke and ESPN’s SportsNation also had videos among the top 10 — though working with established and popular accounts like the LeoNata Family (13.5 billion YouTube views last year, and a 165% views increase year-over-year) could be the easier road in.</p><p><strong><strong>Music’s Global Nature</strong></strong></p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><a href=""https://tubularlabs.com/blog/2022-social-video-rewind/""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/01/Screen-Shot-2022-12-16-at-11.49.26-AM.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1054"" height=""704"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/01/Screen-Shot-2022-12-16-at-11.49.26-AM.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/01/Screen-Shot-2022-12-16-at-11.49.26-AM.png 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/01/Screen-Shot-2022-12-16-at-11.49.26-AM.png 1054w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></a></figure><p>When looking at the top music videos on YouTube in 2022, Tubular noticed a focus away from U.S. performers. Ranked by V30 (views in the first 30 days from upload), non-U.S. artists like BLACKPINK, BTS and PSY were able to differentiate themselves above others.</p><p>Latin music also exploded in 2022, as nearly 34K uploaded videos amounted to more than 18 billion views for the year.</p><p>Interestingly, however, things were more U.S.- and U.K.-based when looking at sounds utilized for social videos. There, Harry Styles’s “As It Was” scored a dominating 27.6 billion views, followed by Lizzo’s “About Damn Time.” Styles also had over 1 million videos created using his music last year, with half of those utilizing “As It Was.”</p><p><strong><strong>Social Video Fueling Retail Comebacks</strong></strong></p><p>As Tubular notes in its “rewind” blog, brands like Abercrombie &amp; Fitch and UGG both surged in 2022 due at least in part to social video popuarlity.</p><p>Abercrombie was particularly aware of the TikTok conversation going on around its brand and leaned into the video platform’s ability to drive both talk and sales among users. Engagements around hashtags like #abercrombie or #abercrombiehaul or #abercrombieandfitch<strong><strong> </strong></strong>climbed 260% year-over-year in Nov. 2022.</p><p>Holiday videos helped push a sales and web traffic bump for UGG, as data from Tubular showed. According to its Consumer Insights product, over 20% of Ugg.com visitors watched holiday content on social video.</p>",63b8500a1ac00c003d9f24c8,"To wrap up 2022, Tubular Labs assembled a lengthy collection of insights from the year in social video trends, top videos, creators and more. It’s worth digging into the entire “rewind” piece on the company’s blog, but as social video continues to grow — and even rival TV in some age groups — we wanted to pull out some of the biggest takeaways from 2022 below.

Shorts Are Tall For YouTube Creators

Honing in on U.S. YouTube channels, eight of the top 10 videos were shorts (under one-minute long), with all eight shorts uploaded by individual creators. Tops among those was Daniel LaBelle’s If Cleaning Was a Timed Sport. Part 2, which generated over 565 million views.

Creator content and shorts have grown at a staggering pace in recent years, and are increasingly successful ways for brands to get in front of audiences on social video as well. There’s an avenue for brands and publishers here as well — both Coke and ESPN’s SportsNation also had videos among the top 10 — though working with established and popular accounts like the LeoNata Family (13.5 billion YouTube views last year, and a 165% views increase year-over-year) could be the easier road in.

Music’s Global Nature

When looking at the top music videos on YouTube in 2022, Tubular noticed a focus away from U.S. performers. Ranked by V30 (views in the first 30 days from upload), non-U.S. artists like BLACKPINK, BTS and PSY were able to differentiate themselves above others.

Latin music also exploded in 2022, as nearly 34K uploaded videos amounted to more than 18 billion views for the year.

Interestingly, however, things were more U.S.- and U.K.-based when looking at sounds utilized for social videos. There, Harry Styles’s “As It Was” scored a dominating 27.6 billion views, followed by Lizzo’s “About Damn Time.” Styles also had over 1 million videos created using his music last year, with half of those utilizing “As It Was.”

Social Video Fueling Retail Comebacks

As Tubular notes in its “rewind” blog, brands like Abercrombie & Fitch and UGG both surged in 2022 due at least in part to social video popuarlity.

Abercrombie was particularly aware of the TikTok conversation going on around its brand and leaned into the video platform’s ability to drive both talk and sales among users. Engagements around hashtags like #abercrombie or #abercrombiehaul or #abercrombieandfitch climbed 260% year-over-year in Nov. 2022.

Holiday videos helped push a sales and web traffic bump for UGG, as data from Tubular showed. According to its Consumer Insights product, over 20% of Ugg.com visitors watched holiday content on social video.",https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1611162616475-46b635cb6868?crop=entropy&cs=tinysrgb&fit=max&fm=jpg&ixid=MnwxMTc3M3wwfDF8c2VhcmNofDF8fHlvdXR1YmV8ZW58MHx8fHwxNjczMDIzNjA4&ixlib=rb-4.0.3&q=80&w=2000,0,post,published,,public,all,2023-01-06T16:44:58.000Z,2023-01-06T16:48:46.000Z,2023-01-06T16:48:46.000Z,,,,,,6359c410975d780031398a07,1,63bed3aaae6bbd003d4faec5,0c65072f-af48-4612-befe-c1c31c39e014,December's Top Rx Pharma Brands by TV Ad Spend,big-pharma-spent-less-on-tv-ads-in-december,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[],""cards"":[[""image"",{""src"":""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/01/ispotdecpharmabrands.png"",""width"":829,""height"":494}]],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.fiercepharma.com/marketing/abbvies-rinvoq-ends-year-high-it-tops-tv-drug-ad-spending-list-december""]]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Rinvoq, an AbbVie JAK inhibitor immunology drug, was the No. 1 prescription pharmaceutical brand when it came to estimated national TV ad spend in December, ""],[0,[0],1,""according to iSpot.tv data shared with FiercePharma""],[0,[],0,"". It spent about $40.6 million on TV ads during the month, a decrease from its November spend of $55.8 million. ""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Some additional insights around TV ads from the top pharma brands in December: ""]]],[3,""ul"",[[[0,[],0,""As a whole, total spend declined month-over-month for the top ten pharma brands, down to $164.9 million from November's $202 million. ""]],[[0,[],0,""Dupixent, a Sanofi and Regeneron immunology drug, was No. 2 for estimated TV ad spend with $23.1 million, a decrease from its November spend of $25.4 million) ""]],[[0,[],0,""The three brands that were in the top 10 in December but not in November were Cabenuva (GSK HIV drug) in sixth place, Ocrevus (Roche multiple sclerosis drug) in eighth and Opzelura (Incyte eczema cream) in tenth place. ""]]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>Rinvoq, an AbbVie JAK inhibitor immunology drug, was the No. 1 prescription pharmaceutical brand when it came to estimated national TV ad spend in December, <a href=""https://www.fiercepharma.com/marketing/abbvies-rinvoq-ends-year-high-it-tops-tv-drug-ad-spending-list-december"">according to iSpot.tv data shared with FiercePharma</a>. It spent about $40.6 million on TV ads during the month, a decrease from its November spend of $55.8 million. </p><p>Some additional insights around TV ads from the top pharma brands in December: </p><ul><li>As a whole, total spend declined month-over-month for the top ten pharma brands, down to $164.9 million from November's $202 million. </li><li>Dupixent, a Sanofi and Regeneron immunology drug, was No. 2 for estimated TV ad spend with $23.1 million, a decrease from its November spend of $25.4 million) </li><li>The three brands that were in the top 10 in December but not in November were Cabenuva (GSK HIV drug) in sixth place, Ocrevus (Roche multiple sclerosis drug) in eighth and Opzelura (Incyte eczema cream) in tenth place. </li></ul><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/01/ispotdecpharmabrands.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""829"" height=""494"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/01/ispotdecpharmabrands.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/01/ispotdecpharmabrands.png 829w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></figure>",63bed3aaae6bbd003d4faec5,"Rinvoq, an AbbVie JAK inhibitor immunology drug, was the No. 1 prescription pharmaceutical brand when it came to estimated national TV ad spend in December, according to iSpot.tv data shared with FiercePharma. It spent about $40.6 million on TV ads during the month, a decrease from its November spend of $55.8 million.

Some additional insights around TV ads from the top pharma brands in December:

 * As a whole, total spend declined month-over-month for the top ten pharma brands, down to $164.9 million from November's $202 million.
 * Dupixent, a Sanofi and Regeneron immunology drug, was No. 2 for estimated TV ad spend with $23.1 million, a decrease from its November spend of $25.4 million)
 * The three brands that were in the top 10 in December but not in November were Cabenuva (GSK HIV drug) in sixth place, Ocrevus (Roche multiple sclerosis drug) in eighth and Opzelura (Incyte eczema cream) in tenth place.",__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/01/ispotdecpharmabrands-1.png,0,post,published,,public,all,2023-01-11T15:20:10.000Z,2023-01-11T18:09:50.000Z,2023-01-11T18:09:50.000Z,Rinvoq was the No. 1 prescription pharmaceutical brand when it came to estimated national TV ad spend in December according to iSpot.tv,,,,,6359c410975d780031398a07,1,63c164917b7e17003de71c14,7ed09aef-9865-47ff-a336-344d5adb1c9f,Vicks Was TV's Most-Seen OTC or Rx Pharma Brand in December,vicks-was-tvs-most-seen-otc-and-rx-pharma-brand-in-december,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[],""cards"":[[""image"",{""src"":""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/01/top-otc-and-rx-pharma-dec.png"",""width"":706,""height"":437}]],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.mmm-online.com/home/channel/vicks-topped-rx-and-otc-pharma-brands-for-ad-impressions-in-december-2022-dupixent-took-year-end-crown/""]]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Cough and cold medicine Vicks was the most seen over-the-counter or prescription pharmaceutical brand on TV in December, ""],[0,[0],1,""according to iSpot.tv data recently shared with MM+M""],[0,[],0,"". Vicks ads had a 7.17% impressions share of voice for the month, notably ahead of the No. 2 brand Rinvoq (4.26% share of voice).  ""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Some additional insights around the most-seen pharma brands in December: ""]]],[3,""ul"",[[[0,[],0,""Rounding out the top five as ranked by impressions share of voice were Mucinex (4.25% SOV), Dupixent (4.22%) and Skyrizi (2.50%). ""]],[[0,[],0,""Although it was in fourth place for December, looking at 2022 as a whole, Dupixent was the top OTC/Rx pharma brand by impressions share of voice. ""]],[[0,[],0,""Broadcast networks delivered top impressions shares for six of the top ten brands, with CBS leading as the top network by impressions share for Vicks (19.16% SOV).""]]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>Cough and cold medicine Vicks was the most seen over-the-counter or prescription pharmaceutical brand on TV in December, <a href=""https://www.mmm-online.com/home/channel/vicks-topped-rx-and-otc-pharma-brands-for-ad-impressions-in-december-2022-dupixent-took-year-end-crown/"">according to iSpot.tv data recently shared with MM+M</a>. Vicks ads had a 7.17% impressions share of voice for the month, notably ahead of the No. 2 brand Rinvoq (4.26% share of voice).  </p><p>Some additional insights around the most-seen pharma brands in December: </p><ul><li>Rounding out the top five as ranked by impressions share of voice were Mucinex (4.25% SOV), Dupixent (4.22%) and Skyrizi (2.50%). </li><li>Although it was in fourth place for December, looking at 2022 as a whole, Dupixent was the top OTC/Rx pharma brand by impressions share of voice. </li><li>Broadcast networks delivered top impressions shares for six of the top ten brands, with CBS leading as the top network by impressions share for Vicks (19.16% SOV).</li></ul><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/01/top-otc-and-rx-pharma-dec.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""706"" height=""437"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/01/top-otc-and-rx-pharma-dec.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/01/top-otc-and-rx-pharma-dec.png 706w""></figure>",63c164917b7e17003de71c14,"Cough and cold medicine Vicks was the most seen over-the-counter or prescription pharmaceutical brand on TV in December, according to iSpot.tv data recently shared with MM+M. Vicks ads had a 7.17% impressions share of voice for the month, notably ahead of the No. 2 brand Rinvoq (4.26% share of voice).  

Some additional insights around the most-seen pharma brands in December:

 * Rounding out the top five as ranked by impressions share of voice were Mucinex (4.25% SOV), Dupixent (4.22%) and Skyrizi (2.50%).
 * Although it was in fourth place for December, looking at 2022 as a whole, Dupixent was the top OTC/Rx pharma brand by impressions share of voice.

Data from Inscape shows the NFL’s six wildcard games accounted for 21.56% of TV minutes watched from Jan. 14-16, and NFL studio shows nabbed another 3.6%.

 * NFL games delivered over 26% of watch-time on Saturday and Sunday (Jan. 14-15) alone — 11x more than the next most-watched program (men’s college basketball).
 * In primetime, NFL games took up 31.05% of minutes watched from Jan. 14-16, which was about 10x the next most-watched program (the very related Monday Night Countdown on ESPN).",https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1512145559054-d62d208cd151?crop=entropy&cs=tinysrgb&fit=max&fm=jpg&ixid=MnwxMTc3M3wwfDF8c2VhcmNofDl8fG5mbHxlbnwwfHx8fDE2NzQxNjgyMjY&ixlib=rb-4.0.3&q=80&w=2000,0,post,published,,public,all,2023-01-19T22:38:28.000Z,2023-01-19T22:43:57.000Z,2023-01-19T22:43:57.000Z,,,,,,6359c410975d780031398a07,1,63ced76154f0e2003d9c62cf,b63437dc-3f46-41f0-9277-c8ae51149e6c,Charlotte Tilbury Was December’s Top Cosmetics Brand by Earned Media Value,charlotte-tilbury-was-decembers-top-cosmetics-brand-by-earned-media-value,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[],""cards"":[[""image"",{""src"":""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/01/CIQ-Dec-Cosmetics.png"",""width"":1640,""height"":1244,""caption"":""Via CreatorIQ""}]],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""creatoriq.com""]],[""em""]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""According to a new report from ""],[0,[0],1,""CreatorIQ""],[0,[],0,"", the top cosmetics brand in the US in December was Charlotte Tilbury, with $33.4 million in earned media value* (EMV). That represented an 18% month-over-month increase in EMV for the brand, and a 4% year-over-year increase. Overall, there was $815.9 million in EMV generated by over 121K creators for 554 cosmetics brands during the month. ""]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""More from the report:""]]],[3,""ul"",[[[0,[],0,""ColourPop took second place for EMV ($31.9 million), with its 2.5k ambassadors posting about 4 times each, resulting in an EMV per ambassador of almost $13K, the highest of the top ten brands.""]],[[0,[],0,""Rare Beauty, which was in third place for EMV, had the highest month-over-month increase, an impressive 49% growth. The brand’s holiday gift collections contributed to a 12% month-over-month expansion of Rare Beauty’s community, which grew to 2.6k content creators.""]],[[0,[],0,""e.l.f. rounded out the ranking with an EMV of $18.9 million, and it was the only brand not present in the previous month’s Top 10. A collaboration between musician Meghan Trainor and The Weather Channel stirred additional excitement around the brand, with weather forecast-inspired videos showcasing a series of e.l.f. products and securing $175.3K EMV for the brand.""]]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[1],1,""*Earned media value (EMV) quantifies the estimated value of consumer engagement with digital earned media and can be used to evaluate the earned performance of individual marketing campaigns and benchmark brands within the competitive landscape.""]]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>According to a new report from <a href=""creatoriq.com"">CreatorIQ</a>, the top cosmetics brand in the US in December was Charlotte Tilbury, with $33.4 million in earned media value* (EMV). That represented an 18% month-over-month increase in EMV for the brand, and a 4% year-over-year increase. Overall, there was $815.9 million in EMV generated by over 121K creators for 554 cosmetics brands during the month. </p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card kg-card-hascaption""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/01/CIQ-Dec-Cosmetics.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1640"" height=""1244"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/01/CIQ-Dec-Cosmetics.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/01/CIQ-Dec-Cosmetics.png 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1600/2023/01/CIQ-Dec-Cosmetics.png 1600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/01/CIQ-Dec-Cosmetics.png 1640w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""><figcaption>Via CreatorIQ</figcaption></figure><p>More from the report:</p><ul><li>ColourPop took second place for EMV ($31.9 million), with its 2.5k ambassadors posting about 4 times each, resulting in an EMV per ambassador of almost $13K, the highest of the top ten brands.</li><li>Rare Beauty, which was in third place for EMV, had the highest month-over-month increase, an impressive 49% growth. The brand’s holiday gift collections contributed to a 12% month-over-month expansion of Rare Beauty’s community, which grew to 2.6k content creators.</li><li>e.l.f. rounded out the ranking with an EMV of $18.9 million, and it was the only brand not present in the previous month’s Top 10. A collaboration between musician Meghan Trainor and The Weather Channel stirred additional excitement around the brand, with weather forecast-inspired videos showcasing a series of e.l.f. products and securing $175.3K EMV for the brand.</li></ul><p><em>*Earned media value (EMV) quantifies the estimated value of consumer engagement with digital earned media and can be used to evaluate the earned performance of individual marketing campaigns and benchmark brands within the competitive landscape.</em></p>",63ced76154f0e2003d9c62cf,"According to a new report from CreatorIQ, the top cosmetics brand in the US in December was Charlotte Tilbury, with $33.4 million in earned media value* (EMV). That represented an 18% month-over-month increase in EMV for the brand, and a 4% year-over-year increase. Overall, there was $815.9 million in EMV generated by over 121K creators for 554 cosmetics brands during the month.

More from the report:

 * ColourPop took second place for EMV ($31.9 million), with its 2.5k ambassadors posting about 4 times each, resulting in an EMV per ambassador of almost $13K, the highest of the top ten brands.
 * Rare Beauty, which was in third place for EMV, had the highest month-over-month increase, an impressive 49% growth. The brand’s holiday gift collections contributed to a 12% month-over-month expansion of Rare Beauty’s community, which grew to 2.6k content creators.
 * e.l.f. rounded out the ranking with an EMV of $18.9 million, and it was the only brand not present in the previous month’s Top 10. A collaboration between musician Meghan Trainor and The Weather Channel stirred additional excitement around the brand, with weather forecast-inspired videos showcasing a series of e.l.f. products and securing $175.3K EMV for the brand.

*Earned media value (EMV) quantifies the estimated value of consumer engagement with digital earned media and can be used to evaluate the earned performance of individual marketing campaigns and benchmark brands within the competitive landscape.",https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1526045478516-99145907023c?crop=entropy&cs=tinysrgb&fit=max&fm=jpg&ixid=MnwxMTc3M3wwfDF8c2VhcmNofDgxfHxtYWtldXB8ZW58MHx8fHwxNjc0NTAwMDA0&ixlib=rb-4.0.3&q=80&w=2000,0,post,published,,public,all,2023-01-23T18:52:17.000Z,2023-01-23T19:04:42.000Z,2023-01-23T19:04:42.000Z,"According to a new report from CreatorIQ, the top cosmetics brand in the US in December was Charlotte Tilbury, with $33.4 million in earned media value.",,,,,6359c410975d780031398a07,1,63cedb7854f0e2003d9c6310,16f7f7aa-4668-4a7a-b025-5c87eaf68130,2022's Top Rx Pharma Brands by TV Ad Spend,2022s-top-rx-pharma-brands-by-tv-ad-spend,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[],""cards"":[[""image"",{""src"":""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/01/ispot2022pharmabrands.png"",""width"":829,""height"":494,""caption"":""via iSpot.tv""}]],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.fiercepharma.com/marketing/abbvie-takes-2022-tv-drug-ad-spending-crown-rinvoq-knocking-last-years-winner-dupixent""]]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Rinvoq, an AbbVie JAK inhibitor immunology drug, was the No. 1 prescription pharmaceutical brand when it came to estimated national TV ad spend in 2022, according to ""],[0,[0],1,""iSpot.tv data shared with FiercePharma""],[0,[],0,"". ""]]]],[10,0]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>Rinvoq, an AbbVie JAK inhibitor immunology drug, was the No. 1 prescription pharmaceutical brand when it came to estimated national TV ad spend in 2022, according to <a href=""https://www.fiercepharma.com/marketing/abbvie-takes-2022-tv-drug-ad-spending-crown-rinvoq-knocking-last-years-winner-dupixent"">iSpot.tv data shared with FiercePharma</a>. It spent about $315.8 million on TV ads during the year, a noticeable increase from its $165 million estimated TV ad spend in 2021. </p><p>Some additional insights around TV ads from the top pharma brands in 2022: </p><ul><li>In total, the top ten brands spent about $1.68 billion, a slight increase from 2021's $1.61 billion.</li><li>Dupixent, a Sanofi and Regeneron immunology drug, was No. 2 for estimated TV ad spend with $305.9. In 2021, the brand was the No. 1 spender for Rx pharma with $287.6 million. </li><li>Verzenio was the only brand that made the top ten for spend in 2022 but not in 2021; it took tenth place for 2022 spend with $111.8 million, up from $70.1 million in 2021 (No. 18). </li></ul><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card kg-card-hascaption""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/01/ispot2022pharmabrands.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""829"" height=""494"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/01/ispot2022pharmabrands.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/01/ispot2022pharmabrands.png 829w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""><figcaption>via iSpot.tv</figcaption></figure>",63cedb7854f0e2003d9c6310,"Rinvoq, an AbbVie JAK inhibitor immunology drug, was the No. 1 prescription pharmaceutical brand when it came to estimated national TV ad spend in 2022, according to iSpot.tv data shared with FiercePharma. It spent about $315.8 million on TV ads during the year, a noticeable increase from its $165 million estimated TV ad spend in 2021.

Some additional insights around TV ads from the top pharma brands in 2022:

 * In total, the top ten brands spent about $1.68 billion, a slight increase from 2021's $1.61 billion.
 * Dupixent, a Sanofi and Regeneron immunology drug, was No. 2 for estimated TV ad spend with $305.9. In 2021, the brand was the No. 1 spender for Rx pharma with $287.6 million.
 * Verzenio was the only brand that made the top ten for spend in 2022 but not in 2021; it took tenth place for 2022 spend with $111.8 million, up from $70.1 million in 2021 (No. 18).",https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1583604310111-9cd137d6ffe5?crop=entropy&cs=tinysrgb&fit=max&fm=jpg&ixid=MnwxMTc3M3wwfDF8c2VhcmNofDIxfHxwaGFybWF8ZW58MHx8fHwxNjc0NTAxNzg2&ixlib=rb-4.0.3&q=80&w=2000,0,post,published,,public,all,2023-01-23T19:09:44.000Z,2023-01-24T13:13:57.000Z,2023-01-24T13:13:57.000Z,,,,,,6359c410975d780031398a07,1,63d14d732a163f003d62551b,1bdfbdaa-acf4-4469-8b25-f38b7c0e1fad,These Were December’s Top Apparel Brands in the US Based on Earned Media Value,these-were-decembers-top-apparel-brands-in-the-us-based-on-earned-media-value,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[[""soft-return"","""",{}],[""soft-return"","""",{}]],""cards"":[[""image"",{""src"":""https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/N4Vkq5_akE5uhA5y0jGxfku-BmQofxzYJKl26o_OREwjvQoBdXRRdCzNoqR5antWfo_HJOKiMStyBz9UOktGtUpsqm_ceqbmjOpXsC0YGtXNu85XF0YA-S0z8NBsPD7vc_VJ1Y6BFSkosBeNXOSjPD6P5HxF9fzk8GZ_dgcBsAvskdD63NKDLM1WjpPh8w"",""width"":624,""height"":476,""caption"":""Via CreatorIQ""}]],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""http://creatoriq.com""]],[""em""]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""According to a recently-released report from ""],[0,[0],1,""CreatorIQ""],[0,[],0,"", Fashion Nova racked up $89.7 million in earned media value* (EMV) during the month of December, making it the top apparel brand in the US. Pastrana, who wore Pit Viper’s iconic shades during various stages of the event, generated a notable $647.6k EMV via 25 mentions.""]]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[1],1,""*Earned media value (EMV) quantifies the estimated value of consumer engagement with digital earned media and can be used to evaluate the earned performance of individual marketing campaigns and benchmark brands within the competitive landscape.""]]],[1,""p"",[[1,[],0,1]]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>According to a recently-released report from <a href=""http://creatoriq.com"">CreatorIQ</a>, Fashion Nova racked up $89.7 million in earned media value* (EMV) during the month of December, making it the top apparel brand in the US. Nike was in second place with $61.8 million EMV, followed by SHEIN in third ($37.8 million). <br></p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card kg-card-hascaption""><img src=""https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/N4Vkq5_akE5uhA5y0jGxfku-BmQofxzYJKl26o_OREwjvQoBdXRRdCzNoqR5antWfo_HJOKiMStyBz9UOktGtUpsqm_ceqbmjOpXsC0YGtXNu85XF0YA-S0z8NBsPD7vc_VJ1Y6BFSkosBeNXOSjPD6P5HxF9fzk8GZ_dgcBsAvskdD63NKDLM1WjpPh8w"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""624"" height=""476""><figcaption>Via CreatorIQ</figcaption></figure><p>More from the report:</p><ul><li>H&amp;M took fifth place with $26.2 million EMV and was one of only two brands that experienced month-over-month EMV increases. Leading the pack in potency and overall EMV for H&amp;M was lifestyle influencer Zoe Sugg, whose 20 mentions powered $1.2M EMV, a significant jump over the $66.9K she generated the previous month.</li><li>Abercrombie &amp; Fitch was the only month-over-month ranking newcomer, with $18 million EMV for December, a 8% increase from its November EMV and representing 15% year-over-year growth.</li><li>One notable brand outside the Top 10 was eyewear company Pit Viper. Although it collected a modest $3.1 million EMV, that was a 101% month-over-month increase. Much of the brand’s success stemmed from its sponsorship of stunt driver Travis Pastrana at Gymkhana 2022, a popular stunt event put on by racing brand Hoonigan. Pastrana, who wore Pit Viper’s iconic shades during various stages of the event, generated a notable $647.6k EMV via 25 mentions.</li></ul><p><em>*Earned media value (EMV) quantifies the estimated value of consumer engagement with digital earned media and can be used to evaluate the earned performance of individual marketing campaigns and benchmark brands within the competitive landscape.</em></p>",63d14d732a163f003d62551b,"According to a recently-released report from CreatorIQ, Fashion Nova racked up $89.7 million in earned media value* (EMV) during the month of December, making it the top apparel brand in the US. Nike was in second place with $61.8 million EMV, followed by SHEIN in third ($37.8 million).


More from the report:

 * H&M took fifth place with $26.2 million EMV and was one of only two brands that experienced month-over-month EMV increases. Leading the pack in potency and overall EMV for H&M was lifestyle influencer Zoe Sugg, whose 20 mentions powered $1.2M EMV, a significant jump over the $66.9K she generated the previous month.
 * Abercrombie & Fitch was the only month-over-month ranking newcomer, with $18 million EMV for December, a 8% increase from its November EMV and representing 15% year-over-year growth.
 * One notable brand outside the Top 10 was eyewear company Pit Viper. Although it collected a modest $3.1 million EMV, that was a 101% month-over-month increase. Much of the brand’s success stemmed from its sponsorship of stunt driver Travis Pastrana at Gymkhana 2022, a popular stunt event put on by racing brand Hoonigan. Pastrana, who wore Pit Viper’s iconic shades during various stages of the event, generated a notable $647.6k EMV via 25 mentions.

*Earned media value (EMV) quantifies the estimated value of consumer engagement with digital earned media and can be used to evaluate the earned performance of individual marketing campaigns and benchmark brands within the competitive landscape.",https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1445205170230-053b83016050?crop=entropy&cs=tinysrgb&fit=max&fm=jpg&ixid=MnwxMTc3M3wwfDF8c2VhcmNofDExfHxmYXNoaW9ufGVufDB8fHx8MTY3NDY2MTYyOA&ixlib=rb-4.0.3&q=80&w=2000,0,post,published,,public,all,2023-01-25T15:40:35.000Z,2023-01-25T16:21:11.000Z,2023-01-25T16:20:53.000Z,,,,,,6359c410975d780031398a07,1,63d2b4da8469ad003d60a159,34446d09-22cb-4baa-922d-66f643159a56,"Email Drives More Sales Than SMS, Social and Banner Ads",email-drives-more-sales-than-sms-social-and-banner,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[[""soft-return"","""",{}],[""soft-return"","""",{}]],""cards"":[[""image"",{""src"":""https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/_lvqSeGyt7qMdAb6gBfkYwTc_Javg4JQhInYuNhRd0aUAgXbPAh2iVPLN49uZZ5aeG2TDfkV7WNxdXVt0RB_yInw9wqKoibNQmSPmxZt5ZWJgDD9T5GxqaLL15RnzzfMVgrJ1YwaEKXWvXWqlh0cnjqhmUb6yP6vDcpSOfUEeHGA4xeOYq9buUqD61-gKQ"",""width"":318,""height"":409,""href"":""https://go.meetmarigold.com/consumer-trends-index"",""cardWidth"":"""",""caption"":""via Marigold""}]],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""https://meetmarigold.com/""]],[""a"",[""href"",""https://go.meetmarigold.com/consumer-trends-index""]]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""New research from ""],[0,[0],1,""Marigold""],[0,[],0,""’s 2023 Digital Consumer Trends Index report indicates email is the most effective channel to influence purchases.""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Marigold, in partnership with Econsultancy, released its 2023 Digital Consumer Trends Index report which found email to be the most effective channel in driving product sales. Research from the report shows that 52% of consumers purchase a product directly as result of receiving an email. This figure is 108% higher than SMS and banner ads and a 4% growth year-over-year.""]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[[1,[],0,0],[0,[],0,""More from the report:""]]],[3,""ul"",[[[0,[],0,""Less than a quarter of consumers made a purchase directly as a result of a banner ad, which is a 29% drop from the previous year, and only 12% of marketers plan to devote budget to banner ads this year.""]],[[0,[],0,""3 out of 8 consumers have bought something from an email on their mobile device - a 3% increase from 2022.""]],[[0,[],0,""Only 25% of consumers have purchased something after receiving a piece of SMS marketing""]]]],[1,""p"",[[1,[],0,1],[0,[],0,""For more insights, ""],[0,[1],1,""download the full report here""],[0,[],0,"".""]]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>New research from <a href=""https://meetmarigold.com/"">Marigold</a>’s 2023 Digital Consumer Trends Index report indicates email is the most effective channel to influence purchases.</p><p>Marigold, in partnership with Econsultancy, released its 2023 Digital Consumer Trends Index report which found email to be the most effective channel in driving product sales. Research from the report shows that 52% of consumers purchase a product directly as result of receiving an email. This figure is 108% higher than SMS and banner ads and a 4% growth year-over-year.</p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card kg-card-hascaption""><a href=""https://go.meetmarigold.com/consumer-trends-index""><img src=""https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/_lvqSeGyt7qMdAb6gBfkYwTc_Javg4JQhInYuNhRd0aUAgXbPAh2iVPLN49uZZ5aeG2TDfkV7WNxdXVt0RB_yInw9wqKoibNQmSPmxZt5ZWJgDD9T5GxqaLL15RnzzfMVgrJ1YwaEKXWvXWqlh0cnjqhmUb6yP6vDcpSOfUEeHGA4xeOYq9buUqD61-gKQ"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""318"" height=""409""></a><figcaption>via Marigold</figcaption></figure><p><br>More from the report:</p><ul><li>Less than a quarter of consumers made a purchase directly as a result of a banner ad, which is a 29% drop from the previous year, and only 12% of marketers plan to devote budget to banner ads this year.</li><li>3 out of 8 consumers have bought something from an email on their mobile device - a 3% increase from 2022.</li><li>Only 25% of consumers have purchased something after receiving a piece of SMS marketing</li></ul><p><br>For more insights, <a href=""https://go.meetmarigold.com/consumer-trends-index"">download the full report here</a>.</p>",63d2b4da8469ad003d60a159,"New research from Marigold’s 2023 Digital Consumer Trends Index report indicates email is the most effective channel to influence purchases.

Marigold, in partnership with Econsultancy, released its 2023 Digital Consumer Trends Index report which found email to be the most effective channel in driving product sales. Research from the report shows that 52% of consumers purchase a product directly as result of receiving an email. This figure is 108% higher than SMS and banner ads and a 4% growth year-over-year.


More from the report:

 * Less than a quarter of consumers made a purchase directly as a result of a banner ad, which is a 29% drop from the previous year, and only 12% of marketers plan to devote budget to banner ads this year.
 * 3 out of 8 consumers have bought something from an email on their mobile device - a 3% increase from 2022.
 * Only 25% of consumers have purchased something after receiving a piece of SMS marketing


For more insights, download the full report here.",https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1596526131083-e8c633c948d2?crop=entropy&cs=tinysrgb&fit=max&fm=jpg&ixid=MnwxMTc3M3wwfDF8c2VhcmNofDV8fGVtYWlsfGVufDB8fHx8MTY3NDc1MzMzMQ&ixlib=rb-4.0.3&q=80&w=2000,0,post,published,,public,all,2023-01-26T17:14:02.000Z,2023-01-27T16:08:33.000Z,2023-01-27T16:08:33.000Z,New research from Marigold’s 2023 Digital Consumer Trends Index report indicates email is the most effective channel to influence purchases.,,,,,6359c410975d780031398a07,1,63d2c9328469ad003d60a181,33755c2b-6344-4dc7-9f56-130d227596d3,"Consumers Purchase Preferred Brands, Regardless of Price",consumers-are-more-likely-to-purchase-from-preferred-brands-regardless-of-the-price,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[[""soft-return"","""",{}],[""soft-return"","""",{}]],""cards"":[[""image"",{""src"":""https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/I8JRbPry5w2CWB2ljukWMaYSSv00zmXV9PyFp9ffxqNBiwhkJk_BiMR2mcqFfBOPKuNO2DPwpmvuz1D88U0drxMQEoHquBJnZVdDJRCHMBQb38wKPdcYnqW8K1d8W6uYETop6JvA6zk0oAtyQ9Wvml1x0Tmo2h2zkNPdZE6bTB3JvBRryVHBrygbtMYDlA"",""width"":314,""height"":385,""caption"":""via Marigold"",""cardWidth"":""wide"",""href"":""https://go.meetmarigold.com/consumer-trends-index""}]],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""http://meetmarigold.com/""]],[""a"",[""href"",""www.themeasure.net/email-drives-more-sales-than-sms-social-and-banner""]],[""a"",[""href"",""https://go.meetmarigold.com/consumer-trends-index""]]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[0],1,""Marigold""],[0,[],0,""’s 2023 Digital Consumer Trends Index research finds brand loyalty is on the rise as consumers report a willingness to pay more to purchase from their preferred brands.""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Marigold, in partnership with Econsultancy, released its 2023 Digital Consumer Trends Index report — a global study across consumer and brand engagement trends. The research found that 59% of consumers will happily pay more to purchase from their favorite brands, which has increased 4% since 2022.""]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[[1,[],0,0],[0,[],0,""More from the report:""]]],[3,""ul"",[[[0,[],0,""Consumers report valuing having a good product or service (77%), customer service (77%), product availability (80%) and having a range of options (81%) as important factors that influence brand loyalty.""]],[[0,[],0,""A third (33%) of consumers have switched away from a previously favored brand - a 6% increase since 2022. 33% switch due to a lack of offers and promotions.""]],[[0,[1],1,""52% of consumers purchase a product directly as result of receiving an email.""],[0,[],0,"" This figure is 108% higher than SMS and banner ads and a 4% growth year-over-year. ""]]]],[1,""p"",[[1,[],0,1],[0,[],0,""For more insights, ""],[0,[2],1,""download the full report here""],[0,[],0,"".""]]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p><a href=""http://meetmarigold.com/"">Marigold</a>’s 2023 Digital Consumer Trends Index research finds brand loyalty is on the rise as consumers report a willingness to pay more to purchase from their preferred brands.</p><p>Marigold, in partnership with Econsultancy, released its 2023 Digital Consumer Trends Index report — a global study across consumer and brand engagement trends. The research found that 59% of consumers will happily pay more to purchase from their favorite brands, which has increased 4% since 2022.</p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card kg-width-wide kg-card-hascaption""><a href=""https://go.meetmarigold.com/consumer-trends-index""><img src=""https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/I8JRbPry5w2CWB2ljukWMaYSSv00zmXV9PyFp9ffxqNBiwhkJk_BiMR2mcqFfBOPKuNO2DPwpmvuz1D88U0drxMQEoHquBJnZVdDJRCHMBQb38wKPdcYnqW8K1d8W6uYETop6JvA6zk0oAtyQ9Wvml1x0Tmo2h2zkNPdZE6bTB3JvBRryVHBrygbtMYDlA"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""314"" height=""385""></a><figcaption>via Marigold</figcaption></figure><p><br>More from the report:</p><ul><li>Consumers report valuing having a good product or service (77%), customer service (77%), product availability (80%) and having a range of options (81%) as important factors that influence brand loyalty.</li><li>A third (33%) of consumers have switched away from a previously favored brand - a 6% increase since 2022. 33% switch due to a lack of offers and promotions.</li><li><a href=""www.themeasure.net/email-drives-more-sales-than-sms-social-and-banner"">52% of consumers purchase a product directly as result of receiving an email.</a> This figure is 108% higher than SMS and banner ads and a 4% growth year-over-year. </li></ul><p><br>For more insights, <a href=""https://go.meetmarigold.com/consumer-trends-index"">download the full report here</a>.</p>",63d2c9328469ad003d60a181,"Marigold’s 2023 Digital Consumer Trends Index research finds brand loyalty is on the rise as consumers report a willingness to pay more to purchase from their preferred brands.

Marigold, in partnership with Econsultancy, released its 2023 Digital Consumer Trends Index report — a global study across consumer and brand engagement trends. The research found that 59% of consumers will happily pay more to purchase from their favorite brands, which has increased 4% since 2022.


More from the report:

 * Consumers report valuing having a good product or service (77%), customer service (77%), product availability (80%) and having a range of options (81%) as important factors that influence brand loyalty.
 * A third (33%) of consumers have switched away from a previously favored brand - a 6% increase since 2022. 33% switch due to a lack of offers and promotions.
 * 52% of consumers purchase a product directly as result of receiving an email. This figure is 108% higher than SMS and banner ads and a 4% growth year-over-year.


For more insights, download the full report here.",https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1601924994987-69e26d50dc26?crop=entropy&cs=tinysrgb&fit=max&fm=jpg&ixid=MnwxMTc3M3wwfDF8c2VhcmNofDExfHxzaG9wcGluZ3xlbnwwfHx8fDE2NzQ3NTg1NDg&ixlib=rb-4.0.3&q=80&w=2000,0,post,published,,public,all,2023-01-26T18:40:50.000Z,2023-02-02T23:53:39.000Z,2023-02-02T23:53:39.000Z,Marigold’s 2023 Digital Consumer Trends Index research finds brand loyalty is on the rise as consumers report a willingness to pay more to purchase from their preferred brands.,,,,,6359c410975d780031398a07,1,63d2cad78469ad003d60a1a6,6bcd1435-6014-4062-b1c3-23bfd0ce845d,How To Get Consumers To Share Personal Data—Provide Value,how-to-get-consumers-to-share-personal-data-provide-value,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[[""soft-return"","""",{}]],""cards"":[[""image"",{""src"":""https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/Dt_M0EPoxwA1D3-yzkeC41jrBPIhwdki-keCOP3742qJVzSe6qrIii33yhODiqFYpByeOOwCRQQXZSKS5VIo_hJKal1kxbc8NHhNRZS2KOUq_iEDCDSCSSZq3kXGReUTgHcLrLcJM_pNsv8T9oGNqzpH-dU7tgkxCvbzXJTOzRnj0doEtxoGtLInQhMhgw"",""width"":624,""height"":416,""href"":""https://go.meetmarigold.com/consumer-trends-index"",""caption"":""via Marigold""}]],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""consumers-are-more-likely-to-purchase-from-preferred-brands-regardless-of-the-price""]],[""a"",[""href"",""https://go.meetmarigold.com/consumer-trends-index""]]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Marigold finds the most effective tactics in creating a value exchange with consumers includes discounts, coupons, bonus rewards and exclusive access.""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Marigold, in partnership with Econsultancy, released its 2023 Digital Consumer Trends Index report, which reports that over 90% of consumers would share personal or preference data in exchange for a discount, coupon or bonus reward points. Consumers will also readily share their information in return for early or exclusive access or for the opportunity to win a prize.""]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""More from the report:""]]],[3,""ul"",[[[0,[],0,""Consumers will willingly trade their behavioral data, like their hobbies and interests (70%) for better service.""]],[[0,[],0,""Consumers are more wary about sharing their real-time location (31%) or photos (29%) with a brand or company.""]],[[0,[0],1,""59% of consumers will happily pay more to purchase from their favorite brands, which has increased 4% since 2022.""],[0,[],0,"" ""],[1,[],0,0]]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""For more insights, ""],[0,[1],1,""download the full report here""],[0,[],0,"".""]]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>Marigold finds the most effective tactics in creating a value exchange with consumers includes discounts, coupons, bonus rewards and exclusive access.</p><p>Marigold, in partnership with Econsultancy, released its 2023 Digital Consumer Trends Index report, which reports that over 90% of consumers would share personal or preference data in exchange for a discount, coupon or bonus reward points. Consumers will also readily share their information in return for early or exclusive access or for the opportunity to win a prize.</p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card kg-card-hascaption""><a href=""https://go.meetmarigold.com/consumer-trends-index""><img src=""https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/Dt_M0EPoxwA1D3-yzkeC41jrBPIhwdki-keCOP3742qJVzSe6qrIii33yhODiqFYpByeOOwCRQQXZSKS5VIo_hJKal1kxbc8NHhNRZS2KOUq_iEDCDSCSSZq3kXGReUTgHcLrLcJM_pNsv8T9oGNqzpH-dU7tgkxCvbzXJTOzRnj0doEtxoGtLInQhMhgw"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""624"" height=""416""></a><figcaption>via Marigold</figcaption></figure><p>More from the report:</p><ul><li>Consumers will willingly trade their behavioral data, like their hobbies and interests (70%) for better service.</li><li>Consumers are more wary about sharing their real-time location (31%) or photos (29%) with a brand or company.</li><li><a href=""consumers-are-more-likely-to-purchase-from-preferred-brands-regardless-of-the-price"">59% of consumers will happily pay more to purchase from their favorite brands, which has increased 4% since 2022.</a> <br></li></ul><p>For more insights, <a href=""https://go.meetmarigold.com/consumer-trends-index"">download the full report here</a>.</p>",63d2cad78469ad003d60a1a6,"Marigold finds the most effective tactics in creating a value exchange with consumers includes discounts, coupons, bonus rewards and exclusive access.

Marigold, in partnership with Econsultancy, released its 2023 Digital Consumer Trends Index report, which reports that over 90% of consumers would share personal or preference data in exchange for a discount, coupon or bonus reward points. Consumers will also readily share their information in return for early or exclusive access or for the opportunity to win a prize.

More from the report:

 * Consumers will willingly trade their behavioral data, like their hobbies and interests (70%) for better service.
 * Consumers are more wary about sharing their real-time location (31%) or photos (29%) with a brand or company.
 * 59% of consumers will happily pay more to purchase from their favorite brands, which has increased 4% since 2022.

The number of people who report installing ad blockers or browsing in privacy mode has increased by double-digits since 2022.<br></p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card kg-width-wide kg-card-hascaption""><a href=""https://go.meetmarigold.com/consumer-trends-index""><img src=""https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/thA8nZ8BreFond_HTiO6uOoYl9TuVysMkx_I_Ku-_fdHYPa50qst8roiAK_FwO0GKEcVtdhYedC4HdNjakBhDS3yGy07-JhpNYcFZBLFxNk7QqQjCwt2CN-M0ENP4hB-hQrQyj63NG6f20LytNIDPXRkJZbARVwk7wAw11tVZDaS5dcsbRytEKwyFDPKKw"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""467"" height=""359""></a><figcaption>via Marigold</figcaption></figure><p>More from the report:</p><ul><li>67% of consumers are unaware of cookie depreciation and 4% don’t know what cookies are or do for marketers.</li><li>Purchases influenced by banner ads dropped 29% from 2022.</li><li><a href=""www.themeasure.net/email-drives-more-sales-than-sms-social-and-banner"">52% of consumers purchase a product directly as result of receiving an email.</a> This figure is 108% higher than SMS and banner ads and a 4% growth year-over-year.</li></ul><p>For more insights, <a href=""https://go.meetmarigold.com/consumer-trends-index"">download the full report here</a>.</p>",63d2cbe88469ad003d60a1ba,"Over half of consumers use “privacy mode” when browsing the internet, according to new research from Marigold.

The 2023 Digital Consumer Trends Index report from Marigold indicates consumers are becoming more empowered to take digital privacy into their own hands. The number of people who report installing ad blockers or browsing in privacy mode has increased by double-digits since 2022.


More from the report:

 * 67% of consumers are unaware of cookie depreciation and 4% don’t know what cookies are or do for marketers.
 * Purchases influenced by banner ads dropped 29% from 2022.
 * 52% of consumers purchase a product directly as result of receiving an email. This figure is 108% higher than SMS and banner ads and a 4% growth year-over-year.

""]]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>According to a review of the most-liked 2022 Super Bowl ads that included licensed music by <a href=""songtradr.com"">Songtradr</a>, 85% featured songs released years — even decades — ago. What’s more, an additional post-game analysis shows that all had the most notable upticks in on-demand streams and Shazam track ID activity following the game. </p><p>For instance, Electric Light Orchestra’s “Showdown,” first released in 1973, was featured in a Michelob Ultra spot. The track had a 10% increase in Shazams in the week around the Super Bowl, the biggest jump the song saw in the last year. </p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card kg-card-hascaption""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/01/ShowdownShazam.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""2000"" height=""883"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/01/ShowdownShazam.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/01/ShowdownShazam.png 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1600/2023/01/ShowdownShazam.png 1600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w2400/2023/01/ShowdownShazam.png 2400w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""><figcaption>Via Songtradr</figcaption></figure><p>So what does this mean for brands debating how (or even whether) to include music in their advertising? <a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/new-ads-old-music-why-super-bowl-ads-license-classic-songs-over-new-releases"">This article from TVREV dives deeper</a>, and includes a look at another song featured during Super Bowl 2022 that received notable bumps across music sharing services following the game. </p>",63d3e47423c6c8003d960646,"According to a review of the most-liked 2022 Super Bowl ads that included licensed music by Songtradr, 85% featured songs released years — even decades — ago. For instance, Electric Light Orchestra’s “Showdown,” first released in 1973, was featured in a Michelob Ultra spot. The track had a 10% increase in Shazams in the week around the Super Bowl, the biggest jump the song saw in the last year.

While this category can sometimes be full of films with less box office success, recent efforts to expand Best Picture consideration has opened it up to more blockbuster-type movies.""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Using data from ""],[0,[0],1,""Tubular Labs""],[0,[],0,"", we're able to look at the top Best Picture nominees this year by social views for trailers and promotional videos across YouTube, Facebook and Twitter.""]]],[3,""ul"",[[[0,[1],1,""Avatar: Way of Water""],[0,[],0,"" led the way with over 428 million, followed by ""],[0,[1],1,""Top Gun: Maverick""],[0,[],0,"" (348 million+) and ""],[0,[1],1,""Elvis""],[0,[],0,"" (256 million+). ""]],[[0,[],0,""But other movies on the nominees list also had plenty of views – with titles like ""],[0,[1],1,""All Quiet on the Western Front""],[0,[],0,"" (Netflix) and ""],[0,[1],1,""Everything Everywhere All At Once""],[0,[],0,"" (A24) both topping 40 million views globally.""]],[[0,[],0,""Both ""],[0,[1],1,""Triangle of Sadness""],[0,[],0,"" (NEON) and ""],[0,[1],1,""Banshees of Inisherin""],[0,[],0,"" (Searchlight) had just 2.4 million views through Jan. 24.""]]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>Oscar nominees were announced on Tuesday, including the list of potential honorees for Best Picture. While this category can sometimes be full of films with less box office success, recent efforts to expand Best Picture consideration has opened it up to more blockbuster-type movies.</p><p>Using data from <a href=""http://tubularlabs.com"">Tubular Labs</a>, we're able to look at the top Best Picture nominees this year by social views for trailers and promotional videos across YouTube, Facebook and Twitter.</p><ul><li><em>Avatar: Way of Water</em> led the way with over 428 million, followed by <em>Top Gun: Maverick</em> (348 million+) and <em>Elvis</em> (256 million+). </li><li>But other movies on the nominees list also had plenty of views – with titles like <em>All Quiet on the Western Front</em> (Netflix) and <em>Everything Everywhere All At Once</em> (A24) both topping 40 million views globally.</li><li>Both <em>Triangle of Sadness</em> (NEON) and <em>Banshees of Inisherin</em> (Searchlight) had just 2.4 million views through Jan. 24.</li></ul><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><a href=""https://twitter.com/TubularLabs/status/1618658560019152917/photo/1""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/01/FnahXYKWQAY2TuP.jpg"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""2000"" height=""2000"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/01/FnahXYKWQAY2TuP.jpg 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/01/FnahXYKWQAY2TuP.jpg 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1600/2023/01/FnahXYKWQAY2TuP.jpg 1600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/01/FnahXYKWQAY2TuP.jpg 2400w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></a></figure>",63d42aec23c6c8003d9606b3,"Oscar nominees were announced on Tuesday, including the list of potential honorees for Best Picture. While this category can sometimes be full of films with less box office success, recent efforts to expand Best Picture consideration has opened it up to more blockbuster-type movies.

Using data from Tubular Labs, we're able to look at the top Best Picture nominees this year by social views for trailers and promotional videos across YouTube, Facebook and Twitter.

 * Avatar: Way of Water led the way with over 428 million, followed by Top Gun: Maverick (348 million+) and Elvis (256 million+).
 * But other movies on the nominees list also had plenty of views – with titles like All Quiet on the Western Front (Netflix) and Everything Everywhere All At Once (A24) both topping 40 million views globally.
 * Both Triangle of Sadness (NEON) and Banshees of Inisherin (Searchlight) had just 2.4 million views through Jan. 24.",https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1648538874920-5deefcb65673?crop=entropy&cs=tinysrgb&fit=max&fm=jpg&ixid=MnwxMTc3M3wwfDF8c2VhcmNofDd8fG9zY2FyJTIwYXdhcmR8ZW58MHx8fHwxNjc0ODQ5NDg4&ixlib=rb-4.0.3&q=80&w=2000,0,post,published,,public,all,2023-01-27T19:50:04.000Z,2023-01-27T19:58:24.000Z,2023-01-27T19:58:24.000Z,How did Best Picture nominee trailers and promo videos fare on social video?,,,,,6359c410975d780031398a07,1,63d7dccb23c6c8003d960727,faa41430-29a3-422a-a315-96028036c8e5,Top Haircare Brands in the US by Earned Media Value,decembers-top-haircare-brands-in-the-us-by-earned-media-value,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[[""soft-return"","""",{}]],""cards"":[[""image"",{""src"":""https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/LO3Kkf-Y6Z5K7lYSKWM1cIyF_oAX2w6BbeyxupNSKYbhDtAThWK_9E-gqhgDomTDc_LPs-DGj4seDI6E8jaFeZEAHGwtXvV0MYzOXZWMX-tJv6FOmdYCEj_kNnrv1WDuiGLVYnjMSrKT7J-sT06Obxhv5OZtUgI4r3l84KWHX3D3Ik8TTJOBtWhhVir2kw"",""width"":569,""height"":444}]],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.creatoriq.com/""]],[""em""]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""According to a new report from ""],[0,[0],1,""CreatorIQ""],[0,[],0,"", Redken was December's top haircare brand in the US based on earned media value* (EMV), with nearly $7.4 million. ""]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""More from the report:""]]],[3,""ul"",[[[0,[],0,""Living Proof, which was in fifth place with $3.7 million EMV, had the highest growth: a 66% month-over-month increase and a notable year-over-year increase of 253%. ""]]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[1],1,""*Earned media value (EMV) quantifies the estimated value of consumer engagement with digital earned media and can be used to evaluate the earned performance of individual marketing campaigns and benchmark brands within the competitive landscape.""]]],[1,""p"",[[1,[],0,0]]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>According to a new report from <a href=""https://www.creatoriq.com/"">CreatorIQ</a>, Redken was December's top haircare brand in the US based on earned media value* (EMV), with nearly $7.4 million. Close behind was Olaplex, with $7.1 million in EMV while K18 Hair took third ($5.5 million EMV). As a whole, in December the haircare industry had $116.8 million in EMV generated by nearly 24K creators for 247 haircare brands. </p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/LO3Kkf-Y6Z5K7lYSKWM1cIyF_oAX2w6BbeyxupNSKYbhDtAThWK_9E-gqhgDomTDc_LPs-DGj4seDI6E8jaFeZEAHGwtXvV0MYzOXZWMX-tJv6FOmdYCEj_kNnrv1WDuiGLVYnjMSrKT7J-sT06Obxhv5OZtUgI4r3l84KWHX3D3Ik8TTJOBtWhhVir2kw"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""569"" height=""444""></figure><p>More from the report:</p><ul><li>Living Proof, which was in fifth place with $3.7 million EMV, had the highest growth: a 66% month-over-month increase and a notable year-over-year increase of 253%. Living Proof benefited from press around the release of two Netflix series: <em>Emily in Paris</em> and <em>Wednesday</em>. <em>Emily in Paris</em> star Lily Collins emerged as the brand’s primary EMV-driver, contributing $1.7M across 17 posts.</li><li>Ouai, which was at No. 7 with $3.3 million EMV, was the only month-over-month ranking newcomer. The brand’s performance in December benefited from a 26% increase in mentions and a 16% community expansion inspired in part by the holiday season. A-lister Kim Kardashsian contributed $271.6K EMV via three mentions about her holiday work with Alexandria House, a nonprofit focused on unhoused women and children in LA.</li><li>The top five tools, wigs &amp; extensions brands were Dyson Haircare ($10.6 million EMV), ghd ($4.2 million), Framar ($3.9 million), T3 Micro ($2.1 million) and Bellami ($2 million).  </li></ul><p><em>*Earned media value (EMV) quantifies the estimated value of consumer engagement with digital earned media and can be used to evaluate the earned performance of individual marketing campaigns and benchmark brands within the competitive landscape.</em></p>",63d7dccb23c6c8003d960727,"According to a new report from CreatorIQ, Redken was December's top haircare brand in the US based on earned media value* (EMV), with nearly $7.4 million. Close behind was Olaplex, with $7.1 million in EMV while K18 Hair took third ($5.5 million EMV). As a whole, in December the haircare industry had $116.8 million in EMV generated by nearly 24K creators for 247 haircare brands.

More from the report:

 * Living Proof, which was in fifth place with $3.7 million EMV, had the highest growth: a 66% month-over-month increase and a notable year-over-year increase of 253%. Living Proof benefited from press around the release of two Netflix series: Emily in Paris and Wednesday. Emily in Paris star Lily Collins emerged as the brand’s primary EMV-driver, contributing $1.7M across 17 posts.
 * Ouai, which was at No. 7 with $3.3 million EMV, was the only month-over-month ranking newcomer. The brand’s performance in December benefited from a 26% increase in mentions and a 16% community expansion inspired in part by the holiday season. A-lister Kim Kardashsian contributed $271.6K EMV via three mentions about her holiday work with Alexandria House, a nonprofit focused on unhoused women and children in LA.
 * The top five tools, wigs & extensions brands were Dyson Haircare ($10.6 million EMV), ghd ($4.2 million), Framar ($3.9 million), T3 Micro ($2.1 million) and Bellami ($2 million).

",,,,,6359c410975d780031398a07,1,63dd32d423c6c8003d9607e3,93952d00-4249-4227-93d7-16c7f5dedf75,NFL Playoffs’ Weekend Watch-Time Dominance,data-nfl-playoffs-weekend-watch-time-dominance,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[],""cards"":[[""image"",{""src"":""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/02/nfl-playoff-watch-time--1-.jpeg"",""width"":1378,""height"":787,""href"":""http://inscape.tv/""}]],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""http://inscape.tv/""]]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""The NFL always owns weekend TV viewership in-season, and that goes double for the playoffs. Data from ""],[0,[0],1,""Inscape""],[0,[],0,"" reveals how much the NFL’s share of watch-time climbed during each round of the postseason in January, culminating in an enormous 36.08% of linear TV minutes watched the day of the conference championship games (Jan. 29).""]]],[3,""ul"",[[[0,[],0,""From the start of the playoffs (Jan. 14) through the conference championships, NFL games accounted for 11.93% of watch-time.""]],[[0,[],0,""Share of watch-time grew from 21.56% during the wildcard round (six games), to 27.51% during the divisional round (four games) and then 36.08% during the one-day conference championship round; likely buoyed in part by matchups between four of the five best teams during the regular season.""]]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>The NFL always owns weekend TV viewership in-season, and that goes double for the playoffs. Data from <a href=""http://inscape.tv/"">Inscape</a> reveals how much the NFL’s share of watch-time climbed during each round of the postseason in January, culminating in an enormous 36.08% of linear TV minutes watched the day of the conference championship games (Jan. 29).</p><ul><li>From the start of the playoffs (Jan. 14) through the conference championships, NFL games accounted for 11.93% of watch-time.</li><li>Share of watch-time grew from 21.56% during the wildcard round (six games), to 27.51% during the divisional round (four games) and then 36.08% during the one-day conference championship round; likely buoyed in part by matchups between four of the five best teams during the regular season.</li></ul><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><a href=""http://inscape.tv/""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/02/nfl-playoff-watch-time--1-.jpeg"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1378"" height=""787"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/02/nfl-playoff-watch-time--1-.jpeg 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/02/nfl-playoff-watch-time--1-.jpeg 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/02/nfl-playoff-watch-time--1-.jpeg 1378w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></a></figure>",63dd32d423c6c8003d9607e3,"The NFL always owns weekend TV viewership in-season, and that goes double for the playoffs. Data from Inscape reveals how much the NFL’s share of watch-time climbed during each round of the postseason in January, culminating in an enormous 36.08% of linear TV minutes watched the day of the conference championship games (Jan. 29).

 * From the start of the playoffs (Jan. 14) through the conference championships, NFL games accounted for 11.93% of watch-time.
 * Share of watch-time grew from 21.56% during the wildcard round (six games), to 27.51% during the divisional round (four games) and then 36.08% during the one-day conference championship round; likely buoyed in part by matchups between four of the five best teams during the regular season.",https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1512145751010-9a6970a44079?crop=entropy&cs=tinysrgb&fit=max&fm=jpg&ixid=MnwxMTc3M3wwfDF8c2VhcmNofDN8fG5mbHxlbnwwfHx8fDE2NzU0NDA5Mzg&ixlib=rb-4.0.3&q=80&w=2000,0,post,published,,public,all,2023-02-03T16:14:12.000Z,2023-02-03T16:17:02.000Z,2023-02-01T16:14:00.000Z,,,,,,6359c410975d780031398a07,1,63dd339223c6c8003d96081c,88c4b086-0170-4af1-8d5d-3623e7b628d9,What Are Beyoncé Audiences Shopping For At Target?,what-are-beyonce-audiences-shopping-for-at-target,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[],""cards"":[[""image"",{""src"":""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/02/what-are-beyonce-audiences-shopping-for--1-.jpeg"",""width"":1378,""height"":787,""href"":""http://tubularlabs.com/""}]],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""http://tubularlabs.com/""]],[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.youtube.com/@beyonceVEVO""]]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Whether Beyoncé sets the Grammy award wins record or not this weekend, her audience is already winning with certain product categories at Target. Consumer Insights data from ""],[0,[0],1,""Tubular Labs""],[0,[],0,"" below shows which product categories ""],[0,[1],1,""Beyoncé’s VEVO YouTube audience""],[0,[],0,"" is most likely to shop for at Target, perhaps telegraphing future brand partnerships for the superstar.""]]],[3,""ul"",[[[0,[],0,""Beyoncé YouTube viewers were diehards for the superstar, and were more likely to visit Beyoncé.com (124x more likely than the norm) than any other website.""]],[[0,[],0,""On Amazon, her audience was a bit more music-focused, with high affinity for dance pop and vocal pop CDs/vinyls… as well as bow ties (11.0x more likely than the norm).""]],[[0,[],0,""Tubular data shows that these viewers were most likely to search retailer sites for oatmeal (something the singer has noted was a go-to breakfast option).""]]]],[10,0]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>Whether Beyoncé sets the Grammy award wins record or not this weekend, her audience is already winning with certain product categories at Target. Consumer Insights data from <a href=""http://tubularlabs.com/"">Tubular Labs</a> below shows which product categories <a href=""https://www.youtube.com/@beyonceVEVO"">Beyoncé’s VEVO YouTube audience</a> is most likely to shop for at Target, perhaps telegraphing future brand partnerships for the superstar.</p><ul><li>Beyoncé YouTube viewers were diehards for the superstar, and were more likely to visit Beyoncé.com (124x more likely than the norm) than any other website.</li><li>On Amazon, her audience was a bit more music-focused, with high affinity for dance pop and vocal pop CDs/vinyls… as well as bow ties (11.0x more likely than the norm).</li><li>Tubular data shows that these viewers were most likely to search retailer sites for oatmeal (something the singer has noted was a go-to breakfast option).</li></ul><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><a href=""http://tubularlabs.com/""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/02/what-are-beyonce-audiences-shopping-for--1-.jpeg"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1378"" height=""787"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/02/what-are-beyonce-audiences-shopping-for--1-.jpeg 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/02/what-are-beyonce-audiences-shopping-for--1-.jpeg 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/02/what-are-beyonce-audiences-shopping-for--1-.jpeg 1378w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></a></figure>",63dd339223c6c8003d96081c,"Whether Beyoncé sets the Grammy award wins record or not this weekend, her audience is already winning with certain product categories at Target.  * Beyoncé YouTube viewers were diehards for the superstar, and were more likely to visit Beyoncé.com (124x more likely than the norm) than any other website.
 * On Amazon, her audience was a bit more music-focused, with high affinity for dance pop and vocal pop CDs/vinyls… as well as bow ties (11.0x more likely than the norm).

That was a 45% month-over-month increase in EMV, and a 96% year-over-year increase. The skincare industry overall had an EMV of $253.9 million for the month, generated by 62.2K creators for 651 skincare brands. ""]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[[1,[],0,0],[0,[],0,""More from the report:""]]],[3,""ul"",[[[0,[],0,""Elemis was in second place for EMV, with an estimated $6.6 million. Although that represented a 13% month-over-month decrease, it was a 161% year-over-year increase in EMV.""]],[[0,[],0,""Only four of the top ten brands had over 1,000 ambassadors: Drunk Elephant, Elemis, Glow Recipe and Langeige.""]],[[0,[],0,""Vaseline, one of two ranking newcomers, had the highest month-over-month EMV growth (85%), and an impressive 259% year-over-year increase in EMV. TikTok powered renewed interest in its classic petroleum jelly formula via the “slugging” #SkinTok trend. Vaseline leaned into the viral fad by partnering with content creators including Dr. Shah, Alessya Farrugia, and Dasia Janae to highlight how it can help users achieve the highly-coveted #GlassSkin look.""]]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[1],1,""*Earned media value (EMV) quantifies the estimated value of consumer engagement with digital earned media and can be used to evaluate the earned performance of individual marketing campaigns and benchmark brands within the competitive landscape.""]]],[1,""p"",[[1,[],0,1]]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>According to a recently-released report from <a href=""http://creatoriq.com"">CreatorIQ</a>, Drunk Elephant was the top skincare brand in the US for December, racking up an earned media value* (EMV) of nearly $6.9 million. That was a 45% month-over-month increase in EMV, and a 96% year-over-year increase. The skincare industry overall had an EMV of $253.9 million for the month, generated by 62.2K creators for 651 skincare brands. </p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card kg-card-hascaption""><img src=""https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/0pEmLfgD4SpnGECadtZiVzKkLquADMJqrZrTnTezugeh_UrfkgDi1PL0JPBYzJB2_KEJUq4Ze7eX0uAZXg4sUU5ZoK-J5knDUvBPTkP632RWq6KOpLEBb9B6fAP_2QNMjWuxb-LVTz1ZUq5_L5it0go"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""624"" height=""479""><figcaption>Via CreatorIQ</figcaption></figure><p><br>More from the report:</p><ul><li>Elemis was in second place for EMV, with an estimated $6.6 million. Although that represented a 13% month-over-month decrease, it was a 161% year-over-year increase in EMV.</li><li>Only four of the top ten brands had over 1,000 ambassadors: Drunk Elephant, Elemis, Glow Recipe and Langeige.</li><li>Vaseline, one of two ranking newcomers, had the highest month-over-month EMV growth (85%), and an impressive 259% year-over-year increase in EMV. TikTok powered renewed interest in its classic petroleum jelly formula via the “slugging” #SkinTok trend. Vaseline leaned into the viral fad by partnering with content creators including Dr. Shah, Alessya Farrugia, and Dasia Janae to highlight how it can help users achieve the highly-coveted #GlassSkin look.</li></ul><p><em>*Earned media value (EMV) quantifies the estimated value of consumer engagement with digital earned media and can be used to evaluate the earned performance of individual marketing campaigns and benchmark brands within the competitive landscape.</em></p>",63e114ed23c6c8003d96086c,"According to a recently-released report from CreatorIQ, Drunk Elephant was the top skincare brand in the US for December, racking up an earned media value* (EMV) of nearly $6.9 million. That was a 45% month-over-month increase in EMV, and a 96% year-over-year increase. The skincare industry overall had an EMV of $253.9 million for the month, generated by 62.2K creators for 651 skincare brands.


More from the report:

 * Elemis was in second place for EMV, with an estimated $6.6 million. Although that represented a 13% month-over-month decrease, it was a 161% year-over-year increase in EMV.
 * Only four of the top ten brands had over 1,000 ambassadors: Drunk Elephant, Elemis, Glow Recipe and Langeige.
 * Vaseline, one of two ranking newcomers, had the highest month-over-month EMV growth (85%), and an impressive 259% year-over-year increase in EMV. TikTok powered renewed interest in its classic petroleum jelly formula via the “slugging” #SkinTok trend. Vaseline leaned into the viral fad by partnering with content creators including Dr. Shah, Alessya Farrugia, and Dasia Janae to highlight how it can help users achieve the highly-coveted #GlassSkin look.

*Earned media value (EMV) quantifies the estimated value of consumer engagement with digital earned media and can be used to evaluate the earned performance of individual marketing campaigns and benchmark brands within the competitive landscape.",https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1515377905703-c4788e51af15?crop=entropy&cs=tinysrgb&fit=max&fm=jpg&ixid=MnwxMTc3M3wwfDF8c2VhcmNofDI0fHxza2luY2FyZXxlbnwwfHx8fDE2NzU2OTU0NjM&ixlib=rb-4.0.3&q=80&w=2000,0,post,published,,public,all,2023-02-06T14:55:41.000Z,2023-02-06T14:58:14.000Z,2023-02-06T14:58:14.000Z,"According to a recently-released report from CreatorIQ, Drunk Elephant was the top skincare brand in the US for December, racking up an earned media value* (EMV) of nearly $6.9 million.",,,,,6359c410975d780031398a07,1,63e2982d4c23ae003c7f00ee,031050e2-f39c-45c4-8f6f-91df3af7cd76,Men's College Basketball Leads Most-Watched Programming for Jan. 30-Feb. 5,mens-college-basketball-leads,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[],""cards"":[[""image"",{""src"":""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/02/InscapeTopShowsJan30-Feb5.png"",""width"":1018,""height"":1219}]],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""inscape.tv""]],[""em""],[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.tvrev.com/news/basketball-fills-the-nfl-void-tv-by-the-numbers""]]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[0],1,""Inscape's""],[0,[],0,"" weekly TV By the Numbers rankings reveal the most-watched shows and networks based on live, linear minutes watched. It spent about $41.3 million, up slightly from December's outlay of $40.6 million. Rinvoq was also the top-spending Rx brand for <a href=""__GHOST_URL__/2022s-top-rx-pharma-brands-by-tv-ad-spend/"">2022 overall</a>.</p><p>Some additional insights around TV ads from the top pharma brands in January:</p><ul><li>In total, the top ten brands spent about $207.4 million, an increase from January 2022's $188.1 million.</li><li>Skyrizi moves into second place from fourth in December, spending an estimated $37.7 million, up from $16.9 million the previous month. </li><li>Rexulti, an antipsychotic drug from Lunbeck and Otsuka, was a month-over-month ranking newcomer with an estimated spend of $12.5 million after not spending at all on national TV in December. </li></ul><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card kg-card-hascaption""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/02/ispotjan2023pharma.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""829"" height=""494"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/02/ispotjan2023pharma.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/02/ispotjan2023pharma.png 829w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""><figcaption>Via iSpot.tv</figcaption></figure>",63e503717fb889003df4ceec,"Rinvoq, an AbbVie JAK inhibitor immunology drug, was the No. 1 prescription pharmaceutical brand when it came to estimated national TV ad spend in January, according to iSpot.tv data shared with FiercePharma. ""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""It wouldn’t be surprising for these two to grow their audience after the wide exposure offered by the Super Bowl ad — in total, the Prime-specific accounts have already seen about 5% growth in followers compared to the week before the Super Bowl, up to about 3.9 million across platforms. ""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""A few other stats about Paul and KSI:""]]],[3,""ul"",[[[0,[],0,""Instagram is one of the most engaging platforms for Paul, KSI and Prime alike: Paul has a 2.77% engagement rate, which CreatorIQ considers “good” for the platform, KSI has a 5.47% (“excellent”) and Prime has a whopping 36.43% engagement rate (“exemplary” — but it’s worth noting that account has far fewer followers overall, 1.4 million compared to Paul’s 25 million and KSI’s 12.6 million)""]],[[0,[],0,""Paul and KSI’s Instagram audience is right in the sweet spot target demographic for a sports drink: About half of Paul’s audience is between 18-24 years old and nearly 60% male. Restaurants, food & grocery (22.2%) and sports (21.7%) are two of the top ten interests of his audience.""]],[[0,[],0,""KSI’s audience is overwhelmingly male (83%), with 52.6% ages 18-24. Sports is the top interest for his followers (29.4%) ""],[1,[],0,0]]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[[1,[],0,1]]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>Social media stars Logan Paul and KSI have already had a busy 2023. In the last few weeks, their Prime Hydration drink became the official sports drink of UFC, their global expansion continues and they <a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ebha0MzwtU8&amp;ab_channel=LoganPaul"">ran an ad during the Super Bowl pregame</a> — the first creator-owned Big Game commercial ever.</p><p>Logan Paul already has a wide audience: According to <a href=""http://creatoriq.com"">CreatorIQ</a>, he has about 98 million followers across social networks, with his Instagram account as the one with the largest audience (25 million). KSI has a slightly more modest following: about 78 million across the big social platforms, with YouTube as his most popular account (24 million). </p><p>It wouldn’t be surprising for these two to grow their audience after the wide exposure offered by the Super Bowl ad — in total, the Prime-specific accounts have already seen about 5% growth in followers compared to the week before the Super Bowl, up to about 3.9 million across platforms. </p><p>A few other stats about Paul and KSI:</p><ul><li>Instagram is one of the most engaging platforms for Paul, KSI and Prime alike: Paul has a 2.77% engagement rate, which CreatorIQ considers “good” for the platform, KSI has a 5.47% (“excellent”) and Prime has a whopping 36.43% engagement rate (“exemplary” — but it’s worth noting that account has far fewer followers overall, 1.4 million compared to Paul’s 25 million and KSI’s 12.6 million)</li><li>Paul and KSI’s Instagram audience is right in the sweet spot target demographic for a sports drink: About half of Paul’s audience is between 18-24 years old and nearly 60% male. Restaurants, food &amp; grocery (22.2%) and sports (21.7%) are two of the top ten interests of his audience.</li><li>KSI’s audience is overwhelmingly male (83%), with 52.6% ages 18-24. Sports is the top interest for his followers (29.4%) <br></li></ul><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card kg-card-hascaption""><img src=""https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/NxGa8jFAISnsUKMmrfdXj6ncJSvYkQruSQW3nffU3_J3cekmAienmjui8qSY2gpqWiGqpFilma8sBmtlE9aq97tEg21U8yXN4nJ7VrMtwfxV6Pdok8uBDvwb_AsjRvQJ7nl_OVgUddqvnK6FonE0SDQ"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""624"" height=""269""><figcaption>Instagram engagement rate for PRIME via CreatorIQ</figcaption></figure>",63ece45aa9343e003dbba71f,"Social media stars Logan Paul and KSI have already had a busy 2023. In the last few weeks, their Prime Hydration drink became the official sports drink of UFC, their global expansion continues and they ran an ad during the Super Bowl pregame — the first creator-owned Big Game commercial ever.

Logan Paul already has a wide audience: According to CreatorIQ, he has about 98 million followers across social networks, with his Instagram account as the one with the largest audience (25 million). KSI has a slightly more modest following: about 78 million across the big social platforms, with YouTube as his most popular account (24 million).

It wouldn’t be surprising for these two to grow their audience after the wide exposure offered by the Super Bowl ad — in total, the Prime-specific accounts have already seen about 5% growth in followers compared to the week before the Super Bowl, up to about 3.9 million across platforms.

A few other stats about Paul and KSI:

 * Instagram is one of the most engaging platforms for Paul, KSI and Prime alike: Paul has a 2.77% engagement rate, which CreatorIQ considers “good” for the platform, KSI has a 5.47% (“excellent”) and Prime has a whopping 36.43% engagement rate (“exemplary” — but it’s worth noting that account has far fewer followers overall, 1.4 million compared to Paul’s 25 million and KSI’s 12.6 million)
 * Paul and KSI’s Instagram audience is right in the sweet spot target demographic for a sports drink: About half of Paul’s audience is between 18-24 years old and nearly 60% male. Restaurants, food & grocery (22.2%) and sports (21.7%) are two of the top ten interests of his audience.
 * KSI’s audience is overwhelmingly male (83%), with 52.6% ages 18-24. Sports is the top interest for his followers (29.4%)
