""]]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>Last week's bankruptcy filing by Diamond Sports (Sinclair's subsidiary and owner of the Bally Sports regional sports networks) could create real coverage for as many as 42 U.S. professional teams. As Sportico's Lev Akabas points out (while linking to a piece by colleague Kurt Badenahusen), 23% of MLB club revenues are derived from RSNs.

Diamond Sports’ Bally Sports-branded networks carry the games of 16 NBA, 14 MLB & 12 NHL teams. But when Diamond filed for bankruptcy last week, the impact on MLB got all the attention

Why? Because local media is a much bigger slice of the MLB revenue pie pic.twitter.com/IofkDRyXdA

— Lev Akabas (@LevAkabas) March 20, 2023

Now, there are plenty of clubs that don't appear on Bally Sports RSNs – among them, the Los Angeles Dodgers, New York Mets, New York Yankees, Philadelphia Phillies, Boston Red Sox, Chicago Cubs and more big-market franchises. But the bulk of the teams that could be affected are in MLB's smaller markets. And those teams don't have the same revenue firehoses that the aforementioned big-market franchises do.

MLB could opt to stream games for free if the bottom falls out for RSNs, according to the New York Post. And while that's still exposure, it also means less revenue for those clubs since they'd no longer be getting paid by MVPDs. Add in women's basketball and that number goes up to nearly 11% — far above anything else on TV. Some additional insights about the top programming and networks on TV:</p><ul><li>The 2023 World Baseball Classic jumps into third place from No. 12 previously, accounting for 0.88% of minutes watched, as the U.S. team marched through the quarter and semifinals.</li><li>Week-over-week program ranking newcomers include <em>Gunsmoke</em> (No. 11), <em>Chicago P.D. </em>(No. 21) and <em>The First 48</em> (No. 23).</li><li>On the network side of things, CBS takes first place with 9.73% of watch-time, much of which was driven by the NCAA Men’s Basketball Tournament.</li><li>Thanks almost entirely to March Madness, truTV vaults into the ranking at No. 17, snagging 1.31% of minutes watched.</li></ul><p>Read more and <a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/just-how-much-did-march-madness-dominate-live-tv-viewing-last-week"">see the full network ranking at TVREV.com</a>.</p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/03/InscapeTopShowsMar13-19.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1018"" height=""1219"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/03/InscapeTopShowsMar13-19.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/03/InscapeTopShowsMar13-19.png 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/03/InscapeTopShowsMar13-19.png 1018w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></figure>",6419dfb77a9749003db445e2,"According to Inscape, the 2023 NCAA Men’s Basketball Tournament accounted for nearly 10% of all live, linear minutes watched during the week of Mar. 13-19.  * Week-over-week program ranking newcomers include Gunsmoke (No. 11), Chicago P.D. (No. 21) and The First 48 (No. 23).
 * On the network side of things, CBS takes first place with 9.73% of watch-time, much of which was driven by the NCAA Men’s Basketball Tournament.
 * Thanks almost entirely to March Madness, truTV vaults into the ranking at No. 17, snagging 1.31% of minutes watched.

It’s long been unclear if there’s really a “primetime” window for social video content, but data like this arms both creators and brands with what they need to maximize the impact of videos – and at least start the daypart conversation for those platforms.""]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Tubular's data looks across content categories, too, in order to really get into specificity on these premium timeslots, and how they may be different depending on the nature of the content. For instance:""]]],[3,""ul"",[[[0,[],0,""In the U.S. in the last 90 days, the most videos are uploaded to YouTube between 1 and 2 p.m. ET, but the early morning hours of 6-8 a.m. ET attracts the most views per video.""]],[[0,[],0,""In the last 90 days, pop culture and entertainment videos posted on Facebook around 7 a.m. ET earns the most views (4.3 billion views), but sports content sees its highest views when uploaded around 9 a.m. ET (3 billion views).""]],[[0,[],0,""In the last 30 days, gaming videos posted on YouTube receive the most engagement around 11 a.m. ET (63.3 million engagements), but earn the most views around 6 a.m. ET (1.7 billion views).""]]]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>New data from <a href=""http://tubularlabs.com"">Tubular Labs</a> reveals that beauty influencers received the most TikTok views (11.4 billion) at 1 p.m. ET over the last 90 days. It’s long been unclear if there’s really a “primetime” window for social video content, but data like this arms both creators and brands with what they need to maximize the impact of videos – and at least start the daypart conversation for those platforms.</p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><a href=""https://tvnewscheck.com/tech/article/tubular-labs-announces-new-upload-time-metric-to-guide-video-content-strategy/""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/03/copy-copy-inscape-2023-oscars-1.jpg"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1365"" height=""763"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/03/copy-copy-inscape-2023-oscars-1.jpg 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/03/copy-copy-inscape-2023-oscars-1.jpg 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/03/copy-copy-inscape-2023-oscars-1.jpg 1365w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></a></figure><p>Tubular's data looks across content categories, too, in order to really get into specificity on these premium timeslots, and how they may be different depending on the nature of the content. For instance:</p><ul><li>In the U.S. in the last 90 days, the most videos are uploaded to YouTube between 1 and 2 p.m. ET, but the early morning hours of 6-8 a.m. ET attracts the most views per video.</li><li>In the last 90 days, pop culture and entertainment videos posted on Facebook around 7 a.m. ET earns the most views (4.3 billion views), but sports content sees its highest views when uploaded around 9 a.m. ET (3 billion views).</li><li>In the last 30 days, gaming videos posted on YouTube receive the most engagement around 11 a.m. ET (63.3 million engagements), but earn the most views around 6 a.m. ET (1.7 billion views).</li></ul>",641b44332364bb003dbd7340,"New data from Tubular Labs reveals that beauty influencers received the most TikTok views (11.4 billion) at 1 p.m. ET over the last 90 days. It’s long been unclear if there’s really a “primetime” window for social video content, but data like this arms both creators and brands with what they need to maximize the impact of videos – and at least start the daypart conversation for those platforms.

Tubular's data looks across content categories, too, in order to really get into specificity on these premium timeslots, and how they may be different depending on the nature of the content. For instance:

 * In the U.S. in the last 90 days, the most videos are uploaded to YouTube between 1 and 2 p.m. ET, but the early morning hours of 6-8 a.m. ET attracts the most views per video.
 * In the last 90 days, pop culture and entertainment videos posted on Facebook around 7 a.m. ET earns the most views (4.3 billion views), but sports content sees its highest views when uploaded around 9 a.m. ET (3 billion views).
 * In the last 30 days, gaming videos posted on YouTube receive the most engagement around 11 a.m. ET (63.3 million engagements), but earn the most views around 6 a.m. ET (1.7 billion views).",https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1522335789203-aabd1fc54bc9?crop=entropy&cs=tinysrgb&fit=max&fm=jpg&ixid=MnwxMTc3M3wwfDF8c2VhcmNofDEwfHxiZWF1dHl8ZW58MHx8fHwxNjc5NTA4NTU2&ixlib=rb-4.0.3&q=80&w=2000,0,post,published,,public,all,2023-03-22T18:08:51.000Z,2023-03-29T21:50:24.000Z,2023-03-22T21:49:00.000Z,,,,,,,1,641da48a2364bb003dbd7369,1bc16fbf-d383-4c82-b0a0-54b843aded56,Hyundai Owns Most-Seen Auto Ad on TV Right Now,hyundai-owns-most-seen-auto-ad-on-tv-right-now,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[],""cards"":[[""html"",{""html"":""<div style=\""position:relative; width:100%; padding-top:56.25%; padding-bottom:40px;\""><iframe src=\""https://www.ispot.tv/share/1OOE\"" style=\""position:absolute; top:0; right:0; left:0; bottom:0; width:100%; height:100%;\"" frameborder=\""0\"" scrolling=\""no\"" allowfullscreen=\""\""></iframe></div>""}]],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.wardsauto.com/industry-news/hyundai-gets-away-most-seen-auto-tv-ad""]]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""According to ""],[0,[0],1,""iSpot.tv data shared with WardsAuto""],[0,[],0,"", Hyundai tops the list of the most-seen auto ads recently. ""]]],[3,""ul"",[[[0,[],0,""Chevrolet (209.5 million TV ad impressions), Dodge (191.3 million), Jeep (186.2 million) and Buick (178.9 million) round out the chart.""]],[[0,[],0,""Notably, Buick's commercial for the '23 Envision had the highest estimated TV ad spend ($4.6 million) of the five but the fewest airings (147). The spot, a promotion for the automaker's ""Getaway Sales Event,"" generated 220.4 million TV ad impressions Mar. 13-19, with an estimated national TV ad spend of $1.2 million — notably the lowest outlay of the five ads on the ranking. </p><ul><li>Chevrolet (209.5 million TV ad impressions), Dodge (191.3 million), Jeep (186.2 million) and Buick (178.9 million) round out the chart.</li><li>Notably, Buick's commercial for the '23 Envision had the highest estimated TV ad spend ($4.6 million) of the five but the fewest airings (147). One reason: Buick zeroed in on high-priced March Madness action, with 42% of its airings occurring during women’s college basketball games and 38% during men’s basketball.</li><li>According to iSpot’s Creative Assessment, the Jeep ad ""Bear Hunt"" ad scored above the auto industry norm for likability and desire.</li></ul><!--kg-card-begin: html--><div style=""position:relative; width:100%; padding-top:56.25%; padding-bottom:40px;""><iframe src=""https://www.ispot.tv/share/1OOE"" style=""position:absolute; top:0; right:0; left:0; bottom:0; width:100%; height:100%;"" frameborder=""0"" scrolling=""no"" allowfullscreen=""""></iframe></div><!--kg-card-end: html-->",641da48a2364bb003dbd7369,"According to iSpot.tv data shared with WardsAuto, Hyundai tops the list of the most-seen auto ads recently. The spot, a promotion for the automaker's ""Getaway Sales Event,"" generated 220.4 million TV ad impressions Mar. 13-19, with an estimated national TV ad spend of $1.2 million — notably the lowest outlay of the five ads on the ranking.

 * Chevrolet (209.5 million TV ad impressions), Dodge (191.3 million), Jeep (186.2 million) and Buick (178.9 million) round out the chart.
 * Notably, Buick's commercial for the '23 Envision had the highest estimated TV ad spend ($4.6 million) of the five but the fewest airings (147). One reason: Buick zeroed in on high-priced March Madness action, with 42% of its airings occurring during women’s college basketball games and 38% during men’s basketball.

",,,,,,1,641dc0662364bb003dbd73a5,90383695-845d-49c5-b190-c1abc4665d1a,Marketing To Their Thumbs: 8-in-10 Millennials Would Rather Lose Ability To Speak Than Ability To Text!,marketing-to-their-thumbs-8-of-10-millennials-would-rather-lose-the-ability-to-speak-than-the-ability-to-text,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[[""soft-return"","""",{}]],""cards"":[[""image"",{""src"":""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/03/WK-Privacy.png"",""width"":258,""height"":214,""cardWidth"":"""",""href"":""https://www.wunderkind.co/resources/guides/marketers-guide-to-the-new-performance-marketing-era/"",""caption"":""""}],[""image"",{""src"":""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/03/WK-Text.png"",""width"":290,""height"":262,""href"":""https://www.wunderkind.co/resources/guides/marketers-guide-to-the-new-performance-marketing-era/""}]],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.wunderkind.co/resources/guides/marketers-guide-to-the-new-performance-marketing-era/""]]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Modern marketers have an uphill battle in 2023.""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""With tightening regulations on data and consumer privacy, skyrocketing costs of traditional advertising platforms and a bevvy or real-world headwinds – from recession-like sentiment to pandemic-driven changes in consumer media habits – it’s harder now than ever for marketers to acquire and engage with customers. ""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""According to a ""],[0,[0],1,""new report from Wunderkind""],[0,[],0,"", 86% of U.S. consumers have actually tried to erase their online footprint, and 87% say they will no longer shop with companies they don’t trust to use their data responsibly.""]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""So what is the clear way forward for marketers?""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""For millennials, marketers have a clear imperative to hit them where it counts – text messaging. In fact, the report noted that, according to OpenMarket, 8 of 10 millennials said they would rather lose the ability to speak than the ability to text! Among all consumers, 41% said they are likely to switch to another brand because they offer text messaging.""]]],[10,1],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Wunderkind found that retailers on average allocate over 10% of their budget to creating and maintaining a quality website. That includes implementing a system that can identify and engage with site visitors, even after they’ve left. After all, 26% of consumers will return and make a purchase on a website after abandoning their cart if retargeted with direct, personalized email.""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Given that nearly 70% of eCommerce shopping carts are abandoned before completing a purchase, the tools and strategies outlined in the ""],[0,[0],1,""“The New Performance Marketing Era”""],[0,[],0,"" guide provide a solid foundation for sustainable growth and scalable success.""],[1,[],0,0]]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>Modern marketers have an uphill battle in 2023.</p><p>With tightening regulations on data and consumer privacy, skyrocketing costs of traditional advertising platforms and a bevvy or real-world headwinds – from recession-like sentiment to pandemic-driven changes in consumer media habits – it’s harder now than ever for marketers to acquire and engage with customers. </p><p>According to a <a href=""https://www.wunderkind.co/resources/guides/marketers-guide-to-the-new-performance-marketing-era/"">new report from Wunderkind</a>, 86% of U.S. consumers have actually tried to erase their online footprint, and 87% say they will no longer shop with companies they don’t trust to use their data responsibly.</p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><a href=""https://www.wunderkind.co/resources/guides/marketers-guide-to-the-new-performance-marketing-era/""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/03/WK-Privacy.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""258"" height=""214""></a></figure><p>So what is the clear way forward for marketers?</p><p>For millennials, marketers have a clear imperative to hit them where it counts – text messaging. In fact, the report noted that, according to OpenMarket, 8 of 10 millennials said they would rather lose the ability to speak than the ability to text! Among all consumers, 41% said they are likely to switch to another brand because they offer text messaging.</p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><a href=""https://www.wunderkind.co/resources/guides/marketers-guide-to-the-new-performance-marketing-era/""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/03/WK-Text.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""290"" height=""262""></a></figure><p>Wunderkind found that retailers on average allocate over 10% of their budget to creating and maintaining a quality website. That includes implementing a system that can identify and engage with site visitors, even after they’ve left. After all, 26% of consumers will return and make a purchase on a website after abandoning their cart if retargeted with direct, personalized email.</p><p>Given that nearly 70% of eCommerce shopping carts are abandoned before completing a purchase, the tools and strategies outlined in the <a href=""https://www.wunderkind.co/resources/guides/marketers-guide-to-the-new-performance-marketing-era/"">“The New Performance Marketing Era”</a> guide provide a solid foundation for sustainable growth and scalable success.<br></p>",641dc0662364bb003dbd73a5,"Modern marketers have an uphill battle in 2023.

With tightening regulations on data and consumer privacy, skyrocketing costs of traditional advertising platforms and a bevvy or real-world headwinds – from recession-like sentiment to pandemic-driven changes in consumer media habits – it’s harder now than ever for marketers to acquire and engage with customers.

According to a new report from Wunderkind, 86% of U.S. consumers have actually tried to erase their online footprint, and 87% say they will no longer shop with companies they don’t trust to use their data responsibly.

So what is the clear way forward for marketers?

For millennials, marketers have a clear imperative to hit them where it counts – text messaging. In fact, the report noted that, according to OpenMarket, 8 of 10 millennials said they would rather lose the ability to speak than the ability to text! Among all consumers, 41% said they are likely to switch to another brand because they offer text messaging.

Wunderkind found that retailers on average allocate over 10% of their budget to creating and maintaining a quality website. That includes implementing a system that can identify and engage with site visitors, even after they’ve left. After all, 26% of consumers will return and make a purchase on a website after abandoning their cart if retargeted with direct, personalized email.

Given that nearly 70% of eCommerce shopping carts are abandoned before completing a purchase, the tools and strategies outlined in the “The New Performance Marketing Era” guide provide a solid foundation for sustainable growth and scalable success.

That's an increase from the previous week's 0.79%, putting it in third place in the program ranking. Men's basketball, meanwhile, remains at No. 1, but saw a decrease in minutes watched (down to 4.70% from 9.88% previously). Some additional insights about the top programming and networks on TV: </p><ul><li>PGA Tour Golf had a notable week-over-week increase in watch-time — capturing 1.40% compared to 0.68% previously — and moves into second place from eighth.</li><li><em>The First 48 </em>was another program with a noticeable week-over-week ranking increase, rising from No. 23 to No. 17, with reruns plus a new episode accounting for 0.48% of watch-time for the week. </li><li>Looking at the network ranking, CBS is holding steady in first place, although it saw a slight decrease in watch-time, down to 8.17% from 9.73% the previous week. The NCAA Men’s Tournament remains a titan for the network’s viewership.</li><li>With 6.59% of watch-time, NBC moves into second place from third previously, helped along by PGA Tour Golf, <em>Today</em> and <em>The Voice</em>.</li></ul><p>Read more and <a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/weekly-watch-time-for-womens-basketball-jumps-up"">see the full network ranking at TVREV.com</a>.</p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/03/InscapeTopShowsMar20-26.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1018"" height=""1219"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/03/InscapeTopShowsMar20-26.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/03/InscapeTopShowsMar20-26.png 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/03/InscapeTopShowsMar20-26.png 1018w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></figure>",64230279aab221003d875a86,"According to viewership data from Inscape, the 2023 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament captured 1.11% of all live, linear minutes watched on TV for Mar. 20-26.  * PGA Tour Golf had a notable week-over-week increase in watch-time — capturing 1.40% compared to 0.68% previously — and moves into second place from eighth.
 * The First 48 was another program with a noticeable week-over-week ranking increase, rising from No. 23 to No. 17, with reruns plus a new episode accounting for 0.48% of watch-time for the week.
 * Looking at the network ranking, CBS is holding steady in first place, although it saw a slight decrease in watch-time, down to 8.17% from 9.73% the previous week. The NCAA Men’s Tournament remains a titan for the network’s viewership.
 * With 6.59% of watch-time, NBC moves into second place from third previously, helped along by PGA Tour Golf, Today and The Voice.

",,,,,,1,64242bc2ad470b003d543d19,d8b51840-747d-4660-9205-6e102a0127ca,Creators Generated Nearly $300 Million in Earned Media Value for Starbucks Last Year,creators-generated-nearly-300-million-in-earned-media-value-for-starbucks-last-year,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[[""soft-return"","""",{}]],""cards"":[[""image"",{""src"":""https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/XxDTrSfKFaTVQh2qPjKDmBynKRdcaoXFSLtgThvtAwofr5bf7wIbeS43oh_Yn0iw5Y-xGLpFPXsDu3aI5Xk91e1h2HMCxcSOd6yzYc9wqCobCiB90RWRF1V9S3qdwl5avKYWT4xaXrmuu3UoSMmHNNI"",""width"":624,""height"":423}]],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""http://creatoriq.com""]],[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.adweek.com/adweek-wire/creatoriq-report-starbucks-first-in-creator-led-marketing-but-mcdonalds-leads-in-impact/""]],[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qWPuKae44j8""]]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""As creators continue to supercharge digital marketing efforts for brands across all industries,  ""],[0,[0],1,""CreatorIQ""],[0,[],0,"" is identifying which companies are seeing the most success in terms of earned media value (EMV). The company recently released data showcasing how ""],[0,[1],1,""creator-led social content around quick-service restaurants drove a combined $1.2 billion EMV""],[0,[],0,"" in 2022. ""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Starbucks reigned supreme for the QSR industry, racking up over $294.8 million EMV with nearly 4.7 million estimated impressions. A few more insights: ""]]],[3,""ul"",[[[0,[],0,""Not only did Starbucks lead for EMV, it boasted a creator count of 30,522 — more than twice as many as No. 2 QSR brand, McDonald’s.""]],[[0,[],0,""However, McDonald’s’ results suggest a more efficient and impactful effort, with over 5 billion impressions and a total EMV of $267.7M—nearly equal to Starbucks’ results with half the creators and posts.""]],[[0,[],0,""Only two other brands managed to rack up more than a billion impressions: Starbucks (4.7 billion) and Chipotle (1.1 billion).""]],[[0,[],0,""One of the top creator posts for Starbucks was from ""],[0,[2],1,""YouTuber Jack Doherty""],[0,[],0,"" that generated an estimated EMV of $314.3K.""]]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[[1,[],0,0]]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>As creators continue to supercharge digital marketing efforts for brands across all industries,  <a href=""http://creatoriq.com"">CreatorIQ</a> is identifying which companies are seeing the most success in terms of earned media value (EMV). The company recently released data showcasing how <a href=""https://www.adweek.com/adweek-wire/creatoriq-report-starbucks-first-in-creator-led-marketing-but-mcdonalds-leads-in-impact/"">creator-led social content around quick-service restaurants drove a combined $1.2 billion EMV</a> in 2022. </p><p>Starbucks reigned supreme for the QSR industry, racking up over $294.8 million EMV with nearly 4.7 million estimated impressions. A few more insights: </p><ul><li>Not only did Starbucks lead for EMV, it boasted a creator count of 30,522 — more than twice as many as No. 2 QSR brand, McDonald’s.</li><li>However, McDonald’s’ results suggest a more efficient and impactful effort, with over 5 billion impressions and a total EMV of $267.7M—nearly equal to Starbucks’ results with half the creators and posts.</li><li>Only two other brands managed to rack up more than a billion impressions: Starbucks (4.7 billion) and Chipotle (1.1 billion).</li><li>One of the top creator posts for Starbucks was from <a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qWPuKae44j8"">YouTuber Jack Doherty</a> that generated an estimated EMV of $314.3K.</li></ul><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/XxDTrSfKFaTVQh2qPjKDmBynKRdcaoXFSLtgThvtAwofr5bf7wIbeS43oh_Yn0iw5Y-xGLpFPXsDu3aI5Xk91e1h2HMCxcSOd6yzYc9wqCobCiB90RWRF1V9S3qdwl5avKYWT4xaXrmuu3UoSMmHNNI"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""624"" height=""423""></figure>",64242bc2ad470b003d543d19,"As creators continue to supercharge digital marketing efforts for brands across all industries,  CreatorIQ is identifying which companies are seeing the most success in terms of earned media value (EMV). The company recently released data showcasing how creator-led social content around quick-service restaurants drove a combined $1.2 billion EMV in 2022.

Starbucks reigned supreme for the QSR industry, racking up over $294.8 million EMV with nearly 4.7 million estimated impressions. A few more insights:

 * Not only did Starbucks lead for EMV, it boasted a creator count of 30,522 — more than twice as many as No. 2 QSR brand, McDonald’s.
 * However, McDonald’s’ results suggest a more efficient and impactful effort, with over 5 billion impressions and a total EMV of $267.7M—nearly equal to Starbucks’ results with half the creators and posts.
 * Only two other brands managed to rack up more than a billion impressions: Starbucks (4.7 billion) and Chipotle (1.1 billion).
 * One of the top creator posts for Starbucks was from YouTuber Jack Doherty that generated an estimated EMV of $314.3K.",__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/03/ciq-qsr-leaderboard-2022.png,0,post,published,,public,all,2023-03-29T12:14:58.000Z,2023-03-29T21:48:25.000Z,2023-03-28T04:00:00.000Z,"CreatorIQ reveals that Starbucks was first in creator-led marketing in 2022, but McDonald's won for impact. ",,,,,,1,6424b2dfad470b003d543d42,0f1c4d3b-9f44-40c8-aa1f-0f6256d4a75b,How NBCU Could Use Vanderpump Rules To Boost Peacock,how-nbcu-could-use-vanderpump-rules-to-boost-peacock,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[],""cards"":[[""image"",{""src"":""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/03/copy-copy-inscape-2023-oscars--1-.jpg"",""width"":1365,""height"":763,""href"":""http://ispot.tv""}]],""markups"":[[""em""],[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.tvrev.com/news/vanderpump-rules-ariana-scandoval-peacock-reunion""]]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""The ongoing drama around Bravo’s ""],[0,[0],1,""Vanderpump Rules""],[0,[],0,"" has created a boost for everyone involved (except Tom Sandoval, that is), but NBCU still has more room to capitalize one of TV’s biggest scandals of 2023.""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""As the company continues looking for ways to differentiate Peacock in a crowded sea of streaming services, why not use this pop culture moment to boost subscribers with the promise of exclusive content? The ""],[0,[0],1,""Vanderpump""],[0,[],0,"" reunion special is already going to be must-watch TV. Tying shoulder and/or extended content around it to Peacock subscriptions could be a savvy move that sets the streamer apart and keeps some of that post-""],[0,[0],1,""Poker Face""],[0,[],0,"" buzz going. [""],[0,[1],1,""READ MORE AT TVREV""],[0,[],0,""]""]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>The ongoing drama around Bravo’s <em>Vanderpump Rules</em> has created a boost for everyone involved (except Tom Sandoval, that is), but NBCU still has more room to capitalize one of TV’s biggest scandals of 2023.</p><p>As the company continues looking for ways to differentiate Peacock in a crowded sea of streaming services, why not use this pop culture moment to boost subscribers with the promise of exclusive content? The <em>Vanderpump</em> reunion special is already going to be must-watch TV. Tying shoulder and/or extended content around it to Peacock subscriptions could be a savvy move that sets the streamer apart and keeps some of that post-<em>Poker Face</em> buzz going. Along with post-school/dinner hours, mid-morning ET (10-10:59 a.m.) also ends up being a popular window.

 * Videos uploaded from 10-10:59 a.m. ET received similar YouTube views overall, but received more views per video than those in the 6-6:59 window.

""]]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[[1,[],0,0]]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>“The voice of the consumer is one of the most important signals a brand can consider when building a roadmap for success.” That’s one of the key points made in <a href=""https://go.meetmarigold.com/consumer-trends-index-usa?"">Marigold’s 2023 U.S. Consumer Trends Report</a>, which reveals the latest trends and insights to help marketers align with consumer needs and build strong relationships in today's economic climate. </p><p>Part of the report focuses on generational differences, making clear that age is a critical factor when it comes to crafting the right marketing campaign. Each generation has unique preferences and practices when it comes to brand relationships — and it’s become imperative that marketers understand how behaviors shift across age groups, especially with the increasing variety of marketing formats, technologies and strategies available. </p><p>See a few highlights below and <a href=""https://go.meetmarigold.com/consumer-trends-index-usa?"">download the full report here</a>. </p><ul><li>Email matters across the board – except for Gen Z (only 41% of this cohort will be swayed by email).</li><li>Organic posts and advertisements in social media are the biggest drivers for Millennials (67% and 63%, respectively).</li><li>Gen Z (47%) and Boomers (65%) are more likely to appreciate brands that communicate when necessary about offers and transactions, while Millennials like the VIP treatment.</li><li>A majority of all age groups except Boomers (45%) used mobile phones in store to do research and/or make purchase decisions.</li><li>67% of Millennials participate in loyalty programs, compared to just 33% of Boomers.  </li></ul><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><a href=""https://go.meetmarigold.com/consumer-trends-index-usa?""><img src=""https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/De-tI9rdwsT6rKQ31S2tjax2kvjzOVGcis1hBrbLEVykaobRhLbnlpL4fa5mk7llYUE4F2txzZ35DD3YYf0W0yOvJDySzx586-A-_Bq53cnN71mc32Pg41IrfqS4XeMYCZ9cbEPao_ucvJer6RJbfn8"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""624"" height=""316""></a></figure>",6425874ead470b003d543d8f,"“The voice of the consumer is one of the most important signals a brand can consider when building a roadmap for success.” That’s one of the key points made in Marigold’s 2023 U.S. Consumer Trends Report, which reveals the latest trends and insights to help marketers align with consumer needs and build strong relationships in today's economic climate.

Part of the report focuses on generational differences, making clear that age is a critical factor when it comes to crafting the right marketing campaign. Each generation has unique preferences and practices when it comes to brand relationships — and it’s become imperative that marketers understand how behaviors shift across age groups, especially with the increasing variety of marketing formats, technologies and strategies available.

See a few highlights below and download the full report here.

 * Email matters across the board – except for Gen Z (only 41% of this cohort will be swayed by email).
 * Organic posts and advertisements in social media are the biggest drivers for Millennials (67% and 63%, respectively).
 * Gen Z (47%) and Boomers (65%) are more likely to appreciate brands that communicate when necessary about offers and transactions, while Millennials like the VIP treatment.
 * A majority of all age groups except Boomers (45%) used mobile phones in store to do research and/or make purchase decisions.
 * 67% of Millennials participate in loyalty programs, compared to just 33% of Boomers.  ",https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1533750516457-a7f992034fec?crop=entropy&cs=tinysrgb&fit=max&fm=jpg&ixid=MnwxMTc3M3wwfDF8c2VhcmNofDExfHxtYXJrZXRpbmd8ZW58MHx8fHwxNjgwMTgxNDM0&ixlib=rb-4.0.3&q=80&w=2000,0,post,published,,public,all,2023-03-30T12:57:50.000Z,2023-05-02T14:44:39.000Z,2023-05-02T14:44:39.000Z,"According to Marigold’s 2023 U.S. Consumer Trends Report, few factors offer as stark a difference on multiple levels than age.                     <!--kg-card-end: html-->",6426dd5aad470b003d543dbe,"According to data from iSpot.tv shared with WardsAuto, Chevrolet owned the most-seen auto ad on TV for Mar. 20-26.  * Chevrolet increased its estimated TV ad spend for the spot 37.7% compared to the previous week.
 * Commercials from Hyundai (183.7 million TV ad impressions), Dodge (157.6 million), Mercedes-Benz (135.5 million) and Buick (131.4 million) round out the top five ranking.
 * Buick’s spot for the ’24 Encore GX had the highest estimated spend ($6.3 million) of the top five, but the fewest airings (58) – all of which occurred during March Madness games (both men’s and women’s) and related coverage.

The men’s Final Four, ""],[0,[1],1,""The Price Is Right""],[0,[],0,"", ""],[0,[1],1,""CBS Mornings""],[0,[],0,"" and the 2023 CMT Music Awards were some of the top programs contributing to CBS’s share of minutes watched.""]]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[2],1,""Read more and see the full rankings at TVREV.com""]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>The final week of March Madness scored big for watch-time, with the men’s tournament capturing 1.45% of all live, linear minutes watched, per data from <a href=""inscape.tv"">Inscape</a>. Meanwhile, the women’s tournament was close behind at 1.41%. It’s worth noting that there were more women’s games than men’s during the period measured (five vs. two), including the women’s national championship on Sunday, Apr. 2 — so more opportunities for people to tune-in, bolstering women’s watch-time in general.</p><ul><li>With 0.95% of watch-time, NBA jumps into the top five, up from No. 10 the previous week.</li><li>The new MLB season kicked off on Mar. 30, with all 30 teams playing on Opening Day, reportedly the first time that’s happened since 1968. The MLB games captured 0.85% of minutes watched during the week, putting it solidly in sixth place.</li><li>On the network side of things, CBS once again leads the ranking, although it saw a slight decrease in watch-time week-over-week, down to 8.05% from 8.17% previously. The men’s Final Four, <em>The Price Is Right</em>, <em>CBS Mornings</em> and the 2023 CMT Music Awards were some of the top programs contributing to CBS’s share of minutes watched.</li></ul><p><a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/mens-womens-ncaa-basketball-neck-and-neck-for-watch-timenbsp"">Read more and see the full rankings at TVREV.com</a></p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/04/InscapeTopShowsMar27-Apr2.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1018"" height=""1219"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/04/InscapeTopShowsMar27-Apr2.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/04/InscapeTopShowsMar27-Apr2.png 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/04/InscapeTopShowsMar27-Apr2.png 1018w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></figure>",642c335afdd5a5003d4000ff,"The final week of March Madness scored big for watch-time, with the men’s tournament capturing 1.45% of all live, linear minutes watched, per data from Inscape. Meanwhile, the women’s tournament was close behind at 1.41%. It’s worth noting that there were more women’s games than men’s during the period measured (five vs. two), including the women’s national championship on Sunday, Apr. 2 — so more opportunities for people to tune-in, bolstering women’s watch-time in general.

 * With 0.95% of watch-time, NBA jumps into the top five, up from No. 10 the previous week.
 * The new MLB season kicked off on Mar. 30, with all 30 teams playing on Opening Day, reportedly the first time that’s happened since 1968. The MLB games captured 0.85% of minutes watched during the week, putting it solidly in sixth place.
 * On the network side of things, CBS once again leads the ranking, although it saw a slight decrease in watch-time week-over-week, down to 8.05% from 8.17% previously. The men’s Final Four, The Price Is Right, CBS Mornings and the 2023 CMT Music Awards were some of the top programs contributing to CBS’s share of minutes watched.

Read more and see the full rankings at TVREV.com",https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1627627256672-027a4613d028?crop=entropy&cs=tinysrgb&fit=max&fm=jpg&ixid=MnwxMTc3M3wwfDF8c2VhcmNofDR8fGJhc2tldGJhbGx8ZW58MHx8fHwxNjgwNjE4MzMy&ixlib=rb-4.0.3&q=80&w=2000,0,post,published,,public,all,2023-04-04T14:25:30.000Z,2023-04-04T14:35:05.000Z,2023-04-04T14:35:05.000Z,Basketball owns three of the top five spots in Inscape's ranking of the most-watched programming for Mar. 27-Apr. 2. ,,,,,,1,642f451a6f7bc9003d9d1976,f95c13d2-4697-40f8-b237-52602b1c8dac,Endeavor Wants The Sports Entertainment Content Title Belt,endeavor-wants-the-sports-entertainment-content-title-belt,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[],""cards"":[[""image"",{""src"":""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/04/Minutes-Watched--4-.jpeg"",""width"":1200,""height"":800}]],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.cnbc.com/2023/04/03/wwe-ufc-merger-endeavor.html""]],[""a"",[""href"",""http://tubularlabs.com/""]],[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.tvrev.com/news/endeavor-ufc-wwe-sports-entertainment-video-tv-streaming""]]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""In an environment full of sports entertainment behemoths, you would’ve been forgiven for forgetting about Endeavor – until this week, of course.""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[0],1,""The company will merge""],[0,[],0,"" the Ultimate Fighting Championship (UFC) and World Wrestling Entertainment (WWE) into a new sports entertainment company. And with that, Endeavor basically has a stranglehold on fighting content in the U.S. and abroad. Sure, there are competitors. But none have the brand recognition or the history or tradition of the UFC and WWE. And as shown below, few sports properties are able to hold a candle to this combined venture.""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Data from""],[0,[1],1,"" Tubular Labs""],[0,[],0,"" shows both entities were among the top 10 sports media creators (sports-related accounts owned by media companies) with U.S. audiences in February. WWE was No. 3 with 399 million minutes watched across YouTube and Facebook, while UFC was No. 7 at 173 million. The high marks are nothing new either, as the last year of data reveals.""]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""[""],[0,[2],1,""READ MORE AT TVREV""],[0,[],0,""]""]]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>In an environment full of sports entertainment behemoths, you would’ve been forgiven for forgetting about Endeavor – until this week, of course.</p><p><a href=""https://www.cnbc.com/2023/04/03/wwe-ufc-merger-endeavor.html"">The company will merge</a> the Ultimate Fighting Championship (UFC) and World Wrestling Entertainment (WWE) into a new sports entertainment company. And with that, Endeavor basically has a stranglehold on fighting content in the U.S. and abroad. Sure, there are competitors. But none have the brand recognition or the history or tradition of the UFC and WWE. And as shown below, few sports properties are able to hold a candle to this combined venture.</p><p>Data from<a href=""http://tubularlabs.com/""> Tubular Labs</a> shows both entities were among the top 10 sports media creators (sports-related accounts owned by media companies) with U.S. audiences in February. WWE was No. 3 with 399 million minutes watched across YouTube and Facebook, while UFC was No. 7 at 173 million. The high marks are nothing new either, as the last year of data reveals.</p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/04/Minutes-Watched--4-.jpeg"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1200"" height=""800"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/04/Minutes-Watched--4-.jpeg 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/04/Minutes-Watched--4-.jpeg 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/04/Minutes-Watched--4-.jpeg 1200w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></figure><p>[<a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/endeavor-ufc-wwe-sports-entertainment-video-tv-streaming"">READ MORE AT TVREV</a>]</p>",642f451a6f7bc9003d9d1976,"In an environment full of sports entertainment behemoths, you would’ve been forgiven for forgetting about Endeavor – until this week, of course.

The company will merge the Ultimate Fighting Championship (UFC) and World Wrestling Entertainment (WWE) into a new sports entertainment company. And with that, Endeavor basically has a stranglehold on fighting content in the U.S. and abroad. Sure, there are competitors. But none have the brand recognition or the history or tradition of the UFC and WWE. And as shown below, few sports properties are able to hold a candle to this combined venture.

Data from Tubular Labs shows both entities were among the top 10 sports media creators (sports-related accounts owned by media companies) with U.S. audiences in February. WWE was No. 3 with 399 million minutes watched across YouTube and Facebook, while UFC was No. 7 at 173 million. The high marks are nothing new either, as the last year of data reveals.

 * With 174.2 million TV ad impressions, Ram took second place with a Truck Month spot featuring a song from country singer Lainey Wilson. 4-10, 2022.</li></ul>",64347fa80d0735003d8078c5,"As Spanish golfer Jon Rahm took home the victory – and the green jacket – for the 2023 Masters Tournament, so did live coverage of the event on TV, according to Inscape, the currency-grade smart TV ACR data provider and data technology division of Vizio.

The tournament, which aired live on ESPN Thursday, April 6, and Friday, April 7, and live on CBS Saturday, April 8, and Sunday, April 9, clocked 5.27% of linear minutes watched, topping the program charts by watch-time for all dayparts. Golf Channel’s Live From the Masters highlight show had a 1.42% share duration for that time period.

Compared to 2022, the 2023 tournament had a slightly higher share of watch-time for the weekend days compared to 2022, but was down a bit from last year for the full tournament date range (5.27% vs. 5.87%).

Check out more insights from the 2023 Masters Tournament below:

 * Looking at just the weekend April 8-9, The Masters captured 7.48% of all minutes watched, making it the No. 1 program for the weekend. Live From the Masters had 1.43% (No. 2 program), and NCIS had 1.41% share duration (No. 3).
 * On Sunday, The Masters had 10.54% of minutes watched that day, far ahead of the No. 2 program (again NCIS with 2.17%).
 * For the full TV week of April 3-9, the 2023 Masters Tournament scored first place with 3.05% of watch-time.
 * By comparison, the 2022 Masters Tournament:
 * 5.87% of minutes watched April 7-10, with Live from the Masters capturing 1.36% of watch-time during the same period.
 * Looking at just the weekend April 9-10, 2022, the Masters had 7.30% of minutes watched, slightly less than the 2023 weekend.
 * For the 2022 tournament final day on Sunday, April 10, it had a 8.61% share duration.

The NCAA men’s basketball championship game on April 3 scored 0.83% of minutes watched for the entire week, putting it in sixth place — not too shabby considering it was a single game.</p><p>Some additional insights about the recent top programs and networks on TV:</p><ul><li>Although it remains in fourth place, NBA games saw a week-over-week increase in minutes watch-time, up to 0.97% from 0.95% as the regular season came to a close.</li><li>With Donald J. Trump’s arraignment in New York City on April 4, it’s no surprise that multiple news programs have week-over-week ranking increases, including <em>Today</em>, <em>America Reports</em>, <em>America’s Newsroom</em>, <em>CBS Mornings</em>, <em>Tucker Carlson Tonight</em> and <em>Hannity</em>.</li><li>Looking at networks, CBS retains its No. 1 position week-over-week, increasing its share of watch-time to 9.15% from 8.05% previously, thanks in part to the NCAA men’s basketball championship telecast and 2023 Masters coverage.</li><li>The Golf Channel (No. 16) and Bravo were the two week-over-week ranking newcomers (No. 25).</li></ul><p><a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/golf-putts-into-first-place-for-recent-live-tv-viewership"">Read more and see the full rankings at TVREV.com</a></p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/04/InscapeTopShowsApr3-9.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1018"" height=""1219"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/04/InscapeTopShowsApr3-9.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/04/InscapeTopShowsApr3-9.png 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/04/InscapeTopShowsApr3-9.png 1018w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></figure>",64357a050d0735003d8078e4,"The 2023 Masters Tournament and related coverage scored over 4% of all live, linear minutes watched during the week of April 3-9, placing it solidly in first place for the program ranking, per data from Inscape. Some additional insights about the recent top programs and networks on TV:

 * Although it remains in fourth place, NBA games saw a week-over-week increase in minutes watch-time, up to 0.97% from 0.95% as the regular season came to a close.
 * With Donald J. Trump’s arraignment in New York City on April 4, it’s no surprise that multiple news programs have week-over-week ranking increases, including Today, America Reports, America’s Newsroom, CBS Mornings, Tucker Carlson Tonight and Hannity.
 * Looking at networks, CBS retains its No. 1 position week-over-week, increasing its share of watch-time to 9.15% from 8.05% previously, thanks in part to the NCAA men’s basketball championship telecast and 2023 Masters coverage.
 * The Golf Channel (No. 16) and Bravo were the two week-over-week ranking newcomers (No. 25).

See below for the quick-hit graphic from ""],[0,[0],1,""Yahoo Finance""],[0,[],0,"":""]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""While that price tag seems steep, keep in mind that NFL Sunday Ticket cost nearly $294 per season for the basic plan with DIRECTV, and an extra $102 per season for the premium plan that included both the Red Zone Channel and Fantasy Zone network.""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""For consumers that also subscribe to YouTube TV, the base option here is actually ""],[0,[1],1,""cheaper""],[0,[],0,"" than it was last year — until June 6, anyway For the Red Zone bundle, fans will pay about $6 less, again if they’re YouTube TV subscribers and sign up by June 6.""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""If you really want Sunday Ticket, you’re going to pay for it, whatever the price. Realistically, this is just like any other late-adopter tax, and that’s where YouTube really makes money here. Additionally, they’ll make a ton on new YouTube TV subscriptions. So even where it’s “cheaper” for consumers if they sign up with YouTube TV by June 6, YouTube is still making $63 per month on top of that for the first 10 months, then $73 per month after if they retain those subscribers.""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""[""],[0,[2],1,""Read more at TVREV""],[0,[],0,""]""]]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>About a month before from the release of the 2023-24 NFL regular season schedule, fans now know how much they’ll pay to watch the games.</p><p>On Tuesday, YouTube announced a variety of price points for customers that looks steep on paper, but is mostly a savvy scheme devised to boost YouTube TV sign-ups. See below for the quick-hit graphic from <a href=""https://twitter.com/YahooFinance/status/1645864449360777242"">Yahoo Finance</a>:</p><!--kg-card-begin: html--><blockquote class=""twitter-tweet""><p lang=""en"" dir=""ltr"">YouTube reveals prices of NFL Sunday Ticket subscription <a href=""https://t.co/pcXxUTOfnl"">https://t.co/pcXxUTOfnl</a> <a href=""https://t.co/ogGLgtT9nt"">pic.twitter.com/ogGLgtT9nt</a></p>&mdash; Yahoo Finance (@YahooFinance) <a href=""https://twitter.com/YahooFinance/status/1645864449360777242?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw"">April 11, 2023</a></blockquote> <script async src=""https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js"" charset=""utf-8""></script> <!--kg-card-end: html--><p>While that price tag seems steep, keep in mind that NFL Sunday Ticket cost nearly $294 per season for the basic plan with DIRECTV, and an extra $102 per season for the premium plan that included both the Red Zone Channel and Fantasy Zone network.</p><p>For consumers that also subscribe to YouTube TV, the base option here is actually <em>cheaper</em> than it was last year — until June 6, anyway For the Red Zone bundle, fans will pay about $6 less, again if they’re YouTube TV subscribers and sign up by June 6.</p><p>If you really want Sunday Ticket, you’re going to pay for it, whatever the price. Realistically, this is just like any other late-adopter tax, and that’s where YouTube really makes money here. Additionally, they’ll make a ton on new YouTube TV subscriptions. So even where it’s “cheaper” for consumers if they sign up with YouTube TV by June 6, YouTube is still making $63 per month on top of that for the first 10 months, then $73 per month after if they retain those subscribers.</p><p>[<a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/youtube-nfl-sunday-ticket-pricing-tv-streaming"">Read more at TVREV</a>]</p>",6435dea10d0735003d80791d,"About a month before from the release of the 2023-24 NFL regular season schedule, fans now know how much they’ll pay to watch the games.

On Tuesday, YouTube announced a variety of price points for customers that looks steep on paper, but is mostly a savvy scheme devised to boost YouTube TV sign-ups. See below for the quick-hit graphic from Yahoo Finance:

YouTube reveals prices of NFL Sunday Ticket subscription https://t.co/pcXxUTOfnl pic.twitter.com/ogGLgtT9nt

— Yahoo Finance (@YahooFinance) April 11, 2023

While that price tag seems steep, keep in mind that NFL Sunday Ticket cost nearly $294 per season for the basic plan with DIRECTV, and an extra $102 per season for the premium plan that included both the Red Zone Channel and Fantasy Zone network.

For consumers that also subscribe to YouTube TV, the base option here is actually cheaper than it was last year — until June 6, anyway For the Red Zone bundle, fans will pay about $6 less, again if they’re YouTube TV subscribers and sign up by June 6.

If you really want Sunday Ticket, you’re going to pay for it, whatever the price. Realistically, this is just like any other late-adopter tax, and that’s where YouTube really makes money here. Additionally, they’ll make a ton on new YouTube TV subscriptions. So even where it’s “cheaper” for consumers if they sign up with YouTube TV by June 6, YouTube is still making $63 per month on top of that for the first 10 months, then $73 per month after if they retain those subscribers.

Hub’s ""],[0,[1],1,""2023 Connected Home Report""],[0,[],0,"" shows that in Q1 2023, 88% of smart TV households were streaming via native OS – up from 75% in Q1 2020. ""]]],[3,""ul"",[[[0,[],0,""With smart TV households also growing in that time period, there isn’t much upside left for third-party devices.""]],[[0,[],0,""These trends are a major boost for OEMs, however, as TV manufacturers continue to add a significant amount of content to their own native operating systems built into devices.""]]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>It's been <a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/wir20220909"">known for awhile</a> that the dongle is dying, but recent research from Hub reveals even more around OEM operating system dominance. Hub’s <a href=""https://www.hubresearchllc.com/reports/?category=2023&amp;title=2023-connected-home"">2023 Connected Home Report</a> shows that in Q1 2023, 88% of smart TV households were streaming via native OS – up from 75% in Q1 2020. </p><ul><li>With smart TV households also growing in that time period, there isn’t much upside left for third-party devices.</li><li>These trends are a major boost for OEMs, however, as TV manufacturers continue to add a significant amount of content to their own native operating systems built into devices.</li></ul><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/04/ML6JcxzZcgadXZgGUqAFjJ-1200-75.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""625"" height=""310"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/04/ML6JcxzZcgadXZgGUqAFjJ-1200-75.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/04/ML6JcxzZcgadXZgGUqAFjJ-1200-75.png 625w""></figure>",643f17926f818f003df3aef8,"It's been known for awhile that the dongle is dying, but recent research from Hub reveals even more around OEM operating system dominance. Hub’s 2023 Connected Home Report shows that in Q1 2023, 88% of smart TV households were streaming via native OS – up from 75% in Q1 2020.

 * With smart TV households also growing in that time period, there isn’t much upside left for third-party devices.
 * These trends are a major boost for OEMs, however, as TV manufacturers continue to add a significant amount of content to their own native operating systems built into devices.",https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1560169897-fc0cdbdfa4d5?crop=entropy&cs=tinysrgb&fit=max&fm=jpg&ixid=MnwxMTc3M3wwfDF8c2VhcmNofDF8fHNtYXJ0JTIwdHZ8ZW58MHx8fHwxNjgxODU2NTAy&ixlib=rb-4.0.3&q=80&w=2000,0,post,published,,public,all,2023-04-18T22:20:02.000Z,2023-04-18T22:24:33.000Z,2023-04-18T22:24:33.000Z,,,,,,,1,643ffdeb6f818f003df3af29,5ce39399-cf13-4f15-a5e7-4db6b6f16973,How Customer Interactions Will Evolve in the Age of AI,how-customer-interactions-will-evolve-in-the-age-of-ai,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[[""soft-return"","""",{}]],""cards"":[[""image"",{""src"":""https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/7iy422NGGBUKVf6hzxaxj9HZKOmBu11Cq1poiEUzVDARBxUlr5oACSlyTZP2rxp00NHp1U6Yxi05yzu2So_rrNDfyh1Qa-oRN4uC237a11kWanfYhYRFk1ESCHn1n5AvtmWbc1w9DoyXFE0L7281nV8"",""width"":624,""height"":324,""href"":""https://www.wunderkind.co/resources/webinars/ai-evolution-the-power-of-change/""}]],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.wunderkind.co/resources/webinars/ai-evolution-the-power-of-change/""]]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Artificial intelligence (AI) has burst into the public zeitgeist in recent months thanks to revolutionary progress in the field with the likes of ChatGPT, and the technology is poised to change life as we know it. For marketers, AI offers a new avenue to gather actionable data about their audiences and solve some of the problems that are surfacing as third-party cookies become obsolete and privacy regulations tighten. ""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Performance marketing company ""],[0,[0],1,""Wunderkind""],[0,[],0,"" recently spoke with Create Labs founder Abran Maldonado, a premier ambassador of AGI (Artificial General Intelligence) who was granted exclusive access to GPT3, the technology behind ChatGPT. ""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Here are a few highlights from their conversation, and you can ""],[0,[0],1,""watch the full webinar here""],[0,[],0,"".""]]],[3,""ul"",[[[0,[],0,""AI is uniquely positioned to revolutionize marketing across agencies and advertisers by capturing permissible customer data through direct conversations and online interactions.""]],[[0,[],0,""Instead of using cookies to collect data about site visitors, retailers can offer AI tools that act as a personal shopper, engaging consumers with open-ended questions such as “Tell me the things that you like,\"" which will capture voluntary data in real-time.""]],[[0,[],0,""AI can also help marketers make important decisions about which software platforms, technologies, and other tools are worth investing in, including screening vendors, partners, agencies and more. ""]]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[[1,[],0,0]]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>Artificial intelligence (AI) has burst into the public zeitgeist in recent months thanks to revolutionary progress in the field with the likes of ChatGPT, and the technology is poised to change life as we know it. For marketers, AI offers a new avenue to gather actionable data about their audiences and solve some of the problems that are surfacing as third-party cookies become obsolete and privacy regulations tighten. </p><p>Performance marketing company <a href=""https://www.wunderkind.co/resources/webinars/ai-evolution-the-power-of-change/"">Wunderkind</a> recently spoke with Create Labs founder Abran Maldonado, a premier ambassador of AGI (Artificial General Intelligence) who was granted exclusive access to GPT3, the technology behind ChatGPT. </p><p>Here are a few highlights from their conversation, and you can <a href=""https://www.wunderkind.co/resources/webinars/ai-evolution-the-power-of-change/"">watch the full webinar here</a>.</p><ul><li>AI is uniquely positioned to revolutionize marketing across agencies and advertisers by capturing permissible customer data through direct conversations and online interactions.</li><li>Instead of using cookies to collect data about site visitors, retailers can offer AI tools that act as a personal shopper, engaging consumers with open-ended questions such as “Tell me the things that you like,"" which will capture voluntary data in real-time.</li><li>AI can also help marketers make important decisions about which software platforms, technologies, and other tools are worth investing in, including screening vendors, partners, agencies and more. </li></ul><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><a href=""https://www.wunderkind.co/resources/webinars/ai-evolution-the-power-of-change/""><img src=""https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/7iy422NGGBUKVf6hzxaxj9HZKOmBu11Cq1poiEUzVDARBxUlr5oACSlyTZP2rxp00NHp1U6Yxi05yzu2So_rrNDfyh1Qa-oRN4uC237a11kWanfYhYRFk1ESCHn1n5AvtmWbc1w9DoyXFE0L7281nV8"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""624"" height=""324""></a></figure>",643ffdeb6f818f003df3af29,"Artificial intelligence (AI) has burst into the public zeitgeist in recent months thanks to revolutionary progress in the field with the likes of ChatGPT, and the technology is poised to change life as we know it. For marketers, AI offers a new avenue to gather actionable data about their audiences and solve some of the problems that are surfacing as third-party cookies become obsolete and privacy regulations tighten.

Performance marketing company Wunderkind recently spoke with Create Labs founder Abran Maldonado, a premier ambassador of AGI (Artificial General Intelligence) who was granted exclusive access to GPT3, the technology behind ChatGPT.

Here are a few highlights from their conversation, and you can watch the full webinar here.

 * AI is uniquely positioned to revolutionize marketing across agencies and advertisers by capturing permissible customer data through direct conversations and online interactions.
 * Instead of using cookies to collect data about site visitors, retailers can offer AI tools that act as a personal shopper, engaging consumers with open-ended questions such as “Tell me the things that you like,"" which will capture voluntary data in real-time.
 * AI can also help marketers make important decisions about which software platforms, technologies, and other tools are worth investing in, including screening vendors, partners, agencies and more.",https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1423666639041-f56000c27a9a?crop=entropy&cs=tinysrgb&fit=max&fm=jpg&ixid=MnwxMTc3M3wwfDF8c2VhcmNofDV8fG9ubGluZSUyMHNob3BwaW5nfGVufDB8fHx8MTY4MTkxNTQwNw&ixlib=rb-4.0.3&q=80&w=2000,0,post,published,,public,all,2023-04-19T14:42:51.000Z,2023-04-19T14:45:59.000Z,2023-04-19T14:45:59.000Z,A webinar from Wunderkind explores how AI is poised to shape the future of marketing and customer interactions.,,,,,,1,644045016f818f003df3af45,907fb58b-5ceb-4fd3-a04b-4e6054d3633c,Upfronts Survey: TV Spend Not Going Anywhere,upfronts-survey-tv-spend-not-going-anywhere,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[],""cards"":[[""image"",{""src"":""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/04/Screen-Shot-2023-04-19-at-11.28.40-AM.png"",""width"":1064,""height"":1222,""href"":""https://www.ispot.tv/hub/resources/free-reports/2023-upfronts-survey-results/""}]],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.ispot.tv/hub/resources/free-reports/2023-upfronts-survey-results/""]],[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.tvrev.com/news/upfronts-survey-indicates-tv-spend-ispot-buyers-newfronts""]]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""While we’ve been hearing a constant drumbeat of “recession” talk since last year, it may not have the presumed effect on the TV ad market – at least not for the 2023 Upfronts, anyway.""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""A ""],[0,[0],1,""recent survey from iSpot""],[0,[],0,"" revealed 2023 upfront plans for over 500 brand and agency professionals, sharing insights around TV spending plans for 2023-24. Of those, 21% said they were planning to commit “a bit more” or “much more” than they did during the 2022 Upfronts.</p><p>In conjunction with that, the survey also indicated that 78% still expected overall marketing budgets to increase (34%) or remain the same (44%), year-over-year.</p><p> [<a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/upfronts-survey-indicates-tv-spend-ispot-buyers-newfronts"">READ MORE AT TVREV</a>]</p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><a href=""https://www.ispot.tv/hub/resources/free-reports/2023-upfronts-survey-results/""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/04/Screen-Shot-2023-04-19-at-11.28.40-AM.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1064"" height=""1222"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/04/Screen-Shot-2023-04-19-at-11.28.40-AM.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/04/Screen-Shot-2023-04-19-at-11.28.40-AM.png 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/04/Screen-Shot-2023-04-19-at-11.28.40-AM.png 1064w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></a></figure>",644045016f818f003df3af45,"While we’ve been hearing a constant drumbeat of “recession” talk since last year, it may not have the presumed effect on the TV ad market – at least not for the 2023 Upfronts, anyway.

A recent survey from iSpot revealed 2023 upfront plans for over 500 brand and agency professionals, sharing insights around TV spending plans for 2023-24.  One of the big takeaways is that 74% of respondents expected to spend at least as much as they did last year. Of those, 21% said they were planning to commit “a bit more” or “much more” than they did during the 2022 Upfronts.

In conjunction with that, the survey also indicated that 78% still expected overall marketing budgets to increase (34%) or remain the same (44%), year-over-year.

""]]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""For more insights on the latest consumer sentiment and spending habits, ""],[0,[0],1,""download the full report from Wunderkind here""],[0,[],0,"".""]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[[1,[],0,0]]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>Although global turmoil and economic uncertainty have many consumers tightening their belts, one cohort remains confident about the future: Gen Z. </p><p>According to a new report from performance marketing company <a href=""https://www.wunderkind.co/resources/research-study/2023-consumer-spending-report/"">Wunderkind</a>, only 22% of Gen Z respondents feel like they need to reduce discretionary spending amidst today’s economic environment. With $360 billion in disposable income and buying power on the rise, that’s good news for brands marketing to this segment. </p><p>Economic headwinds remain, however, making it vital for marketers to understand how consumer behavior and desires are changing. Wunderkind’s report found that: </p><ul><li>52% of U.S. consumers and 64% of UK consumers are cutting back on non-essential purchases. Another 37% of the U.S. population say they plan to cut back on essentials, while 30% of consumers in the UK plan to do the same.</li><li>Consumers are still shopping online: 42% of US shoppers plan to maintain eCommerce shopping levels, with an additional 32% stating they plan to do more digital shopping this year.</li><li>Luxury shoppers are still shopping for luxury in the US: 63% of high-income Americans say they have no need to cut back on luxury spending at all. </li></ul><p>For more insights on the latest consumer sentiment and spending habits, <a href=""https://www.wunderkind.co/resources/research-study/2023-consumer-spending-report/"">download the full report from Wunderkind here</a>.</p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/UYq0ygsQhH4uQrtLwHbjfKdxD0m68vtVjn4-DxsE90fGbp6XLvEbSR28x-YW5IKCe6kW3gtmbgd6PFgL23JUgVNZQD1Kmr2Uo_lQHnVjuhG2x3OyOrD5oE7GU1OkmwK8nVtZIEh3cn_QOTS8-p0eNRI"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""624"" height=""325""></figure>",644155edcbd299003d681fe2,"Although global turmoil and economic uncertainty have many consumers tightening their belts, one cohort remains confident about the future: Gen Z.

According to a new report from performance marketing company Wunderkind, only 22% of Gen Z respondents feel like they need to reduce discretionary spending amidst today’s economic environment. With $360 billion in disposable income and buying power on the rise, that’s good news for brands marketing to this segment.

Economic headwinds remain, however, making it vital for marketers to understand how consumer behavior and desires are changing. Wunderkind’s report found that:

 * 52% of U.S. consumers and 64% of UK consumers are cutting back on non-essential purchases. Another 37% of the U.S. population say they plan to cut back on essentials, while 30% of consumers in the UK plan to do the same.
 * Consumers are still shopping online: 42% of US shoppers plan to maintain eCommerce shopping levels, with an additional 32% stating they plan to do more digital shopping this year.
 * Luxury shoppers are still shopping for luxury in the US: 63% of high-income Americans say they have no need to cut back on luxury spending at all.

For more insights on the latest consumer sentiment and spending habits, download the full report from Wunderkind here.",https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1521566652839-697aa473761a?crop=entropy&cs=tinysrgb&fit=max&fm=jpg&ixid=MnwxMTc3M3wwfDF8c2VhcmNofDN8fGNvbnN1bWVyfGVufDB8fHx8MTY4MjAwMzUzMQ&ixlib=rb-4.0.3&q=80&w=2000,0,post,published,,public,all,2023-04-20T15:10:37.000Z,2023-04-21T15:42:39.000Z,2023-04-21T15:42:26.000Z,New research from Wunderkind finds 78% of Gen Z generation have no plans to reduce spending. ,,,,,,1,6442afa4cbd299003d681ff3,2d7153a0-5035-46e2-9103-db678c633277,Ram Owns Most-Seen Auto TV Ad for April 10-16,ram-owns,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[],""cards"":[[""html"",{""html"":""                    <div style=\""position:relative; width:100%; padding-top:56.25%; padding-bottom:40px;\""><iframe src=\""https://www.ispot.tv/share/1TKo\"" style=\""position:absolute; top:0; right:0; left:0; bottom:0; width:100%; height:100%;\"" frameborder=\""0\"" scrolling=\""no\"" allowfullscreen=\""\""></iframe></div>\n                    ""}]],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.wardsauto.com/industry-news/ram-s-heartfelt-spot-no1-among-most-seen-auto-tv-ads""]],[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.ispot.tv/products/creative-testing""]],[""u""],[""em""]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""According to recent data from ""],[0,[0],1,""iSpot.tv shared with WardsAuto""],[0,[],0,"", Ram's \""To Be a Ram: Have Heart\"" commercial leads the top-five ranking of most seen auto ads on TV for April 10-16.                     <!--kg-card-end: html-->",6442afa4cbd299003d681ff3,"According to recent data from iSpot.tv shared with WardsAuto, Ram's ""To Be a Ram: Have Heart"" commercial leads the top-five ranking of most seen auto ads on TV for April 10-16. The spot garnered 217.8 million national TV ad impressions, a 28.9% increase from the previous week. Estimated national TV ad spend for the spot was also up 60.4% week-over-week.

 * Dodge's spot for the Hornet, which took first place the previous week, slips to second with 210.6 million national TV ad impressions. Per iSpot’s Creative Assessment, 29% of survey respondents cited the product itself as the single best thing about the ad.
 * A commercial highlighting Lexus electric vehicles takes third place. NBA games generated over 12.8 million TV ad impressions out of the total 196.9 million.
 * Subaru's fourth- and fifth-place spots combine for a total of 317.3 million TV ad impressions, and both had a similar national TV ad spend (est. $1.4 million).

NHL, also in the post-season, takes second place with 1.68% of minutes watched. </p><p>Some additional insights about the recent top programs and networks on TV:</p><ul><li>Thanks to multiple marathons on Bravo, <em>Below Deck</em> sails from No. 31 to No. 16, accounting for 0.49% of minutes watched during the week.</li><li><em>American Idol </em>also has a notable week-over-week jump, landing at No. 11 from No. 21 previously.</li><li>On the network side of things, ABC retains first place with a modest week-over-week increase in watch-time, up to 7.34% from 7.29% previously.</li><li>TLC is the sole week-over-week newcomer to the network ranking, landing at No. 25 with 0.91% of of minutes watched.</li></ul><p><a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/nba-dunks-for-tv-watch-time-nhl-skates-into-second"">Read more and see the full rankings at TVREV.com.</a></p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/04/InscapeTopShowsApr17-23.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1018"" height=""1219"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/04/InscapeTopShowsApr17-23.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/04/InscapeTopShowsApr17-23.png 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/04/InscapeTopShowsApr17-23.png 1018w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></figure>",6447e6a9cbd299003d68202e,"For the second week in a row, NBA basketball leads Inscape's ranking of the most-watched programing on TV. Some additional insights about the recent top programs and networks on TV:

 * Thanks to multiple marathons on Bravo, Below Deck sails from No. 31 to No. 16, accounting for 0.49% of minutes watched during the week.
 * American Idol also has a notable week-over-week jump, landing at No. 11 from No. 21 previously.
 * On the network side of things, ABC retains first place with a modest week-over-week increase in watch-time, up to 7.34% from 7.29% previously.
 * TLC is the sole week-over-week newcomer to the network ranking, landing at No. 25 with 0.91% of of minutes watched.

",,,,,,1,644aa1abcbd299003d68205d,002e679d-4a10-41e9-9abc-a7d0cf89dc8b,Big Mouth's Historical Revenue Contribution To Netflix,big-mouths-historical-revenue-contribution-to-netflix,,"{""root"":{""children"":[{""children"":[{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""Ahead of its seventh-season premiere, Netflix has officially renewed the raunchy animated sitcom "",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1},{""detail"":0,""format"":2,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""Big Mouth "",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1},{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""for an eighth and final season. ["",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1},{""children"":[{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""read the rest, from Brandon Katz, on TVREV"",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""link"",""version"":1,""rel"":null,""target"":null,""title"":null,""url"":""https://www.tvrev.com/news/big-mouths-historical-revenue-contribution-to-netflix""},{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""]"",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""paragraph"",""version"":1},{""children"":[],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""paragraph"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""root"",""version"":1}}","<p>Ahead of its seventh-season premiere, Netflix has officially renewed the raunchy animated sitcom <em>Big Mouth </em>for an eighth and final season. As such, it will officially become the longest-running scripted series in terms of seasons for the market-leading streamer best known for its fire hose approach to content. That is a remarkable accomplishment, but perhaps not a surprising one.</p><p>According to <a href=""http://parrotanalytics.com"">Parrot Analytics</a> content valuation data, <em>Big Mouth </em>has contributed an estimated $153.7 million in global revenue for the platform since debuting in 2018 through last quarter. It’s also spawned a spinoff, <em>Human Resources</em>, that has been renewed for a second season. Given the increased scrutiny placed on Netflix’s lucrative mega-deals with producers in recent years, its overall pact with animation production company Titmouse has quietly become one of its best bang-for-buck values in a less expensive and growing genre. [<a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/big-mouths-historical-revenue-contribution-to-netflix"">read the rest, from Brandon Katz, on TVREV</a>]</p>",644aa1abcbd299003d68205d,"Ahead of its seventh-season premiere, Netflix has officially renewed the raunchy animated sitcom Big Mouth for an eighth and final season. As such, it will officially become the longest-running scripted series in terms of seasons for the market-leading streamer best known for its fire hose approach to content. That is a remarkable accomplishment, but perhaps not a surprising one.

According to Parrot Analytics content valuation data, Big Mouth has contributed an estimated $153.7 million in global revenue for the platform since debuting in 2018 through last quarter. It’s also spawned a spinoff, Human Resources, that has been renewed for a second season. Given the increased scrutiny placed on Netflix’s lucrative mega-deals with producers in recent years, its overall pact with animation production company Titmouse has quietly become one of its best bang-for-buck values in a less expensive and growing genre. [""],[0,[3],1,""read the rest on TVREV""],[0,[],0,""]""]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>As much as the network may want to move on from the false election fraud claims that got them into their current legal problems, and the power that Carlson had manning the top nightly program on cable news, it’s also going to be hard for the network to walk away from what’s worked.</p><p>For instance, data from <a href=""http://inscape.tv/"">Inscape</a> shows that <em>Tucker Carlson Tonight</em> accounted for 6.75% of all live, linear minutes watched on Fox News from Jan. 1-April 23, 2023 (No. 4 among all programs on the network). It was No. 26 in terms of linear watch-time across all programs since Jan. 1, and No. 5 in primetime across all networks.</p><p>Where do you turn to replace that? There’s one option that’s already within the Fox News ecosystem: <em>Jesse Watters Primetime</em>, as data from <a href=""http://ispot.tv"">iSpot</a> points to pretty clearly. [<a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/data-fox-news-post-tucker-carlson-reality"">read the rest on TVREV</a>]</p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><a href=""http://ispot.tv""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/04/iSpot-Fox-News-Impressions-SOV.jpg"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1402"" height=""787"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/04/iSpot-Fox-News-Impressions-SOV.jpg 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/04/iSpot-Fox-News-Impressions-SOV.jpg 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/04/iSpot-Fox-News-Impressions-SOV.jpg 1402w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></a></figure>",644aa2cdcbd299003d68207f,"As much as the network may want to move on from the false election fraud claims that got them into their current legal problems, and the power that Carlson had manning the top nightly program on cable news, it’s also going to be hard for the network to walk away from what’s worked.

For instance, data from Inscape shows that Tucker Carlson Tonight accounted for 6.75% of all live, linear minutes watched on Fox News from Jan. 1-April 23, 2023 (No. 4 among all programs on the network). It was No. 26 in terms of linear watch-time across all programs since Jan. 1, and No. 5 in primetime across all networks.

Where do you turn to replace that? There’s one option that’s already within the Fox News ecosystem: Jesse Watters Primetime, as data from iSpot points to pretty clearly. Success",shakira-tiktok-and-how-brands-can-find-similar-success,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[],""cards"":[[""image"",{""src"":""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/04/Screen-Shot-2023-04-27-at-9.34.43-AM.png"",""width"":1002,""height"":690,""href"":""http://songtradr.com""}]],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.tiktok.com/@fallontonight/video/7209160379379797290?lang=en""]],[""em""],[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.adweek.com/adweek-wire/songtradr-data-shakira-tiktok-and-how-brands-can-find-similar-success/""]]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Using recent Shakira popularity on TikTok, Songtradr digs into how brands can find similar success, sometimes without even utilizing the original song.""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Shakira and Bizzarap’s “""],[0,[0],1,""Bzrp Music Sessions, Vol. 53""],[0,[],0,""” (or “Out of Your League”) was one of the most-used songs on TikTok earlier in 2023 – according to data from Songtradr – but the Latin hit has yet to be utilized by brands in TV advertising since its early January release.""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""For advertisers that may want to avoid creating brand confusion with Kroger – or are simply
