[""],[0,[2],1,""READ MORE""],[0,[],0,""]""]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>Using recent Shakira popularity on TikTok, Songtradr digs into how brands can find similar success, sometimes without even utilizing the original song.</p><p>Shakira and Bizzarap’s “<a href=""https://www.tiktok.com/@fallontonight/video/7209160379379797290?lang=en"">Bzrp Music Sessions, Vol. 53</a>” (or “Out of Your League”) was one of the most-used songs on TikTok earlier in 2023 – according to data from Songtradr – but the Latin hit has yet to be utilized by brands in TV advertising since its early January release.</p><p>For advertisers that may want to avoid creating brand confusion with Kroger – or are simply looking for a cheaper alternative – there are options to find similar songs to “Out of Your League.” These tracks can sound <em>like</em> Shakira, and use the song’s 2023 popularity on TikTok as a hook, while also avoiding complete overlap.</p><p>For example, Songtradr reveals these characteristics for “Out of Your League,” including higher scores for danceability (78%) and energy (63%).</p><p>Using that data, brands can either opt to try and license a Shakira song (or even “Out Of Your League”), or opt for another track that fits a similar profile. [<a href=""https://www.adweek.com/adweek-wire/songtradr-data-shakira-tiktok-and-how-brands-can-find-similar-success/"">READ MORE</a>]</p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><a href=""http://songtradr.com""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/04/Screen-Shot-2023-04-27-at-9.34.43-AM.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1002"" height=""690"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/04/Screen-Shot-2023-04-27-at-9.34.43-AM.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/04/Screen-Shot-2023-04-27-at-9.34.43-AM.png 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/04/Screen-Shot-2023-04-27-at-9.34.43-AM.png 1002w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></a></figure>",644aa3b3cbd299003d6820a9,"Using recent Shakira popularity on TikTok, Songtradr digs into how brands can find similar success, sometimes without even utilizing the original song.

Shakira and Bizzarap’s “Bzrp Music Sessions, Vol. 53” (or “Out of Your League”) was one of the most-used songs on TikTok earlier in 2023 – according to data from Songtradr – but the Latin hit has yet to be utilized by brands in TV advertising since its early January release.

For advertisers that may want to avoid creating brand confusion with Kroger – or are simply looking for a cheaper alternative – there are options to find similar songs to “Out of Your League.” These tracks can sound like Shakira, and use the song’s 2023 popularity on TikTok as a hook, while also avoiding complete overlap.

For example, Songtradr reveals these characteristics for “Out of Your League,” including higher scores for danceability (78%) and energy (63%).

Using that data, brands can either opt to try and license a Shakira song (or even “Out Of Your League”), or opt for another track that fits a similar profile. According to ""],[0,[3],1,""iSpot's Creative Assessment""],[0,[],0,"", 15% of surveyed viewers considered the music, a song by country singer Lainey Wilson, the single best thing about the ad.""]],[[0,[],0,""Chevrolet's \""Big Life\"" took fifth place (171.7 million TV ad impressions) and was the only spot on the ranking that aired during NHL games.""]]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>From April 17-23, a Dodge commercial for its new Hornet model generated 191.6 million national TV ad impressions, putting it <a href=""https://www.wardsauto.com/industry-news/dodge-retakes-top-spot-among-most-seen-auto-tv-ads"">at the top of iSpot.tv's most-seen auto ads chart</a>. Subaru, meanwhile, remains the most-seen brand in the ranking for the third week in a row: It's been increasing investment in ""<a href=""https://www.ispot.tv/share/2P3o"">Dog Tested: Soccer Practice</a>,"" spotlighting the Ascent, and ""<a href=""https://www.ispot.tv/share/11VD"">Crash Safety</a>,"" which highlights the evolution of safety features in the Forester model. </p><ul><li>Combined, the Subaru ads had over 359 million national TV ad impressions. </li><li>Ram Trucks takes third place with a spot that racked up 185.6 million national TV ad impressions. According to <a href=""https://www.ispot.tv/products/creative-testing"">iSpot's Creative Assessment</a>, 15% of surveyed viewers considered the music, a song by country singer Lainey Wilson, the single best thing about the ad.</li><li>Chevrolet's ""Big Life"" took fifth place (171.7 million TV ad impressions) and was the only spot on the ranking that aired during NHL games.</li></ul><!--kg-card-begin: html-->                    <div style=""position:relative; width:100%; padding-top:56.25%; padding-bottom:40px;""><iframe src=""https://www.ispot.tv/share/1w8v"" style=""position:absolute; top:0; right:0; left:0; bottom:0; width:100%; height:100%;"" frameborder=""0"" scrolling=""no"" allowfullscreen=""""></iframe></div>
                    <!--kg-card-end: html-->",644bc497cbd299003d6820cc,"From April 17-23, a Dodge commercial for its new Hornet model generated 191.6 million national TV ad impressions, putting it at the top of iSpot.tv's most-seen auto ads chart. Subaru, meanwhile, remains the most-seen brand in the ranking for the third week in a row: It's been increasing investment in ""Dog Tested: Soccer Practice,"" spotlighting the Ascent, and ""Crash Safety,"" which highlights the evolution of safety features in the Forester model.

 * Combined, the Subaru ads had over 359 million national TV ad impressions.
 * Ram Trucks takes third place with a spot that racked up 185.6 million national TV ad impressions. According to iSpot's Creative Assessment, 15% of surveyed viewers considered the music, a song by country singer Lainey Wilson, the single best thing about the ad.
 * Chevrolet's ""Big Life"" took fifth place (171.7 million TV ad impressions) and was the only spot on the ranking that aired during NHL games.
",https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1596044021783-8f4b592565ed?crop=entropy&cs=tinysrgb&fit=max&fm=jpg&ixid=MnwxMTc3M3wwfDF8c2VhcmNofDl8fGRvZGdlfGVufDB8fHx8MTY4MjY4NzcxMg&ixlib=rb-4.0.3&q=80&w=2000,0,post,published,,public,all,2023-04-28T13:05:27.000Z,2023-04-28T13:17:16.000Z,2023-04-28T13:17:16.000Z,"Yet once again, Subaru is the brand with the highest total combined TV ad impressions in iSpot.tv's top-five ranking.",,,,,,1,644c07b2cbd299003d682109,6a77ac6a-1550-44de-b228-d4fbe7301fdc,NFL Draft Is TV Audience's First Pick In Primetime,nfl-draft-audiences-first-pick-tv-primetime-inscape,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[],""cards"":[],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""https://frontofficesports.com/newsletter/how-the-nfl-draft-took-over-tv/""]],[""a"",[""href"",""http://inscape.tv""]]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""The NFL Draft, an unwanted TV property many years ago, is now ""],[0,[0],1,""one of the biggest events of the year""],[0,[],0,"" from a viewership standpoint. And the 2023 edition has been no different, at least through the first round.""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""According to ""],[0,[1],1,""Inscape""],[0,[],0,"" data:""]]],[3,""ul"",[[[0,[],0,""The 2023 NFL Draft was the No. 1 program: 8.11% of April 27 linear TV watch-time""]],[[0,[],0,""Including pre-draft shows, NFL Draft programming accounted for 9.66% of minutes watched""]],[[0,[],0,""In primetime, the NFL Draft had 20.74% of watch-time (5.5x the next program); NFL Draft Countdown was No. 8, with 1.57% of primetime minutes watched""]],[[0,[],0,""The first round of this year’s NFL Draft is up considerably vs. last year in terms of share of minutes watched – the event had 17.25% of primetime watch-time on day one last year, and 6.63% of watch-time for the day""]]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Granted, last year's first round was also up against three elimination games in the NBA Playoffs (which would've been the case this year if not for early exits). But the draft has become an event that dominates TV like few others can.""]]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>The NFL Draft, an unwanted TV property many years ago, is now <a href=""https://frontofficesports.com/newsletter/how-the-nfl-draft-took-over-tv/"">one of the biggest events of the year</a> from a viewership standpoint. And the 2023 edition has been no different, at least through the first round.</p><p>According to <a href=""http://inscape.tv"">Inscape</a> data:</p><ul><li>The 2023 NFL Draft was the No. 1 program: 8.11% of April 27 linear TV watch-time</li><li>Including pre-draft shows, NFL Draft programming accounted for 9.66% of minutes watched</li><li>In primetime, the NFL Draft had 20.74% of watch-time (5.5x the next program); NFL Draft Countdown was No. 8, with 1.57% of primetime minutes watched</li><li>The first round of this year’s NFL Draft is up considerably vs. last year in terms of share of minutes watched – the event had 17.25% of primetime watch-time on day one last year, and 6.63% of watch-time for the day</li></ul><p>Granted, last year's first round was also up against three elimination games in the NBA Playoffs (which would've been the case this year if not for early exits). But the draft has become an event that dominates TV like few others can.</p>",644c07b2cbd299003d682109,"The NFL Draft, an unwanted TV property many years ago, is now one of the biggest events of the year from a viewership standpoint. And the 2023 edition has been no different, at least through the first round.

According to Inscape data:

 * The 2023 NFL Draft was the No. 1 program: 8.11% of April 27 linear TV watch-time
 * Including pre-draft shows, NFL Draft programming accounted for 9.66% of minutes watched
 * In primetime, the NFL Draft had 20.74% of watch-time (5.5x the next program); NFL Draft Countdown was No. 8, with 1.57% of primetime minutes watched
 * The first round of this year’s NFL Draft is up considerably vs. last year in terms of share of minutes watched – the event had 17.25% of primetime watch-time on day one last year, and 6.63% of watch-time for the day

Granted, last year's first round was also up against three elimination games in the NBA Playoffs (which would've been the case this year if not for early exits). But the draft has become an event that dominates TV like few others can.",https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1512145751010-9a6970a44079?crop=entropy&cs=tinysrgb&fit=max&fm=jpg&ixid=MnwxMTc3M3wwfDF8c2VhcmNofDEzfHxuZmwlMjBmYW5zfGVufDB8fHx8MTY4MjcwNDYzOQ&ixlib=rb-4.0.3&q=80&w=2000,0,post,published,,public,all,2023-04-28T17:51:46.000Z,2023-04-28T17:58:50.000Z,2023-04-28T17:58:50.000Z,,,,,,,1,6451272c6a102d00010b0227,477b473f-d981-4641-b3b9-6772cac2763e,"NBA Playoffs, NFL Draft Lead for TV Watch-Time",nba-playoffs-nfl-draft-lead-for-tv-watch-time,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[],""cards"":[[""image"",{""src"":""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/05/InscapeTopShowsApr24-30.png"",""width"":1018,""height"":1219}]],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""inscape.tv""]],[""em""],[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.tvrev.com/news/nba-playoffs-nfl-draft-lead-for-tv-watch-timenbsp""]]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Yet again the NBA dominates ""],[0,[0],1,""Inscape's""],[0,[],0,"" ranking of most-watched programming on TV, capturing 4.50% viewership share from April 24-30 — a slight decline from the previous week's 5.53%. Meanwhile, the NFL draft accounted for 2.71% of minutes watched, putting it in second place. </p><p>Some additional insights about the recent top programs and networks on TV: </p><ul><li><em>Inside the NBA</em> saw the biggest week-over-week ranking increase, jumping to No. 22 from No. 38 previously, with 0.42% of minutes watched.</li><li>Other program ranking newcomers include <em>Law &amp; Order</em> (No. 17), <em>The Golden Girls</em> (No. 24) and <em>NBC Nightly News With Lester Holt</em> (No. 25).</li><li>Looking at the network ranking, ABC increased its viewership share to 7.49% from 7.34% previously, and remains in first place.</li><li>While CBS and NBC retain their second- and third-place positions, respectively, both slightly increased watch-time: CBS accounted for 6.75% of minutes watched, up from 6.73% previously, while NBC had 6.08%, up from 5.73%.</li></ul><p><a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/nba-playoffs-nfl-draft-lead-for-tv-watch-timenbsp"">Get more insights and see the full rankings at TVREV.com. </a></p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/05/InscapeTopShowsApr24-30.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1018"" height=""1219"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/05/InscapeTopShowsApr24-30.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/05/InscapeTopShowsApr24-30.png 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/05/InscapeTopShowsApr24-30.png 1018w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></figure>",6451272c6a102d00010b0227,"Yet again the NBA dominates Inscape's ranking of most-watched programming on TV, capturing 4.50% viewership share from April 24-30 — a slight decline from the previous week's 5.53%. Some additional insights about the recent top programs and networks on TV:

 * Inside the NBA saw the biggest week-over-week ranking increase, jumping to No. 22 from No. 38 previously, with 0.42% of minutes watched.
 * Other program ranking newcomers include Law & Order (No. 17), The Golden Girls (No. 24) and NBC Nightly News With Lester Holt (No. 25).
 * Looking at the network ranking, ABC increased its viewership share to 7.49% from 7.34% previously, and remains in first place.
 * While CBS and NBC retain their second- and third-place positions, respectively, both slightly increased watch-time: CBS accounted for 6.75% of minutes watched, up from 6.73% previously, while NBC had 6.08%, up from 5.73%.

""]]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>Skyrizi, an AbbVie immunology drug, was the No. 1 prescription pharmaceutical brand when it came to estimated national TV ad spend in April, according to <a href=""https://www.fiercepharma.com/marketing/abbvies-skyrizi-aprils-biggest-drug-ad-spender-return-some-old-faces-top-10"">iSpot.tv data shared with FiercePharma</a>. It spent about $29.8 million on TV ads, a slight decrease from March's outlay of $30.5 million. </p><p>Some additional insights around TV ads for the top pharma brands in April: </p><ul><li>In total, the top ten brands spent an estimated $177.3 million, about the same amount as March's top ten brands.</li><li>Rinvoq, which was the top-spending Rx brand in March, took second place in April with an estimated national TV ad spend of $28.6 million, down from its March outlay of $32.4 million. </li><li>Brands that did not make the top ten in March but did in February include Trelegy, Vraylar, Rybelsus and Ocrevus. </li></ul><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/05/ispotapr2023pharma.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""829"" height=""494"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/05/ispotapr2023pharma.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/05/ispotapr2023pharma.png 829w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></figure>",6453d4c4ac3c330001856f42,"Skyrizi, an AbbVie immunology drug, was the No. 1 prescription pharmaceutical brand when it came to estimated national TV ad spend in April, according to iSpot.tv data shared with FiercePharma. It spent about $29.8 million on TV ads, a slight decrease from March's outlay of $30.5 million.

Some additional insights around TV ads for the top pharma brands in April:

 * In total, the top ten brands spent an estimated $177.3 million, about the same amount as March's top ten brands.
 * Rinvoq, which was the top-spending Rx brand in March, took second place in April with an estimated national TV ad spend of $28.6 million, down from its March outlay of $32.4 million.

                    <!--kg-card-end: html-->",6454ffb8b851ab00015f8adc,"According to iSpot.tv data recently shared with Wards Auto, Mercedes-Benz owns the most-seen auto ad for April 24-30. Its ""Intense Thrills"" spot promoting electric vehicles generated 269.2 million national TV ad impressions off an estimated spend of $2.5 million — nearly $1 million more than any of the other four ads on the ranking.

 * Dodge increased its investment in ""Swarming the Nation"" by 48% week-over-week, leading to a 7% increase in impressions and putting it in second place.
 * A Chevrolet Colorado spot lands at No. 3 with 178.5 million TV ad impressions. It was the only spot on the ranking that didn't air during the 2023 NFL draft.
 * ""To Be a Ram: Have Heart"" takes fourth place, and per iSpot's Creative Assessment data, it had an 89% brand match (the percentage of survey respondents who remembered it was a Ram Trucks ad after watching it), above the recent automaker industry norm of 78%.

News programming including coverage of King Charles III’s coronation, the Kentucky Derby and USFL games contributed to its watch-time.""]]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[2],1,""Get more insights and see the full rankings at TVREV.com.""],[0,[],0,"" ""]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[[1,[],0,0]]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>Viewership data from <a href=""inscape.tv"">Inscape</a> reveals that the first week of May was a big one for sports, with various leagues and related programming snagging seven of the top 25 spots on the show ranking. NBA playoff action continues to be a slam dunk, with games accounting for 5.07% of all minutes watched during the week, an increase from the previous week’s 4.50%.</p><p>Some additional insights about the recent top programs and networks on TV: </p><ul><li>NHL moves into second place with 1.17% of watch-time, while MLB steals fourth, up from No. 13 previously, with 0.88% viewership share.</li><li>The 149th Kentucky Derby raced into sixth place with 0.81% of minutes watched<a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/nba-playoffs-top-mages-kentucky-derby-win"">,</a> while USFL games captured 0.41% of watch-time, putting it in the ranking for the first time this season. </li><li>Notably, the network ranking did not see drastic change: 13 networks retained their positions week-over-week — although that doesn’t mean the watch-time remained the same. ABC, which held steady in first place, accounted for 7.45% of all minutes watched, a slight decrease from the previous week’s 7.49%.</li><li>NBC moves into second place with 7.12% viewership share, an increase from 6.08% last week. News programming including coverage of King Charles III’s coronation, the Kentucky Derby and USFL games contributed to its watch-time.</li></ul><p><a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/nhl-skates-into-second-for-tv-watch-timenbsp"">Get more insights and see the full rankings at TVREV.com.</a> </p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/05/InscapeTopShowsMay1-7.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1018"" height=""1219"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/05/InscapeTopShowsMay1-7.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/05/InscapeTopShowsMay1-7.png 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/05/InscapeTopShowsMay1-7.png 1018w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></figure>",645a577f2adb3f00019073ee,"Viewership data from Inscape reveals that the first week of May was a big one for sports, with various leagues and related programming snagging seven of the top 25 spots on the show ranking. NBA playoff action continues to be a slam dunk, with games accounting for 5.07% of all minutes watched during the week, an increase from the previous week’s 4.50%.

Some additional insights about the recent top programs and networks on TV:

 * NHL moves into second place with 1.17% of watch-time, while MLB steals fourth, up from No. 13 previously, with 0.88% viewership share.
 * The 149th Kentucky Derby raced into sixth place with 0.81% of minutes watched, while USFL games captured 0.41% of watch-time, putting it in the ranking for the first time this season.
 * Notably, the network ranking did not see drastic change: 13 networks retained their positions week-over-week — although that doesn’t mean the watch-time remained the same. ABC, which held steady in first place, accounted for 7.45% of all minutes watched, a slight decrease from the previous week’s 7.49%.
 * NBC moves into second place with 7.12% viewership share, an increase from 6.08% last week. News programming including coverage of King Charles III’s coronation, the Kentucky Derby and USFL games contributed to its watch-time.

Get more insights and see the full rankings at TVREV.com.",https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1576584520374-c55375496eac?crop=entropy&cs=tinysrgb&fit=max&fm=jpg&ixid=MnwxMTc3M3wwfDF8c2VhcmNofDJ8fG5obHxlbnwwfHx8fDE2ODM1OTIzODc&ixlib=rb-4.0.3&q=80&w=2000,0,post,published,,public,all,2023-05-09T14:23:59.000Z,2023-05-09T14:33:14.000Z,2023-05-09T14:33:14.000Z,Inscape data for May 1-7 reveals that viewers were favoring sports programming.  ,,,,,,1,645a9c53bb5e760001d25779,00dab7f9-6c8b-413c-a084-edd1d9d66a4e,Panda Express Breaks Through With Top TV Ad In Early 2023,panda-express-breaks-through-ispot-video-award,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[],""cards"":[[""image"",{""src"":""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/05/Screen-Shot-2023-05-09-at-12.17.33-PM.png"",""width"":1086,""height"":408}]],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.ispot.tv/ad/1Av7/panda-express-sizzling-shrimp-fire-kissed""]]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""iSpot's recent video ad spotlight report recapping the first four months of 2023 honored 25 commercials across a variety of industries, from quick-serve restaurants, to automotive brands, insurance and more. Beverage Brands</a>, <a href=""creatoriq.com"">CreatorIQ</a> — TikTok's first official SaaS Creator Marketing partner — examines how Cheetos, OLIPOP and Chobani are motivating creators to endorse their products on TikTok, and measures the outcomes of specific campaigns. </p><p>Here are a few highlights, and you can <a href=""https://www.creatoriq.com/white-papers/tiktok-influencer-marketing-guide-food-and-beverage-brands"">download the full report here</a>.</p><p><strong>Cheetos uses fun food challenge to spur creator-led content</strong></p><ul><li>To market their new spicy flavor, Cheetos started a social campaign #CheetosReaperReactions to get food lovers to film their rapid reactions</li><li>The hashtag became the leading tag for the brand on TikTok and generated $38.6 million earned media value (EMV). </li></ul><p><strong>OLIPOP gives creator partners artistic freedom to improve authenticity</strong></p><ul><li>OLIPOP worked with CreatorIQ to identify and curate creators for their next partnership campaign via creator information and custom questionnaires, and matched creators to specific campaign goals. Identifying the right targets and allowing them to go off script gave way to big payoffs.</li><li>#OLIPOPPartner hashtags dramatically outperformed those tagged with the secondary campaign term, #OLIPOP.</li><li>The TikTok campaign generated $25.4M EM (that’s 62% of the brand’s total EMV and 1.8K% more than last year)</li></ul><p><strong>Chobani mobilizes creators via competitive cross-platform campaign</strong></p><ul><li>Chobani worked with Roblox to create “Chobani Oatmilk Cosmic Race” — a race in Roblox universe that took players across the virtual galaxy delivering Chobani Oatmilk to various planets</li><li>Players took the experience from Roblox to TikTok for post-game content with the hashtag #CatchChobaniOatmilk.</li><li>As a result of the campaign, Chobani accrued $33.2M EMV, a 278% YoY improvement, and doubled its creator community (which contributed to a 75% YoY increase in post volume).</li></ul><p><em>*Source: TikTok</em></p>",645bae13bb5e760001d257e4,"With over 1 billion monthly active users — 90% of whom visit every day* — TikTok has become a critical space for brands looking to connect with consumers throughout their purchase journey.  Creator-led marketing on the platform has opened a new frontier for brands to expand awareness, build revenue and engage more effectively with customers.

In the new report TikTok Marketing Best Practices For Food & Beverage Brands, CreatorIQ — TikTok's first official SaaS Creator Marketing partner — examines how Cheetos, OLIPOP and Chobani are motivating creators to endorse their products on TikTok, and measures the outcomes of specific campaigns.

Here are a few highlights, and you can download the full report here.

Cheetos uses fun food challenge to spur creator-led content

 * To market their new spicy flavor, Cheetos started a social campaign #CheetosReaperReactions to get food lovers to film their rapid reactions
 * The hashtag became the leading tag for the brand on TikTok and generated $38.6 million earned media value (EMV).

OLIPOP gives creator partners artistic freedom to improve authenticity

 * OLIPOP worked with CreatorIQ to identify and curate creators for their next partnership campaign via creator information and custom questionnaires, and matched creators to specific campaign goals. Identifying the right targets and allowing them to go off script gave way to big payoffs.
 * #OLIPOPPartner hashtags dramatically outperformed those tagged with the secondary campaign term, #OLIPOP.
 * The TikTok campaign generated $25.4M EM (that’s 62% of the brand’s total EMV and 1.8K% more than last year)

Chobani mobilizes creators via competitive cross-platform campaign

 * Chobani worked with Roblox to create “Chobani Oatmilk Cosmic Race” — a race in Roblox universe that took players across the virtual galaxy delivering Chobani Oatmilk to various planets
 * Players took the experience from Roblox to TikTok for post-game content with the hashtag #CatchChobaniOatmilk.
 * As a result of the campaign, Chobani accrued $33.2M EMV, a 278% YoY improvement, and doubled its creator community (which contributed to a 75% YoY increase in post volume).

*Source: TikTok",__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/05/Cheetos.png,0,post,published,,public,all,2023-05-10T14:45:39.000Z,2023-05-10T15:12:45.000Z,2023-05-10T15:11:21.000Z,"New research from CreatorIQ reveals best practices that build awareness, revenue and affinity for food and beverage brands",,,,,,1,645e3b59bb5e760001d25852,4493aec6-4d4b-4435-adb9-51df883de445,Automakers Spent $200 Million on TV Ads in April,automakers-spent-200-million-on-tv-ads-in-april,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[],""cards"":[[""image"",{""src"":""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/05/vehicles-auto-makers_industry-overview_top-brands_04-01-2023_to_04-30-2023--1-.png"",""width"":1800,""height"":900,""caption"":""Via iSpot.tv""}]],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.mediapost.com/publications/article/385316/automotive-national-tv-spending-level-with-year-ag.html""]]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[0],1,""According to iSpot.tv data shared with MediaPost""],[0,[],0,"", automakers spent an estimated $200.8 million on national TV advertising during April, nearly a flat rate year-over-year (In April 2022 spend was about $200.8). TV ad impressions, however, were up 5.7% year-over-year, with auto ads receiving 26.4 billion impressions during the month.""]]],[3,""ul"",[[[0,[],0,""Brands leading for outlay included Nissan ($21.7 million), Kia ($17.1 million), Lexus ($17 million), Mercedes-Benz ($14.6 million) and Toyota ($13.8 million).""]],[[0,[],0,""Automakers leaned into sports programming, leveraging NBA, NHL and MLB in particular. TNT (5.42%) and NBC (4.45%).""]]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Get more insights in the ""],[0,[0],1,""MediaPost article""],[0,[],0,"". ""]]],[10,0]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p><a href=""https://www.mediapost.com/publications/article/385316/automotive-national-tv-spending-level-with-year-ag.html"">According to iSpot.tv data shared with MediaPost</a>, automakers spent an estimated $200.8 million on national TV advertising during April, nearly a flat rate year-over-year (In April 2022 spend was about $200.8). TV ad impressions, however, were up 5.7% year-over-year, with auto ads receiving 26.4 billion impressions during the month.</p><ul><li>Brands leading for outlay included Nissan ($21.7 million), Kia ($17.1 million), Lexus ($17 million), Mercedes-Benz ($14.6 million) and Toyota ($13.8 million).</li><li>Automakers leaned into sports programming, leveraging NBA, NHL and MLB in particular. </li><li>Dodge, Ram Trucks, Chevrolet and Subaru owned the most-seen ads. </li><li>Top networks for automakers by share of household TV ad impressions for the month were CBS (7.62%), ESPN (7.30%), ABC (6.23%). TNT (5.42%) and NBC (4.45%).</li></ul><p>Get more insights in the <a href=""https://www.mediapost.com/publications/article/385316/automotive-national-tv-spending-level-with-year-ag.html"">MediaPost article</a>. </p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card kg-card-hascaption""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/05/vehicles-auto-makers_industry-overview_top-brands_04-01-2023_to_04-30-2023--1-.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1800"" height=""900"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/05/vehicles-auto-makers_industry-overview_top-brands_04-01-2023_to_04-30-2023--1-.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/05/vehicles-auto-makers_industry-overview_top-brands_04-01-2023_to_04-30-2023--1-.png 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1600/2023/05/vehicles-auto-makers_industry-overview_top-brands_04-01-2023_to_04-30-2023--1-.png 1600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/05/vehicles-auto-makers_industry-overview_top-brands_04-01-2023_to_04-30-2023--1-.png 1800w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""><figcaption>Via iSpot.tv</figcaption></figure>",645e3b59bb5e760001d25852,"According to iSpot.tv data shared with MediaPost, automakers spent an estimated $200.8 million on national TV advertising during April, nearly a flat rate year-over-year (In April 2022 spend was about $200.8). TV ad impressions, however, were up 5.7% year-over-year, with auto ads receiving 26.4 billion impressions during the month.

 * Brands leading for outlay included Nissan ($21.7 million), Kia ($17.1 million), Lexus ($17 million), Mercedes-Benz ($14.6 million) and Toyota ($13.8 million).
 * Automakers leaned into sports programming, leveraging NBA, NHL and MLB in particular.
 * Dodge, Ram Trucks, Chevrolet and Subaru owned the most-seen ads.
 * Top networks for automakers by share of household TV ad impressions for the month were CBS (7.62%), ESPN (7.30%), ABC (6.23%). TNT (5.42%) and NBC (4.45%).

Get more insights in the MediaPost article.",https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1530675706010-bc677ce30ab6?crop=entropy&cs=tinysrgb&fit=max&fm=jpg&ixid=M3wxMTc3M3wwfDF8c2VhcmNofDR8fG5pc3NhbnxlbnwwfHx8fDE2ODM4OTc1Nzl8MA&ixlib=rb-4.0.3&q=80&w=2000,0,post,published,,public,all,2023-05-12T13:12:57.000Z,2023-05-12T13:21:14.000Z,2023-05-12T13:20:56.000Z,"Estimated outlay was flat year-over-year, but TV ad impressions increased by 5.7% compared to April 2022. ",,,,,,1,645e99bebb5e760001d25888,1dd81eb0-ff35-427e-98ab-2ce8317944ba,Scoring With Incremental Ad Reach,scoring-with-incremental-ad-reach-ispot-fubo-streaming,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[],""cards"":[[""image"",{""src"":""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/05/fubo-ispot-graphic--1--1.jpg"",""width"":1172,""height"":696}]],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.nexttv.com/news/fubo-working-with-ispot-to-measure-incremental-impressions""]],[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.tvrev.com/news/scoring-incremental-ad-reach-tv-fubo-ispot-streaming""]]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""A ""],[0,[0],1,""new announcement from Fubo""],[0,[],0,"" shows how much sports will remain an enormous part of ad decision-making, even as audiences migrate to streaming environments.""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Fubo is now partnering with iSpot to support connected TV measurement, quantifying ad impressions delivered to incremental households beyond linear TV (plus person-level estimates for co-viewing). Key there is the role iSpot will play identifying the incremental reach of Fubo programming. An iSpot study found that on average, 40% of ad impressions served on Fubo reached incremental households unreached on linear. [""],[0,[1],1,""Read more on TVREV""],[0,[],0,""]""]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>A <a href=""https://www.nexttv.com/news/fubo-working-with-ispot-to-measure-incremental-impressions"">new announcement from Fubo</a> shows how much sports will remain an enormous part of ad decision-making, even as audiences migrate to streaming environments.</p><p>Fubo is now partnering with iSpot to support connected TV measurement, quantifying ad impressions delivered to incremental households beyond linear TV (plus person-level estimates for co-viewing). Key there is the role iSpot will play identifying the incremental reach of Fubo programming. An iSpot study found that on average, 40% of ad impressions served on Fubo reached incremental households unreached on linear. [<a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/scoring-incremental-ad-reach-tv-fubo-ispot-streaming"">Read more on TVREV</a>]</p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/05/fubo-ispot-graphic--1--1.jpg"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1172"" height=""696"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/05/fubo-ispot-graphic--1--1.jpg 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/05/fubo-ispot-graphic--1--1.jpg 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/05/fubo-ispot-graphic--1--1.jpg 1172w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></figure>",645e99bebb5e760001d25888,"A new announcement from Fubo shows how much sports will remain an enormous part of ad decision-making, even as audiences migrate to streaming environments.

Fubo is now partnering with iSpot to support connected TV measurement, quantifying ad impressions delivered to incremental households beyond linear TV (plus person-level estimates for co-viewing). Key there is the role iSpot will play identifying the incremental reach of Fubo programming. An iSpot study found that on average, 40% of ad impressions served on Fubo reached incremental households unreached on linear. NHL, meanwhile, takes second place on the ranking for the second week in a row, but saw a slightly smaller viewership share compared to the previous week (1.12% vs. 1.17%).

Some additional insights about the recent top programs and networks on TV:  

 * Multiple news programs saw week-over-week ranking increases, including CBS Mornings, Fox and Friends, America’s Newsroom, CNN News Central, ABC World News Tonight With David Muir, America Reports and NBC Nightly News With Lester Holt. Of those, two are week-over-week ranking newcomers (America Reports and NBC Nightly News).
 * While it doesn’t make the top 25, the inaugural week of Jeopardy! Masters captured 0.38% of watch-time and is the No. 28 program for May 8-14.
 * On the network side of things, ABC remains in first place with its 7.08% viewership share fueled in part by NBA games, Jeopardy! Masters and American Idol.
 * The networks in the No. 4-10 positions retain their ranking positions, but each of them saw a larger viewership share week-over-week. TNT had the biggest increase, up to 4.13% from 3.78% previously, thanks primarily to NBA games.

                    <!--kg-card-end: html-->",646772ddab5a24000158eddc,"A heartfelt spot from Ram Trucks received 269.5 million national TV ad impressions, putting it in first place on iSpot.tv's most-seen auto ads ranking for May 8-14, according to data shared with WardsAuto.  * A Dodge ad for the new Hornet took second place with 217.5 million national TV ad impressions and, per iSpot's Creative Assessment, 31% of surveyed viewers considered the best thing about the commercial to be the visuals.
 * Chevrolet and Infinity take third and fourth place, respectively, with about 190 million national TV ad impressions each.
 * Sports commentary programming was a key driver of the 150.6 million impressions that Lexus's fifth-place spot received.

One of the findings, shared with TVREV in advance: The NFL still owns primetime on the Big 4 nets – with 18.58% of household TV ad impressions. ""],[0,[1],1,""The Voice""],[0,[],0,"", however, was a big mover, growing from 2.75% to 4.26% year-over-year due in part to schedule tweaks.""]]],[3,""ul"",[[[0,[],0,""Live sporting events staying relatively static or growing underlines just how important that programming has become to all networks, including broadcast giants ABC, CBS, Fox and NBC.""]],[[0,[],0,""Broadcast may be able to stay tied to sports, but how long can cable do so? One of the findings, shared with TVREV in advance: The NFL still owns primetime on the Big 4 nets – with 18.58% of household TV ad impressions. <em>The Voice</em>, however, was a big mover, growing from 2.75% to 4.26% year-over-year due in part to schedule tweaks.</p><ul><li>Live sporting events staying relatively static or growing underlines just how important that programming has become to all networks, including broadcast giants ABC, CBS, Fox and NBC.</li><li>Broadcast may be able to stay tied to sports, but how long can cable do so? ESPN's plans to <a href=""https://www.wsj.com/articles/espn-lays-plans-to-stream-flagship-channel-eyeing-cable-tvs-demise-ad0fb727"">take the flagship network direct-to-consumers</a> via streaming could spell doom for cable (and newfound freedom for Disney).</li></ul><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><a href=""http://ispot.tv""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/05/tv-ad-season-primetime-big-4.jpg"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1402"" height=""787"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/05/tv-ad-season-primetime-big-4.jpg 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/05/tv-ad-season-primetime-big-4.jpg 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/05/tv-ad-season-primetime-big-4.jpg 1402w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></a></figure>",6467fd28ab5a24000158ee1a,"iSpot’s upcoming TV season ad recap dives into some of the industry’s biggest narratives from September through early May, including in-depth looks at specific dayparts and networks. One of the findings, shared with TVREV in advance: The NFL still owns primetime on the Big 4 nets – with 18.58% of household TV ad impressions.  * Live sporting events staying relatively static or growing underlines just how important that programming has become to all networks, including broadcast giants ABC, CBS, Fox and NBC.
 * Broadcast may be able to stay tied to sports, but how long can cable do so? That puts it among the top 44% of songs on Spotify.""]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Interestingly, the track has not been used in any movie, TV show or video game in the last 15 years, according to data from Songtradr, meaning the sudden spike in popularity is largely driven by the exposure created by Amazon’s ad.""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""The unique audio selection also gives Amazon an opportunity to create brand affinity all its own with the track – something that could pay big dividends based on the song’s growing popularity on Spotify.""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""The song scores highly for characteristics like valence (87%), danceability (82%) and energy (39%), which indicates the perception Amazon is aiming to generate with this spot – and perhaps others.""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Previous Amazon spots have also chosen upbeat and danceable music. A Whole Foods spot utilized the Du-Ettes’ “""],[0,[3],1,""Every Beat of My Heart""],[0,[],0,""” while Amazon’s Super Bowl ad this year deployed Nancy Adams’s “""],[0,[4],1,""Love""],[0,[],0,"",” Both present similar energy in the backdrop of grocery images. In its Medusa-themed ad from late 2021, Amazon deployed Nicki Minaj’s “""],[0,[5],1,""Chun-Li""],[0,[],0,"",” scoring 76% for danceability, 74% for energy and 47% for valence.""]]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>Amazon’s recent TV ad “<a href=""https://www.ispot.tv/ad/1oku/amazon-prime-tache-song-by-queen"">Tache</a>” has breathed new life into a deep-cut track from Queen called “<a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kToCuYfkGI4"">Cool Cat</a>” according to data from <a href=""http://songtradr.com/"">Songtradr</a>, boosting its Spotify popularity score by over 33%.</p><p>Since the ad first aired on March 13, Songtradr data shows the track’s popularity score rose from 42, to its current score of 56. That puts it among the top 44% of songs on Spotify.</p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><a href=""http://songtradr.com""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/05/Screen-Shot-2023-05-22-at-10.14.24-AM.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1568"" height=""650"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/05/Screen-Shot-2023-05-22-at-10.14.24-AM.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/05/Screen-Shot-2023-05-22-at-10.14.24-AM.png 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/05/Screen-Shot-2023-05-22-at-10.14.24-AM.png 1568w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></a></figure><p>Interestingly, the track has not been used in any movie, TV show or video game in the last 15 years, according to data from Songtradr, meaning the sudden spike in popularity is largely driven by the exposure created by Amazon’s ad.</p><p>The unique audio selection also gives Amazon an opportunity to create brand affinity all its own with the track – something that could pay big dividends based on the song’s growing popularity on Spotify.</p><p>The song scores highly for characteristics like valence (87%), danceability (82%) and energy (39%), which indicates the perception Amazon is aiming to generate with this spot – and perhaps others.</p><p>Previous Amazon spots have also chosen upbeat and danceable music. A Whole Foods spot utilized the Du-Ettes’ “<a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jCu82W6UZJY"">Every Beat of My Heart</a>” while Amazon’s Super Bowl ad this year deployed Nancy Adams’s “<a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=I9K9qzdbhNM"">Love</a>,” Both present similar energy in the backdrop of grocery images. In its Medusa-themed ad from late 2021, Amazon deployed Nicki Minaj’s “<a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wpm07-BGJnE"">Chun-Li</a>,” scoring 76% for danceability, 74% for energy and 47% for valence.</p>",646ba224ab5a24000158ee4e,"Amazon’s recent TV ad “Tache” has breathed new life into a deep-cut track from Queen called “Cool Cat” according to data from Songtradr, boosting its Spotify popularity score by over 33%.

Since the ad first aired on March 13, Songtradr data shows the track’s popularity score rose from 42, to its current score of 56. That puts it among the top 44% of songs on Spotify.

Interestingly, the track has not been used in any movie, TV show or video game in the last 15 years, according to data from Songtradr, meaning the sudden spike in popularity is largely driven by the exposure created by Amazon’s ad.

The unique audio selection also gives Amazon an opportunity to create brand affinity all its own with the track – something that could pay big dividends based on the song’s growing popularity on Spotify.

The song scores highly for characteristics like valence (87%), danceability (82%) and energy (39%), which indicates the perception Amazon is aiming to generate with this spot – and perhaps others.

Previous Amazon spots have also chosen upbeat and danceable music. A Whole Foods spot utilized the Du-Ettes’ “Every Beat of My Heart” while Amazon’s Super Bowl ad this year deployed Nancy Adams’s “Love,” Both present similar energy in the backdrop of grocery images. In its Medusa-themed ad from late 2021, Amazon deployed Nicki Minaj’s “Chun-Li,” scoring 76% for danceability, 74% for energy and 47% for valence.",https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1562583078-6a59243d5b2e?crop=entropy&cs=tinysrgb&fit=max&fm=jpg&ixid=M3wxMTc3M3wwfDF8c2VhcmNofDF8fGZyZWRkaWUlMjBtZXJjdXJ5fGVufDB8fHx8MTY4NDc3NTY4N3ww&ixlib=rb-4.0.3&q=80&w=2000,0,post,published,,public,all,2023-05-22T17:11:00.000Z,2023-05-22T17:29:48.000Z,2023-05-22T17:29:48.000Z,,,,,,,1,646cd75caf2abd00017f63a2,01f0c20c-bc8c-4f9c-8ac4-d7e164559ae7,College Softball Comes Out of Left Field: TV By the Numbers,college-softball-comes-out-of-left-field-tv-by-the-numbers,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[],""cards"":[[""image"",{""src"":""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/05/InscapeTopShowsMay15-21.png"",""width"":1018,""height"":1219}]],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""inscape.tv""]],[""em""],[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.tvrev.com/news/college-softball-comes-out-of-left-field-tv-by-the-numbers""]]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""While NBA and the 2023 PGA Championship took top spots for TV watch-time last week, college softball jumped into the ranking at No. 10, per ""],[0,[0],1,""Inscape""],[0,[],0,"" data, with 0.64% of all live, linear minutes watched. Some additional insights about the recent top programs and networks on TV:

 * People are still tuning into NBA playoff action, but watch-time was down during a week that saw the Celtics stumble against the Heat, while the Lakers succumbed to the Nuggets. In total, games captured 3.35% of watch-time, down from 5.42% previously.

 * On the network side of things, CBS beats out ABC for first place with 7.86% of minutes watched, driven in part by the 2023 PGA Championship.
 * Oxygen was the sole week-over-week network ranking newcomer, moving from No. 27 to No. 25 with 0.93% of minutes watched. Dateline: Secrets Uncovered and Snapped were its two top programs.

",,,,,,1,646e0bdbaf2abd00017f63d2,defb7080-bd8f-40bf-b905-6263d07c46f0,Inscape Launches Commercial Feed+ With New Streaming Data,inscape-launches-commercial-feed-with-new-streaming-data,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[],""cards"":[[""image"",{""src"":""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/05/InscapeCommercialFeed.png"",""width"":1999,""height"":818,""caption"":""Via Inscape""}]],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.adweek.com/adweek-wire/inscape-elevates-acr-measurement-by-adding-new-streaming-data-with-commercial-feed/""]],[""em""],[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.inscape.tv/resources/solutions/2023/commercial-feed-plus""]]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Understanding ad effectiveness and the impact of TV commercial exposures is a critical part of audience planning and measurement, but historically viewing data has been fragmented and visibility into streaming environments limited. Inscape wants to change that with ""],[0,[0],1,""the launch of Commercial Feed+""],[0,[],0,"", an enhanced dataset that places an emphasis on streaming. ""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Commercial Feed+, which is built on Inscape’s Emmy® award-winning automatic content recognition (ACR) technology, leverages additional sources of ad creatives and layers in ad detections ""],[0,[1],1,""beyond""],[0,[],0,"" ACR, which increases commercial exposure visibility across multiple viewing sources including linear and streaming. ""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""All of that, the company says, will help drive more accurate planning and measurement decisions for clients. Commercial Feed+ will also deduplicate TV commercial data, making for easier integration across partners’ internal systems and tools. ""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""An analysis of increased streaming coverage delivered by the Commercial Feed+ found increases in ad impressions and ad hours, and more unique commercial exposures.""]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""You can ""],[0,[2],1,""learn more about Commercial Feed+ here""],[0,[],0,"". ""]]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>Understanding ad effectiveness and the impact of TV commercial exposures is a critical part of audience planning and measurement, but historically viewing data has been fragmented and visibility into streaming environments limited. Inscape wants to change that with <a href=""https://www.adweek.com/adweek-wire/inscape-elevates-acr-measurement-by-adding-new-streaming-data-with-commercial-feed/"">the launch of Commercial Feed+</a>, an enhanced dataset that places an emphasis on streaming. </p><p>Commercial Feed+, which is built on Inscape’s Emmy® award-winning automatic content recognition (ACR) technology, leverages additional sources of ad creatives and layers in ad detections <em>beyond</em> ACR, which increases commercial exposure visibility across multiple viewing sources including linear and streaming. </p><p>All of that, the company says, will help drive more accurate planning and measurement decisions for clients. Commercial Feed+ will also deduplicate TV commercial data, making for easier integration across partners’ internal systems and tools. </p><p>An analysis of increased streaming coverage delivered by the Commercial Feed+ found increases in ad impressions and ad hours, and more unique commercial exposures.</p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card kg-card-hascaption""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/05/InscapeCommercialFeed.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1999"" height=""818"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/05/InscapeCommercialFeed.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/05/InscapeCommercialFeed.png 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1600/2023/05/InscapeCommercialFeed.png 1600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/05/InscapeCommercialFeed.png 1999w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""><figcaption>Via Inscape</figcaption></figure><p>You can <a href=""https://www.inscape.tv/resources/solutions/2023/commercial-feed-plus"">learn more about Commercial Feed+ here</a>. </p>",646e0bdbaf2abd00017f63d2,"Understanding ad effectiveness and the impact of TV commercial exposures is a critical part of audience planning and measurement, but historically viewing data has been fragmented and visibility into streaming environments limited. Inscape wants to change that with the launch of Commercial Feed+, an enhanced dataset that places an emphasis on streaming.

Commercial Feed+, which is built on Inscape’s Emmy® award-winning automatic content recognition (ACR) technology, leverages additional sources of ad creatives and layers in ad detections beyond ACR, which increases commercial exposure visibility across multiple viewing sources including linear and streaming.

All of that, the company says, will help drive more accurate planning and measurement decisions for clients. Commercial Feed+ will also deduplicate TV commercial data, making for easier integration across partners’ internal systems and tools.

An analysis of increased streaming coverage delivered by the Commercial Feed+ found increases in ad impressions and ad hours, and more unique commercial exposures.

You can learn more about Commercial Feed+ here.",__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/05/InscapeCommercialFeed2.png,0,post,published,,public,all,2023-05-24T13:06:35.000Z,2023-05-25T21:01:08.000Z,2023-05-25T21:01:08.000Z,The holistic dataset is part of Inscape’s overarching strategy to modernize TV viewing data.,,,,,,1,646e8a00af2abd00017f63f5,3b8e3827-4b3c-4ca3-9cde-31cfa3f991f9,Cocomelon’s Steady Ascent,cocomelons-steady-ascent-tubular-youtube-data,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[],""cards"":[[""image"",{""src"":""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/05/Cocomelon.jpg"",""width"":1402,""height"":787,""href"":""http://tubularlabs.com""}]],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""http://tubularlabs.com""]]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""It’s tough to believe that kids content giant Cocomelon can still grow its pool of unique viewers on social video, yet that’s exactly what it’s been doing for the past year, according to data from ""],[0,[0],1,""Tubular Labs""],[0,[],0,"". As <a href=""https://twitter.com/RiverAveBlues/status/1660291354314911749"">one account pointed out on Twitter</a> this week, you’d need FOUR different subscriptions – Peacock, Amazon, YES Network and Apple TV+ – to watch the New York Yankees over a seven-day stretch. That's unsustainable, obviously. Especially when looking at consumer behaviors...</p><p>Take, for instance, the <a href=""https://www.forbes.com/home-improvement/internet/streaming-survey/"">chart below from Forbes earlier this year</a>. About 80% of consumers subscribe to fewer than four streaming services, but you’ll need at least four to watch most teams. So are consumer behaviors going to change when we’ve already seen subscription numbers plateau? Or could we see consumers either drop teams/leagues altogether? [<a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/sports-cutting-themselves-tv-pieces-rights-streaming"">READ MORE AT TVREV</a>]</p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/05/86-pay-for-more-than-one-streaming-subscription.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1220"" height=""922"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/05/86-pay-for-more-than-one-streaming-subscription.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/05/86-pay-for-more-than-one-streaming-subscription.png 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/05/86-pay-for-more-than-one-streaming-subscription.png 1220w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></figure>",646fd9b4af2abd00017f6412,"For all of the good streaming has done for the proliferation of content overall, that proliferation has also led to significant fracturing. [""],[0,[1],1,""READ MORE AT TVREV""],[0,[],0,""]""]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>Warner Bros. Discovery has had a busy few weeks.</p><p>Last week the company debuted WBD Stream, a digital video ad product that will give advertisers access to content across its portfolio, as well as a number of ad options for Max and Discovery+. This week, the company <a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/wir20230414"">launched Max, its rebrand of HBO Max</a>.</p><p>With that in mind, we thought we’d take a look at how WBD networks are performing.</p><p>WBD networks accounted for 12 of the top 50 networks (24%) ranked by watch-time from Jan. 1, 2023 through May 14, 2023. That’s more than any other parent company, according to data from Inscape, the currency-grade smart TV ACR data provider and data technology division of Vizio.</p><p>On the ad front, Warner Bros. Discovery-owned networks delivered 19.6% of the total household TV ad impressions for Jan. 1 - May 14, 2023, per iSpot.tv. [<a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/wbd-owned-networks-account-for-nearly-of-top-50-nets"">READ MORE AT TVREV</a>]</p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/05/wbd-nets-ispot-sov-1.jpg"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1321"" height=""787"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/05/wbd-nets-ispot-sov-1.jpg 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/05/wbd-nets-ispot-sov-1.jpg 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/05/wbd-nets-ispot-sov-1.jpg 1321w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></figure>",64710f25af2abd00017f6435,"Warner Bros. Discovery has had a busy few weeks.

Last week the company debuted WBD Stream, a digital video ad product that will give advertisers access to content across its portfolio, as well as a number of ad options for Max and Discovery+. This week, the company launched Max, its rebrand of HBO Max.

With that in mind, we thought we’d take a look at how WBD networks are performing.

WBD networks accounted for 12 of the top 50 networks (24%) ranked by watch-time from Jan. 1, 2023 through May 14, 2023. That’s more than any other parent company, according to data from Inscape, the currency-grade smart TV ACR data provider and data technology division of Vizio.

On the ad front, Warner Bros. Discovery-owned networks delivered 19.6% of the total household TV ad impressions for Jan. 1 - May 14, 2023, per iSpot.tv. Some additional insights about the top programs and networks on TV for May 22-28:

 * Thanks to a weekend marathon on Paramount Network, Yellowstone jumps into the top ten with 0.71% of all live, linear minutes watched.
 * The three-episode season finale of The Voice, which was spread across two days, propelled the show into eleventh place with 0.67% of watch-time.
 * There’s a notable amount of stability in the network chart week-over-week, with 17 of the 25 networks maintaining ranking positions. That being said, there is movement within the top three: NBC snags first place with 6.92% of watch-time, driven in part by The Voice and the 2023 Indianapolis 500.
 * Although the networks in positions 7-18 don’t shift in the chart, all but ION saw slight increases in watch-time compared to the previous week, with TNT seeing the largest increase due in part to NBA games and NCIS: New Orleans reruns.

 * With 200.2 million TV ad impressions, Dodge takes second place. “Swarming the Nation”  plays with a breaking news style, featuring a mix of news anchors and user-generated footage that results in a high-octane, fresh take on what a car commercial can be. According to iSpot’s Creative Assessment, 31% of survey respondents cited the visual scenes as the single best thing about the ad.
 * Third place goes to Chevrolet's ""Big Life,"" which had 191.4 million TV ad impressions. NHL games generated 4.5 million of those impressions, while programming on Fox News delivered 19.4 million impressions.
 * While 21% of the impressions for Mercedes-Benz's fourth-place ad came from college baseball, Infiniti's fifth-place spot relied upon The Voice finale episodes for impressions.

""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[1],1,""More insights, including a look at the top sports creators, here.""],[0,[],0,"" ""]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[[0,[2],1,""Earned Media Value (EMV) is an influencer marketing metric utilized to measure the value of social media content, takes into account engagement with brand-related content created by influencers, publications, retailers, and other brands.""]]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>With the NBA finals in full swing, creator marketing platform <a href=""creatoriq.com"">CreatorIQ</a> dug into the data to reveal which NBA teams generated the most social engagement during the 2023 season — and it's California lovin' when it comes to Earned Media Value* (EMV). </p><p>The Los Angeles Lakers are utterly dominating the court: There are nearly 3,000 creators associated with the franchise in the U.S., generating a total EMV of $178.3 million — nearly twice that of the No. 2 team, the Golden State Warriors. Meanwhile, the Sacramento Kings (No. 9 for EMV) have the highest year-over-year growth among all the teams in the league. </p><p><a href=""https://www.adweek.com/adweek-wire/creatoriq-reveals-the-nba-teams-and-content-creators-dominating-social-media/"">More insights, including a look at the top sports creators, here.</a> </p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/06/ciq-nba.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1321"" height=""787"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/06/ciq-nba.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/06/ciq-nba.png 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/06/ciq-nba.png 1321w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></figure><p><em>Earned Media Value (EMV) is an influencer marketing metric utilized to measure the value of social media content, takes into account engagement with brand-related content created by influencers, publications, retailers, and other brands.</em></p>",647a047ac024e20001ed9f32,"With the NBA finals in full swing, creator marketing platform CreatorIQ dug into the data to reveal which NBA teams generated the most social engagement during the 2023 season — and it's California lovin' when it comes to Earned Media Value* (EMV).

The Los Angeles Lakers are utterly dominating the court: There are nearly 3,000 creators associated with the franchise in the U.S., generating a total EMV of $178.3 million — nearly twice that of the No. 2 team, the Golden State Warriors. Meanwhile, the Sacramento Kings (No. 9 for EMV) have the highest year-over-year growth among all the teams in the league.

More insights, including a look at the top sports creators, here.

CBS holds steady week-over-week at No. 2 with 6.26% of watch-time.</li><li>ESPN2 is the sole week-over-week ranking newcomer, landing at No. 24 with 1.00% of watch-time, fueled in part by college baseball.</li></ul><p><a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/the-curious-case-of-natalia-grace-cracks-top-25-programs-for-watch-time"">Read more and see the full rankings at TVREV.com.</a> </p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/06/InscapeTopShowsMay29-June4.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1018"" height=""1219"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/06/InscapeTopShowsMay29-June4.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/06/InscapeTopShowsMay29-June4.png 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/06/InscapeTopShowsMay29-June4.png 1018w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></figure>",647f4a82a569080001e43f67,"Amidst a sports-heavy week of TV viewership, one new program managed to break through the noise: The Curious Case of Natalia Grace, which aired over the course of three nights on Investigation Discovery and captured 0.41% of all live, linear minutes watched May 29 through June 4, according to data from Inscape.

The docuseries dives deep into the mystery behind a supposedly 6-year-old Ukrainian orphan adopted in 2010 by an Indiana couple who quickly started to believe she was actually an adult woman with spondyloepiphyseal dysplasia, a rare form of dwarfism.

Some additional highlights about the top TV programs and networks for the week:

 * The first two games of the NBA finals between the Heat and Nuggets take first place for watch-time with 1.62%.
 * Additionally, there are several new sporting events that make the ranking: NASCAR Cup Series captured 0.68% of watch-time, putting it at No. 10, while 2023 Roland-Garros Tennis takes No. 11 (0.67%) and the 2023 women’s college softball world series lands at No. 12 (0.67%).
 * On the network side of things, ABC takes first place with a 7.22% viewership share, fueled in part by the NBA finals. CBS holds steady week-over-week at No. 2 with 6.26% of watch-time.
 * ESPN2 is the sole week-over-week ranking newcomer, landing at No. 24 with 1.00% of watch-time, fueled in part by college baseball.

Read more and see the full rankings at TVREV.com.",__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/06/NataliaGrace.png,0,post,published,,public,all,2023-06-06T15:02:26.000Z,2023-06-06T15:14:48.000Z,2023-06-06T15:14:48.000Z,"Meanwhile, sports continue to dominate much of last week’s live TV viewership, per Inscape.",,,,,,1,647f4ea5a569080001e43f9a,3c217b21-49a7-4478-97a7-1d8287355cc3,Daytime TV: New Reach Opportunities for Advertisers,daytime-tv,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[],""cards"":[[""image"",{""src"":""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/06/DaytimeByTheNumbersiSpot.png"",""width"":2050,""height"":788,""href"":""https://www.ispot.tv/hub/resources/free-reports/daypart-spotlight-daytime-tv-transparency-report/""}]],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.ispot.tv/hub/resources/free-reports/daypart-spotlight-daytime-tv-transparency-report/""]]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""A ""],[0,[0],1,""new report from iSpot""],[0,[],0,"" dives into daytime TV advertising trends from Labor Day 2022 through Memorial Day 2023, and reveals that many networks and advertisers are putting new emphasis on daytime programming.""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""In total, there were over 860 billion household TV ad impressions delivered during daytime on linear TV, representing a 1.3% year-over-year increase. That increase was fueled in part by growth on broadcast networks, where daytime TV ad impressions increased nearly 10% year-over-year. Daytime programming accounted for 17.7% of all household TV ad impressions, second only to primetime (25%).""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""The report notes that \""these shifts create new avenues for networks to maximize the value of non-primetime dayparts, while advertisers can locate pockets of broad-reach programming for lower CPMs.\""""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[0],1,""Learn more and download the report here""],[0,[],0,"". ""]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>A <a href=""https://www.ispot.tv/hub/resources/free-reports/daypart-spotlight-daytime-tv-transparency-report/"">new report from iSpot</a> dives into daytime TV advertising trends from Labor Day 2022 through Memorial Day 2023, and reveals that many networks and advertisers are putting new emphasis on daytime programming.</p><p>In total, there were over 860 billion household TV ad impressions delivered during daytime on linear TV, representing a 1.3% year-over-year increase. That increase was fueled in part by growth on broadcast networks, where daytime TV ad impressions increased nearly 10% year-over-year. Daytime programming accounted for 17.7% of all household TV ad impressions, second only to primetime (25%).</p><p>The report notes that ""these shifts create new avenues for networks to maximize the value of non-primetime dayparts, while advertisers can locate pockets of broad-reach programming for lower CPMs.""</p><p><a href=""https://www.ispot.tv/hub/resources/free-reports/daypart-spotlight-daytime-tv-transparency-report/"">Learn more and download the report here</a>. </p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><a href=""https://www.ispot.tv/hub/resources/free-reports/daypart-spotlight-daytime-tv-transparency-report/""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/06/DaytimeByTheNumbersiSpot.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""2000"" height=""769"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/06/DaytimeByTheNumbersiSpot.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/06/DaytimeByTheNumbersiSpot.png 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1600/2023/06/DaytimeByTheNumbersiSpot.png 1600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/06/DaytimeByTheNumbersiSpot.png 2050w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></a></figure>",647f4ea5a569080001e43f9a,"A new report from iSpot dives into daytime TV advertising trends from Labor Day 2022 through Memorial Day 2023, and reveals that many networks and advertisers are putting new emphasis on daytime programming.

In total, there were over 860 billion household TV ad impressions delivered during daytime on linear TV, representing a 1.3% year-over-year increase. That increase was fueled in part by growth on broadcast networks, where daytime TV ad impressions increased nearly 10% year-over-year. Daytime programming accounted for 17.7% of all household TV ad impressions, second only to primetime (25%).

The report notes that ""these shifts create new avenues for networks to maximize the value of non-primetime dayparts, while advertisers can locate pockets of broad-reach programming for lower CPMs.""

        ",6480839ca569080001e4403d,"According to a recent case study from VIZIO Ads, a utility company saw success connecting with local audiences by using CTV video and VIZIO’s Household Connect. The report suggests that highly selective CTV video can be an advantageous partner in awareness building, particularly when viewed several times.

 * The study highlights the impact a geo-targeted campaign had for a utility company looking to build awareness among a very specific audience within their service range.
 * Exposure to the media led to significant increases in major performance indicators, including Aided Awareness (+6.8 pts) and Ad Recall (+6.9 pts), indicating the media left a lasting impression on its target audience.

A few highlights:

 * CBS tops the list with a 12.40% impressions SOV, notably higher than the No. 2 network, ABC, which captured a 7.76% share.
 * CBS (+7.3%), ABC (+15.0%) and NBC (+4.6%) all increased household TV ad impressions during daytime programming year-over-year, creating more ad reach opportunities.
 * Univision's daytime household TV ad impressions climbed over 13% year-over-year — thanks in part to telenovelas, which more than doubled impressions year-over-year during the daypart.

Get additional insights including top show genres, year-over-year daytime advertiser trends and more by downloading iSpot's full report here.",__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/06/iSpotDaytimeReport.png,0,post,published,,public,all,2023-06-07T13:42:42.000Z,2023-06-12T13:08:30.000Z,2023-06-12T13:08:30.000Z,CBS tops the chart with a 12.40% share of daytime TV ad impressions. ,,,,,,1,648098aea569080001e44089,1f97f742-dacd-404d-b305-ecf1857d3c33,Dollars For Digital Advertising Shift to Social Media Influencers,dollars-for-digital-advertising-shift-to-social-media-influencers,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[[""soft-return"","""",{}]],""cards"":[[""image"",{""src"":""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/06/ciq-ad-dollars-to-creators.png"",""width"":1318,""height"":763}]],""markups"":[[""em""],[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.creatoriq.com/""]],[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.creatoriq.com/white-papers/creator-marketing-drives-roi""]]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Turns out those social media stars bouncing all over your TikTok feed aren’t just thirsty for likes and follows, but have actually helped ""],[0,[0],1,""influence ""],[0,[],0,""(pun intended) an ongoing paradigm shift in advertising budgets. ""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""According to a recent study by ""],[0,[1],1,""CreatorIQ""],[0,[],0,"", an end-to-end creator marketing platform powering efforts for over 1,000 brands and agencies, marketers are shifting ad dollars traditionally spent on digital advertising to creator-led marketing initiatives. ""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Spurred by advancements in measurement that now can attribute sales directly to creator content on social media, 67% of marketers surveyed by CreatorIQ report increasing their investment in influencer marketing from 2022 to 2023. But of those brands whose budgets increased, only 24% are working with a net-new budget and 76% said they were diverting funds from other marketing activities, including digital ads, to creator-led initiatives.""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Another upside for brands and creators alike? ""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""The survey found that 77% of respondents said they actively convert creators who share organically about their organization into brand partners, allowing them to tap into something once nearly impossible to find in pitch people – authenticity.""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[2],1,""The full report is available for download here.""]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[[1,[],0,0]]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>Turns out those social media stars bouncing all over your TikTok feed aren’t just thirsty for likes and follows, but have actually helped <em>influence </em>(pun intended) an ongoing paradigm shift in advertising budgets. </p><p>According to a recent study by <a href=""https://www.creatoriq.com/"">CreatorIQ</a>, an end-to-end creator marketing platform powering efforts for over 1,000 brands and agencies, marketers are shifting ad dollars traditionally spent on digital advertising to creator-led marketing initiatives. </p><p>Spurred by advancements in measurement that now can attribute sales directly to creator content on social media, 67% of marketers surveyed by CreatorIQ report increasing their investment in influencer marketing from 2022 to 2023. But of those brands whose budgets increased, only 24% are working with a net-new budget and 76% said they were diverting funds from other marketing activities, including digital ads, to creator-led initiatives.</p><p>Another upside for brands and creators alike? </p><p>The survey found that 77% of respondents said they actively convert creators who share organically about their organization into brand partners, allowing them to tap into something once nearly impossible to find in pitch people – authenticity.</p><p><a href=""https://www.creatoriq.com/white-papers/creator-marketing-drives-roi"">The full report is available for download here.</a></p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/06/ciq-ad-dollars-to-creators.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1318"" height=""763"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/06/ciq-ad-dollars-to-creators.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/06/ciq-ad-dollars-to-creators.png 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/06/ciq-ad-dollars-to-creators.png 1318w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></figure>",648098aea569080001e44089,"Turns out those social media stars bouncing all over your TikTok feed aren’t just thirsty for likes and follows, but have actually helped influence (pun intended) an ongoing paradigm shift in advertising budgets.

According to a recent study by CreatorIQ, an end-to-end creator marketing platform powering efforts for over 1,000 brands and agencies, marketers are shifting ad dollars traditionally spent on digital advertising to creator-led marketing initiatives.

Spurred by advancements in measurement that now can attribute sales directly to creator content on social media, 67% of marketers surveyed by CreatorIQ report increasing their investment in influencer marketing from 2022 to 2023. But of those brands whose budgets increased, only 24% are working with a net-new budget and 76% said they were diverting funds from other marketing activities, including digital ads, to creator-led initiatives.

Another upside for brands and creators alike?

The survey found that 77% of respondents said they actively convert creators who share organically about their organization into brand partners, allowing them to tap into something once nearly impossible to find in pitch people – authenticity.

The full report is available for download here.",https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1575472782454-230f8dd14bd7?crop=entropy&cs=tinysrgb&fit=max&fm=jpg&ixid=M3wxMTc3M3wwfDF8c2VhcmNofDV8fGRvbGxhcnN8ZW58MHx8fHwxNjg2MTQ5Nzg4fDA&ixlib=rb-4.0.3&q=80&w=2000,0,post,published,,public,all,2023-06-07T14:48:14.000Z,2023-06-07T14:56:49.000Z,2023-06-07T14:56:49.000Z,CreatorIQ's recent study reveals that marketers are shifting ad dollars to creator-led marketing initiatives. ,,,,,,1,64832174a569080001e440bb,57843d70-44bf-4b17-b08c-1567ba252d30,Alfa Romeo Charges Up the Most-Seen Auto TV Ads Chart,alfa-romeo-charges-up-the-most-seen-auto-tv-ads-chart,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[],""cards"":[[""html"",{""html"":""                    <div style=\""position:relative; ""]]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>Alfa Romeo leads <a href=""https://www.wardsauto.com/industry-news/alfa-romeo-leads-charge-most-seen-auto-tv-ad"">iSpot.tv's recent ranking of most-seen auto TV ads</a> with a spot for the Tonale that received over 261 million national TV ad impressions.</p><p> The ad states that while “you can take Alfa Romeo out of Italy, you best believe you can’t take the Italy out of an Alfa Romeo.” The sleek, almost cinematic vibe resonated with viewers: According to iSpot’s <a href=""https://www.ispot.tv/products/creative-testing?ref=themeasure.net"">Creative Assessment</a>, 30% of survey respondents cited the visual scenes as the single best thing about the ad.</p><ul><li>With 195.9 million TV ad impressions, Chevrolet’s spot highlighting the various features of the Silverado takes second place.</li><li>Ram Trucks owns the third-place ad, which only aired during the first part of the week but still managed to run up 137.6 million TV ad impressions. Notably, the early morning daypart delivered the most impressions. </li><li>The No. 4 spot from Mercedes-Benz received 117.7 million TV ad impressions with cable networks leading the charge, while Lexus leaned into sports-related programming for its fifth-place spot. </li></ul><!--kg-card-begin: html-->                    <div style=""position:relative; width:100%; padding-top:56.25%; padding-bottom:40px;""><iframe src=""https://www.ispot.tv/share/1pJc"" style=""position:absolute; top:0; right:0; left:0; bottom:0; width:100%; height:100%;"" frameborder=""0"" scrolling=""no"" allowfullscreen=""""></iframe></div>
<!--kg-card-end: html-->",64832174a569080001e440bb,"Alfa Romeo leads iSpot.tv's recent ranking of most-seen auto TV ads with a spot for the Tonale that received over 261 million national TV ad impressions.

The ad states that while “you can take Alfa Romeo out of Italy, you best believe you can’t take the Italy out of an Alfa Romeo.” The sleek, almost cinematic vibe resonated with viewers: According to iSpot’s Creative Assessment, 30% of survey respondents cited the visual scenes as the single best thing about the ad.

 * With 195.9 million TV ad impressions, Chevrolet’s spot highlighting the various features of the Silverado takes second place.
 * Ram Trucks owns the third-place ad, which only aired during the first part of the week but still managed to run up 137.6 million TV ad impressions. Notably, the early morning daypart delivered the most impressions.
 * The No. 4 spot from Mercedes-Benz received 117.7 million TV ad impressions with cable networks leading the charge, while Lexus leaned into sports-related programming for its fifth-place spot.

""]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>When it comes to what people are watching on TV, <a href=""inscape.tv"">Inscape</a> data reveals that sports are still going strong: Six of the top ten most-watched programs last week were sports related, led by the NBA finals which captured a 1.57% viewership share. </p><ul><li>The first three games of the 2023 Stanley Cup Final between the Florida Panthers and the Vegas Golden Knights accounted for 0.64% of watch-time, putting it at No. 11.</li><li>Sports weren't the only thing drawing people in: Amidst a week that saw the departure of CNN Chairman and CEO Chris Licht plus Donald Trump’s announcement of his own indictment, it’s not surprising that some news programs saw a bump: <em>CBS Mornings, </em><em>ABC World News Tonight With David Muir,</em> <em>CNN News Central </em>and <em>America’s Newsroom</em> all move up the ranking compared to the previous week</li><li>On the network side of things, ABC remains in first place week-over-week but increased its viewership share from 7.22% to 7.58%, thanks in part to the NBA finals.  * The first three games of the 2023 Stanley Cup Final between the Florida Panthers and the Vegas Golden Knights accounted for 0.64% of watch-time, putting it at No. 11.
 * Sports weren't the only thing drawing people in: Amidst a week that saw the departure of CNN Chairman and CEO Chris Licht plus Donald Trump’s announcement of his own indictment, it’s not surprising that some news programs saw a bump: CBS Mornings, ABC World News Tonight With David Muir, CNN News Central and America’s Newsroom all move up the ranking compared to the previous week
 * On the network side of things, ABC remains in first place week-over-week but increased its viewership share from 7.22% to 7.58%, thanks in part to the NBA finals. CBS also maintains its ranking position while growing its share from 6.26% to 6.36%.
 * MSNBC and CNN have the largest position increases, with the former moving from No. 12 to No. 7 week-over-week, while the latter jumps into No. 11 from No. 17.
