""]]],[3,""ul"",[[[0,[],0,""The top five auto brands by estimated outlay were Kia ($17.2 million), Lexus ($13.2 million), Toyota ($12.2 million), Ram Trucks ($11.4 million) and Chevrolet ($11.1 million).""]],[[0,[],0,""The top five brands by share of automaker household TV ad impressions in May were Chevrolet (10.08%), Toyota (9.09%), Lexus (8.64%), Hyundai (7.45%) and Ram Trucks (7.12%).""]],[[0,[],0,""Chevrolet owned two of the most-seen automaker ads by share of household TV ad impressions for the month: ""],[0,[1],1,""Big Life ""],[0,[],0,""(2.40% impressions SOV) and ""],[0,[2],1,""A Whole New Level""],[0,[],0,"" (1.73%).""]],[[0,[],0,""May's top programs for automakers by share of household TV ad impressions were NBA (6.24%), ""],[0,[3],1,""SportsCenter""],[0,[],0,"" (1.33%), NHL (1.32%), ""],[0,[3],1,""Law & Order: Special Victims Unit""],[0,[],0,"" (0.67%) and MLB (0.52%).""]]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>Estimated national TV ad spend in May for the automotive industry was down about 19.2%  year-over-year, according to <a href=""https://www.mediapost.com/publications/article/386258/automotive-tv-spending-drops-19-in-may-impressio.html"">iSpot.tv data recently shared with MediaPost.</a> Auto brands spent an est. $156.2 million, compared to $193.3 million in May 2022. Total household national TV ad impressions, on the other hand, were up about 3.9% year-over-year to 27.4 billion. </p><ul><li>The top five auto brands by estimated outlay were Kia ($17.2 million), Lexus ($13.2 million), Toyota ($12.2 million), Ram Trucks ($11.4 million) and Chevrolet ($11.1 million).</li><li>The top five brands by share of automaker household TV ad impressions in May were Chevrolet (10.08%), Toyota (9.09%), Lexus (8.64%), Hyundai (7.45%) and Ram Trucks (7.12%).</li><li>Chevrolet owned two of the most-seen automaker ads by share of household TV ad impressions for the month: <a href="" https://www.ispot.tv/ad/1zUU/chevrolet-colorado-big-life-song-by-dierks-bentley-t1"">Big Life </a>(2.40% impressions SOV) and <a href=""https://www.ispot.tv/ad/2vv7/chevrolet-silverado-a-whole-new-level-t1"">A Whole New Level</a> (1.73%).</li><li>May's top programs for automakers by share of household TV ad impressions were NBA (6.24%), <em>SportsCenter</em> (1.33%), NHL (1.32%), <em>Law &amp; Order: Special Victims Unit</em> (0.67%) and MLB (0.52%).</li></ul><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/06/ispot-autos-may-2023.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1646"" height=""900"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/06/ispot-autos-may-2023.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/06/ispot-autos-may-2023.png 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1600/2023/06/ispot-autos-may-2023.png 1600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/06/ispot-autos-may-2023.png 1646w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></figure>",6489befdbd6457000118a14a,"Estimated national TV ad spend in May for the automotive industry was down about 19.2%  year-over-year, according to iSpot.tv data recently shared with MediaPost. Auto brands spent an est. $156.2 million, compared to $193.3 million in May 2022. Total household national TV ad impressions, on the other hand, were up about 3.9% year-over-year to 27.4 billion.

 * The top five auto brands by estimated outlay were Kia ($17.2 million), Lexus ($13.2 million), Toyota ($12.2 million), Ram Trucks ($11.4 million) and Chevrolet ($11.1 million).
 * The top five brands by share of automaker household TV ad impressions in May were Chevrolet (10.08%), Toyota (9.09%), Lexus (8.64%), Hyundai (7.45%) and Ram Trucks (7.12%).
 * Chevrolet owned two of the most-seen automaker ads by share of household TV ad impressions for the month: Big Life (2.40% impressions SOV) and A Whole New Level (1.73%).

""]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>What comes to your mind when you think daytime TV? Is it the long-running game shows or all the drama and intrigue of soap operas? <a href=""https://www.ispot.tv/hub/resources/free-reports/daypart-spotlight-daytime-tv-transparency-report"">iSpot's recent report</a> dives into the data for this daypart to reveal current trends, including the top programs by share of daytime TV ad impressions. </p><p>Come on down, <em>The Price Is Right</em>, because you are leading the pack! The daytime stalwart captured a 3.53% share of daytime TV ad impressions from Labor Day 2022 through Memorial Day 2023. A few additional insights: </p><ul><li><em>The Young and the Restless </em>takes second place with 2.84% impressions SOV, while <em>The View</em> was third (2.56% SOV). </li><li><em>Let's Make A Deal </em>delivered over 11% more household TV ad impressions year-over-year during daytime despite just 16.5 more minutes of advertising during the program.</li><li>Top program genres by share of daytime TV ad impressions include drama &amp; action (13.04% SOV), talk (10.68%) and reality (10.01%). </li></ul><p>The report also includes a look at top networks and show genres, year-over-year daytime advertiser trends and more. <a href=""https://www.ispot.tv/hub/resources/free-reports/daypart-spotlight-daytime-tv-transparency-report"">Download it here</a>. </p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/06/DaytimeTVTopPrograms.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1442"" height=""1300"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/06/DaytimeTVTopPrograms.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/06/DaytimeTVTopPrograms.png 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/06/DaytimeTVTopPrograms.png 1442w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></figure>",648b1571bd6457000118a18a,"What comes to your mind when you think daytime TV? Is it the long-running game shows or all the drama and intrigue of soap operas? iSpot's recent report dives into the data for this daypart to reveal current trends, including the top programs by share of daytime TV ad impressions.

Come on down, The Price Is Right, because you are leading the pack! The daytime stalwart captured a 3.53% share of daytime TV ad impressions from Labor Day 2022 through Memorial Day 2023. A few additional insights:

 * The Young and the Restless takes second place with 2.84% impressions SOV, while The View was third (2.56% SOV).
 * Let's Make A Deal delivered over 11% more household TV ad impressions year-over-year during daytime despite just 16.5 more minutes of advertising during the program.
 * Top program genres by share of daytime TV ad impressions include drama & action (13.04% SOV), talk (10.68%) and reality (10.01%).

The report also includes a look at top networks and show genres, year-over-year daytime advertiser trends and more. Per iSpot's Creative Assessment survey data this commercial had an 89% brand match (the percentage of survey respondents who remembered it was a Chevrolet ad after watching it), above the recent automaker industry norm of 76%.</p><ul><li>With 209.2 million national TV ad impressions, a Dodge ad for the Hornet takes second place. </li><li>At No. 3 is Alfa Romeo's ""Our Heritage,"" which received 201 million impressions. Meanwhile, the Silverado takes the spotlight in the No. 5 ad. Per iSpot's Creative Assessment survey data this commercial had an 89% brand match (the percentage of survey respondents who remembered it was a Chevrolet ad after watching it), above the recent automaker industry norm of 76%.

 * At No. 3 is Alfa Romeo's ""Our Heritage,"" which received 201 million impressions. Top impression-driving networks included Fox News (17.4 million impressions), HLN (12.8 million) and MSNBC (12.6 million).

The 2023 U.S. Open Golf Championship, which accounted for 4.28% of all live, linear minutes watched June 12-18. </p><p>Some additional insights about <a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/us-open-partees-atop-inscapes-ranking-of-most-watched-tv-programs"">the week's top programs and networks</a>: </p><ul><li>Baseball, both MLB and the men’s college world series, make the top ten programs by watch-time, with 0.90% and 0.75% viewership shares, respectively.</li><li><em>Celebrity Family Feud</em> jumps into the ranking at No. 15, fueled by rerun marathons across BET, ABC and BET Her. In its place? The 2023 U.S. Open Golf Championship, which accounted for 4.28% of all live, linear minutes watched June 12-18.

Some additional insights about the week's top programs and networks:

 * Baseball, both MLB and the men’s college world series, make the top ten programs by watch-time, with 0.90% and 0.75% viewership shares, respectively.
 * Celebrity Family Feud jumps into the ranking at No. 15, fueled by rerun marathons across BET, ABC and BET Her. The new season premieres July 9.
 * On the network side of things, fueled by the U.S. Open, NBC snags first place on the network ranking with 7.83% of minutes watched, up from third the previous week. As a result, both ABC and CBS are bumped down a notch.
 * Paramount Network and USA Network had the biggest ranking increases compared to the previous week: USA Network moves from No. 14 to No. 9 with 2.10% of minutes watched, thanks in part to the U.S. Open. ""]]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>Weight-loss brands are making gains during daytime TV, according to iSpot's recent <a href=""https://www.ispot.tv/hub/resources/free-reports/daypart-spotlight-daytime-tv-transparency-report"">Daytime TV Transparency Report</a>, which examines advertising trends during the daypart from Sept. 5, 2022 through May 29, 2023. </p><p>The category saw a 35% increase in TV ad impressions during the daytime, with Nutrafol leading the charge with a 163% year-over-year increase. WW was close behind, with a 151% year-over-year increase. </p><ul><li>GOLO emphasized CBS and Fox News programming to fuel its 132% year-over-year impressions increase</li><li>More than 93% of Instacart's daytime TV ad impressions during the period measured came from reruns. </li><li>For more insights about current daytime TV advertising trends, <a href=""https://www.ispot.tv/hub/resources/free-reports/daypart-spotlight-daytime-tv-transparency-report/"">download iSpot's report here</a>. </li></ul><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><a href=""https://www.ispot.tv/hub/resources/free-reports/daypart-spotlight-daytime-tv-transparency-report/""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/06/iSpotDaytimeBrands.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1368"" height=""1264"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/06/iSpotDaytimeBrands.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/06/iSpotDaytimeBrands.png 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/06/iSpotDaytimeBrands.png 1368w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></a></figure>",6492fb0be3445d00015c809a,"Weight-loss brands are making gains during daytime TV, according to iSpot's recent Daytime TV Transparency Report, which examines advertising trends during the daypart from Sept. 5, 2022 through May 29, 2023.

And views for Spider-Man videos have topped 1.20 billion every week since Nov. 15-21, 2021 – peaking the first week of June 2023 at 2.34 billion (with reactions to <em>Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse</em>).</p><p>While Marvel and Sony contribute plenty of Spidey-related videos, a much larger share of views come from user-generated content, which speaks to the fan popularity of the character (especially among younger people). And views for Spider-Man videos have topped 1.20 billion every week since Nov. 15-21, 2021 – peaking the first week of June 2023 at 2.34 billion (with reactions to Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse).

While Marvel and Sony contribute plenty of Spidey-related videos, a much larger share of views come from user-generated content, which speaks to the fan popularity of the character (especially among younger people). That’s something that bodes well for streaming services that pay for the rights to Spidey’s films… but it’s particularly important for Sony, which can use that growing interest in an already-popular character as a cash register.

Of the consumers surveyed, 24.9% cited “personal expression” in day-to-day wear as the biggest driver of luxury purchases. More from the findings:</p><ul><li>70.2% are confident about their personal economic outlook for 2023.</li><li>67.4% of respondents saying that they are shopping “somewhat more” or “much more” online compared to last year.</li><li>Before purchasing, 50.4% of consumers research a brand or product three to five times.</li><li>89.8% of consumers state that personalized and consistent digital engagement is influential in helping drive these decisions.</li></ul><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><a href=""https://www.wunderkind.co/resources/research-study/luxury-retail-pulse-how-shoppers-are-spending-on-luxury-brands/""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/06/Screen-Shot-2023-06-27-at-1.45.32-PM.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""842"" height=""648"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/06/Screen-Shot-2023-06-27-at-1.45.32-PM.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/06/Screen-Shot-2023-06-27-at-1.45.32-PM.png 842w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></a></figure>",649b355b182de900011bce2f,"While rececession fears spark plenty of shifts to consumer behaviors, luxury brands may be immune to these dynamics, according to a new study from Wunderkind.

A few additional insights about the top TV programs and networks last week:

 * PGA Tour golf and the 2023 NBA Draft — which previously did not make the top 50 shows by watch-time — jump into the top ten, taking seventh and tenth places, respectively.
 * NBC Nightly News With Lester Holt rockets to No. 24 from No. 42 previously, capturing 0.42% of minutes watched. Several other news programs saw week-over-week increases, including CNN News Central, Fox and Friends, America’s Newsroom and America Reports.
 * Looking at TV networks, CBS captured 6.42% of minutes watched last week, putting it squarely in first place on the network ranking, up from third previously. The Price is Right, CBS Mornings and PGA Tour golf were three of the programs driving watch-time during the week.
 * Week-over-week network ranking newcomers include Lifetime at No. 24 (1.02% of watch-time) and Oxygen at No. 25 (1.01%).

",,,,,,1,649d6f37182de900011bce9b,91d85663-eee1-46a9-98a3-ee37d78270d5,Donatos Pizza Captures Bigger Slice of Customer Engagement,donatos-pizza-captures-bigger-slice-of-customer-engagement,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[],""cards"":[[""image"",{""src"":""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/06/DonatosMarigold.png"",""width"":1862,""height"":596,""href"":""https://go.meetmarigold.com/donatos-case-study/pr""}]],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""https://go.meetmarigold.com/donatos-case-study/pr""]]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""A recent ""],[0,[0],1,""case study from Marigold""],[0,[],0,"" highlights how zero-party data personalization can be more effective than a simple deep discount when it comes to engaging and retaining customers. ""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Donatos, a family-owned pizza business in the Midwest, used Marigold’s Cheetah Digital to launch a new loyalty program based on customer-specific details like favorite menu items, dietary preferences and other data that led to offering on-demand rewards customized to each account. ""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""With multiple ways for customers to accrue points, a badge system to reinforce desired behavior and location-specific offers, the new loyalty program was a success and quickly surpassed Donatos’ performance goals. In 2022 alone, it added nearly 135k new members to its loyalty program. ""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Donatos also experienced success in several other areas:""]]],[3,""ul"",[[[0,[],0,""By February 2023, membership engagement hit an all-time high of 51.4%, a year-over-year improvement of 23%.""]],[[0,[],0,""An increase from 8% of members earning and using their earned rewards to 19%, with an average of 3 million points per month redeemed for on-demand rewards.""]],[[0,[],0,""10% of active members are responsible for 31.5% of the company's total net sales.""]],[[0,[],0,""98k+ transactions attributed to on-demand rewards.""]]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Learn more and read the ""],[0,[0],1,""full case study here.""]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>A recent <a href=""https://go.meetmarigold.com/donatos-case-study/pr"">case study from Marigold</a> highlights how zero-party data personalization can be more effective than a simple deep discount when it comes to engaging and retaining customers. </p><p>Donatos, a family-owned pizza business in the Midwest, used Marigold’s Cheetah Digital to launch a new loyalty program based on customer-specific details like favorite menu items, dietary preferences and other data that led to offering on-demand rewards customized to each account. </p><p>With multiple ways for customers to accrue points, a badge system to reinforce desired behavior and location-specific offers, the new loyalty program was a success and quickly surpassed Donatos’ performance goals. In 2022 alone, it added nearly 135k new members to its loyalty program. </p><p>Donatos also experienced success in several other areas:</p><ul><li>By February 2023, membership engagement hit an all-time high of 51.4%, a year-over-year improvement of 23%.</li><li>An increase from 8% of members earning and using their earned rewards to 19%, with an average of 3 million points per month redeemed for on-demand rewards.</li><li>10% of active members are responsible for 31.5% of the company's total net sales.</li><li>98k+ transactions attributed to on-demand rewards.</li></ul><p>Learn more and read the <a href=""https://go.meetmarigold.com/donatos-case-study/pr"">full case study here.</a></p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><a href=""https://go.meetmarigold.com/donatos-case-study/pr""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/06/DonatosMarigold.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1862"" height=""596"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/06/DonatosMarigold.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/06/DonatosMarigold.png 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1600/2023/06/DonatosMarigold.png 1600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/06/DonatosMarigold.png 1862w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></a></figure>",649d6f37182de900011bce9b,"A recent case study from Marigold highlights how zero-party data personalization can be more effective than a simple deep discount when it comes to engaging and retaining customers.

Donatos, a family-owned pizza business in the Midwest, used Marigold’s Cheetah Digital to launch a new loyalty program based on customer-specific details like favorite menu items, dietary preferences and other data that led to offering on-demand rewards customized to each account.

With multiple ways for customers to accrue points, a badge system to reinforce desired behavior and location-specific offers, the new loyalty program was a success and quickly surpassed Donatos’ performance goals. In 2022 alone, it added nearly 135k new members to its loyalty program.

Donatos also experienced success in several other areas:

 * By February 2023, membership engagement hit an all-time high of 51.4%, a year-over-year improvement of 23%.
 * An increase from 8% of members earning and using their earned rewards to 19%, with an average of 3 million points per month redeemed for on-demand rewards.
 * 10% of active members are responsible for 31.5% of the company's total net sales.
 * 98k+ transactions attributed to on-demand rewards.

        ",649d7a44182de900011bcebc,"Amidst decreasing linear viewership, brands continue to shift budget to CTV — but marketers are still challenged with catching consumers before they dive into ad-free environments. VIZIO Ads recently released a new case study with Subway that showcases how incorporating CTV video with high-impact Home Screen TV placements can build incremental reach beyond linear TV campaigns.

By partnering with VIZIO, Subway saw quick gains in the incremental potential of streaming media alongside their linear TV campaign:

 * VIZIO Ads’ measurement showed that Subway’s linear TV campaign reach was 32%.
 * By adding CTV video and VIZIO Home Screen, Subway’s campaign reach skyrocketed to nearly 82% of VIZIO TVs — tripling the impact of its linear TV efforts alone.

Sign in now or subscribe to download the case study for free.

place fifth and PGA Tour golf remains in seventh week-over-week.</li><li><em>Below Deck</em>, which hasn’t aired on live TV since April, jumps into the ranking at No. 13 (0.53% of watch-time), thanks Some additional insights about the top programs and networks on TV:

 * Elsewhere in sports, MLB games place fifth and PGA Tour golf remains in seventh week-over-week.
 * Below Deck, which hasn’t aired on live TV since April, jumps into the ranking at No. 13 (0.53% of watch-time), thanks to multiple marathons on Bravo that ran June 29 through July 2.
 * On the network side of things, CBS remains in first place, increasing its watch-time from 6.42% to 6.49% week-over-week. Today, America’s Got Talent and NASCAR Cup Series were three of the programs driving NBC’s watch-time during the week.
 * For the first time this year, BET makes the network ranking, arriving at No. 25 with 1.04% of minutes watched. Celebrity Family Feud accounted for nearly a quarter of the network’s watch-time during the week.

""]],[[0,[],0,""Novo Nordisk was the only month-over-month newcomer to the top ten. It spent an estimated $11.6 million, with the bulk ($7.1 million) going toward a spot featuring actor Anthony Anderson that promotes awareness about type 2 diabetes. ""]]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>Skyrizi, AbbVie's immunology drug, was the No. 1 pharmaceutical brand by estimated TV ad spend for June, according to <a href=""https://www.fiercepharma.com/marketing/abbvies-skyrizi-retakes-tv-drug-ad-spenders-crown-june-overall-spend-falls-40m"">iSpot.tv data recently shared with FiercePharma</a>. It had an outlay of $26.6 million across five TV ads in June, a decrease from its May spend of $28.4 million. </p><p>Some additional insights around the top-spending Rx brands in June: </p><ul><li>In total, the top ten brands spent an estimated 163.2 million on national TV ads in June, a $40 million decrease from May's outlay by the top ten brands.</li><li>Rinvoq, which was the No. 1 brand by May spend, drops to No. 2 with $25.3 million. </li><li>Novo Nordisk was the only month-over-month newcomer to the top ten. It spent an estimated $11.6 million, with the bulk ($7.1 million) going toward a spot featuring actor Anthony Anderson that promotes awareness about type 2 diabetes. </li></ul><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><a href=""https://www.fiercepharma.com/marketing/abbvies-skyrizi-retakes-tv-drug-ad-spenders-crown-june-overall-spend-falls-40m""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/07/ispotjune2023pharma.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""829"" height=""494"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/07/ispotjune2023pharma.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/07/ispotjune2023pharma.png 829w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></a></figure>",64a6d76b5c70d00001dcb597,"Skyrizi, AbbVie's immunology drug, was the No. 1 pharmaceutical brand by estimated TV ad spend for June, according to iSpot.tv data recently shared with FiercePharma. Despite a lack of new scripted content, though, these giants actually increased unique U.S. viewers across YouTube and Facebook in May. <a href=""https://tvrev.us10.list-manage.com/track/click?u=44cda535c0a18903d9071ddf8&amp;id=20193bd479&amp;e=31c0547e96"">Tubular Labs</a>’ Audience Ratings shows Comcast, Paramount, Disney and Warner Bros. Discovery all had their highest unique viewer totals of the last 12 months, while leaning on a combination of movie trailers, sports highlights and short videos.

 * Comcast unique viewers in May grew by 17% month-over-month, while WBD climbed by 14%.

a sea of IP-driven streaming content, Star Trek rarely gets the same fanfare as its counterparts. Yet, the long-running franchise has no problem drawing in similar audience demand, as data from <a href=""http://parrotanalytics.com"">Parrot Analytics</a> highlights. <em>Star Trek: Strange New Worlds</em> had 45x higher demand than the average show in its first four days – competing with (or surpassing) “bigger” franchises. That’s a boost for Paramount+, which can continue to bank on Star Trek’s reliable viewership.</p><ul><li>The final season of <em>Picard</em>, which served as an expertly coordinated reunion for <em>The Next Generation </em>with warp drives fueled by well-executed nostalgia, was the 17th most in-demand TV series in the US during its February-April run.</li><li><em>Star Trek: Discovery </em>will soon conclude a five season run in which it has ranked among the top 2.7% of all series in the US in demand since premiering in 2017.</li></ul><p>[<a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/enduringappealstarwars"">Read more at TVREV</a>]</p>",64a73ab15c70d00001dcb634,"In a sea of IP-driven streaming content, Star Trek rarely gets the same fanfare as its counterparts. Yet, the long-running franchise has no problem drawing in similar audience demand, as data from Parrot Analytics highlights. Star Trek: Strange New Worlds had 45x higher demand than the average show in its first four days – competing with (or surpassing) “bigger” franchises. That’s a boost for Paramount+, which can continue to bank on Star Trek’s reliable viewership.

 * The final season of Picard, which served as an expertly coordinated reunion for The Next Generation with warp drives fueled by well-executed nostalgia, was the 17th most in-demand TV series in the US during its February-April run.
 * Star Trek: Discovery will soon conclude a five season run in which it has ranked among the top 2.7% of all series in the US in demand since premiering in 2017.

 * Nickelodeon, which hypes its comedies The Really Loud House and Erin & Aaron in fourth.

[Read more at Promax]",https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1608751819407-6ec94205fd7b?crop=entropy&cs=tinysrgb&fit=max&fm=jpg&ixid=M3wxMTc3M3wwfDF8c2VhcmNofDF8fGFiY3xlbnwwfHx8fDE2ODg2ODIyNTN8MA&ixlib=rb-4.0.3&q=80&w=2000,0,post,published,,public,all,2023-07-06T22:21:23.000Z,2023-07-06T22:25:44.000Z,2023-07-06T16:25:00.000Z,,,,,,,1,64a73fdc5c70d00001dcb68a,68220bab-3878-4710-ae14-8cf6d6545460,Sports Betting Grows National TV Ad Spend In U.S.,sports-betting-grows-national-tv-ad-spend-in-u-s,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[],""cards"":[[""image"",{""src"":""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/07/custom-industry-online-sports-betting-custom-brands_industry-overview_top-brands_01-01-2022_to_12-31-2022.png"",""width"":1800,""height"":900,""href"":""http://ispot.tv""}]],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.espn.com/nfl/story/_/id/37819966/what-league-rules-gambling-sports-ncaa-nba-mlb-nfl-nhl""]],[""strong""]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Sports betting is more prevalent than ever before in American history. With that comes lucrative partnerships with sportsbooks and new advertising revenue streams. The amount sportsbook brands have spent on national TV commercials annually has increased from $21.4 million in 2019 to $314.6 million in 2022 and sports betting ads have increased by more than threefold, according to data from iSpot.""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""[""],[0,[0],1,""More at ESPN""],[0,[],0,""]""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[1],1,""Sports Betting Brands by Share of Household TV Ad Impressions in 2022""]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>Sports betting is more prevalent than ever before in American history. With that comes lucrative partnerships with sportsbooks and new advertising revenue streams. The amount sportsbook brands have spent on national TV commercials annually has increased from $21.4 million in 2019 to $314.6 million in 2022 and sports betting ads have increased by more than threefold, according to data from iSpot.</p><p>[<a href=""https://www.espn.com/nfl/story/_/id/37819966/what-league-rules-gambling-sports-ncaa-nba-mlb-nfl-nhl"">More at ESPN</a>]</p><p><strong>Sports Betting Brands by Share of Household TV Ad Impressions in 2022</strong></p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><a href=""http://ispot.tv""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/07/custom-industry-online-sports-betting-custom-brands_industry-overview_top-brands_01-01-2022_to_12-31-2022.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1800"" height=""900"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/07/custom-industry-online-sports-betting-custom-brands_industry-overview_top-brands_01-01-2022_to_12-31-2022.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/07/custom-industry-online-sports-betting-custom-brands_industry-overview_top-brands_01-01-2022_to_12-31-2022.png 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1600/2023/07/custom-industry-online-sports-betting-custom-brands_industry-overview_top-brands_01-01-2022_to_12-31-2022.png 1600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/07/custom-industry-online-sports-betting-custom-brands_industry-overview_top-brands_01-01-2022_to_12-31-2022.png 1800w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></a></figure>",64a73fdc5c70d00001dcb68a,"Sports betting is more prevalent than ever before in American history. With that comes lucrative partnerships with sportsbooks and new advertising revenue streams. The amount sportsbook brands have spent on national TV commercials annually has increased from $21.4 million in 2019 to $314.6 million in 2022 and sports betting ads have increased by more than threefold, according to data from iSpot.

[More at ESPN]

                    <!--kg-card-end: html-->",64a81ccc5c70d00001dcb6b8,"With 283.8 million national TV ad impressions, Ram Trucks takes first place on iSpot's ranking of most-seen auto TV ads for June 26 through July 2.  * Subaru has the third- and fourth-place commercials and both are quite different: The No. 3 ad highlights Subaru's ""love promise"" and talks about how the company has helped nearly 300,000 cancer patients nationwide, while the No. 4 spot touts Subaru’s recent accolade from Consumer Reports as the 2023 Best Mainstream Brand. Combined, the ads racked up nearly 270 million TV ad impressions.
 * According to iSpot’s Creative Assessment, 24% of surveyed viewers considered Subaru's Consumer Reports commercial’s message to be the single best thing about the spot.
 * Rounding out the ranking is Alfa Romeo and its spot for the Tonale which has been on and off the chart for weeks. It received 122.1 million TV ad impressions, a third of which from primetime airings.

With the finals taking place this weekend, we’ll have to wait and see if Wimbledon aces Inscape’s ranking again next week.  </p><p>Some additional insights about the top programming and networks on TV:</p><ul><li>Rerun marathons on ION fueled watch-time for three of the top ten programs: <em>NCIS</em> (No. 3 with 0.95% of minutes watched), <em>Law &amp; Order: SVU</em> (which slips to fifth from first last time with 0.84%) and <em>Chicago P.D.</em>, which rockets up 20 slots into seventh place (0.70%).</li><li>Two additional summer sporting events made the top 25 ranking that haven’t previously appeared: the 2023 U.S. Women’s Open Championship (No. 9, 0.65%) and NBA Summer League Basketball (No. 14, 0.56%).</li><li>On the network side of things, CBS yet again takes first place on the network ranking, although its viewership share slipped to 5.87% from 6.49% previously.</li><li>ESPN2 sprints into No. 20, up from No. 50 previously, thanks largely to NBA Summer League games. Other week-over-week ranking newcomers include Oxygen (No. 21, 1.13% of watch-time), TNT (No. 22, 1.12%) and Discovery (No. 23,1.12%).</li></ul><p><a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/game-set-match-wimbledon-wins-for-tv-viewership"">Read more and see the full rankings at TVREV.com</a>.</p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/07/InscapeTopShowsJuly3-9.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1018"" height=""1219"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/07/InscapeTopShowsJuly3-9.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/07/InscapeTopShowsJuly3-9.png 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/07/InscapeTopShowsJuly3-9.png 1018w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></figure>",64ad6d86c89bba000107d42f,"As the oldest and most prestigious tennis tournament in the world, Wimbledon continues to captivates viewers year after year, and 2023 is no exception: Per Inscape, the first week of the championships captured 1.70% of all live, linear minutes watched July 3-9, making it the only program during the week to rise about a 1% viewership share — MLB games took second place with 0.95% of watch-time. With the finals taking place this weekend, we’ll have to wait and see if Wimbledon aces Inscape’s ranking again next week.  

Some additional insights about the top programming and networks on TV:

 * Rerun marathons on ION fueled watch-time for three of the top ten programs: NCIS (No. 3 with 0.95% of minutes watched), Law & Order: SVU (which slips to fifth from first last time with 0.84%) and Chicago P.D., which rockets up 20 slots into seventh place (0.70%).
 * Two additional summer sporting events made the top 25 ranking that haven’t previously appeared: the 2023 U.S. Women’s Open Championship (No. 9, 0.65%) and NBA Summer League Basketball (No. 14, 0.56%).
 * On the network side of things, CBS yet again takes first place on the network ranking, although its viewership share slipped to 5.87% from 6.49% previously.
 * ESPN2 sprints into No. 20, up from No. 50 previously, thanks largely to NBA Summer League games. Other week-over-week ranking newcomers include Oxygen (No. 21, 1.13% of watch-time), TNT (No. 22, 1.12%) and Discovery (No. 23,1.12%).

""]]],[3,""ul"",[[[0,[],0,""The top five brands by outlay were Lexus ($12.8 million), Kia ($12.7 million), Chevrolet ($11.7 million), Toyota ($10.6 million) and Nissan ($8.9 million).""]],[[0,[],0,""The top five brands by share of automaker household TV ad impressions were Chevrolet (10.12%), Lexus (8.02%), Toyota (7.97%), Hyundai (7.12%) and Kia (5.95%).""]],[[0,[],0,""Alfa Romeo, which has advertised minimally on national TV in recent years, burst on the scene in June with a spend of $6.2 million around a single spot promoting the Tonale. Meanwhile, TV ad impressions were up 7% year-over-year to 27.9 billion. </p><ul><li>The top five brands by outlay were Lexus ($12.8 million), Kia ($12.7 million), Chevrolet ($11.7 million), Toyota ($10.6 million) and Nissan ($8.9 million).</li><li>The top five brands by share of automaker household TV ad impressions were Chevrolet (10.12%), Lexus (8.02%), Toyota (7.97%), Hyundai (7.12%) and Kia (5.95%).</li><li>Alfa Romeo, which has advertised minimally on national TV in recent years, burst on the scene in June with a spend of $6.2 million around a single spot promoting the Tonale. Other brands increasing spend year-over-year included Mercedes-Benz (+91.33%), Dodge (+ 32.0%), Lexus (+19.15%) and Chevrolet (+13.99%).</li><li>June's top programs for automakers by share of household TV ad impressions were NBA (2.23%), 2023 U.S. Open Golf Championship (1.46%), SportsCenter (0.90%), MLB (0.90%) and 2023 Men's College World Series (0.65%).</li></ul><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/07/ispot-autos-june-2023.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1646"" height=""900"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/07/ispot-autos-june-2023.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/07/ispot-autos-june-2023.png 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1600/2023/07/ispot-autos-june-2023.png 1600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/07/ispot-autos-june-2023.png 1646w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></figure>",64ad8862c89bba000107d45d,"Estimated national TV ad spend in June for the automotive industry declined 18.1% year-over-year, according to iSpot data recently shared with MediaPost. Total outlay for national TV ads during the month was $128.7 million vs. $157.2 million in June 2022. Meanwhile, TV ad impressions were up 7% year-over-year to 27.9 billion.

 * The top five brands by outlay were Lexus ($12.8 million), Kia ($12.7 million), Chevrolet ($11.7 million), Toyota ($10.6 million) and Nissan ($8.9 million).
 * The top five brands by share of automaker household TV ad impressions were Chevrolet (10.12%), Lexus (8.02%), Toyota (7.97%), Hyundai (7.12%) and Kia (5.95%).
 * Alfa Romeo, which has advertised minimally on national TV in recent years, burst on the scene in June with a spend of $6.2 million around a single spot promoting the Tonale. Other brands increasing spend year-over-year included Mercedes-Benz (+91.33%), Dodge (+ 32.0%), Lexus (+19.15%) and Chevrolet (+13.99%).

""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""One key finding: Organizations with the most advanced influencer marketing programs (defined as brands in the top 20% in metrics like impressions, engagement, conversion, and annual revenue attributed to influencer marketing efforts) see far better results from their efforts than competitors with less sophisticated influencer marketing programs. ""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Get more insights about the value of influencer marketing in 2023 by ""],[0,[0],1,""downloading the report for free here.""]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>A new report from creator marketing platform <a href=""https://www.creatoriq.com/white-papers/unleashing-the-power-of-creators?utm_campaign=ROCS%202023&amp;utm_source=PR"">CreatorIQ</a> reveals a direct correlation between creator investment and increased brand ROI, demonstrating the value of influencer marketing. </p><p>One key finding: Organizations with the most advanced influencer marketing programs (defined as brands in the top 20% in metrics like impressions, engagement, conversion, and annual revenue attributed to influencer marketing efforts) see far better results from their efforts than competitors with less sophisticated influencer marketing programs. </p><p>In other words, they’re spending money to make money. </p><p>The <em>Unleashing the Power of Creators</em> report, commissioned from leading marketing research group Aberdeen Strategy and Research, found that these Influencer Marketing Leaders outperformed the lower 80% in year-over-year improvement across KPIs in all stages of the funnel. These Influencer Marketing Leaders saw: </p><ul><li>9.1x greater improvement in impressions</li><li>8.2x greater improvement in engagement</li><li>11.7x greater improvement in conversion rates</li></ul><p>Most notably, this cohort’s strong performance contributed to a 6.2x greater year-over-year increase in annual company revenue, leading to a Return-On-Creator-Spend (ROCS) of $4.70 on every dollar invested in influencer marketing programs. CreatorIQ developed this new ROCS metric to help advertisers measure the impact of creator-led marketing programs against traditional digital channels. </p><p>Get more insights about the value of influencer marketing in 2023 by <a href=""https://www.creatoriq.com/white-papers/unleashing-the-power-of-creators?utm_campaign=ROCS%202023&amp;utm_source=PR"">downloading the report for free here.</a></p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/07/CIQROCS.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1318"" height=""763"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/07/CIQROCS.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/07/CIQROCS.png 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/07/CIQROCS.png 1318w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></figure>",64aebb83c89bba000107d497,"A new report from creator marketing platform CreatorIQ reveals a direct correlation between creator investment and increased brand ROI, demonstrating the value of influencer marketing.

One key finding: Organizations with the most advanced influencer marketing programs (defined as brands in the top 20% in metrics like impressions, engagement, conversion, and annual revenue attributed to influencer marketing efforts) see far better results from their efforts than competitors with less sophisticated influencer marketing programs.

In other words, they’re spending money to make money.

The Unleashing the Power of Creators report, commissioned from leading marketing research group Aberdeen Strategy and Research, found that these Influencer Marketing Leaders outperformed the lower 80% in year-over-year improvement across KPIs in all stages of the funnel. These Influencer Marketing Leaders saw:

 * 9.1x greater improvement in impressions
 * 8.2x greater improvement in engagement
 * 11.7x greater improvement in conversion rates

Most notably, this cohort’s strong performance contributed to a 6.2x greater year-over-year increase in annual company revenue, leading to a Return-On-Creator-Spend (ROCS) of $4.70 on every dollar invested in influencer marketing programs. CreatorIQ developed this new ROCS metric to help advertisers measure the impact of creator-led marketing programs against traditional digital channels.

It was also No. 1 in May. The brand had a 4.57% impressions SOV with an estimated national TV ad spend of $21.4 million for the month. </p><p>Some additional insights around the most-seen OTC/Rx brands for June:</p><ul><li>Skyrizi was a close second place, with ads for its Crohn’s disease, psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis drugs receiving a 4.37% impressions SOV. It also had a higher estimated national ad spend than Dupixent — $26.6 million. </li><li>Claritin and Allegra were the only over-the-counter medications to make the top ten, coming in at No. 6 (2.53%) and No. 8 (2.05%), respectively. </li><li>Broadcast networks delivered top impressions SOV for all of the top ten brands except for Novo Nordisk, which saw its largest network SOV (13.80%) come from Fox News. </li></ul><p><a href=""www"">Read more at MM+M Online.</a></p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/07/junetop-otc-and-rx-pharma.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""706"" height=""437"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/07/junetop-otc-and-rx-pharma.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/07/junetop-otc-and-rx-pharma.png 706w""></figure>",64aebe5ac89bba000107d4b2,"Dupixent, a drug for eczema and asthma, topped iSpot's June ranking of over-the-counter and prescription drugs by impressions share of voice (SOV). It was also No. 1 in May. The brand had a 4.57% impressions SOV with an estimated national TV ad spend of $21.4 million for the month.

Some additional insights around the most-seen OTC/Rx brands for June:

 * Skyrizi was a close second place, with ads for its Crohn’s disease, psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis drugs receiving a 4.37% impressions SOV. It also had a higher estimated national ad spend than Dupixent — $26.6 million.
 * Claritin and Allegra were the only over-the-counter medications to make the top ten, coming in at No. 6 (2.53%) and No. 8 (2.05%), respectively.
 * Broadcast networks delivered top impressions SOV for all of the top ten brands except for Novo Nordisk, which saw its largest network SOV (13.80%) come from Fox News.

""]]]],[10,0]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>For the second week in a row, Subaru owns two of the five most-seen auto TV ads, <a href=""https://www.wardsauto.com/industry-news/subaru-spots-lead-most-watched-auto-ad-ranking"">per iSpot data shared with WardsAuto</a>. While they have similar estimated national TV ad spend, impressions and top programs/networks for impression delivery, the commercials take drastically different tones. <!--kg-card-end: html-->",64b155a243655a0001716acd,"For the second week in a row, Subaru owns two of the five most-seen auto TV ads, per iSpot data shared with WardsAuto. The spots take first and second place — up from third and fourth last week. While they have similar estimated national TV ad spend, impressions and top programs/networks for impression delivery, the commercials take drastically different tones. The first-place spot (229.2 million impressions) highlights the automaker's ""Love Promise,"" while the No. 2 ad (223.5 million impressions) spreads the news that Subaru was named the 2023 Best Mainstream Brand by Consumer Reports.

 * With 157.6 million TV ad impressions, a Chevrolet Blazer EV spot takes third place. The ad is a Barbie movie tie-in with appearances from several cast members.
 * The fourth-place Ram Trucks commercial leaned into sports for impression delivery, and scored above the norm for attention, likeability, desire and relevance, according to iSpot's Creative Assessment.
 * Kia rounds out the ranking with an ad for the '23 Sportage Hybrid. Over half (62%) of its 105.2 million impressions came from primetime ad airings.

An influx of young stars (there were <a href=""https://www.espn.com/mlb/story/_/id/37990072/2023-mlb-all-star-game-players-first-midsummer-classic"">33 first-time all-stars this year</a>) helps too, as MLB continues to strive for more youthful audience.</p><p>[<a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/mlb-all-star-tv-ratings-watch-time-inscape"">READ MORE AT TVREV</a>]</p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/mlb-all-star-tv-ratings-watch-time-inscape""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/07/inscape-asg.jpg"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1375"" height=""787"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/07/inscape-asg.jpg 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/07/inscape-asg.jpg 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/07/inscape-asg.jpg 1375w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></a></figure>",64b1ade243655a0001716b24,"Data from Inscape shows this year's MLB All-Star Game was the No. 1 program in primetime on July 11, with 11.37% of national linear watch-time (nearly 2x the amount of the next programming, America’s Got Talent).

Tubular Labs recently <a href=""https://tubularlabs.com/blog/womens-sports-winning-big-views-ad-dollars/"">published a blog post</a> around women's sports social video increases, with some impressive findings:</p><ul><li>In 2022, women’s soccer amounted to 610 million U.S. YouTube views. This year’s Women’s World Cup hasn’t even started yet and views for women’s soccer are already at <strong>686 million on YouTube.</strong></li><li>U.S. social videos about women’s basketball reached over 1.06 billion views in 2022. Just six months into 2023, views have already hit 844 million— with many more to come between the WNBA season and more college basketball this fall.</li><li>But basketball is not the only women’s sport to see a rise in viewership over the past year. After a thrilling Women’s College World Series, softball views on Facebook are up from 96M to 119M.</li><li> In 2023, March Madness saw record-breaking TV audiences for the women’s bracket, along with an impressive increase in social views, which escalated by 5x year-over-year<strong> </strong>across social platforms, to be exact.</li></ul><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><a href=""https://tubularlabs.com/blog/womens-sports-winning-big-views-ad-dollars/""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/07/copy-copy-fubo-ispot-graphic.jpg"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1172"" height=""696"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/07/copy-copy-fubo-ispot-graphic.jpg 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/07/copy-copy-fubo-ispot-graphic.jpg 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/07/copy-copy-fubo-ispot-graphic.jpg 1172w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></a></figure>",64b1b22643655a0001716b65,"In advance of the 2023 FIFA Women's World Cup, it's worth noting just how much women's sports content has grown over the past year. Tubular Labs recently published a blog post around women's sports social video increases, with some impressive findings:

 * In 2022, women’s soccer amounted to 610 million U.S. YouTube views. This year’s Women’s World Cup hasn’t even started yet and views for women’s soccer are already at 686 million on YouTube.
 * U.S. social videos about women’s basketball reached over 1.06 billion views in 2022. Just six months into 2023, views have already hit 844 million— with many more to come between the WNBA season and more college basketball this fall.
 * But basketball is not the only women’s sport to see a rise in viewership over the past year. After a thrilling Women’s College World Series, softball views on Facebook are up from 96M to 119M.
 * In 2023, March Madness saw record-breaking TV audiences for the women’s bracket, along with an impressive increase in social views, which escalated by 5x year-over-year across social platforms, to be exact.",https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1551958219-acbc608c6377?crop=entropy&cs=tinysrgb&fit=max&fm=jpg&ixid=M3wxMTc3M3wwfDF8c2VhcmNofDF8fHNvY2NlcnxlbnwwfHx8fDE2ODkzNjc1NzJ8MA&ixlib=rb-4.0.3&q=80&w=2000,0,post,published,,public,all,2023-07-14T20:37:58.000Z,2023-07-14T22:40:51.000Z,2023-07-14T20:48:27.000Z,,,,,,,1,64b6ab6743655a0001716baa,652b89ae-2abd-40f2-ab61-2dfc24c34592,Wimbledon’s Grand Slam: TV By the Numbers,wimbledons-grand-slam-tv-by-the-numbers,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[],""cards"":[[""image"",{""src"":""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/07/InscapeTopShowsJuly10-16.png"",""width"":1018,""height"":1219}]],""markups"":[[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.tvrev.com/news/mlb-all-star-tv-ratings-watch-time-inscape""]],[""em""],[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.tvrev.com/news/wimbledons-grand-slam-tv-by-the-numbers""]]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""The 2023 Wimbledon Championships aced it again, capturing 1.79% of watch-time for the week, up from 1.70% previously. Looking at the tournament as a whole, from July 3-16 it had a 1.75% viewership share across all programs on TV, an increase from 2022's 1.46% share. Elsewhere in sports, the NBA summer league bounces up, moving from No. 14 to No. 6 with a 0.75% viewership share.""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Some additional insights about the top programming and networks on TV:""]]],[3,""ul"",[[[0,[],0,""The 2023 MLB All-Star Game lands at No. 11 with 0.58% of minutes watched. It was also the No. 1 program in primetime on July 11, with 11.37% of national linear watch-time, as ""],[0,[0],1,""TVREV’s John Cassillo previously reported""],[0,[],0,"". ""]],[[0,[1],1,""Chicago Fire""],[0,[],0,"" exploded into the top ten (up from No. 36 previously) with a 0.66% viewership share, thanks to multiple rerun marathons on USA and ION.""]],[[0,[],0,""On the network side of things, CBS remains in first place, increasing its viewership share from 5.87% to 6.20% week-over-week.""]],[[0,[],0,""Week-over-week network ranking newcomers include TLC (No. 19), with watch-time driven in part by ""],[0,[1],1,""90 Day Fiancé: Before the 90 Days""],[0,[],0,"", and BET (No. 25), which was fueled by ""],[0,[1],1,""Celebrity Family Feud""],[0,[],0,"".""]]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""Read more and see the ""],[0,[2],1,""full rankings at TVREV.com""],[0,[],0,"". ""]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>The 2023 Wimbledon Championships aced it again, capturing 1.79% of watch-time for the week, up from 1.70% previously. Looking at the tournament as a whole, from July 3-16 it had a 1.75% viewership share across all programs on TV, an increase from 2022's 1.46% share. Elsewhere in sports, the NBA summer league bounces up, moving from No. 14 to No. 6 with a 0.75% viewership share.</p><p>Some additional insights about the top programming and networks on TV:</p><ul><li>The 2023 MLB All-Star Game lands at No. 11 with 0.58% of minutes watched. It was also the No. 1 program in primetime on July 11, with 11.37% of national linear watch-time, as <a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/mlb-all-star-tv-ratings-watch-time-inscape"">TVREV’s John Cassillo previously reported</a>. </li><li><em>Chicago Fire</em> exploded into the top ten (up from No. 36 previously) with a 0.66% viewership share, thanks to multiple rerun marathons on USA and ION.</li><li>On the network side of things, CBS remains in first place, increasing its viewership share from 5.87% to 6.20% week-over-week.</li><li>Week-over-week network ranking newcomers include TLC (No. 19), with watch-time driven in part by <em>90 Day Fiancé: Before the 90 Days</em>, and BET (No. 25), which was fueled by <em>Celebrity Family Feud</em>.</li></ul><p>Read more and see the <a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/wimbledons-grand-slam-tv-by-the-numbers"">full rankings at TVREV.com</a>. </p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/07/InscapeTopShowsJuly10-16.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1018"" height=""1219"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/07/InscapeTopShowsJuly10-16.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/07/InscapeTopShowsJuly10-16.png 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/07/InscapeTopShowsJuly10-16.png 1018w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></figure>",64b6ab6743655a0001716baa,"The 2023 Wimbledon Championships aced it again, capturing 1.79% of watch-time for the week, up from 1.70% previously. Looking at the tournament as a whole, from July 3-16 it had a 1.75% viewership share across all programs on TV, an increase from 2022's 1.46% share. Elsewhere in sports, the NBA summer league bounces up, moving from No. 14 to No. 6 with a 0.75% viewership share.

Some additional insights about the top programming and networks on TV:

 * The 2023 MLB All-Star Game lands at No. 11 with 0.58% of minutes watched. It was also the No. 1 program in primetime on July 11, with 11.37% of national linear watch-time, as TVREV’s John Cassillo previously reported.
 * Chicago Fire exploded into the top ten (up from No. 36 previously) with a 0.66% viewership share, thanks to multiple rerun marathons on USA and ION.
 * On the network side of things, CBS remains in first place, increasing its viewership share from 5.87% to 6.20% week-over-week.
 * Week-over-week network ranking newcomers include TLC (No. 19), with watch-time driven in part by 90 Day Fiancé: Before the 90 Days, and BET (No. 25), which was fueled by Celebrity Family Feud.

                    <!--kg-card-end: html-->",64ba86768785870001bb5099,"A Ram Trucks ad rises from fourth to first place week-over-week on iSpot's latest ranking of most-watched auto TV ads, raking in over 243 million national TV ad impressions.  The top impression-generating network was NBC, which delivered 31.8 million impressions — more than twice as many as MSNBC, the second-place network.  

 * Subaru owns two of the top five auto commercials (No. 2 and No. 4) with a combined 364 million impressions.

""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""According to an analysis from ""],[0,[0],1,""CreatorIQ""],[0,[],0,"", Alex Morgan and Megan Rapinoe are two of the team members who have generated notable earned media value (EMV) for brands in the first half of 2023. ""]]],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""One of ""],[0,[1],1,""Morgan’s top social posts with Nike from June""],[0,[],0,"" generated an EMV of $123.8k, with  post-level engagement rate of 3.4%, which CreatorIQ considered above average compared to other influencers of a similar sized following.""]]],[10,0],[1,""p"",[[0,[],0,""CreatorIQ also examined Instagram audience growth for a few of the team members. 18-year-old Alyssa Thompson (the first teenager to make the U.S. women’s roster since 1995) stands out with an explosive 140.5% increase in Instagram followers since February 2023. Naomi Girma has grown her Instagram audience by 73%, while Sophia Smith has seen a 33% increase and Trinity Rodman has increased her followers by 19.2% since February. All of them have partnered with brands for various social promotions. ""]]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>As the U.S. Women’s National Team navigates an attempt to win its third World Cup title in a row, audiences worldwide will be glued to screens — and not just TVs. Even before kickoff, brands have been taking note of the rising popularity of female sports and have tapped into creator social marketing with multiple members of the women’s U.S. national team. </p><p>According to an analysis from <a href=""creatoriq.com"">CreatorIQ</a>, Alex Morgan and Megan Rapinoe are two of the team members who have generated notable earned media value (EMV) for brands in the first half of 2023. Looking at five of the brands that Morgan has partnered with (San Diego Wave FC, HBO Max, Nike, Orgain, Peacock), she’s generated an EMV of nearly $2.4 million in the first half of 2023, while Rapinoe has generated an EMV of $367.2 across three brands (Lego, Nike, Uninterrupted). Nike is also leveraging creator marketing with other team members including Sophia Smith, Rose Lavelle and Lynn Williams. </p><p>One of <a href=""https://www.instagram.com/p/CtUT1GjxUtX/?img_index=1"">Morgan’s top social posts with Nike from June</a> generated an EMV of $123.8k, with  post-level engagement rate of 3.4%, which CreatorIQ considered above average compared to other influencers of a similar sized following.</p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><a href=""https://www.instagram.com/p/CtUT1GjxUtX/?img_index=3""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/07/Screenshot-2023-07-24-at-12.26.59-PM.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1836"" height=""1092"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/07/Screenshot-2023-07-24-at-12.26.59-PM.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/07/Screenshot-2023-07-24-at-12.26.59-PM.png 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1600/2023/07/Screenshot-2023-07-24-at-12.26.59-PM.png 1600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/07/Screenshot-2023-07-24-at-12.26.59-PM.png 1836w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></a></figure><p>CreatorIQ also examined Instagram audience growth for a few of the team members. 18-year-old Alyssa Thompson (the first teenager to make the U.S. women’s roster since 1995) stands out with an explosive 140.5% increase in Instagram followers since February 2023. Naomi Girma has grown her Instagram audience by 73%, while Sophia Smith has seen a 33% increase and Trinity Rodman has increased her followers by 19.2% since February. All of them have partnered with brands for various social promotions. </p>",64bea1b18785870001bb50ec,"As the U.S. Women’s National Team navigates an attempt to win its third World Cup title in a row, audiences worldwide will be glued to screens — and not just TVs. Even before kickoff, brands have been taking note of the rising popularity of female sports and have tapped into creator social marketing with multiple members of the women’s U.S. national team.

According to an analysis from CreatorIQ, Alex Morgan and Megan Rapinoe are two of the team members who have generated notable earned media value (EMV) for brands in the first half of 2023. Looking at five of the brands that Morgan has partnered with (San Diego Wave FC, HBO Max, Nike, Orgain, Peacock), she’s generated an EMV of nearly $2.4 million in the first half of 2023, while Rapinoe has generated an EMV of $367.2 across three brands (Lego, Nike, Uninterrupted). Nike is also leveraging creator marketing with other team members including Sophia Smith, Rose Lavelle and Lynn Williams.

One of Morgan’s top social posts with Nike from June generated an EMV of $123.8k, with  post-level engagement rate of 3.4%, which CreatorIQ considered above average compared to other influencers of a similar sized following.

CreatorIQ also examined Instagram audience growth for a few of the team members. 18-year-old Alyssa Thompson (the first teenager to make the U.S. women’s roster since 1995) stands out with an explosive 140.5% increase in Instagram followers since February 2023. Naomi Girma has grown her Instagram audience by 73%, while Sophia Smith has seen a 33% increase and Trinity Rodman has increased her followers by 19.2% since February. Here's a look at the top 25 networks by viewership share for July 17-23 — head over to <a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/summer-sports-score-for-tv-watch-time"">TVREV to see the program ranking and insights about the top shows by watch-time.</a></em></p><p>Thanks in part to the Open Championship, <em>NBC Nightly News With Lester Holt</em> and <em>America’s Got Talent</em>, NBC rises from third to first place on the network ranking, capturing nearly 7% of minutes watched. </p><p>Additional insights around the most-watched networks from July 17-23:</p><ul><li>ABC remains in second place week-over-week, but increased its viewership share from 6.03% to 6.64%, driven in part by <em>GMA</em>, <em>ABC World News Tonight With David Muir</em> and the <em>CMA Fest </em>primetime concert special.</li><li>USA Network has the biggest week-over-week ranking increase, moving from No. 13 to No. 7 with its 2.26% of watch-time fueled in part by the Open Championship.</li><li>Networks that maintain their chart positions but increased viewership compared to the previous week include Fox News, Hallmark, MSNBC, TV Land, Nickelodeon, Oxygen and The CW.</li><li>TNT is the sole week-over-week ranking newcomer, moving up a single notch from No. 26 to No. 25, with 1.07% of minutes watched.</li></ul><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/07/InscapeTopNetworksJuly17-23.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""1018"" height=""1219"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/07/InscapeTopNetworksJuly17-23.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/07/InscapeTopNetworksJuly17-23.png 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/07/InscapeTopNetworksJuly17-23.png 1018w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></figure>",64bfdc1883f59800019e69c6,"Each week, we highlight the most-watched shows and networks using insights from Inscape, the currency-grade smart TV ACR data provider and data technology division of Vizio. Here's a look at the top 25 networks by viewership share for July 17-23 — head over to TVREV to see the program ranking and insights about the top shows by watch-time.

Thanks in part to the Open Championship, NBC Nightly News With Lester Holt and America’s Got Talent, NBC rises from third to first place on the network ranking, capturing nearly 7% of minutes watched.

Additional insights around the most-watched networks from July 17-23:

 * ABC remains in second place week-over-week, but increased its viewership share from 6.03% to 6.64%, driven in part by GMA, ABC World News Tonight With David Muir and the CMA Fest primetime concert special.
 * USA Network has the biggest week-over-week ranking increase, moving from No. 13 to No. 7 with its 2.26% of watch-time fueled in part by the Open Championship.
 * Networks that maintain their chart positions but increased viewership compared to the previous week include Fox News, Hallmark, MSNBC, TV Land, Nickelodeon, Oxygen and The CW.

Presumably the list won’t be limited to those leagues. But the idea of ESPN getting even deeper into business with these long-time partners did spur some questions — which we dive into below:</p><p><strong><strong>Which league partners make the most sense?</strong></strong></p><p>The key question starts at what we know — talks were already started with the NFL, NBA and MLB. Noticeably absent there is the NHL. But otherwise, this is an accurate picture of the leagues that are most heavily tied to ESPN already.</p><p>The chart above looks back at <a href=""http://ispot.tv/"">iSpot</a> data from 2022 to reveal which sorts of programming delivers the highest share of household TV ad impressions across ESPN and ESPN2. Of note, each sport/league’s totals include live competitions as well as syndicated airings and studio shows dedicated specifically to that sport (i.e. NFL Live is included in the larger NFL total).</p><p><strong>[<a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/espn-questions-strategic-partner-sports-mlb-nfl-nba"">Read the full article on TVREV</a>]</strong></p>",64c03ed783f59800019e69f0,"Reporting in the last week revealed that ESPN has already held talks with the NFL, NBA and MLB about minority investment stakes as part of said strategic partnerships. Presumably the list won’t be limited to those leagues. But the idea of ESPN getting even deeper into business with these long-time partners did spur some questions — which we dive into below:

Which league partners make the most sense?

The key question starts at what we know — talks were already started with the NFL, NBA and MLB. Noticeably absent there is the NHL. But otherwise, this is an accurate picture of the leagues that are most heavily tied to ESPN already.

The chart above looks back at iSpot data from 2022 to reveal which sorts of programming delivers the highest share of household TV ad impressions across ESPN and ESPN2. Of note, each sport/league’s totals include live competitions as well as syndicated airings and studio shows dedicated specifically to that sport (i.e. NFL Live is included in the larger NFL total).

[Read the full article on TVREV]",__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/07/espn-programming-sov--1-.jpg,0,post,published,,public,all,2023-07-25T21:29:59.000Z,2023-07-25T21:33:19.000Z,2023-07-25T21:32:47.000Z,,,,,,,1,64c14ce883f59800019e6a0a,3b70fe68-db00-4bf5-9e72-90c55a57d359,How Netflix Wins,how-netflix-wins-strategy-parrot-franchise-ip-international,,"{""root"":{""children"":[{""children"":[{""detail"":0,""format"":2,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""The following is from Brandon Katz of "",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1},{""children"":[{""detail"":0,""format"":2,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""Parrot Analytics"",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""link"",""version"":1,""rel"":null,""target"":null,""title"":null,""url"":""http://parrotanalytics.com""},{""detail"":0,""format"":2,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""..."",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""paragraph"",""version"":1},{""children"":[{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""Netflix, the market-leading streamer, has also recognized what the rest of Hollywood has always known: franchises (or proven on-screen hits that generate multiple entries) elicit recurring interest. Continuations or expansions of existing franchises ("",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1},{""detail"":0,""format"":2,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""Wednesday, Queen Charlotte, XO Kitty, The Witcher Blood Origin, Vikings Valhalla"",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1},{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":"") are among Netflix’s best premieres in this time frame. Building out familiar IP helps ease audience buy in as viewers are more likely to sample a series connected to a brand they already enjoy. This can also lead to better retention, as viewers eagerly anticipate the next "",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1},{""detail"":0,""format"":2,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""Bridgerton "",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1},{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""spinoff, which reduces churn. Locking in that viewer interest long term then provides a streamer with better pricing power."",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""paragraph"",""version"":1},{""type"":""image"",""version"":1,""src"":""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/07/Picture-1.jpeg"",""width"":2500,""height"":3424,""title"":"""",""alt"":"""",""caption"":"""",""cardWidth"":""regular"",""href"":""https://www.tvrev.com/news/netflixs-winning-strategies-hits-franchises-and-international-appeal""},{""children"":[{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""["",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1},{""children"":[{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""read the rest of Brandon Katz's post on TVREV"",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""link"",""version"":1,""rel"":null,""target"":null,""title"":null,""url"":""https://www.tvrev.com/news/netflixs-winning-strategies-hits-franchises-and-international-appeal""},{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""]"",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""paragraph"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""root"",""version"":1}}","<p><em>The following is from Brandon Katz of <a href=""http://parrotanalytics.com""><em>Parrot Analytics</em></a>...</em></p><p>Netflix, the market-leading streamer, has also recognized what the rest of Hollywood has always known: franchises (or proven on-screen hits that generate multiple entries) elicit recurring interest. Continuations or expansions of existing franchises (<em>Wednesday, Queen Charlotte, XO Kitty, The Witcher Blood Origin, Vikings Valhalla</em>) are among Netflix’s best premieres in this time frame. Building out familiar IP helps ease audience buy in as viewers are more likely to sample a series connected to a brand they already enjoy. This can also lead to better retention, as viewers eagerly anticipate the next <em>Bridgerton </em>spinoff, which reduces churn. Locking in that viewer interest long term then provides a streamer with better pricing power.</p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/netflixs-winning-strategies-hits-franchises-and-international-appeal""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/07/Picture-1.jpeg"" class=""kg-image"" alt="""" loading=""lazy"" width=""2000"" height=""2739"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/07/Picture-1.jpeg 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/07/Picture-1.jpeg 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1600/2023/07/Picture-1.jpeg 1600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w2400/2023/07/Picture-1.jpeg 2400w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></a></figure><p>[<a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/netflixs-winning-strategies-hits-franchises-and-international-appeal"">read the rest of Brandon Katz's post on TVREV</a>]</p>",64c14ce883f59800019e6a0a,"The following is from Brandon Katz of Parrot Analytics...

Netflix, the market-leading streamer, has also recognized what the rest of Hollywood has always known: franchises (or proven on-screen hits that generate multiple entries) elicit recurring interest. Continuations or expansions of existing franchises (Wednesday, Queen Charlotte, XO Kitty, The Witcher Blood Origin, Vikings Valhalla) are among Netflix’s best premieres in this time frame. Building out familiar IP helps ease audience buy in as viewers are more likely to sample a series connected to a brand they already enjoy. This can also lead to better retention, as viewers eagerly anticipate the next Bridgerton spinoff, which reduces churn. Locking in that viewer interest long term then provides a streamer with better pricing power.

""]]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>The FIFA Women's World Cup 2023 is well underway, and for many fans, Dani Rojas' catch-phrase is the name of the game.</p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""https://media.tenor.com/2VTeJMtPdtkAAAAC/football-is-life-ted-lasso.gif"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""498"" height=""280""></figure><p>As we march toward the knockout stages, <a href=""inscape.tv"">Inscape</a> shared some quick viewership insights around the first set of games which took place July 20-25. During that initial group stage, WWC matches captured 0.90% of all live, linear minutes watched on TV, putting it at No. 4 on the program ranking behind the 2023 Open Championship (3.04%), GMA (0.96%) and MLB (0.96%).</p><p>The most-watched match was the U.S. vs. Vietnam, which accounted for nearly half (43.9%) of all WWC minutes watched July 20-25. As we march toward the knockout stages, Inscape shared some quick viewership insights around the first set of games which took place July 20-25. During that initial group stage, WWC matches captured 0.90% of all live, linear minutes watched on TV, putting it at No. 4 on the program ranking behind the 2023 Open Championship (3.04%), GMA (0.96%) and MLB (0.96%).

The most-watched match was the U.S. vs. Vietnam, which accounted for nearly half (43.9%) of all WWC minutes watched July 20-25. The Canada vs. Nigeria game took second place for watch-time (10.9%).

Inscape also examined where U.S. tune-in was highest, and discovered that the local area markets of San Francisco-Oak-San Jose, New Orleans and Milwaukee had the highest reach.

According to <a href=""https://www.ispot.tv/products/creative-testing"">iSpot’s Creative Assessment</a>, this commercial scored above the auto norm for attention, likability, desire and relevance.</li><li>Subaru owns the No. 3 and No. 4 ads, which combine for 370.7 million impressions.                     <!--kg-card-end: html-->",64c3cffce69f3e0001ef7a50,"With 217.1 million national TV ad impressions, Chevrolet's ad for the '24 Trax leads iSpot's ranking of most-seen auto TV ads for July 17-23. Of those impressions, 23.6% were generated by the 2023 Open Championship.

 * Ram Trucks takes second place with a spot promoting its ""Make This the Summer"" sales event (208.2 million TV ad impressions). According to iSpot’s Creative Assessment, this commercial scored above the auto norm for attention, likability, desire and relevance.
 * Subaru owns the No. 3 and No. 4 ads, which combine for 370.7 million impressions. Notably, it was the only automaker in the top five ranking that didn't advertise during the Open Championship.
 * Mercedes-Benz's fifth-place ad (166.8 million impressions) had a 91% brand match (the percentage of survey respondents who remembered it was a Mercedes-Benz ad after watching it), above the recent automaker industry norm of 78%.

""]]]],""ghostVersion"":""4.0""}",,"<p>Shark Week, Discovery's annual summer shindig celebrating all things jaws, chomped off a bigger slice of household TV ad impressions this year compared to Shark Week 2022, according to data from <a href=""ispot.tv"">iSpot.tv</a>. </p><p>For July 23-29, 2023, Discovery generated 662.7 million primetime TV ad impressions, an 11% increase from 2022's primetime impressions. Ad airings were up 9% as well. Across all networks, Discovery had a primetime impressions share of voice of 2.30%, ranking it the No. 11 network for primetime SOV. By comparison, the network had a 2.10% SOV for Shark Week 2022 (also ranking No. 11). </p><p>The deep sea dive is clearly a draw for Discovery: For the 2023 Sun-Sat period before Shark Week, Discovery ranked No. 15 for primetime network SOV (1.72%), per iSpot. </p><p>Top brands advertising during Shark Week programming (ranked by impressions SOV) included Domino's, L'OR Barista, ProNamel, Force Factor and Infiniti. Notably, of these five only Domino's advertised during Shark Week 2022. </p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/07/shark-week-2023-brands-sov.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt loading=""lazy"" width=""706"" height=""447"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/07/shark-week-2023-brands-sov.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/07/shark-week-2023-brands-sov.png 706w""></figure><p><a href=""inscape.tv"">Inscape</a> data reveals that there were more minutes watched overall on Discovery during Shark Week than a regular week: It had a 1.75% viewership share for July 23-29, 2023, putting it at No. 10 in the network ranking. By comparison, for the previous Sun-Sat period (July 16-22), Discovery had a 1.08% viewership share (No. 23). </p><p>Discovery’s most-watched Shark Week fare was <em>Belly of the Beast: Feeding Frenzy</em> — the first of its 2023 offerings — which captured nearly 4% of all minutes watched on Discovery during Shark Week, per Inscape. </p>",64c7c48f76004a00010e9488,"Shark Week, Discovery's annual summer shindig celebrating all things jaws, chomped off a bigger slice of household TV ad impressions this year compared to Shark Week 2022, according to data from iSpot.tv.

For July 23-29, 2023, Discovery generated 662.7 million primetime TV ad impressions, an 11% increase from 2022's primetime impressions. Ad airings were up 9% as well. Across all networks, Discovery had a primetime impressions share of voice of 2.30%, ranking it the No. 11 network for primetime SOV. By comparison, the network had a 2.10% SOV for Shark Week 2022 (also ranking No. 11).

The deep sea dive is clearly a draw for Discovery: For the 2023 Sun-Sat period before Shark Week, Discovery ranked No. 15 for primetime network SOV (1.72%), per iSpot.

Top brands advertising during Shark Week programming (ranked by impressions SOV) included Domino's, L'OR Barista, ProNamel, Force Factor and Infiniti. Notably, of these five only Domino's advertised during Shark Week 2022.

Inscape data reveals that there were more minutes watched overall on Discovery during Shark Week than a regular week: It had a 1.75% viewership share for July 23-29, 2023, putting it at No. 10 in the network ranking. By comparison, for the previous Sun-Sat period (July 16-22), Discovery had a 1.08% viewership share (No. 23).

Discovery’s most-watched Shark Week fare was Belly of the Beast: Feeding Frenzy — the first of its 2023 offerings — which captured nearly 4% of all minutes watched on Discovery during Shark Week, per Inscape.",https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1563186627-0d185db94083?crop=entropy&cs=tinysrgb&fit=max&fm=jpg&ixid=M3wxMTc3M3wwfDF8c2VhcmNofDZ8fHNoYXJrfGVufDB8fHx8MTY5MDgxNDI1Nnww&ixlib=rb-4.0.3&q=80&w=2000,0,post,published,,public,all,2023-07-31T14:26:23.000Z,2023-07-31T14:55:26.000Z,2023-07-31T14:55:26.000Z,Primetime household TV ad impressions increased this Shark Week vs. 2022. ,,,,,,1,64c914803d8c4d0001de4df4,bfedfe4f-1a49-4d33-b7b2-e0a352110738,ABC Leads Inscape’s Ranking of Most-Watched Networks for July 24-30,abc-leads-inscapes-ranking-of-most-watched-networks-for-july-24-30,"{""version"":""0.3.1"",""atoms"":[],""cards"":[[""image"",{""src"":""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/08/InscapeTopNetworksJuly24-30.png"",""width"":1018,""height"":1219}]],""markups"":[[""em""],[""a"",[""href"",""inscape.tv""]],[""a"",[""href"",""https://www.tvrev.com/news/mlb-slides-into-first-for-tv-watch-time""]],[""a"",[""href"",""__GHOST_URL__/shark-week-takes-bigger-bite-for-tv-ad-impressions/""]]],""sections"":[[1,""p"",[[0,[0],0,""Each week, we highlight the most-watched shows and networks using insights from ""],[0,[1],1,""Inscape""],[0,[],0,"", the currency-grade smart TV ACR data provider and data technology division of Vizio. Data is linear, live TV only and includes all episode types (new and reruns). Rankings are by percent share duration (i.e., time spent watching).
