TVREV"",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""link"",""version"":1,""rel"":""noreferrer"",""target"":null,""title"":null,""url"":""https://www.tvrev.com/news/netflixs-declining-supply-share-is-a-sign-of-streamings-changing-dynamics""},{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""]"",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":null,""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""paragraph"",""version"":1},{""type"":""image"",""version"":1,""src"":""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/10/Parrot_Analytics_Netflix-Total-Share-of-Global-Streaming-Original-Series-and-Quarterly-Premieres.jpeg"",""width"":2500,""height"":3000,""title"":"""",""alt"":"""",""caption"":"""",""cardWidth"":""regular"",""href"":""https://www.tvrev.com/news/netflixs-declining-supply-share-is-a-sign-of-streamings-changing-dynamics""},{""children"":[],""direction"":null,""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""paragraph"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""root"",""version"":1}}","<p><em>The following is</em>&nbsp;<em>a selection</em>&nbsp;<em>from Brandon Katz of</em>&nbsp;<a href=""http://parrotanalytics.com/?ref=themeasure.net""><em>Parrot Analytics</em></a><em>.</em></p><p>Netflix’s streaming originals footprint is quickly shrinking, according to data from <a href=""http://parrotanalytics.com"">Parrot Analytics</a>. And its share of premieres has dipped even further, as the competitive landscape catches up.</p><ul><li>Netflix’s supply share of global streaming original titles has steadily ticked down since 2020, as new competitors entered the field, falling from 33.1% in Q1 2020 to 25.3% in Q3 2023. </li><li>Looking at the supply share of new premieres during each quarter, the impact of Netflix’s increased competition is even more stark. </li><li>As recently as Q3 2021, Netflix accounted for 30.2% of all new streaming original titles released globally. Fast forward two years and Netflix’s share of new streaming originals worldwide is down to 14.7%. Each quarter in 2023 has seen Netflix’s supply share of new streaming original premieres drop below 15%.&nbsp;</li></ul><p>[<a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/netflixs-declining-supply-share-is-a-sign-of-streamings-changing-dynamics"" rel=""noreferrer"">read the rest of Brandon Katz's post on TVREV</a>]</p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/netflixs-declining-supply-share-is-a-sign-of-streamings-changing-dynamics""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/10/Parrot_Analytics_Netflix-Total-Share-of-Global-Streaming-Original-Series-and-Quarterly-Premieres.jpeg"" class=""kg-image"" alt="""" loading=""lazy"" width=""2000"" height=""2400"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/10/Parrot_Analytics_Netflix-Total-Share-of-Global-Streaming-Original-Series-and-Quarterly-Premieres.jpeg 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/10/Parrot_Analytics_Netflix-Total-Share-of-Global-Streaming-Original-Series-and-Quarterly-Premieres.jpeg 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1600/2023/10/Parrot_Analytics_Netflix-Total-Share-of-Global-Streaming-Original-Series-and-Quarterly-Premieres.jpeg 1600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w2400/2023/10/Parrot_Analytics_Netflix-Total-Share-of-Global-Streaming-Original-Series-and-Quarterly-Premieres.jpeg 2400w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></a></figure>",6530300b108ae80001abba83,"The following is a selection from Brandon Katz of Parrot Analytics.

Netflix’s streaming originals footprint is quickly shrinking, according to data from Parrot Analytics. And its share of premieres has dipped even further, as the competitive landscape catches up.

 * Netflix’s supply share of global streaming original titles has steadily ticked down since 2020, as new competitors entered the field, falling from 33.1% in Q1 2020 to 25.3% in Q3 2023.
 * Looking at the supply share of new premieres during each quarter, the impact of Netflix’s increased competition is even more stark.
 * As recently as Q3 2021, Netflix accounted for 30.2% of all new streaming original titles released globally. Fast forward two years and Netflix’s share of new streaming originals worldwide is down to 14.7%. Each quarter in 2023 has seen Netflix’s supply share of new streaming original premieres drop below 15%. 

[read the rest of Brandon Katz's post on TVREV]",https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1621955964441-c173e01c135b?crop=entropy&cs=tinysrgb&fit=max&fm=jpg&ixid=M3wxMTc3M3wwfDF8c2VhcmNofDF8fG5ldGZsaXh8ZW58MHx8fHwxNjk3NjU3NjYxfDA&ixlib=rb-4.0.3&q=80&w=2000,0,post,published,,public,all,2023-10-18T19:20:43.000Z,2023-10-18T19:47:47.000Z,2023-10-18T16:35:00.000Z,,,,,,,1,65303454108ae80001abbaa2,57d2c547-ec55-406f-ba38-0cd1ad22809a,Which ‘Plus’ Gets Biggest Ad Push?,which-plus-gets-biggest-ad-push-ispot-streaming-tv-advertising-q3-report,,"{""root"":{""children"":[{""children"":[{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""Paramount+ is getting the biggest TV promo push of any streaming service, and in general, streamers are betting on NFL audiences – as new data from "",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1},{""children"":[{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""iSpot’s Q3 report"",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""link"",""version"":1,""rel"":""noreferrer"",""target"":null,""title"":null,""url"":""https://www.ispot.tv/hub/resources/free-reports/2023-q3-tv-transparency-report/""},{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":"" showcases."",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""paragraph"",""version"":1},{""children"":[{""children"":[{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""NFL games delivered 9% of Q3 TV ad impressions for streaming services (No. 1 among all programs), while college football ranked second with 3.2%. absolutely dominated the music and video streaming landscape when it came to Earned Media Value (EMV) in September: <a href=""https://www.adweek.com/adweek-wire/spotify-reigns-supreme-for-earned-media-value-among-streaming-brands-in-september/"" rel=""noreferrer"">According to a new report from CreatorIQ</a>, creators generated a massive $159.8 million EMV for the music behemoth, over twice as much as the No. 2 brand, Netflix. Spotify also boasted the largest community size and highest potency among the top ten streaming brands, with EMV per creator averaging around $34.1K.</p><p>Notably, CreatorIQ’s analysis revealed that in general, gaming and sports podcasts drive more EMV for Spotify than musicians:&nbsp;</p><ul><li>Comedic YouTube duo Lanky Box was one of its top creators by EMV for the month, driving $23.5 million.&nbsp;</li><li>At No. 2 was New Heights, the podcast from NFL brothers Travis and Jason Kelce ($4.1 million EMV).</li></ul><p>You can download CreatorIQ’s full <a href=""https://www.creatoriq.com/top-streaming-services-september-2023"">September leaderboard for streaming brands here</a>.&nbsp;</p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""https://lh7-us.googleusercontent.com/f_rOOjJqgIPJw0Hzu2PUFRhd_rvdvOdZ6zOyjam0d1b0OhFsGOTh5PIQoKrgfAlbC9_wYE-bfqcHzfA28mNNJT7aVMSB2u2dhXFXnCt3vFbA_o8EEdvz5CKgKW-A_Tr7dGairDwfdXXlS8BHj6nBrBw"" class=""kg-image"" alt="""" loading=""lazy"" width=""624"" height=""393""></figure>",65314330b732800001aeb368,"Spotify absolutely dominated the music and video streaming landscape when it came to Earned Media Value (EMV) in September: According to a new report from CreatorIQ, creators generated a massive $159.8 million EMV for the music behemoth, over twice as much as the No. 2 brand, Netflix. Spotify also boasted the largest community size and highest potency among the top ten streaming brands, with EMV per creator averaging around $34.1K.

Notably, CreatorIQ’s analysis revealed that in general, gaming and sports podcasts drive more EMV for Spotify than musicians: 

 * Comedic YouTube duo Lanky Box was one of its top creators by EMV for the month, driving $23.5 million. 
 * At No. 2 was New Heights, the podcast from NFL brothers Travis and Jason Kelce ($4.1 million EMV).

"",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""listitem"",""version"":1,""value"":2},{""children"":[{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""Comcast was up from 125.3 million to 158.3 million, and Fox flew from 66.2 million viewers to 93.9 million."",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""listitem"",""version"":1,""value"":3}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""list"",""version"":1,""listType"":""bullet"",""start"":1,""tag"":""ul""}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""root"",""version"":1}}","<p><a href=""http://tubularlabs.com"" rel=""noreferrer"">Tubular Audience Ratings</a> show how the NFL is giving traditional media companies a major boost.</p><p>September marked the return of NFL action, and with it, larger U.S. audiences for the league’s TV rights holders. The Walt Disney Company (+4%), Paramount (+2%), Comcast (+4%) and Fox Corporation (+14%) all increased domestic unique viewers across Facebook and YouTube month over month – partly on the back of football highlights.</p><ul><li>After a summer hampered by work stoppages, the media giants all saw significant improvements from 12 months ago. </li><li>Disney grew from 132.0 million to 161.4 million viewers year-over-year, while Paramount jumped from 139.9 million to 160.3 million viewers. </li><li>Comcast was up from 125.3 million to 158.3 million, and Fox flew from 66.2 million viewers to 93.9 million.</li></ul>",6536ac23ab0ef200014a62c6,"Tubular Audience Ratings show how the NFL is giving traditional media companies a major boost.

September marked the return of NFL action, and with it, larger U.S. audiences for the league’s TV rights holders. The Walt Disney Company (+4%), Paramount (+2%), Comcast (+4%) and Fox Corporation (+14%) all increased domestic unique viewers across Facebook and YouTube month over month – partly on the back of football highlights.

 * After a summer hampered by work stoppages, the media giants all saw significant improvements from 12 months ago.
 * Disney grew from 132.0 million to 161.4 million viewers year-over-year, while Paramount jumped from 139.9 million to 160.3 million viewers.
 * Comcast was up from 125.3 million to 158.3 million, and Fox flew from 66.2 million viewers to 93.9 Flavor?,do-tv-audiences-need-local-flavor-tvrev-report-broadcast,,"{""root"":{""children"":[{""children"":[{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""Audiences are torn about whether they need local broadcast stations to feel sufficiently informed, as TVREV’s report, "",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1},{""children"":[{""detail"":0,""format"":8,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""Local TV: Perils & Promise In the Age of Streaming"",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""link"",""version"":1,""rel"":null,""target"":null,""title"":null,""url"":""https://www.tvrev.com/special-reports/p/local-tv-perils-promise-in-the-age-of-streaming?ref=themeasure.net""},{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":"", notes."",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""paragraph"",""version"":1},{""children"":[{""children"":[{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""According to the report, 35% of respondents (all over 25 years old) stated they would feel sufficiently informed by other sources if their local broadcast stations shut information."",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""listitem"",""version"":1,""value"":2},{""children"":[{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""Being okay with moving on from local broadcast seems correlated in part to age. The report also found that over 40% of audiences 25-to-54 would be fine with local broadcast going away, while less than 30% of respondents 55 and older felt the same way."",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""listitem"",""version"":1,""value"":3}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""list"",""version"":1,""listType"":""bullet"",""start"":1,""tag"":""ul""},{""children"":[],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""paragraph"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""root"",""version"":1}}","<p>Audiences are torn about whether they need local broadcast stations to feel sufficiently informed, as TVREV’s report,&nbsp;<a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/special-reports/p/local-tv-perils-promise-in-the-age-of-streaming?ref=themeasure.net""><u>Local TV: Perils &amp; Promise In the Age of Streaming</u></a>, notes.</p><ul><li>According to the report, 35% of respondents (all over 25 years old) stated they would feel sufficiently informed by other sources if their local broadcast stations shut down.</li><li>But 27% felt they wouldn't be – meanwhile, 38% said they were unsure – which creates some uncertainty around how vital local broadcast is seen in today's sea of information.</li><li>Being okay with moving on from local broadcast seems correlated in part to age. The report also found that over 40% of audiences 25-to-54 would be fine with local broadcast going away, while less than 30% of respondents 55 and older felt the same way.</li></ul>",6536f7afab0ef200014a62ee,"Audiences are torn about whether they need local broadcast stations to feel sufficiently informed, as TVREV’s report, Local TV: Perils & Promise In the Age of Streaming, notes.

 * According to the report, 35% of respondents (all over 25 years old) stated they would feel sufficiently informed by other sources if their local broadcast stations shut down.
 * But 27% felt they wouldn't be – meanwhile, 38% said they were unsure – which creates some uncertainty around how vital local broadcast is seen in today's sea of information.
 * Being okay with moving on from local broadcast seems correlated in part to age. The report also found that over 40% of audiences 25-to-54 would be fine with local broadcast going away, while less than 30% of respondents 55 and older felt the same way.",__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/10/Screen-Shot-2023-10-25-at-11.27.00-AM.png,0,post,published,,public,all,2023-10-23T22:46:07.000Z,2023-10-25T18:28:09.000Z,2023-10-25T18:28:09.000Z,,,,,,,1,6537cece53718500015cccbe,72c0f758-db0c-421f-901c-76b79094a5f2,Football Propels CBS to Top of TV Network Ranking,football-propels-cbs-to-top-of-tv-network-ranking,,"{""root"":{""children"":[{""children"":[{""detail"":0,""format"":2,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""Each week, we highlight the most-watched shows and networks using insights from "",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1},{""children"":[{""detail"":0,""format"":2,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""Inscape"",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""link"",""version"":1,""rel"":null,""target"":null,""title"":null,""url"":""http://inscape.tv""},{""detail"":0,""format"":2,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":"", the currency-grade smart TV ACR data provider and data technology division of Vizio. division of Vizio. Data is linear, live TV only and includes all episode types (new and reruns). Rankings are by percent share duration (i.e., time spent watching). Here's a look at the top 25 networks by viewership share for October 16-22 — head over to TVREV to see the <a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/with-league-championship-games-mlb-increases-tv-viewership-share"" rel=""noreferrer""><em>program ranking</em></a> and get insights about the top shows by watch-time.</em></p><p>CBS jumps from fourth to first place week-over-week, with NFL and college football games largely contributing to its 8.62% viewership share. NBC, which had been king for three weeks in a row, slips to No. 2, while ABC remains in third week-over-week.&nbsp;</p><p>Additional insights around the most-watched TV networks from October 16-22:</p><ul><li>Fox Sports 1 rockets up the ranking from No. 23 to No. 8, thanks largely to MLB games, which accounted for over 60% of all minutes watched on the network.&nbsp;</li><li>There are three week-over-week ranking newcomers: Hallmark Movies &amp; Mysteries (No. 22), History (No. 24) and Bravo (No. 25). Of those, Hallmark Movies &amp; Mysteries saw the biggest increase in viewership share (from 0.72% to 0.82%), with nearly a quarter of watch-time spent on <em>Murder, She Wrote.</em>&nbsp;</li><li>Halloween hasn’t even happened yet, but Hallmark Movies &amp; Mysteries is already leaning into the holiday season: Of the network’s top ten programs by watch-time, six are Christmas themed.</li></ul><p>Check out the <a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/with-league-championship-games-mlb-increases-tv-viewership-share"" rel=""noreferrer"">latest ranking of most-watched TV programs</a> at TVREV.</p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/10/InscapeTopNetworksOct16-22.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt="""" loading=""lazy"" width=""1018"" height=""1219"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/10/InscapeTopNetworksOct16-22.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/10/InscapeTopNetworksOct16-22.png 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/10/InscapeTopNetworksOct16-22.png 1018w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></figure>",6537cece53718500015cccbe,"Each week, we highlight the most-watched shows and networks using insights from Inscape, the currency-grade smart TV ACR data provider and data technology division of Vizio. Data is linear, live TV only and includes all episode types (new and reruns). Rankings are by percent share duration (i.e., time spent watching). Here's a look at the top 25 networks by viewership share for October 16-22 — head over to TVREV to see the program ranking and get insights about the top shows by watch-time.

CBS jumps from fourth to first place week-over-week, with NFL and college football games largely contributing to its 8.62% viewership share. NBC, which had been king for three weeks in a row, slips to No. 2, while ABC remains in third week-over-week. 

Additional insights around the most-watched TV networks from October 16-22:

 * Fox Sports 1 rockets up the ranking from No. 23 to No. 8, thanks largely to MLB games, which accounted for over 60% of all minutes watched on the network. 
 * There are three week-over-week ranking newcomers: Hallmark Movies & Mysteries (No. 22), History (No. 24) and Bravo (No. 25). Of those, Hallmark Movies & Mysteries saw the biggest increase in viewership share (from 0.72% to 0.82%), with nearly a quarter of watch-time spent on Murder, She Wrote. 
 * Halloween hasn’t even happened yet, but Hallmark Movies & Mysteries is already leaning into the holiday season: Of the network’s top ten programs by watch-time, six are Christmas themed.

to a <a href=""https://www.ispot.tv/hub/the-drama-and-talk-shows-behind-cpgs-q3-tv-ad-growth/"" rel=""noreferrer"">new report from iSpot</a>, Q3 household TV ad impressions for consumer packaged goods climbed nearly 11% year-over-year on national linear TV. Notably, CPG brands spent the quarter leaning into program genres like drama &amp; action, which have been effective at providing TV ad reach.</p><ul><li>Drama &amp; action shows accounted for nearly 16% of CPG TV ad impressions in Q3, delivering 8.6% more ad impressions YoY for CPG brands. </li><li>Combined,&nbsp;<em>Law &amp; Order: SVU</em>,&nbsp;<em>NCIS</em>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<em>Chicago Fire</em>&nbsp;were responsible for more than a quarter of those drama &amp; action impressions. ION delivered 24.1% of the industry’s drama &amp; action ad impressions, showing the power of re-air programming for CPG.&nbsp;</li><li>Primetime CPG TV ad impressions grew slightly year-over-year&nbsp;in Q3 as brands focused on re-airs of programs like&nbsp;<em>Everybody Loves Raymond</em>&nbsp;and crime procedurals, plus&nbsp;<em>America’s Got Talent</em>&nbsp;and (come September) college football.</li><li>Daytime CPG TV ad impressions grew as well, thanks to significant increases during soap operas like&nbsp;<em>The Young and the Restless</em>&nbsp;(+26% YoY) and&nbsp;<em>General Hospital</em>&nbsp;(+48% YoY).&nbsp;</li></ul><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><a href=""https://www.ispot.tv/hub/the-drama-and-talk-shows-behind-cpgs-q3-tv-ad-growth/""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/10/Screen-Shot-2023-10-23-at-12.13.30-PM.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt="""" loading=""lazy"" width=""1230"" height=""1076"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/10/Screen-Shot-2023-10-23-at-12.13.30-PM.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/10/Screen-Shot-2023-10-23-at-12.13.30-PM.png 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/10/Screen-Shot-2023-10-23-at-12.13.30-PM.png 1230w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></a></figure>",65381b2153718500015cccda,"According to a new report from iSpot, Q3 household TV ad impressions for consumer packaged goods climbed nearly 11% year-over-year on national linear TV. Notably, CPG brands spent the quarter leaning into program genres like drama & action, which have been effective at providing TV ad reach.

 * Drama & action shows accounted for nearly 16% of CPG TV ad impressions in Q3, delivering 8.6% more ad impressions YoY for CPG brands.
 * Combined, Law & Order: SVU, NCIS and Chicago Fire were responsible for more than a quarter of those drama & action impressions. ION delivered 24.1% of the industry’s drama & action ad impressions, showing the power of re-air programming for CPG. 
 * Primetime CPG TV ad impressions grew slightly year-over-year in Q3 as brands focused on re-airs of programs like Everybody Loves Raymond and crime procedurals, plus America’s Got Talent and (come September) college football.
 * Daytime CPG TV ad impressions grew as well, thanks to significant increases during soap operas like The Young and the Restless (+26% YoY) and General Hospital (+48% YoY). ",__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/10/NUP_201333_00121.jpeg,0,post,published,,public,all,2023-10-24T19:29:37.000Z,2023-10-24T19:36:31.000Z,2023-10-24T19:36:14.000Z,,,,,,,1,65381d6553718500015ccd13,dedfa810-992b-4119-b1f9-4d47e96b3af6,Targeting Testosterone? study makes the case that many TV ad campaigns are still out of step with household purchasing trends in the United States, since women control or influence "",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1},{""children"":[{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""85% of U.S. consumer spending"",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""link"",""version"":1,""rel"":null,""target"":null,""title"":null,""url"":""https://girlpowermarketing.com/statistics-purchasing-power-women/""},{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""."",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""listitem"",""version"":1,""value"":4}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""list"",""version"":1,""listType"":""bullet"",""start"":1,""tag"":""ul""},{""type"":""image"",""version"":1,""src"":""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/10/songtradr-image-gender.jpg"",""width"":1375,""height"":787,""title"":"""",""alt"":"""",""caption"":"""",""cardWidth"":""regular"",""href"":""""},{""children"":[],""direction"":null,""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""paragraph"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""root"",""version"":1}}","<p>Popular TV ads are more likely to license music that appeals to men instead of women, <a href=""https://www.adweek.com/adweek-wire/songtradr-music-in-tv-ads-more-likely-to-appeal-to-men/"" rel=""noreferrer"">according to a new study</a> from&nbsp;<a href=""http://songtradr.com/"">Songtradr</a>. AI sonic analysis technology from Songtradr examined the top 50 TV ads with licensed songs this year (by household TV ad impressions, per <a href=""http://ispot.tv"" rel=""noreferrer"">iSpot</a>), and found the average music selection skewed toward music that men are more likely to prefer.</p><ul><li>Among the songs in those top 50 ads, the average favorability rating for men was 52%, versus 48% for women. </li><li>For the songs that scored more favorably for women, less than half had a score of 75% or higher (meaning most were not overwhelmingly favorable). </li><li>Meanwhile, 70% of favorable songs for men scored 75% or higher – indicating more ads leaned heavily into music that overwhelmingly appealed to men.</li><li>The study makes the case that many TV ad campaigns are still out of step with household purchasing trends in the United States, since women control or influence&nbsp;<a href=""https://girlpowermarketing.com/statistics-purchasing-power-women/"">85% of U.S. consumer spending</a>.</li></ul><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/10/songtradr-image-gender.jpg"" class=""kg-image"" alt="""" loading=""lazy"" width=""1375"" height=""787"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/10/songtradr-image-gender.jpg 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/10/songtradr-image-gender.jpg 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/10/songtradr-image-gender.jpg 1375w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></figure>",65381d6553718500015ccd13,"Popular TV ads are more likely to license music that appeals to men instead of women, according to a new study from Songtradr. AI sonic analysis technology from Songtradr examined the top 50 TV ads with licensed songs this year (by household TV ad impressions, per iSpot), and found the average music selection skewed toward music that men are more likely to prefer.

 * Among the songs in those top 50 ads, the average favorability rating for men was 52%, versus 48% for women.
 * For the songs that scored more favorably for women, less than half had a score of 75% or higher (meaning most were not overwhelmingly favorable).
 * Meanwhile, 70% of favorable songs for men scored 75% or higher – indicating more ads leaned heavily into music that overwhelmingly appealed to men.
 * The study makes the case that many TV ad campaigns are still out of step with household purchasing trends in the United States, since women control or influence 85% of U.S. consumer spending.",https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1509098681029-b45e9c845022?crop=entropy&cs=tinysrgb&fit=max&fm=jpg&ixid=M3wxMTc3M3wwfDF8c2VhcmNofDR8fG1hbiUyMGhlYWRwaG9uZXN8ZW58MHx8fHwxNjk4MTc2NTcyfDA&ixlib=rb-4.0.3&q=80&w=2000,0,post,published,,public,all,2023-10-24T19:39:17.000Z,2023-10-24T19:52:03.000Z,2023-10-23T12:00:00.000Z,,,,,,,1,6539d67f53718500015ccd94,1640a808-cace-4b46-8049-46c344df9053,Special Report: Getting (More) Transparent About TV In Q3,special-report-more-transparency-tv-ispot-q3-2023-advertising,,"{""root"":{""children"":[{""children"":[{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""The summer season, entertainment industry disruptions and limited major programming events in Q3 highlighted a critical need for transparency in the TV ad industry. highlighted a critical need for transparency in the TV ad industry.

 * Household TV ad impressions saw a modest 1.4% YoY increase in Q3, while estimated national spend dipped by 5.95%.
 * However, the real story lies in the resilience of TV ads in reaching and resonating with viewers – particularly during re-air favorites like Friends, NCIS and Everybody Loves Raymond.

"",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""listitem"",""version"":1,""value"":1},{""children"":[{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""ABC News grew 3%, to 30.6 million (but also grew minutes watched by 14% month-over-month), while CBS News saw 51% more unique viewers. CNN’s U.S. unique viewers grew by 7% month-over-month, Fox News was up 4% and MSNBC climbed 1%. "",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""listitem"",""version"":1,""value"":3},{""children"":[{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""For cable news creators, the most-watched videos of the month were primarily focused on national politics (and particularly, Donald Trump)."",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""listitem"",""version"":1,""value"":4}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""list"",""version"":1,""listType"":""bullet"",""start"":1,""tag"":""ul""},{""type"":""image"",""version"":1,""src"":""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/10/copy-tubular-media-comapnies-upward.jpg"",""width"":1453,""height"":787,""title"":"""",""alt"":"""",""caption"":"""",""cardWidth"":""regular"",""href"":""http://tubularlabs.com""},{""children"":[],""direction"":null,""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""paragraph"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""root"",""version"":1}}","<p>Cable and broadcast news surged in September 2023, as U.S. audiences tuned in to stay informed – but also for less newsworthy fodder as well, according to <a href=""http://tubularlabs.com"" rel=""noreferrer"">Tubular Labs</a>.</p><ul><li>As part of their monthly Audience Ratings findings, Tubular found that in September, NBC News saw its U.S. unique viewers across Facebook and YouTube climb by 19% month-over-month to 44.2 million. </li><li>ABC News grew 3%, to 30.6 million (but also grew minutes watched by 14% month-over-month), while CBS News saw 51% more unique viewers. Audiences were primarily watching local videos of surprising incidents that had virality to them.</li><li>Cable news saw its own increases as well. CNN’s U.S. unique viewers grew by 7% month-over-month, Fox News was up 4% and MSNBC climbed 1%. </li><li>For cable news creators, the most-watched videos of the month were primarily focused on national politics (and particularly, Donald Trump).</li></ul><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><a href=""http://tubularlabs.com""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/10/copy-tubular-media-comapnies-upward.jpg"" class=""kg-image"" alt="""" loading=""lazy"" width=""1453"" height=""787"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/10/copy-tubular-media-comapnies-upward.jpg 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/10/copy-tubular-media-comapnies-upward.jpg 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/10/copy-tubular-media-comapnies-upward.jpg 1453w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></a></figure>",653ab2c453718500015cce2a,"Cable and broadcast news surged in September 2023, as U.S. audiences tuned in to stay informed – but also for less newsworthy fodder as well, according to Tubular Labs.

 * As part of their monthly Audience Ratings findings, Tubular found that in September, NBC News saw its U.S. unique viewers across Facebook and YouTube climb by 19% month-over-month to 44.2 million.
 * ABC News grew 3%, to 30.6 million (but also grew minutes watched by 14% month-over-month), while CBS News saw 51% more unique viewers. Audiences were primarily watching local videos of surprising incidents that had virality to them.
 * Cable news saw its own increases as well. CNN’s U.S. unique viewers grew by 7% month-over-month, Fox News was up 4% and MSNBC climbed 1%.
 * For cable news creators, the most-watched videos of the month were primarily focused on national politics (and particularly, Donald Trump).",https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1503694978374-8a2fa686963a?crop=entropy&cs=tinysrgb&fit=max&fm=jpg&ixid=M3wxMTc3M3wwfDF8c2VhcmNofDd8fG5ld3N8ZW58MHx8fHwxNjk4MzQ2OTAyfDA&ixlib=rb-4.0.3&q=80&w=2000,0,post,published,,public,all,2023-10-26T18:41:08.000Z,2023-10-26T19:02:56.000Z,2023-10-26T19:02:56.000Z,,,,,,,1,653ab32353718500015cce32,6df05955-fbf1-417e-a44b-c7adf9ab9ade,Kids Diana Show Surpasses Creator Peers in Fall Social Watchtime,kids-diana-show-surpasses-creator-peers-in-fall-social-watchtime,,"{""root"":{""children"":[{""children"":[{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""While school starting again usually means a dip for individual creator video viewers and minutes watched – and it did for the overwhelming majority of creators in September 2023 – there were some exceptions to that rule. "",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""paragraph"",""version"":1},{""children"":[{""children"":[{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""According to "",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1},{""children"":[{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""Tubular Labs"",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""link"",""version"":1,""rel"":""noreferrer"",""target"":null,""title"":null,""url"":""http://tubularlabs.com""},{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":"" Audience Ratings, Kids Diana Show stood apart from others, as one of just three of the top 20 U.S. creators (influencers) to increase domestic minutes watched month-over-month."",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""listitem"",""version"":1,""value"":1},{""children"":[{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""Kids Diana Show grew U.S. minutes watched across Facebook and YouTube 46% vs. August, to 421.5 million, while also growing unique U.S. viewers on those platforms by 25%. "",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""listitem"",""version"":1,""value"":2},{""children"":[{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""Along with new videos on popular topics like first day of school, mermaids and Paw Patrol, the channel also creates compilation videos of “top moments” from previous videos. In September, compilation “"",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1},{""children"":[{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""Diana and Roma Top Videos With Mom"",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""link"",""version"":1,""rel"":null,""target"":null,""title"":null,""url"":""https://youtu.be/hw4s_WTcyjw""},{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""” was the top video with over 15 million views."",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""listitem"",""version"":1,""value"":3}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""list"",""version"":1,""listType"":""bullet"",""start"":1,""tag"":""ul""}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""root"",""version"":1}}","<p>While school starting again usually means a dip for individual creator video viewers and minutes watched – and it did for the overwhelming majority of creators in September 2023 – there were some exceptions to that rule. </p><ul><li>According to <a href=""http://tubularlabs.com"" rel=""noreferrer"">Tubular Labs</a> Audience Ratings, Kids Diana Show stood apart from others, as one of just three of the top 20 U.S. creators (influencers) to increase domestic minutes watched month-over-month.</li><li>Kids Diana Show grew U.S. minutes watched across Facebook and YouTube 46% vs. August, to 421.5 million, while also growing unique U.S. viewers on those platforms by 25%. </li><li>Along with new videos on popular topics like first day of school, mermaids and Paw Patrol, the channel also creates compilation videos of “top moments” from previous videos. In September, compilation “<a href=""https://youtu.be/hw4s_WTcyjw"">Diana and Roma Top Videos With Mom</a>” was the top video with over 15 million views.</li></ul>",653ab32353718500015cce32,"While school starting again usually means a dip for individual creator video viewers and minutes watched – and it did for the overwhelming majority of creators in September 2023 – there were some exceptions to that rule.

 * According to Tubular Labs Audience Ratings, Kids Diana Show stood apart from others, as one of just three of the top 20 U.S. creators (influencers) to increase domestic minutes watched month-over-month.
 * Kids Diana Show grew U.S. minutes watched across Facebook and YouTube 46% vs. August, to 421.5 million, while also growing unique U.S. viewers on those platforms by 25%.
 * Along with new videos on popular topics like first day of school, mermaids and Paw Patrol, the channel also creates compilation videos of “top moments” from previous videos. "",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""listitem"",""version"":1,""value"":3}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""list"",""version"":1,""listType"":""bullet"",""start"":1,""tag"":""ul""},{""children"":[{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""["",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1},{""children"":[{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""read the rest of Brandon Katz's post on TVREV"",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""link"",""version"":1,""rel"":""noreferrer"",""target"":null,""title"":null,""url"":""https://www.tvrev.com/news/streamings-latest-balancing-act-new-releases-vs-old-favorites""},{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""]"",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":null,""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""paragraph"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""root"",""version"":1}}","<p><em>The following is</em>&nbsp;<em>a selection</em>&nbsp;<em>from Brandon Katz of</em>&nbsp;<a href=""http://parrotanalytics.com/?ref=themeasure.net""><em>Parrot Analytics</em></a><em>.</em></p><p>Apple TV+ has figured out how to generate demand around its shows – and keep it, even 6 to 12 months after initial release. Data from <a href=""http://parrotanalytics.com"">Parrot Analytics</a> spotlights how Apple shows are winning in both the short and long view.</p><ul><li>Apple TV+ had the largest share of audience demand in the U.S. last quarter concentrated among shows that released new episodes in the last six months – not surpising given the considerably smaller library of Apple TV+ compared to its rivals.</li><li>Disney+ had the smallest share of audience demand in the US last quarter for shows that released new episodes beyond that six month mark. </li><li>This chart presents the demand share for series that aired a new episode either in the last 12 or six months as of September 30, 2023, according to Parrot Analytics. Demand is expressed as a share of the total demand for a platform TV catalog. In essence, it helps provide clarity into whether or not a platform is mostly relying on freshly released new TV content or slightly older programming. </li></ul><p>[<a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/streamings-latest-balancing-act-new-releases-vs-old-favorites"" rel=""noreferrer"">read the rest of Brandon Katz's post on TVREV</a>]</p>",653ac2b953718500015cce6b,"The following is a selection from Brandon Katz of Parrot Analytics.

Apple TV+ has figured out how to generate demand around its shows – and keep it, even 6 to 12 months after initial release. Data from Parrot Analytics spotlights how Apple shows are winning in both the short and long view.

 * Apple TV+ had the largest share of audience demand in the U.S. last quarter concentrated among shows that released new episodes in the last six months – not surpising given the considerably smaller library of Apple TV+ compared to its rivals.
 * Disney+ had the smallest share of audience demand in the US last quarter for shows that released new episodes beyond that six month mark.
 * This chart presents the demand share for series that aired a new episode either in the last 12 or six months as of September 30, 2023, according to Parrot Analytics. Demand is expressed as a share of the total demand for a platform TV catalog. In essence, it helps provide clarity into whether or not a platform is mostly relying on freshly released new TV content or slightly older programming.

Taylor Swift is everywhere between her record-setting tour, album drops (both new and re-releases) and the Eras Tour in movie theaters – one place you don't see much of her is on TV – apart from some recent <a href=""https://apnews.com/article/taylor-swift-travis-kelce-chiefs-jets-1b1b3ba43139acefcbdf52072b018154"" rel=""noreferrer"">NFL Sundays</a>.</p><p>Data from <a href=""http://songtradr.com"" rel=""noreferrer"">Songtradr</a> reveals that the star's music actually hasn't been licensed for a single TV show or movie since 2008, when her music was used here and there during episodes of <em>90210</em> and <em>The Hills</em>. </p><ul><li>TV exposure via ads has also been pretty limited as well, with Capital One being the <a href=""https://www.ispot.tv/ad/2S2s/capital-one-venture-x-card-multiple-taylors-featuring-taylor-swift-spanish"" rel=""noreferrer"">only brand partner in commercials</a> since 2020.</li><li>Capital One has also done its part to <a href=""https://deadline.com/2023/10/taylor-swift-movie-eras-tour-nfl-marketing-amc-theaters-1235567995/"" rel=""noreferrer"">promote the Eras Tour movie event</a>.</li><li>With Swift now officially a billionaire, and seemingly printing money with her music and tours, you could argue she's beyond the point of really needing music licensing, since she's arguably doing more for the brand than they could possibly do for her.</li><li>However, brands can use data from Songtradr to identify other music that Swift's audience is listening to, or sounds that might fit the same mold – and are more likely to be licensed.</li></ul>
<!--kg-card-begin: html-->
<div style=""position:relative; width:100%; padding-top:56.25%; padding-bottom:40px;""><iframe src=""https://www.ispot.tv/share/2S2s"" style=""position:absolute; top:0; right:0; left:0; bottom:0; width:100%; height:100%;"" frameborder=""0"" scrolling=""no"" allowfullscreen=""""></iframe></div>
<!--kg-card-end: html-->
",6540205b53718500015cceba,"While Taylor Swift is everywhere between her record-setting tour, album drops (both new and re-releases) and the Eras Tour in movie theaters – one place you don't see much of her is on TV – apart from some recent NFL Sundays.

Data from Songtradr reveals that the star's music actually hasn't been licensed for a single TV show or movie since 2008, when her music was used here and there during episodes of 90210 and The Hills.

 * TV exposure via ads has also been pretty limited as well, with Capital One being the only brand partner in commercials since 2020.
 * Capital One has also done its part to promote the Eras Tour movie event.
 * With Swift now officially a billionaire, and seemingly printing money with her music and tours, you could argue she's beyond the point of really needing music licensing, since she's arguably doing more for the brand than they could possibly do for her.
 * However, brands can use data from Songtradr to identify other music that Swift's audience is listening to, or sounds that might fit the same mold – and are more likely to be licensed.

division of Vizio. Data is linear, live TV only and includes all episode types (new and reruns). Rankings are by percent share duration (i.e., time spent watching). Here's a look at the top 25 networks by viewership share for October 23-29 — head over to TVREV to see the <a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/basketball-blasts-into-inscapes-tv-program-rankingnbsp"" rel=""noreferrer""><em>program ranking</em></a> and get insights about the top shows by watch-time.</em></p><p>CBS takes first place for the second week in a row, capturing 8.38% of minutes watched — a slight decrease from the <a href=""__GHOST_URL__/football-propels-cbs-to-top-of-tv-network-ranking/"">previous week’s</a> 8.62%. Football, news and <em>The Price is Right</em> were some of the programming fueling watch-time.&nbsp;</p><p>Additional insights around the most-watched networks from October 23-29:</p><ul><li>Thanks in part to the 2023 World Series, Fox moves from fourth to third place week-over-week, with a total viewership share of 7.04%, a notable increase from its previous 5.99%.</li><li>Hallmark Channel breaks into the top ten with 2.34% of minutes watched (up from No. 11 and 1.99% last week), fueled by its slate of original Christmas movies. Sister network Hallmark Movies &amp; Mysteries also rises up the ranks, taking No. 17 with its 1.09% viewership share also driven by holiday programming.&nbsp;</li><li>TNT jumps from No. 23 to No. 13 week-over-week thanks mostly to NBA games.&nbsp;&nbsp;</li></ul><p>Check out the latest ranking of <a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/basketball-blasts-into-inscapes-tv-program-rankingnbsp"" rel=""noreferrer"">most-watched programs on TV</a> at TVREV.&nbsp;</p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/10/InscapeTopNetworksOct23-29.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt="""" loading=""lazy"" width=""1018"" height=""1219"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/10/InscapeTopNetworksOct23-29.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/10/InscapeTopNetworksOct23-29.png 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/10/InscapeTopNetworksOct23-29.png 1018w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></figure>",654106e6c68849000135d86b,"Each week, we highlight the most-watched shows and networks using insights from Inscape, the currency-grade smart TV ACR data provider and data technology division of Vizio. Data is linear, live TV only and includes all episode types (new and reruns). Rankings are by percent share duration (i.e., time spent watching). Here's a look at the top 25 networks by viewership share for October 23-29 — head over to TVREV to see the program ranking and get insights about the top shows by watch-time.

CBS takes first place for the second week in a row, capturing 8.38% of minutes watched — a slight decrease from the previous week’s 8.62%. Football, news and The Price is Right were some of the programming fueling watch-time. 

Additional insights around the most-watched networks from October 23-29:

 * Thanks in part to the 2023 World Series, Fox moves from fourth to third place week-over-week, with a total viewership share of 7.04%, a notable increase from its previous 5.99%.
 * Hallmark Channel breaks into the top ten with 2.34% of minutes watched (up from No. 11 and 1.99% last week), fueled by its slate of original Christmas movies. Sister network Hallmark Movies & Mysteries also rises up the ranks, taking No. 17 with its 1.09% viewership share also driven by holiday programming. 
 * TNT jumps from No. 23 to No. 13 week-over-week thanks mostly to NBA games.

more at TVREV"",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""link"",""version"":1,""rel"":""noreferrer"",""target"":null,""title"":null,""url"":""https://www.tvrev.com/news/nba-in-season-tournament-trying-new-sports-tv-rights-young-audience""},{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""]"",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":null,""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""paragraph"",""version"":1},{""type"":""image"",""version"":1,""src"":""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/10/Unique-Viewers--11-.jpeg"",""width"":1200,""height"":800,""title"":"""",""alt"":"""",""caption"":"""",""cardWidth"":""regular"",""href"":""""},{""children"":[],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""paragraph"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""root"",""version"":1}}","<p>At a time when TV viewers are getting older and younger audiences are harder to reach, creative approaches like the NBA's new in-season tournament become one of the last remaining cards for leagues to play — especially in light of how staggeringly high live sports rights fees are at this point.</p><ul><li>The chart below, from <a href=""http://tubularlabs.com/"">Tubular Labs</a>, shows a monthly look at unique U.S. viewers aged 13-to-24 for the four major leagues across Facebook and YouTube. Even at their peak, those numbers are not very high (for instance, fewer than 10 million unique people watched the NFL in February, its best month). </li><li>An inability to attract a large number of young viewers on those platforms is not indicative of league-specific failures, as much as a struggle for sports to find solid footing with young audiences. For reference, the figures above account for less than 20% of each league’s monthly unique viewers in many cases.</li><li>The NFL and NBA are the only U.S. sports leagues to create any significant separation throughout the calendar year when it comes to appealing YouTube and Facebook content for younger viewers.</li></ul><p>[<a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/nba-in-season-tournament-trying-new-sports-tv-rights-young-audience"" rel=""noreferrer"">Read more at TVREV</a>]</p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/10/Unique-Viewers--11-.jpeg"" class=""kg-image"" alt="""" loading=""lazy"" width=""1200"" height=""800"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/10/Unique-Viewers--11-.jpeg 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/10/Unique-Viewers--11-.jpeg 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/10/Unique-Viewers--11-.jpeg 1200w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></figure>",65416c79c68849000135d887,"At a time when TV viewers are getting older and younger audiences are harder to reach, creative approaches like the NBA's new in-season tournament become one of the last remaining cards for leagues to play — especially in light of how staggeringly high live sports rights fees are at this point.

 * The chart below, from Tubular Labs, shows a monthly look at unique U.S. viewers aged 13-to-24 for the four major leagues across Facebook and YouTube. Even at their peak, those numbers are not very high (for instance, fewer than 10 million unique people watched the NFL in February, its best month).
 * An inability to attract a large number of young viewers on those platforms is not indicative of league-specific failures, as much as a struggle for sports to find solid footing with young audiences. For reference, the figures above account for less than 20% of each league’s monthly unique viewers in many cases.
 * The NFL and NBA are the only U.S. sports leagues to create any significant separation throughout the calendar year when it comes to appealing YouTube and Facebook content for younger viewers.

the rest of Brandon Katz's post on TVREV"",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""link"",""version"":1,""rel"":""noreferrer"",""target"":null,""title"":null,""url"":""https://www.tvrev.com/news/the-rise-of-fast-what-are-consumers-really-watching""},{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""]"",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":null,""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""paragraph"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""root"",""version"":1}}","<p><em>The following is</em>&nbsp;<em>a selection</em>&nbsp;<em>from Brandon Katz of</em>&nbsp;<a href=""http://parrotanalytics.com/?ref=themeasure.net""><em>Parrot Analytics</em></a><em>.</em></p><p>Free ad-supported streaming television, or FAST, has become quite the trendy topic of conversation throughout Hollywood in recent years. And to begin understanding the consumer use case for FAST, we can explore what audiences are actually watching on the platforms. </p><ul><li>The chart above shows the total demand for all shows and movies available on four major FAST platforms&nbsp;(Tubi,&nbsp;The Roku Channel, Pluto TV and Freevee) in the U.S. in August, according to <a href=""http://parrotanalytics.com"" rel=""noreferrer"">Parrot Analytics</a>. </li><li>Tubi (Fox) leads the way in terms of total demand, with a decided movie focus – something also seen with Pluto (Paramount) and Freevee (Amazon).</li><li>Roku, meanwhile, sits at No. 2 in terms of overall demand, with a larger focus on TV than competitors.</li><li>Understanding what types of content audiences are most seeking out on these platforms can help most effectively direct ad dollars as brands and agencies invest more heavily into FASTs.</li></ul><p>[<a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/the-rise-of-fast-what-are-consumers-really-watching"" rel=""noreferrer"">read the rest of Brandon Katz's post on TVREV</a>]</p>",65416e67c68849000135d8ab,"The following is a selection from Brandon Katz of Parrot Analytics.

Free ad-supported streaming television, or FAST, has become quite the trendy topic of conversation throughout Hollywood in recent years. And to begin understanding the consumer use case for FAST, we can explore what audiences are actually watching on the platforms.

 * The chart above shows the total demand for all shows and movies available on four major FAST platforms (Tubi, The Roku Channel, Pluto TV and Freevee) in the U.S. in August, according to Parrot Analytics.
 * Tubi (Fox) leads the way in terms of total demand, with a decided movie focus – something also seen with Pluto (Paramount) and Freevee (Amazon).
 * Roku, meanwhile, sits at No. 2 in terms of overall demand, with a larger focus on TV than competitors.
 * Understanding what types of content audiences are most seeking out on these platforms can help most effectively direct ad dollars as brands and agencies invest more heavily into FASTs.

messaging."",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""listitem"",""version"":1,""value"":3}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""list"",""version"":1,""listType"":""bullet"",""start"":1,""tag"":""ul""}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""root"",""version"":1}}","<p>As the national monoculture fades, there appears to be a major opportunity for national brands to embrace local ad targeting, according to TVREV’s report,&nbsp;<a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/special-reports/p/local-tv-perils-promise-in-the-age-of-streaming?ref=themeasure.net""><u>Local TV: Perils &amp; Promise In the Age of Streaming</u></a>.</p><ul><li>While 40% of survey respondents said they see many TV ads from national companies targeted toward people in their area, nearly a quarter (24%) did not and 36% weren't sure.</li><li>In the report, TVREV's Alan Wolk identifies this is a big opportunity for local broadcast to utilize AI to make more regionally-focused and timely ads (so, for instance, windshield wiper ads when it's raining).</li><li>Evan Shapiro also notes that the local broadcasters poised to take advantage are those already invested in streaming, CTV and app-based ecosystems, providing national brands with a strong contextual ad environment to reach younger audiences with local messaging.</li></ul>",6542851086fdec0001deb808,"As the national monoculture fades, there appears to be a major opportunity for national brands to embrace local ad targeting, according to TVREV’s report, Local TV: Perils & Promise In the Age of Streaming.

 * While 40% of survey respondents said they see many TV ads from national companies targeted toward people in their area, nearly a quarter (24%) did not and 36% weren't sure.
 * In the report, TVREV's Alan Wolk identifies this is a big opportunity for local broadcast to utilize AI to make more regionally-focused and timely ads (so, for instance, windshield wiper ads when it's raining).
 * Evan Shapiro also notes that the local broadcasters poised to take advantage are those already invested in streaming, CTV and app-based ecosystems, providing national brands with a strong contextual ad environment to reach younger audiences with local messaging.",__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/11/Screen-Shot-2023-11-01-at-10.05.33-AM.png,0,post,published,,public,all,2023-11-01T17:04:16.000Z,2023-11-01T17:59:22.000Z,2023-11-01T11:58:00.000Z,,,,,,,1,65429e3a86fdec0001deb840,1f475cbc-b462-41f8-a39e-e02106126ba1,Lindsay Lohan Makes Walmart's New Black Friday Campaign So Fetch,walmarts-new-black-friday-campaign-creatoriq-mean-girls,,"{""root"":{""children"":[{""children"":[{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""After last year's "",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1},{""detail"":0,""format"":2,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""Office Space"",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1},{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""-inspired ads, Walmart is once again betting on nostalgia for its 2023 holiday spots, with a "",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1},{""detail"":0,""format"":2,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""Mean Girls"",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1},{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""-focused campaign that kicked off on Nov. 1. a sweet spot for consumers likely to understand the references throughout the ad, AND potential parents looking for Black Friday deals leading up to this holiday season."",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""listitem"",""version"":1,""value"":3}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""list"",""version"":1,""listType"":""bullet"",""start"":1,""tag"":""ul""},{""type"":""image"",""version"":1,""src"":""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/11/creatoriq-lindsay-lohan-audience--1-.jpg"",""width"":1381,""height"":787,""title"":"""",""alt"":"""",""caption"":"""",""cardWidth"":""regular"",""href"":""http://creatoriq.com""},{""children"":[],""direction"":null,""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""paragraph"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""root"",""version"":1}}","<p>After last year's <em>Office Space</em>-inspired ads, Walmart is once again betting on nostalgia for its 2023 holiday spots, with a <em>Mean Girls</em>-focused campaign that kicked off on Nov. 1. The ""<a href=""https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VfX-brlBH18"" rel=""noreferrer"">Jingle Bell Rockin'</a>"" video is chock-full of nods to the source material, but also features three of the four stars – Lindsay Lohan, Amanda Seyfried and Lacey Chabert.</p><ul><li>While last year's <em>Office Space</em> references banked on familiarity, the <em>Mean Girls</em> campaign takes things to another level, and also banks on the reach of Mean Girls' stars to expand the resonance of the campaign.</li><li>All three stars were quick to post about the ad on social media – a key part of why <em>Mean Girls</em> was the choice to begin with. Lindsay Lohan has 30.5 million cross-platform social media followers, according to data from <a href=""http://creatoriq.com"" rel=""noreferrer"">CreatorIQ</a>, and her engagement rate on Instagram is deemed ""excellent"" at 6.11%.</li><li>Additionally, 58% of her Instagram followers are 25-to-44 years old; a sweet spot for consumers likely to understand the references throughout the ad, AND potential parents looking for Black Friday deals leading up to this holiday season.</li></ul><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><a href=""http://creatoriq.com""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/11/creatoriq-lindsay-lohan-audience--1-.jpg"" class=""kg-image"" alt="""" loading=""lazy"" width=""1381"" height=""787"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/11/creatoriq-lindsay-lohan-audience--1-.jpg 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/11/creatoriq-lindsay-lohan-audience--1-.jpg 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/11/creatoriq-lindsay-lohan-audience--1-.jpg 1381w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></a></figure>",65429e3a86fdec0001deb840,"After last year's Office Space-inspired ads, Walmart is once again betting on nostalgia for its 2023 holiday spots, with a Mean Girls-focused campaign that kicked off on Nov. 1. The ""Jingle Bell Rockin'"" video is chock-full of nods to the source material, but also features three of the four stars – Lindsay Lohan, Amanda Seyfried and Lacey Chabert.

 * While last year's Office Space references banked on familiarity, the Mean Girls campaign takes things to another level, and also banks on the reach of Mean Girls' stars to expand the resonance of the campaign.
 * All three stars were quick to post about the ad on social media – a key part of why Mean Girls was the choice to begin with. Lindsay Lohan has 30.5 million cross-platform social media followers, according to data from CreatorIQ, and her engagement rate on Instagram is deemed ""excellent"" at 6.11%.

years Subaru has harnessed the endearing nature of dogs to capture attention for its TV ads, and Q3 2023 was no different: iSpot data reveals that the automaker owned two of the top five most likable spots across all industries with ads from its long-standing ""Dog Tested"" campaign. </p><ul><li>""<a href=""https://www.ispot.tv/ad/19SA/subaru-crosstrek-wilderness-dog-tested-tent-t1"" different: iSpot data reveals that the automaker owned two of the top five most likable spots across all industries with ads from its long-standing ""Dog Tested"" campaign.

 * ""Dog Tested: Everybody In"" was the No. 1 ad with a likability score of 799 (100th percentile). Surveyed viewers considered the spot's characters (aka the pups) to be the single best thing about the ad.
 * Subaru also owned the No. 3 ad, with ""Dog Tested: On Repeat"" scoring 773 for likability.

over 5x more than the NBA at No. 2 with 3.20%."",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""listitem"",""version"":1,""value"":2},{""children"":[{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""Check out the "",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1},{""children"":[{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""full article on TVREV"",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""link"",""version"":1,""rel"":""noreferrer"",""target"":null,""title"":null,""url"":""https://www.tvrev.com/news/how-mlb-fixes-postseason-tv-audience-crisis-world-series-viewers""},{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":"" for ideas on how Major League Baseball can tweak its postseason and regular season to maximize TV audience reach."",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""listitem"",""version"":1,""value"":3}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""list"",""version"":1,""listType"":""bullet"",""start"":1,""tag"":""ul""},{""type"":""image"",""version"":1,""src"":""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/11/inscape-world-series-data.jpg"",""width"":1110,""height"":652,""title"":"""",""alt"":"""",""caption"":"""",""cardWidth"":""regular"",""href"":""http://inscape.tv""},{""children"":[],""direction"":null,""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""paragraph"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""root"",""version"":1}}","<p><a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/major-league-baseball-precarious-tv-media-spot-ratings-postseason"">Major League Baseball is in a tough media spot</a>. And a World Series between the Texas Rangers and Arizona Diamondbacks certainly didn’t help matters. After game three of the 2023 World Series, the poor ratings were circulating, as expected. But those figures came in at historic lows that prompted a universal response of “<a href=""https://www.sportsbusinessjournal.com/Articles/2023/11/01/world-series-viewership-mlb-reckoning.aspx"">how can baseball fix this steep decline?</a>”</p><ul><li>From Oct. 27-Nov. 1, <a href=""http://inscape.tv/"">Inscape</a> data shows that this year’s World Series accounted for 14.92% of primetime minutes watched — though that number is actually up compared to 11.27% during last year’s six-game series (Oct. 28-Nov. 5, 2022).</li><li>The decisive game five win by the Rangers actually accounted for 17.90% of minutes watched in primetime; over 5x more than the NBA at No. 2 with 3.20%.</li><li>Check out the <a href=""https://www.tvrev.com/news/how-mlb-fixes-postseason-tv-audience-crisis-world-series-viewers"" rel=""noreferrer"">full article on TVREV</a> for ideas on how Major League Baseball can tweak its postseason and regular season to maximize TV audience reach.</li></ul><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><a href=""http://inscape.tv""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/11/inscape-world-series-data.jpg"" class=""kg-image"" alt="""" loading=""lazy"" width=""1110"" height=""652"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/11/inscape-world-series-data.jpg 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w1000/2023/11/inscape-world-series-data.jpg 1000w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/11/inscape-world-series-data.jpg 1110w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></a></figure>",65441ab78ad7a70001967b2b,"Major League Baseball is in a tough media spot. And a World Series between the Texas Rangers and Arizona Diamondbacks certainly didn’t help matters. After game three of the 2023 World Series, the poor ratings were circulating, as expected. But those figures came in at historic lows that prompted a universal response of “how can baseball fix this steep decline?”

 * From Oct. 27-Nov. 1, Inscape data shows that this year’s World Series accounted for 14.92% of primetime minutes watched — though that number is actually up compared to 11.27% during last year’s six-game series (Oct. 28-Nov. 5, 2022).
 * The decisive game five win by the Rangers actually accounted for 17.90% of minutes watched in primetime; over 5x more than the NBA at No. 2 with 3.20%.
 * Check out the full article on TVREV for ideas on how Major League Baseball can tweak its postseason and regular season to maximize TV audience Q3, the pharmaceutical industry made significant investments in TV advertising –  with many brands unveiling new creative approaches around existing brands, while others introduced new prescription drugs that received FDA approvals.</p><ul><li>For “rising” pharma brands – those that didn’t advertise in 2023 or had the largest year-over-year increase in TV ad impressions – there was a strong emphasis on broadcast news programs like&nbsp;<em>NBC Nightly News with Lester Holt</em>,&nbsp;<em>ABC World News Tonight</em>&nbsp;<em>with David Muir</em>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<em>CBS Evening News With Norah O’Donnell</em>.</li><li>Rising pharma advertisers also appeared frequently during daytime programming like&nbsp;<em>The Price Is Right</em>,&nbsp;<em>General Hospital</em>,&nbsp;<em>The Young and the Restless</em>&nbsp;and others in the entertainment genre.</li><li>Brands like Genentech’s Vabysmo focused on ad buys during major sporting events as well: College football (4.25% of the brand’s household TV ad impressions), PGA Tour (1.59%), NFL (1.28%) and MLB (1.26%) were all among the top 15 programs for Vabysmo impression deliveries.</li></ul><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/11/Screen-Shot-2023-11-01-at-1.56.45-PM.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt="""" loading=""lazy"" width=""1282"" height=""1232"" __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/11/Screen-Shot-2023-11-01-at-1.56.45-PM.png 1282w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></figure>",65441c8b8ad7a70001967b55,"In Q3, the pharmaceutical industry made significant investments in TV advertising – with many brands unveiling new creative approaches around existing brands, while others introduced new prescription drugs that received FDA approvals.

 * For “rising” pharma brands – those that didn’t advertise in 2023 or had the largest year-over-year increase in TV ad impressions – there was a strong emphasis on broadcast news programs like NBC Nightly News with Lester Holt, ABC World News Tonight with David Muir and CBS Evening News With Norah O’Donnell.
 * Rising pharma advertisers also appeared frequently during daytime programming like The Price Is Right, General Hospital, The Young and the Restless and others in the entertainment genre.
 * Brands like Genentech’s Vabysmo focused on ad buys during major sporting events as well: College football (4.25% of the brand’s household TV ad impressions), PGA Tour (1.59%), NFL (1.28%) and MLB (1.26%) were all among the top 15 programs for Vabysmo impression deliveries.",https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1583604310111-9cd137d6ffe5?crop=entropy&cs=tinysrgb&fit=max&fm=jpg&ixid=M3wxMTc3M3wwfDF8c2VhcmNofDF8fHByZXNjcmlwdGlvbiUyMGRydWdzfGVufDB8fHx8MTY5ODk2MzI4M3ww&ixlib=rb-4.0.3&q=80&w=2000,0,post,published,,public,all,2023-11-02T22:02:51.000Z,2023-11-02T22:15:40.000Z,2023-11-02T14:00:00.000Z,,,,,,,1,65494acb1eb91d0001e793e4,92a0645d-8561-498f-befa-ee6a4f040d32,DIY Content Goes Long For Holiday Season,diy-content-goes-long-for-holiday-season-tubular-chartbeat,,"{""root"":{""children"":[{""children"":[{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""While short-form content has exploded over the past few years, longer content still has its benefits. "",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1},{""children"":[{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""here"",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""link"",""version"":1,""rel"":null,""target"":null,""title"":null,""url"":""https://tubularlabs.com/research-guides/2023-holiday-content-trends-unwrapped/?cid=C02124""},{""detail"":0,""format"":0,""mode"":""normal"",""style"":"""",""text"":""."",""type"":""extended-text"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""paragraph"",""version"":1},{""type"":""image"",""version"":1,""src"":""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/11/Screen-Shot-2023-11-06-at-12.24.12-PM.png"",""width"":756,""height"":714,""title"":"""",""alt"":"""",""caption"":"""",""cardWidth"":""regular"",""href"":""https://tubularlabs.com/research-guides/2023-holiday-content-trends-unwrapped/?cid=C02124""},{""children"":[],""direction"":null,""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""paragraph"",""version"":1}],""direction"":""ltr"",""format"":"""",""indent"":0,""type"":""root"",""version"":1}}","<p>While short-form content has exploded over the past few years, longer content still has its benefits. <a href=""https://tubularlabs.com/research-guides/2023-holiday-content-trends-unwrapped/?cid=C02124"">According to a new report</a> from Tubular Labs and Chartbeat, 0-30 second videos made up the largest share of holiday DIY &amp; decorating videos in 2022, but it's 61-120 second videos that have seen views surge over 1,500% YoY.</p><p>Some additional insights around DIY videos for the holiday season:&nbsp;</p><ul><li>Viewership for the Holiday DIY &amp; Decorating category on YouTube has already skyrocketed by 75% YoY.</li><li>Posting early pays off – Last year, the top two DIY &amp; Decor videos on TikTok were both posted in early November. However, 2023’s most popular video so far was posted in July — racking up over 85% of the views of last year’s second most watched video. </li><li>While posting Christmas decor content in July might seem a bit out of place, the high volume of viewership shows that TikTok audiences enjoy getting holiday inspiration early.&nbsp;</li></ul><p>For more best practices on how to prepare your social calendar for the shopping season, download the full Holiday Content Trends Unwrapped report <a href=""https://tubularlabs.com/research-guides/2023-holiday-content-trends-unwrapped/?cid=C02124"">here</a>.</p><figure class=""kg-card kg-image-card""><a href=""https://tubularlabs.com/research-guides/2023-holiday-content-trends-unwrapped/?cid=C02124""><img src=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/11/Screen-Shot-2023-11-06-at-12.24.12-PM.png"" class=""kg-image"" alt="""" loading=""lazy"" width=""756"" height=""714"" srcset=""__GHOST_URL__/content/images/size/w600/2023/11/Screen-Shot-2023-11-06-at-12.24.12-PM.png 600w, __GHOST_URL__/content/images/2023/11/Screen-Shot-2023-11-06-at-12.24.12-PM.png 756w"" sizes=""(min-width: 720px) 720px""></a></figure>",65494acb1eb91d0001e793e4,"While short-form content has exploded over the past few years, longer content still has its benefits. According to a new report from Tubular Labs and Chartbeat, 0-30 second videos made up the largest share of holiday DIY & decorating videos in 2022, but it's 61-120 second videos that have seen views surge over 1,500% YoY.

Some additional insights around DIY videos for the holiday season: 

 * Viewership for the Holiday DIY & Decorating category on YouTube has already skyrocketed by 75% YoY.
 * Posting early pays off – Last year, the top two DIY & Decor videos on TikTok were both posted in early November. However, 2023’s most popular video so far was posted in July — racking up over 85% of the views of last year’s second most watched video.
 * While posting Christmas decor content in July might seem a bit out of place, the high volume of viewership shows that TikTok audiences enjoy getting holiday inspiration early. 

For more best practices on how to prepare your social calendar for the shopping season, download the full Holiday Content Trends Unwrapped report this after 18 uses in 2021 alone.</li><li>While part of the uptick comes from music performance shows like <em>The Voice</em> and <em>The Masked Singer</em>, there's still been a significant amount of Ludacris during shows, which makes differentiation tougher when utilizing his music.</li><li>The same goes for ads as well, as Ludacris and Sleepy Brown's ""Saturday (Oooh! <div style=""position:relative; width:100%; padding-top:56.25%; padding-bottom:40px;""><iframe src=""https://www.ispot.tv/share/5yU9"" style=""position:absolute; top:0; right:0; left:0; bottom:0; width:100%; height:100%;"" frameborder=""0"" scrolling=""no"" allowfullscreen=""""></iframe></div>
<!--kg-card-end: html-->
",65494d251eb91d0001e7940c,"Some artists are TV show and ad music fixtures, and others... are Ludacris.

Data from Songtradr shows just how much the rapper's music has been featured on TV of late, in a way that could inform shows, movies and brands that it may be time to roll out of those choices for a little while, and onto music from similar artists instead to strike a similar chord with audiences.

 * For instance, Ludacris music has been featured 14 times on TV shows since the start of 2022; this after 18 uses in 2021 alone.
 * While part of the uptick comes from music performance shows like The Voice and The Masked Singer, there's still been a significant amount of Ludacris during shows, which makes differentiation tougher when utilizing his music.
 * The same goes for ads as well, as Ludacris and Sleepy Brown's ""Saturday (Oooh! Ooooh!)"" is currently being featured in one of the most-seen holiday ads on TV, Amazon's ""Holidays: Rufus"" – a spot that's been running since Oct. 31.
